name: Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. Title. Django/Angular Full-Stack Developer. Summary. Our client is looking for an experienced full-stack developer to help build web Angular/Django web applications. You will be r. esponsible for helping deliver an outstanding and unprecedented user experience for clients. You will design and build new modules as well as use standardized Angular components across multiple modules. The web technology is based on Django, Angular, and Postgres. Any. experience architecting larger systems with knowledge of industry-leading technologies is a plus. HERE IS WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING: Developing code that fits the Django Rest Framework to meet specific business requirements. Developing Angular modules to meet specific business functionality. Standardizing existing Django code to match best practices. Refactoring older, existing Angular components when needed. THE RIGHT DEVELOPER WILL HAVE5 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE IN THE FOLLOWING: Translating mock-ups and wireframes into front-end code. Django Rest Framework. Djangox preferred, Angular2, Postgres. MS or  BS/BA Degree from Accredited Institution. Due to the team and collaboration involved, our client is seeking someone that is or can relocate to the Raleigh, NC area. This position will be a hybrid in office/work from home position. Relocation assistance will be included. About Us: SourceAbility provides best-in-class recruitment services primarily in the areas of Data and Analytics. We strive to work with client companies that provide exceptional work environments for the candidates we represent. Our staff is highly trained in multiple verticals and work to ensure a positive experience when working with a recruitment firm. SourceAbility, Inc. does not discriminate in the acceptance or re erral of candidates on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, marital status, disability, or other protected characteristics. Contact Please contact Tanya Calkins at SourceAbility.

name: Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. SHR Talent is partnering with a client in the Murfreesboro area looking to hire a Full Stack Developer to produce scalable software solutions. A successful candidate will be a team player with a knack for developing and maintaining hybrid applications using JavaScript, Node, and SQL Databases. Experience in Mobile development using Ionic and Cordova or a similar framework is required. DevOps experience is highly preferred. This is not an H1B/C2C opportunity. Applicants must be s. Requirements: Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role. Experience developing desktop and mobile applications. Highly proficient working with JavaScript. Knowledgeable of multiple back-end languages and JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, N ode.js). Familiarity wit h SQL Databases. Experience working with DevOps tools preferred (e.g. Git, Jenkins, Doc ker, Puppet, Chef). Experience developing CI / CD pipelines preferred. Excellent communication and teamwork skills. Great attention to detail. Degree in Computer Science or related field is preferred.

name: Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. Full Stack Developer Job Description. The IT Digital Sales team is responsible for developing the sales technology roadmap which will enable Kimberly Clark's commercial transformation. Is the delivery engine for all sales capabilities within the sales portfolio, and accountable for the availability and reliability of all apps running in the sales landscape. As part of this team the Full Stack developer is responsible for the design and development of architecting solutions, designing interfaces, estimating work, building new modules/templates/components, maintaining existing capabilities, and creating Responsive/Adaptive web pages that can be viewed on desktop, tablet or mobile and hosted on-premise or in the cloud.The Full-Stack Developer will provide technology thought leadership and come up with solutions that will optimize the ROI, will also need to develop technical artifacts where required (technical specifications, architectural diagrams, database diagrams, etc). Key Accountabilities: Participate in requirements gathering to solidify requirements and determine the best technical solution to meet the business needs. Develop and implement new templates, components, and responsive web pages/sites and support Kimberly-Clark's development and security standards while developing. Work closely with the Sales and Trade Marketing organization on the implementation of new capabilities. Carry out the development of the assigned project adhering to the engineering standards/best practices, committing to the agreed timeline, and ensures quality metrics are met. Integrate internal and external applications using APIs. Prepare technical and other documents related the core platforms as required. Perform technical onboarding of the new employees or Agencies on the core platform. Provide technology leadership to implementation teams. Skills / Experience Required: A Bachelors' of Computer Science or a related field is required. Experience architecting and implementing large-scale web solutions. Experience in defining non-functional requirements for business needs.5 years experience in the development of scalable consumer-facing digital solutions (consumer websites, web applications, mobile sites, etc.) in .NET/ C# / MVC (working with at least one framework like WCF or Web API) with a key focus on performance, security, and scalability. Experience with Web Services (SOAP/REST) architecture. Experience with Cloud ecosystems including Azure and Snowflake is a plus. Experience designing and optimizing relational databases and stored procedures for optimal performance and/or maintainability. Experience with front-end development using JavaScript (jQuery plus Node, Angular, or React), CSS, and HTML is a plus. Kimberly-Clark and its well-known global brands are an indispensable part of life for people in more than5 countries. Every day,3 billion people nearly a quarter of the world's population trust K-C brands and the solutions they provide to enhance their health, hygiene, and well-being. With brands such as Kleenex, Scott, Huggies, Pull-Ups, Kotex, and Depend, Kimberly-Clark holds No.1 or No.share positions in more than countries. With more than0 years of history of innovation, we believe in recruiting the best people and empowering them do their best work. If fresh thinking and a passion to win inspire you, come Unleash Your Power at Kimberly-Clark. For Kimberly-Clark to grow and prosper, we must be an inclusive organization that applies the diverse experiences and passions of its team members to brands that make life better for people all around the world. We actively seek to build a workforce that reflects the experiences of our consumers. When you bring your original thinking to Kimberly-Clark, you fuel the continued success of our enterprise. We are a committed equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected by law. The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by employees assigned to this classification. Statements are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities and skills required for this position. This position may require a post-offer/pre-hire Physical Abilities Test (PAT) to confirm that individuals are able to perform the essential functions of the job. K-C requires that an employee have authorization to work in the country in which the role is based. In the event an applicant does not have current work authorization, K-C will determine, in its sole discretion, whether to sponsor an individual for work authorization. However, based on immigration requirements, not all roles are suitable for sponsorship. This position is subject to drug and alcohol testing, including pre-employment testing. #dice Global VISA and Relocation Specifications: K-C will not provide support for relocation of the chosen candidate for this role, if necessary, relocation will be at the candidate's own expense. Primary Location. USA-WI-Neenah Additional Locations. USA-GA-Atlanta-Roswell Worker Type. Employee Worker Sub-Type. Regular Time Type. Full time.

name: Sr. Full Stack Developer with Top Secret Clearance
description: Job Description. Are you an analytical, data-driven professional? Are you interested in a role that offers an opportunity to provide front line support to our clients instead of a "back office programmer" position? If so, Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) Advisory Regulatory and Legal Support team is the place for you! Join our team of specialists as they unlock insights contained in the data universe and work through challenges related to the identification of improper payments, data quality, mission-oriented analysis, and cost management. Work you'll do As a Full Stack Developer within our Regulatory and Legal Support team, you will: Organize and deliver services on a cross-section of complex projects. Displays both breadth and depth of knowledge regarding functional and technical issues. Displays leadership and business judgment in anticipating client/project needs and developing alternative solutions. Participate in the development of new and maintenance of customer's custom applications. Provide top-level technical services to include, but are not limited to, agile development, system engineering, and software development. Actively contribute to mission capabilities development and deployment to address emerging requirements. Perform in all three areas of development, integration and production deployment. Conduct technical research on software development tasks including automation prototyping and tool development. The Team Transparency, innovation, collaboration, sustainability: these are the hallmark issues shaping government initiatives today. Deloitte's GPS practice is passionate about making an impact with lasting change. Carrying out missions in the GPS practice requires fresh thinking and a creative approach. We collaborate with teams from across our organization in order to bring the full breadth of Deloitte, its commercial and public sector expertise, to best support our clients. Our aspiration is to be the premier integrated solutions provider in helping to transform the GPS marketplace. Advisory Regulatory and Legal Support mitigates current and future risk for our GPS clients across several industries, spanning from finance and audit readiness to forensics and healthcare. With a creative and innovative approach, our Regulatory and Legal Support team exposes our clients' risks and provides recommendations to improve the quality of data. We collaborate closely with government agencies, accountants, IT professionals, and clients to produce analyses in support of risk consulting engagements. Qualifications Required: Must have an active Top Secret clearance with the ability to obtain an SCI. Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future. Bachelor's Degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Engineering, Business Analytics disciplines, or related area. Experience with most of the following: DOMEX, .NET, Core AngularJS, ReactJS, JQuery, HTML, NodeJS, and ElasticSearch. years of experience as a Full Stack Developer. Applied knowledge with .NET, JavaScript, MongoDB, API Design, PostgreSQL, JIRA, Database Administration, JSON, XML APIs and Python. Preferred: Previous Federal Consulting and/or professional services experience. Advanced Degree in related field. Certified in SAS, ACL, CPA, CISA, CISSP, PMP, FRM, ASA, and/or CFA. Applied knowledge of Extended N-tiered Software Architectures, REST, SOAP, WiQuery, AJAX, XSD, UNIX/Solaris, Linux/Ubuntu, Maven and/or Visual C. Experience with Database Design, AWS/cloud development and solutions architecture. Familiarity with and experience developing in government cloud environments (C2S, ICGC). Comfort with Agile Methodology/SCRUM development and Confluence. Experience leveraging data analysis to construct compelling narratives. Familiarity with cloud computing technology. How you'll grow At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

name: .NET Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology? A system's professional who wants to work in a collaborative environment. As an experienced .NET Full Stack Developer, you will have the ability to share new ideas and collaborate on projects as a consultant without the extensive demands of travel. Work you'll do/Responsibilities You will be responsible for managing day to day client business support of their IT landscape and applications. You will be responsible for managing client support incidents. You will be responsible for managing USI teams. You will be responsible for managing weekly/monthly reporting. You will be responsible for managing client conversations. You will be responsible for configuring / POC / managing offshore teams (3-4) and will work with to enhance, and fix issues. You will be responsible for operating engagements. The Team From leading practice to business necessity, every business recognizes the need for a strategic cloud integration platform. At Deloitte Consulting, our technology strategy and architecture specialists help organizations develop the strategies and implement the systems that build business value and drive performance. We have the in-depth knowledge and experience gained from working on some of the most complex IT challenges around the globe, everything from system replacement to full IT transformation. Our TSO ServiceNow team works with clients to transform their technology delivery by collaborating with CIOs, Technology Executives, and their teams. Together we work to establish IT operating models based on the implications of next generation and advanced technologies, new and evolving service models for technology, and the operational expectations of an organization. Our team of experienced technologists understand the interwoven nature technology plays in all aspects of today's business environment and focus on helping our clients shift from foundational delivery of technology to being the strategic business partner and catalyst for change. Our Agile/DevOps/Lean technology experts work to transform the workforce of our clients into the next generation of technology service delivery teams. Qualifications Required Bachelor's Degree or equivocal BS/MS degree in an associated field with at leastyears of experience. Must have experience with Client Facing. Must have experience working with Full Stack .NET Software development. Must have years' experience as a Solution Engineer. Must have experience with managing onshore and offshore teams. Familiarity of working in an Agile framework. Demonstrate skills in coordinating activities, evaluating data, problem-solving and decision-making. A basic understanding of support methodologies like ITIL is desired and should have familiarity with different metrics and SLAs. Self-motivated and able to take the initiative to resolve technical issues. Must live in or be willing to relocate to Houston, TX. Limited Sponsorship may be available. Travel up to% annually. Preferred Qualifications NSAP Strong .net skills IMS service desk, infrastructure expert.

name: Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. Are you a driven problem solver looking to help our clients tackle some of the most pressing challenges within Government and Public Services? Join Deloitte's Program Integrity practice to help government agencies protect taxpayer money. To address the threats that perpetuate fraud, waste, and abuse, our clients look to our team to provide the guidance and solutions required to help them stay ahead of emerging issues and protect the integrity of their programs. If you are looking for a rapidly growing, collaborative environment with opportunities to make an impact and grow, our Program Integrity team would be a great fit for you! Work you'll do As a Full Stack Developer you will be developing web based applications and deploy to cloud as applicable. You'll be responsible for employing the HCD principles, use centric design and follow agile development methodologies. Collaborating with data architects, data scientists, clinical specialists and the program management teams. The team Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, and local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise. We bring a rigorous approach to help government agencies effectively detect, prevent, and respond to issues related to fraud, waste, and abuse. Our team helps tackle these threats by bringing cutting edge analytics and AI experience with innovative mindsets. Our Program Integrity team focuses on thought diversity and collaborative problem solving to help clients address these challenges holistically, with a common goal to protect the integrity of their programs. Deloitte brings a rigorous analytic-based approach to effectively detect, prevent, and respond to issues related to fraud, waste, and abuse. Our practitioners channel their analytic expertise to identify the nature, size, and scope of Program Integrity threats and address them through the development and deployment of analytic solutions such as machine learning models and graph algorithms. Qualifications Required: Bachelor's degree required in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. years' experience as a Full Stack Developer. years' experience developing cloud-based web applications, using Javascript, Style guides and application management. Experience working within Django framework. Must have UI experience with React.js and/or Angular. Must be legally auth orized to work in the United States. Must be able to obtain and maintain the required clearance for this role. Experience building applications on cloud platforms such as GCP, AWS and Azure. Build detailed workflows and user stories. Preferred: Knowledge on building applications on cloud platforms such as GCP, AWS and Azure. Healthcare application development experience is a plus. Ability to create requirements and build into detailed workflows and user stories.

name: Applied AI Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. While analytics isn't new, we're experiencing a renaissance in the science, technology, and application of business analytics today, which makes it hard to keep up. Many business leaders are now facing the dilemma of how best to quickly get up to speed on what analytics can actually deliver in practice. That's where Deloitte's Applied AI team can help. Work you'll do We are looking to add an experienced Developer to our team. As a Full Stack Developer, you will specialize in building powerful yet elegant products using cutting edge technologies. The Developer will have the opportunity to design and build innovative applications that offer measurable business value to our clients. The individual in this role may work in either a pure development role, helping architect and design a solution, or act as a lead, managing a development team. Evaluate client business challenges and work with the team to arrive at the best-fit technology solution components. Design, document, and develop world class web applications leveraging the full spectrum of front-end and back-end technologies and cutting-edge design patterns. Collaborate with clients and business analysts to translate business requirements into technical requirements. Mentor and assist with training junior developers. The team Analytics and Cognitive In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment. As the premier data-powered and platform-enabled cognitive consultancy, we help clients achieve competitive advantage through data and cognitive powered transformations that promote enterprise intelligence, autonomous processes, and precision stakeholder engagement The Analytics and Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy and Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets Minimum Qualifications A Bachelor's degree andyears of relevant work experience are required. Experience with the entire software development lifecycle (SDLC). Experience with developing web applications with SOA, RESTful, and/or MVC architectures. Experience with scripting languages (JavaScript (Node.js) / Python) and expertise in HTML, Java Script, and CSS skills. years development experience with a lower level language (Java or C#). years experience with server-side Web frameworks (Django (Python), Express (Node.js), Play (Java)). Travel up to% (While% of tra vel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.). Limited immigration sponsorship may be available. Preferred Qualifications: Strong database development skills and experience with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server, PostgresDB, MySQL) or NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Neo4j). Knowledge of professional software engineering practices for the full software development lifecycle including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing and operations. Basic DevOps experience to deploy and maintain client projects. Experienced programming knowledge in both SAS and SQL, operating system experience with UNIX and relational database knowledge such as ORACLE/TERADATA. SAS/Base, SAS/Stat, SAS/Macro preferred. Understanding of the technology landscape including open source, commercial on-premises, and cloud-based tools: Microsoft Cognitive Services, IBM Watson, IPSoft, Pega, Salesforce Einstein, Google Cloud Platform/Tensor Flow, Amazon Web Services/Sagemaker, PowerBI, SparkCognition, Expert System, Numenta, Deepmind, CognitiveScale, CustomerMatrix. Full-Stack web application development experience. User Interface (UI) design knowledge. Deep experience designing modular, object-oriented programming. Experience in Hadoop, Spark, Storm or related paradigms and associated languages such as Java/C++, R, Python, etc. Experience developing across Windows/UNIX. Experience developing for mobile platforms. Experience mentoring and/or training junior developers. anccon Aand CConsulting21.

name: Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. What We'll Bring: At TransUnion, we have a welcoming and energetic environment that encourages collaboration and innovation we're consistently exploring new technologies and tools to be agile. This environment gives our people the opportunity to hone current skills and build new capabilities, while discovering their genius. Come be a part of our team you'll work with great people, pioneering products and cutting-edge technology. This role is for a full stack cloud engineer that will operate as a member on one of the core teams responsible for enabling new features and optimizing strategic Analytics platforms across TransUnion. Our multi-Petabyte platforms support a diverse community of internal and customer-based data scientists, statisticians, modelers, product developers and data strategists. As a contributing member on one of our agile development teams, you will have both the accountability and freedom to build systems that are taking TransUnion to the next level. Success in this role requires a blend of skills in the following technology areas:. Agile (Scrum) SDLC. Full-Stack Web Application Development. Systems Engineering ("DevOps") What You'll Bring: years of hands-on experience in development of services/microservices, ideally at an enterprise level. Understanding and implementation experience in event driven and streaming systems. Good understanding Cloud and Microservice Design patterns being preferred. Experience in multiple languages such as Java, .NET, C#, C++, Etc. Experience with modern framework (Angular preferred). Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript. Experience in Hadoop tools (Spark / Scala) and Python. Strongly believe in and support team collaboration and enjoy contributing in ways to assist in team wins. Understanding and implementation experience in event driven and streaming systems. An understanding of the many technologies used in delivering highly performant enterprise service/micro service-based architectures. Strong understanding of an API first development strategy, separation of API from the Service, and the versioning of services. Have used a CI/CD pipeline with highly robust automated testing. Working knowledge of Linux including shell scripting and basic system administration-Knowledge of Ansible is a plus. Experience with using monitoring tools like App-Dynamics and log management tools like Splunk, Prometheus. Excellent analytical skills and the ability to provide alternative solutions to technical problems. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science. Impact You'll Make: At TransUnion, we are dedicated to finding ways information can be used to help people make better and smarter decisions. As a trusted provider of global information solutions, our mission is to help people around the world access the opportunities that lead to a higher quality of life, by helping organizations optimize their risk-based decisions and enabling consumers to understand and manage their personal information. Because when people have access to more complete and multidimensional information, they can make more informed decisions and achieve great things. Every day TransUnion offers our employees the tools and resources they need to find ways information can be used in diverse ways. Whether it is helping businesses better manage risk, providing better insights so a consumer can qualify for his first mortgage or working with law enforcement to make neighborhoods safer, we are improving the quality of life for individuals, families, communities and local economies around the world. #DICE #LI-EP1 We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability status, veteran status, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law. During the COVID-19 pandemic, TransUnion has several safety protocols in place to protect associates, customers, and visitors. You may be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment and/or to participate in certain work-related activities. Exemption is available to qualified candidates as a reasonable accommodation. TransUnion's Internal Job Title: Developer, Applications Development.

name: Sr. Full Stack Developer (C# & Angular)
description: Job Description. As a Senior Technical Consultant you will participate in all aspects of the software development lifecycle which includes estimating, technical design, implementation, documentation, testing, deployment and support of application developed for our clients. As a member working in a team environment you will work with solution architects and developers on interpretation/translation of wireframes and creative designs into functional requirements, and subsequently into technical design. Responsibilities. Participate in the technical planning and requirements gathering phases including estimate, develop, test, manage projects, architect and deliver. Serve as a strong technical contributor. Provide technical support or leadership in the development and continual improvement of service. Develop and maintain effective working relationships with team members. Demonstrate the ability to adapt and work with team members of various experience level. Qualifications. Passionate developer with years of modern web development experience. Must be full stack developer with strong C#/.NET Core experience and at least ayears of experience with Angular, HTML and CSS. Client facing or consulting experience highly preferred. Must be located in the United States or Canada. Development experience on Azure, AWS or Google Cloud Platform required. years of Agile development with distributed teams. Problem solvers with the desire and proven ability to create innovative solutions. Flexible and adaptable attitude, disciplined to manage multiple responsibilities and adjust to varied environments. Future technology leaders dynamic individuals energized by fast paced personal and professional growth. Phenomenal communicators who can explain and present concepts to technical and non-technical audiences alike, including high level decision makers. Bachelorâ€™s Degree in MIS, Computer Science, Math, Engineering or comparable major. Solid foundation in Computer Science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design. Proficient in authoring, editing and presenting technical documents. Ability to communicate effectively via multiple channels (verbal, written, etc.) with technical and non-technical staff. Perficient full-time employees receive complete and competitive benefits. We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an outstanding benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. In addition, all colleagues are eligible for a number of rewards and recognition programs including billable bonus opportunities. Encouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Perficient a great place to work. More About Perficient. Perficient is the leading digital transformation consulting firm serving Global00 and enterprise customers throughout North America. name: Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. Are you looking to make an immediate impact where you can help our clients solve their business challenges? Deloitte's Core Business Operations (CBO) portfolio operates at the center of our client's business. By joining our team, you could help C-suite and program leaders transform their organization and accelerate mission execution through emerging and disruptive technologies, innovative business models, retooled program operations, and industry-driven solutions. Experience in both designing and developing platform components using Java Web Services, JWS/JAX, and Component-Based Architectures. Creating and consuming REST APIs, expertise in tools, techniques, and frameworks like Hibernate, event-driven architecture, and service orchestration. Use a test-first development approach to integrate JUnit testing and JaCoCo / Sonarqube code coverage reporting into the Jenkins build process. Database persistence framework experience using JDBC, JPA, JNDI, and data source configuration. Ability to effectively communicate issues with the client, team members, team leads, and/or project management. Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment. Ability to work independently and manage multiple task assignments. The team Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice our people, ideas, technology, and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, and local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over,000+ professionals brings a fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise. The Systems Engineering offering is comprised of experienced professionals who help guide clients through their most complex technology challenges. This can include the delivery of large-scale software applications and integrated systems, the development of service-oriented architecture (SOA) and other integrations solutions, and the delivery of technology enablement to support CIO services transformation. Our Systems Engineering offering focuses on key client issues that impact the core business, provide operational value, drive down the cost of quality, and enhance technology innovation. Qualifications Required: Bachelor's degree required. Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future. Must be able to obtain and maintain the required clearance for this role. Travel up to. Preferred: IRS clearance / IRS experience. Experience working on Agile scrum teams. Experience with full-stack development using React and Java. Experience with web-based development using Java/J2EE Technologies, expertise in full web stack development; creating and consuming REST APIs, expertise in tools, techniques, and frameworks like Hibernate, event-driven architecture, and service orchestration. Develop and consume REST APIs using techniques and frameworks such as Hibernate, event-driven architecture, and service orchestration, and integration JUnit testing and JaCoCo code coverage reporting into the Jenkins build process. Experience with deployment tools to package and deploy components. Experience in both designing and developing platform components using Java Web Services, JWS/JAX, and Component-Based Architectures. How you'll grow At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their careers to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their careers.

name: Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. In today's environment our clients' abilities to respond to requests for information are more important than ever and through people, processes, tools, and technology, we help them do so. Are you excited about exploring innovative ways to visualize data, use analytics, and help clients find relevant information in an ever-growing sea of emails and electronic documents? Do you have a legal or technology background and want to continue to grow your skills and abilities? We are a practice that brings together teams focusing on thought diversity, collaborative problem solving, and development of our professionals to enable our Government and Public Services (GPS) Discovery and Data Management Practice clients face litigation and other regulatory requirements with the resources to efficiently and effectively assist the government and respond to information requests. If you want to help clients make sense of their data and are passionate about keeping up with the latest data trends and technology sources, then our team would be a great fit for you! Work you'll do Work on Product team to develop integration/workflow platform that automates workflows used by our eDiscovery practice and will be offered to clients for installation on their infrastructure. Act as full-stack web developer on .NET and React JS platform. Demonstrate effective verbal and written communication skills. Effectively prioritize workload to meet deadlines and work objectives. Exercise mature judgement, and strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills. The team Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, and local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise. Discovery is constantly evolving and changing as data volumes and sources continue to grow exponentially. We aim to help our clients solve their most pressing data management challenges by bringing key stakeholders together and helping them to navigate challenges such as cloud migration, implications of new technologies, evolving data sources, and pressure due to time constraints or regulatory requirements. Our practice has established itself as a leader in delivering the full spectrum of Discovery services to government agencies. Our teams apply eDiscovery leading practices and leverage analytics technology, as well as traditional legal research and writing, to assist government attorneys and agency staff through the litigation or information request process. Qualifications Required:. Bachelor's degree required, preferably in Information Technology or a related field.. Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future. Must be able to obtain and maintain the required clearance for this role. At leastyears of professional software development experience. At leastyears of web development experience (e.g. ASP.NET, MVC, etc.). Fluent in Microsoft.NET programmi ng languages (We use C# and .NET Core). Ability to read/write SQL Server database with Entity Framework. Experience with HTML, CSS, REST, JavaScript. Experience with React JS. Experience with source control management tools, such as GIT. Unit test development/management experience, ie: xUnit for backend and Jest for front-end Preferred. Experience with AWS. Familiarity with Cloud-based Serverless application development and architecture. Familiarity with working with Agile/Scrum and iterative development. Creating process or workflow automation systems. Relativity and/or eDiscovery experience. Domain experience in the field of eDiscovery or Litigation Support.

name: Senior Rails Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. About Working Not Working: Hi, thanks for reading our job post. name: .NET Full-Stack Developer
description: Job Description. NET Full-Stack Developer. We are looking for a smart, adaptable, intellectually curious .NET Full-Stack Developer to work on our two SaaS applications, the Enrich Analytics Platform (EAP) and Viewport. Your role will be to design and implement new features, update and enhance existing features, and improve and enhance core back-end technologies. You will be working with analytic modelers, other back-end programmers, and front-end developers. While primarily focused on the back end, integration and understanding of the front end is crucial to the position. Skills and Requirements. First and foremost, you're looking for a great working environment and working with a small, close-knit company. You have experience developing web applications using .NET and a database back end (MS SQL Server, MySQL, etc.). You have knowledge of JavaScript (including libraries and frameworks such as jQuery and Backbone.js). You have a profic ient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git / Mercurial / SVN. You are strong in communication, problem solving, testing and agile development. You may have experience developing web applications with Node.js. You may have exper ience with Cloud technologies such as Azure, AWS or others. You also may have an understanding of web application security. You may have the ability to create and integrate with APIs. You may have experience with CI/CD tools like Jenkins and Grunt. What you'll work with: Visual Studio, ASP.NET, JavaScript (including related libraries and frameworks like d3, jQuery, Backbone), Node.js, Meteor.js, Git, Wind ows, SQL, a nd DynamoDB. Where you'll work. We are a remote-first company, so you can work from anywhere in the U.S. We also have offices in San Jose, CA; Santa Cruz, CA; and Denver, CO. You're welcome to hang out in one of those places, work remotely0%, or a mixture of the two! How to Apply. Just email us. a resume and cover letter telling us why we'd be perfect for each other. In the cover letter, please indicate whether you are authorized to work in the United States. Applications sent without a cover letter will not be considered. If you have earned a degree in the past two years, please also include a copy (unofficial is fine) of your relevant transcript(s). Why a career at Enrich? There are a lot of reasonsâ€”here are a few! Enrich works closely with our clients to do cool stuff. We provide analytic software tools that enable senior executives to make strategic decisions with confidence. We bring clarity to complex business environments fraught with uncertainty and help generate insights that can be translated into action. In other words, we work directly with clients to understand their challenges and develop custom analytics and visualizations to address them. This isn't a place for corporate drones. Our philosophy is to hire good people and give them the autonomy to do great things. No one is looking over anyone else's shoulder. No one is filling out TPS reports. We're about finding creative solutions, trying things that haven't been tried, and developing capabilities that others can't. That's how we deliver the custom thinking our clients expect. Life's too short to waste time on mean people. The two most important characteristics we look for in candidates: "nice" and "smart." We strive to create an informal work environment full of people who want to help each other succeed. We're about smiles and collaboration, not dictating and yelling. The benefits we offerâ€”from big things like great medical insurance to not-so-big things like sit/stand desksâ€”are indicative of our belief in putting people first. Analytics rule. We're a company of quants, from fields such as engineering, math, programming, and physics. We think analyticsâ€”based on big or small dataâ€”can drive better business decisions. We build solutions that allow our customers to go places they thought were impossible. What do we offer? People you're happy to work with (don't worryâ€”you'll meet them all before you come to work here, so you can decide for yourself). Competitive salary. Bonus and profit-sharing program. Complete suite of medical, dental, and vision benefitsâ€”free if it's just you and heavily subsidized if you're covering others. Zero-cost life and short and long-term disability insurance. Subsidized gym membership.1(k) match with no vesting requirement. Remote-first, flexible work environment. Emphasis on work/life balance. EEO Policy Statement. It is the policy of Enrich to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Designs and modifies proprietary company applications or specialized utility programs, using analysis and models to predict and measure the outcome of the design and providing direction to peers as needed. Modifies applications to correct errors, adapt to new technologies, or improve performance; analyzes code and/or data to identify causes of errors, as needed. Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience in Full Stack Development. Net:years Webapi using .Net core :years Angular :Years. Looking for full stack .Net developer with three to five years of experience with hands on knowledge of .Net Framework, Oracle Pl/SQL, webapi development and UI (Angular). Ability to design and develop web components. Must have experience with design, Develop and implementation of enterprise web applications using .NET Framework, ASP.NET core and Oracle Databases on Windows/Linux platforms. Has hands-on experience in developing n-tier applications using C#, ASP.NET, .NET Core, Oracle PL/SQL. Strong design, analysis, and problem-solving skills. Helps peers understand system architectural patterns and technical data flow of applicable systems. Review work done by team developers to ensure that they follow company standards and best practices. Contributes to, and may develop or direct, application testing and validation procedures and documentation. Interpersonal and communications skills, including ability to present and explain technical information within an interdisciplinary team setting. Additional skills. Understanding of, and ability to apply AGILE development methodology in performing duties. Deep understanding and working knowledge of relational databases. General Linux/UNIX operating system skills. Windows operating system skills. Understanding of GIT concepts. Software integration experience (SOAP web services and REST APIs) a plus. Put Our Members/Customers First in All We Do. Be Known for Our Innovative Products and People. Grow our Reputation and Market Share. Compete on Culture.

name: Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. A major financial services firm is looking for a Full Stack Java Developer. to join their team in New York, NY. Responsibilities: Managing the asset lifecycle, IT Platforms and how they interact with their core systems, ensuring they remain fit for purpose, well-supported and stable and that capacity planning is managed effectively. Executing their strategic IT agenda and in partnership with the business Lead translate their strategy into action by aligning this to the purpose of the Fleet. Asset support and stability, including increasing productivity whilst managing cost and quality. Developing and implementing IT Strategy within your and adopting market trends into the new way of working. Implementing DevOps techniques and practices like Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Test Automation, Build Automation and Test-Driven Development to enable the rapid delivery of working code-utilizing tools like Jenkins, Gradle and Git. Managing the full ecosystem of Technology, including the effective partnership with external vendors and providers and leveraging the full capabilities of global technology workforce. Ensuring that you create a service that are integrated, relevant, transparent and easy to consume. Maintaining a sound understanding of the regulatory environment in which they operate, the risks we face and make good decisions to ensure we protect their customers and the bank. Participating in the rapid development of user-driven prototypes to identify technical options and inform multiple architectural approaches. Managing a global team of high skilled developers. Qualifications: A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field with+ years of experience working as a hands-on developer. Front to back (full stack) experience with java-based applications. Advanced knowledge of Java, RESTful SOA, JavaScript (AJAX, JSON), Angular and SOAP. Expert level understanding of database, core database concepts and relational database design. Solid understanding and hands-on experience on development of java based RESTFul APIs. Experience utilizing one or more web frameworks, preferably Spring and Rails. Proficiency with Python, DB2, shell scripting, and autosys. Senior-level experience leading, motivating, coaching, and developing people and teams. Strong Technology acumen and a deep strategic mindset. Proven track record of delivering results and impact. Proven analytical skills and experience making decisions based on hard and soft data. A desire and openness to learning and continuous improvement, both of yourself and your team members. Strong influencing skills to achieve alignment up and down the organization.

name: Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. Description. Job Description: Leidos is seeking a Full Stack Developer to support development of mission critical applications involving AI/ML capabilities for a prominent intelligence mission. As a senior member of the development team, the successful candidate will be responsible for the creation and ongoing iterative development of microservice APIs that expose a robust and changing data environment to client UIs, and work with UI code to ensure data is presented properly. The Full Stack developer will be coordinating between UX developers and other back-end developers to ensure that the entire web application functions properly and is well-built. Primary Responsibilities. Design, develop and deliver modern secure software applications to enable the intel mission. Support grooming of user stories, breakdown of development tasks and estimation of effort. Employ a test-first development approach and code unit and integration tests to mitigate defect risks. Design overall application architecture involving microservices, micro-frontends, APIs, integration patterns, database models and similar. Instrument secure coding practices adhering to OWASP and mitigate vulnerabilities early. Employ modern microservices and event-driven architecture using frameworks like Kafka. Build reusability in day to day development and maintain library of reusable components and services. Obsess on code quality by continuously monitoring SonarQube reports, performing peer reviews and ensure high test coverage. Work with UX engineers and business analysts to design impactful and intuitive interfaces. Collaborate with Software Factory team to achieve disciplined adoption of modern software development practices like TDD, BDD, CI/CD and similar. Troubleshoot defect issues, deduce root cause, and implement mechanisms to prevent reoccurrence and mitigate offshoot issues. Efficiently divide and conquer software development tasks with application developers. Actively seek ways to improve business software processes and interactions. Aid and support the coaching and training of other team members to achieve better quality. Basic Qualifications. years of experience developing distributed software applications using modern and open source technologies and frameworks. Have worked with TypeScript or JavaScript in a modern JS framework. Excel at server-side web development (Java, Python, PHP, Perl). Experience in transactional logic in relational data stores (SQL, JDBC, etc.). Experience with non-relational data stores and indexers (caching, Mongo, Elastic, etc.). Work with and model data effectively. Understand HTTP and HTTPS protocols, REST APIs. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or related discipline. US Citizenship is required due to the nature of the government contracts we support. Security Clearance. Candidates must already possess an active TS/SCI clearance. Candidates must be willing to obtain and maintain a polygraph. Preferred Qualifications. Experience developing AI/ML enabled applications for an intel mission. Experience with Python-based microservices (Flask, FastAPI). ReactJS with TypeScript a plus. Conversant with WebSockets. Experience with GraphQL. Pay Range:

name: Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. BE PART OF A BANK LIKE NO OTHER. When you work with the world's most innovative companies, you know you're making a difference. Our clients are the game changers, leaders and investors who fuel the global innovation economy. They're the businesses behind the next medical breakthroughs. And the visionaries whose new technologies could transform the way people live and work. They come to SVB for our expertise, deep network and nearly forty years of experience in the industries we serve, and to partner with diverse teams of passionate, enterprising SVBers, dedicated to an inclusive approach to helping them grow and succeed at every stage of their business. Join us at SVB and be part of bringing our clients' world-changing ideas to life. At SVB, we have the opportunity to grow and collectively make an impact by supporting the innovative clients and communities SVB serves. We pride ourselves in having both a diverse client roster and an equally diverse and inclusive organization. And we work diligently to encourage all with different ways of thinking, different ways of working, and especially those traditionally underrepresented in technology and financial services, to apply. Job Description. Silicon Valley Bank is seeking an experienced Full Stack Developer that will report into the Sr. Manager, Marketing Technology to contribute to development of a world class marketing technology stack and deliver on innovation opportunities. Develop and sustain industry leading technology innovation to drive data-driven marketing and create client centric experiences. You have a strong understanding and aptitude for external digital and industry trends and can translate such trends into actionable innovation opportunities. Responsibilities: Technical development of new digital-age capabilities. Develop Proof of Concepts using UI tools such as HTML5, CSS by translating designer mock-ups, wire frames and data flows. Lead, evaluate and oversee technical solutions provided by agencies/vendors. Responsible for recommending solutions to Sr. Mgr. Marketing Technology, Director, Marketing Technology and Analytics and Head of Marketing Innovation which would be adopted. Provides recommendations on system and process enhancements, e merging technologies/new initiatives, data governance improvements, new standards and frameworks. Strong Agile development expertise. Deep knowledge in developing full stack web solutions. Design and Development. Concepting, creating and building web applications in partnership with product, UX and design teams to deliver world class customer experiences. Working through the website development lifecycle to launch. Designing user-based interactions through effective front-end architecture. Troubleshooting issues and problem solving as necessary. Resolve all issues raised during the different technical and functional testing stages. Create required technical documentation. Write unit tests to ensure enable automation and continuous delivery. Develop and maintain highly reliable and scalable code. Conduct code and design reviews and collaborate closely with IT and security architects. Develop Proof of Concepts using UI tools such as HTML5, CSS by translating designer mock-ups, wire frames and data flows. Lead, evaluate and oversee technical solutions provided by agencies/vendors. Develop Proof of Concepts using HTML5, CSS. jQuery and JavaScript by translating designer mock-ups, wire frames and data flows.% Support. Provide feedback on technical feasibility during ideation and prototyping. Working off of prototypes created by the UI/UX designer, build, unit test, and merge the code to bring the designs to fruition. Assist with the triage, root cause analysis, and fixing of any front-end defects raised during testing.% Decisions. Occasionally makes recommendations that require approval; does not make impactful decisions that do not require approval. Routinely follows defined process. Types of decisions include design approach, software build, and quality assurance approach. Skills and Competencies. Passion for agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and experimentation. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; ability to combine attention to detail with big picture perspective. Demonstrates excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to multi-task a variety of initiatives/ projects in a fast-paced environment. Ability to flex and navigate effectively through ambiguity. Strategic thinker and creative problem solver always looking for most optimal solution. Good planner; capability to "look around the corner" to determine risks and mitigating strategies. Strong work ethic and ability to work well in a team environment. Results driven. Required Education and Experience. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, or Engineering, or equivalent experience. years of experience developing full stack web solutions. years of experience working in marketing organizations. Hands on experience working with ASP.Net. JavaScript, html, CSS. Hands on API/RESTful API development. Comfortable writing SQL Queries, designing tables and communicating with databases through code. Preferred Education and Experience. years in B2B marketing / financial services. Epi server is a huge plus. Â©21 SVB Financial Group. All rights reserved. name: Full Stack Developer, Mid
description: Job Description. Job Number: R0118624. Full Stack Developer, Mid The Challenge: Are you looking for an opportunity to build powerho us e systems that will modernize cybersecurity? You know a good system is more than j us t a nice-looking interface + data. As a full-stack developer, you'll solve a problem with a complete end-to-end solution in a fast-paced, agile environment. We're looking for someone like you with the skills and experience to build enterprise capabilities. As a sof tware engineer on our team, you'll overcome their complex te chn ical challenges us ing the latest architectural approaches like microservices, cloud and pub/sub distributed systems alongside open-source frameworks and cloud services. You'll us e your passion to learn new tools and te chn iques, identify and implement system improvements, and mentor teammates. You'll analyze the needs and the environment to make sure the solution you're developing considers the current architecture and operating environment, as well as future functionality and enhancements. Work with us as we build systems to change cybersecurity for the better. Join us. The world can't wait. You Have: years of experience with working on sof tware development teams. years of experience in programming and design patterns, including Python, C#, or Java. Experience with databases, including SQL, Graph or NoSQL. Knowledge of programming fundamentals, concepts, and language mechanics. name: .NET Full-Stack Developer
description: Job Description. Aon is looking for a .Net Full Stack Developer As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions supporting Aon's Wealth Practice located anywhere in the U.S. Virtual even post-pandemic. In this role you will be involved with the entire application development lifecycle ranging from the initial feasibility analysis to requirements, design, development, testing, implementation, and production support. You will partner with our internal clients, vendors, and other colleagues to drive solution development forward. This role involves hands-on, full-stack development including front-end, middle tier, and back-end. Our applications are built on the .NET stack, using technologies such as C#, .NET Core Framework, and SQL Server. Responsibilities: Design, Develop, and Implement software solutions across the entire development stack (front-end, middle-tier, and back-end). Collaborate with business and technical team members on analysis and requirements. Provide technical assistance to other developers. Work with IT teams to craft, implement, and manage infrastructure. Provide ongoing application support and troubleshooting. Assist with prioritizing, requirements gathering, project management, and quality assurance. Proactively identify risk areas and opportunities for improvement. Continually learn, implement, and apply software development standard methodologies, tools and techniques. Y ou Bring Knowledge and Expertise Required Experience: years of C# software engineering experience, and the ability and willingness to explore other programming languages. Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new technologies and new business domains. Preferred Experience: Experience with Java. Familiarity with fundamental investment concepts. Experience with software containers and container management. Exposure to actuarial principles. Hands-on infrastructure management experience. Education: BA/BS in Computer Science or related field. #DICE We offer you A total rewards package, continuing education and training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization. The salary range for this position is $95,000 $120,000 annually. This salary range is an estimate, and the actual salary will vary based on applicant's education, experience, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity and alignment with market data. The salary may also be adjusted based on applicant's geographic location. This position is eligible to participate in one of Aon's annual incentive plans. The amount of the incentive varies and is subject to the terms and conditions of the applicable incentive plan. Aon offers a comprehensive package of benefits for full-time and regular part-time colleagues, including, but not limited to: a1(k) savings plan with employer contributions; an employee stock purchase plan; medical, dental and vision insurance, various types of leaves of absence, paid time off, including sick days and vacation days, short-term disability and optional long-term disability, health savings account, health care and dependent care reimbursement accounts, employee and dependent life insurance and supplemental life and ADand D insurance; optional personal insurance policies, adoption assistance, tuition assistance, commuter benefits, and an employee assistance program that includes free counseling sessions. Eligibility for benefits are governed by the applicable plan documents and policies. Our Colleague Experience: From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience. About Aon: Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our,000 colleagues in0 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance. Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce and is an affirmative action employer. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Disclaimer: Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.94523.

name: Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. Job ID:20092 Location: REMOTE WORK , VA , US Date Posted:21-12-20 Category: Software Subcategory: SW Engineer Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Travel: Yes, % of the Time Minimum Clearance Required: Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: None Potential for Remote Work: Yes Description. SAIC is seeking a Full Stack Developer to support the AF EITaaS team. This position is0% remote. Design, plan, develop, implement, and maintain software solutions across the EITaaS program, including business operations, product teams, and enhancing the end-user experience. Provides hands-on development in multiple technologies through system integrations, APIs, and process automation, utilizing programming skills and IVA/RPA technologies. Work with a team of individuals in an Enterprise program to implement scalable solutions in a secure DOD environment for a significant military customer. Automate business processes utilizing AI technology, machine learning, and enhance program resources performance, building efficient, scalable, and enterprise-level production processes. Programs, tests, and implements business solutions according to all SAFe Agile principles and industry standards. Engages with Product Owners and program stakeholders to develop acceptance criteria for features and user stories to meet business requirements. Actively participates in all SAFe Agile ceremonies. Participates in structured walkthroughs, secure coding, and technical reviews, ensuring application coding and design follow secure coding and design principles. Provides technical leadership and effectively communicates with all levels of management. Qualifications. Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, STEM field, or similarly qualified discipline (Advanced degree preferred), withyears of relevant experience. Additionalyears of relevant experience can be substituted for a Degree. Must be70 (at least IAT lvl compliant by date of hire. Active Secret Security clearance. Experience with enterprise-level Full Stack (Front-End, Back-End, and in between) application development to include: scripting, C#, C++, Java/J2EE, PowerShell, JavaScript, Angular, Microsoft .NET, HTML, CSS, in multiple platforms, Windows, Windows Server and Linux. Solid understanding of the current web, web application servers (Apache httpd, Apache Tomcat, IIS), APIs, web services (SOAP/REST), databases MySQL, MariaDB, Microsoft SQL Server. Understanding of containerization and familiarity with Docker. Kubernetes, and/or Jenkins. Knowledge of Microsoft AD, Azure AD, LDAP, and directory services. Excellent troubleshooting skills with the ability to work on and resolve complex technical issues. Experience developing and gathering requirements for complex enterprise systems. Strong analytical skills to interpret and translate business needs into application and operational requirements. Comfortable working0% remote and in highly matrixed environments, must be a self-starter. COVID Policy: Prospective and/or new employees are required to adhere with SAIC's vaccination policy. All SAIC employees must be fully vaccinated and they must submit proof of vaccination on their first day of employment. Prospective or new employees may seek an exemption to the vaccination requirement at Contact Us and must have an approved exemption prior to the start of their employment. Where work is performed strictly at a customer site, customer site vaccination requirements preempt SAIC's vaccination policy. Target salary range: $100,001 $125,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors. SAICÂ® is a premier Fortune0Â® technology integrator driving our nation's technology transformation. Our robust portfolio of offerings across the defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets includes secure high-end solutions in engineering, digital, artificial intelligence, and mission solutions. Using our expertise and understanding of existing and emerging technologies, we integrate the best components from our own portfolio and our partner ecosystem to deliver innovative, effective, and efficient solutions that are critical to achieving our customers' missions. We are more than,500 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. SAIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer, fostering a respectful work culture based on diversity, equity, and inclusion that values all contributors. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $7.1 billion. For more information, visit saic.com. My SAIC Benefits.

name: Full-Stack Developer, Senior
description: Job Description. Job Number: R0112638. Full-Stack Developer, Senior Key Role: Work as a full-stack JavaScript developer to build a system that will modernize, secure, and create efficiency for Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) capabilities to empower the intelligence community (IC) to gain insight and value from their big data holdings. Solve problems with complete end-to-end solutions in a fast-paced, agile environment. Utilize advanced skills needed to build a large-scale, data-centric platform for ISR analysts from vision to a production-ready system. Utilize in-depth JavaScript and Java expertise to learn new tools and techniques, identify and implement system improvements, and mentor teammates. Work with a wide range of technologies, including Java, Node.js, React, Dock er, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, and Amazon Web Services (AWS). Analyze the needs and the environment to ensure the solution considers the current architecture and operating environment, as well as future functionality and enhancements. This position is open to remote delivery anywhere within the U.S., to include the District of Columbia. Basis Qualifications: years of experience with back-end technologies, including Java, Go, Node.JS, Python, or Ruby and front-end technologies, including React, Angular, or Vue.js. Experience with Li nux, Shell scripting, Python or Bash scripting, and RESTful APIs. Experience with working in a cloud environment, including AWS, GCP, or Azure. Experience in working with a relational database and NoSQL database. Experience with MQ, Rabbit MQ, or Kinesis. Knowledge of object-oriented principles and writing clean code. Ability to work closely with operations to build and scale back-end services. Secret clearance. Bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM). Additional Qualifications: Experience with developing multi-threaded and synchronization applications. Experience with creating DevOps processes, including CI/CD pipelines. Experience with Redis, Kafka, and Elasticsearch. Experience with virtualization, load balancing, distributed systems, and networking. Experience with massive data storage, Hadoop, and MapReduce. Experience with Kubernetes or Openshift. Top Secret clearance. Master's degree. Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; Secret clearance is required. Compensation: The proposed salary range for this position in Colorado is0,000 to0,000. Final salary will be determined based on various factors. Our comprehensive benefit offerings include healthcare, retirement plan, insurance programs, commuter program, employee assistance program, paid and unpaid leave programs, education assistance, and childcare benefits. name: Full Stack Developer & Website Administrator
description: Job Description. Description. Job Description: Leidos is currently seeking a full-time Full Stack Developer and Website Administrator. who will support the Deployment Health Research Program at the Naval Health Research Center in San Diego, CA. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining web applications and systems in support of scientific initiatives. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter who has the ability to plan and prioritize work and work independently. Due the COVID-19 pandemic, employees are highly encouraged to work remotely from their home office, although weekly visits to the Naval Health Research Center in San Diego will be required. Longer term, this position will be required to be on-site at the Naval Health Research Center a minimum ofdays a week. Primary Responsibilities. Builds, maintains, and optimizes web applications (participants surveys, public facing websites, intranet sites/utilities, etc.). Work across the full platform stack (web/mobile front-end, server-side, scripting, and database systems) to implement features or improve our development workflow. Collaborates with Principal Investigators, data scientists, research coordinators, and the department's IT team to achieve elegant solutions that meet study needs and ensure requirements are met. Document change control to build/design change control procedures. Facilitate user acceptance testing with research team and address site/content/design feedback. Document lessons learned at the end of each website design project and partner with the project manager or web services lead to address feedback and improve the development process. Maintain code integrity and organization; creating specifications and document best practices for all applications, libraries, and code being developed or updated. Ensure website infrastructure is up to date with system and security updates. Lead the team in best practices in the areas of data integrity and secure coding practices. Ensure user documentation is up-to-date with changes to processes, new processes, and system design changes. Develops new functionality, themes or sites. Manages system performance and system backup. Basic Qualifications. Bachelors degree andor more years of experience in web application development. Knowledge and experience performing Full Stack Web Development using PHP or similar web languages. Expert understanding of database architecture and experience with MySQL and/or Microsoft SQL Server. Experience configuring Apache and/or Internet Information Services (IIS) web servers and performing security hardening according to best practices. DevOps experience managing Linux and/or Windows environments. Proven ability to write standards-compliant HTML/CSS/JavaScript utilizing modern frameworks such as Bootstrap or Tailwind CSS. Experience with git version control software. Ability to effectively and professionally communicate with investigators, vendors, and research staff. Due to federal contract restrictions, candidate must be a U.S. citizen and able to obtain a Secret Secu ity Clearance. We will assist any selected applicant in the process to obtain a secret clearance if they do not already have one. After package submission, it typically takes approximately three weeks for employees to be eligible to begin working. Naval Health West NHW Pay Range:

Believes in responsible growth and is dedicated to supporting our communities by connecting them to the lending, investing and giving them what they need to remain vibrant and vital Job Description: Broker dealers play an important role in global markets as market makers and traders by executing large multi-billion dollar trade volumes across a diverse and complex portfolio of products. Large regulatory fines as well as reputational risk could ensue if the Bank fails to follow few required rules like daily cash reserve deposits with FED, maintain net capital levels, report trading activities etc. Broker Dealer Regulatory Reporting Technology Function (BDFRR) was set up to eliminate operational risk in the reporting process by replacing legacy systems and processes with efficient automated technology stack. BDFRR Platform has footprint across DB, ETL, IIS, Pega, Linux, Python and Axiom Infrastructure components. Hence recruiting a Senior Developer with full-stack experience is very critical to reduce the operational risk, meet the tight SLA reporting deadlines and in enabling a smooth functioning of the intraday reporting processes of the business. Candidate will work as part of a development team and will be responsible for developing new features, as well as maintaining existing features across the tech stack. The developer will collaborate and communicate with the global team members and also work with Support teams to ensure stability of the application. Responsibilities include: Evaluate, analyze the problem definition and the requirements to design and develop new or existing features following SDLC. Collaborate with other developers on the team for code and design reviews to build High-quality reusable code. Troubleshooting and Performance tuning of the application for SLA enhancements. Document high level and component level design, ensure quality standards in terms of usability and security of all the application components. Partner well with the Scrum Master, Project Manager, and other agile team members. Skillsets: Hands-on experience in server-side development, UI development and Scripting. Capable of prioritizing multiple projects in order to meet goals without management oversight. Good understanding of database, performance tuning and debugging skills. Critical thinking and Problem-solving skills. Self-starter, team player, good communications. Domain knowledge in Investment Banking/ Regulatory Reporting. Qualifications: C# or Core Java or Microsoft .Net. JavaScript programming, ReactJS framework or HTML5, Angular for UI development. Python programming. Restful web services, application frameworks like Spring Core. Application servers such as apache, tomcat. Build tools like ant, maven or gradle. RDBMS like Oracle, SQL Server or PL/SQL programming. Data exchange formats such as XML, JSON. Job schedulers like Autosys. Build automation tools like Jenkins, Ansible and source control systems like GIT, Perforce. Agile methodologies. Optional : Data warehousing such as Informatica ETL tool. Axiom. Pega. Shell Scripting in Unix/Linux. Investment Banking/ Regulatory Reporting Domain knowledge.
