name: Database Administrator
description: Job Description. Description. Job Description: Leidos currently has an opening for a Database Administrator supporting a customized enterprise management application that manages curriculum design, forecasting, student registration, scheduling, instructor management, housing, financial management and comprehensive reporting. The system uses Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server databases. as well as standar ized products including Microsoft Windows Server, Red Hat Linux Server, and VMWare operating systems. Primary Responsibilities: Provide analysis, design, development, and deployment support for customer database requirements. Manage database auditing, to include daily review of audit reports. Continually investigate methods to improve database reliability and performance for peer review and implementation alongside developers and systems engineers. Provide input on capacity planning, high availability solutions and upgrade strategies. Proactive database performance monitoring, tuning and best practices implementation. Provide support and guidance to application developers with SQL tuning, data modeling and physical database design. Enforce and document database policies, procedures and standards, ensuring that storage and archiving procedures are functioning correctly. Providex7 support for critical production systems. Be available for after-hours maintenance activities. Communicate with technical, applications and operational staff to ensure database integrity and security. Diagnose and troubleshoot database errors where standard remediation and/or re-engineering and architectural changes may be required. Create and manage database reports, visualizations, and dashboards. Create and manage repeating, automated database tasks. Perform baseline and continuous hardening for Oracle and SQL Server databases according to industry and U.S. Government security controls, and best practices. Additional Responsibilities: Install, upgrade, and perform regular patch management of database management software components. Maintain full operational capability of Oracle (12c/18c) and Microsoft SQL Server (>=16) backend databases in support of the various business applications. Manage database access, including user, role, profile, and object-level permissions. Basic Qualifications: Bachelors' Degree or additional years of relevant work experience and years of relevant experience. Strong, hands-on production-level Oracle DBA experience on Unix/LINUX systems. Solid production-level SQL Server DBA experience. Thorough database high availability and replication experience using utilities such as Oracle RAC, Data Guard, Data Pump, etc. Excellent experience with database design, creation, upgrade. Solid knowledge of Oraclec and technical database concepts, such as: logical relational data modeling, physical data modeling, tuning large instances, resource management, data replication and backup/recovery techniques. Knowledge of heterogeneous database gateways, esp. between Oracle and SQL Server databases  Experience in Oracle database tuning and SQL optimization using Enterprise Manager Cloud Control, AWR/ADDM, etc. Ability to develop key performance metrics. Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to effectively troubleshoot, resolve, or escalate problems. Experience with automating database tasks using T/SQL, PL/SQL, Python, ksh, bash, csh, and (Windows) PowerShell scripting, and other automation utilities. Must have excellent communications and documentation skills. Understanding of Change and Incident Management processes, including. Subversion revision control. Preferred Qualifications: Oracle Database Administrator Certifications. Relevant AWS certification preferred. Pay Range: Pay Range $74,750.00 $115,000.00 $155,250.00 #Remote.

name: Database Administrator SQL/PostgreSQL
description: Job Description. Description. Job Description: Why wake up every day and want more when YOU CAN HAVE IT? Do you love KNOWING at the end of each day that your work made a difference? We embrace and solve some of the world's toughest challenges. We're focused on ensuring our intelligence customers have the right tools, technologies, and tactics to keep pace with an ever evolving threat landscape and succeed in their mission to protect people and critical assets around the world. Who wouldn't be fulfilled being part of that every day? We know once you join Team Leidos, you are sure to go home at the end of every day knowing YOU MADE A DIFFERENCE, resulting in one of the most REWARDING careers you could have imagined. EACH DAY MATTERS! We have an IMMEDIATE NEED for a Database Administrator to provide SQL and PostgreSQL support to Agile DevOps software development and to IT mission critical systems. The DBA will perform database administrator tasks including monitoring user access and security, monitoring performance and managing parameters to provide fast responses to front-end users, mapping out the conceptual design for a planned database, refining the logical design, installing and testing new versions, and refining the physical design to meet system storage requirements and conduct capacity planning Primary Responsibilities. Act as the SME and provide best practice recommendations for SQL and PostgreSQL. Provide SQL infrastructure engineering to include database architecture maintenance, database upgrades, server configurations, and application configurations. Install, configure, and manage multiple SQL server environments with high availability and disaster recovery, to include monitoring, analysis, reporting, and data warehouse services and solutions. Architect and design the configuration and operation of SQL platforms on all environments. Ensure proper integration of SQL with applications to include but not limited to SharePoint, Active Directory, etc. Ensure that storage and archiving procedures are functioning correctly. Work closely with IT Project Managers and Software Developers. Communicate with technical, applications and operational staff to ensure database integrity and security. Commissioning and installing new applications and customizing existing applications. Support on-call activities as needed. Basic Qualifications. Clearance Required to be considered for this role is a Top Secret. years of experience administering, patching, performance tuning and securing PostrgeSQL database. Preferred year administering Microsoft SQL Server. years of AWS RDS management experience. Experience with scripting using Ansible, Python or similar dynamic languages. Must have excellent communications and documentation skills. Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to effectively troubleshoot, resolve, or escalate problems. Experience in Federal Grants Management is a plus. BS degree and years of prior relevant experience or Masters with years of prior relevant experience. Preferred Qualifications. Oracle Database Administrator Certifications a plus. Relevant AWS certification preferred. Pay Range:

Leidos is seeking a Sr. DBA who enjoys working in a dynamic fast-paced environment to support the ALTESS Contract in Radford, VA. ALTESS is a managed service provider for Army and DoD IT systems and offers managed cloud services in Microsoft Azure. CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS: â€¢Must have an active Secret Security clearance. description: Job Description. Provide premium DB2 application DBA support and services to Ensono mainframe clients as they relate to Mainframe DB2 systems. REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS for LOGICAL DB2 Database Administrator: Bachelorâ€™s degree required and/or equivalent work experience. years of professional experience in DB2 for administration and application support. CA and IBM tools for DB2 a plus. Extensive experience with the following: Administrating and supporting databases in Mainframe DB2. Support multiple DB2 subsystems simultaneously. Supporting customer and internal requests for building all types of DB2 objects. Analyzing new versions of DB2 for functionality that can improve customer's systems. Refreshing test data for whole environments. Supporting DB2 security requests. Review DB2 security to find potential risks. Reorganization of application data. Vendor consultations for problems and questions. Space calculations for new objects and environments. Reviewing, tuning of internal DB2 buffer pools and SQL code. DR recovery of application objects. Troubleshooting and solving production database issues. Demonstrated ability to respond quickly and effectively to support requests from multiple clients. Experience establishing policies and procedures pertaining to database management, DR, security, maintenance and utilization preferred. Supporting multiple customer for after hours on-call. Self-motivated and able to work independently. Demonstrated ability to respond quickly and effectively to support requests from multiple clients. Must be able to multi-task and work under short deadlines and in high pressure situations. Excellent communication skills (written, verbal and presentations). Ability to work as part of a team, as well as independently.

name: Database Administrator
description: Job Description. Database Administrator. Job Summary. Perform technical and administrative functions to the Oracle Databases and operating systems. Administer all upgrades and patches to the Districtâ€™s system module and maintain version upgrades. Essential Functions. Create and deploy Oracle Databases and install and upgrade Oracle Database Software. Work on disaster recovery and performance tuning. Act as a technical reference for Oracle Database systems and assist users. Evaluate, specify, manage, install and upgrade Unix Operating System Hardware/Software. Monitor and take appropriate action to maintain integrity of databases including security issues and standards along with referential integrity checking and multiple access schemes. Install and upgrade the Districtâ€™s Administrative Software and integrate third party packages. Monitor the database and optimize database performance and use of resources including selecting optimal physical implementation of databases. Monitor and manage database backups when warranted, database restorations, porting of databases, and system performance evaluations. Perform database capacity planning and processing requirements. Consult with and coordinate work activities with other sections. Work with application developers to insure integration at the database level. Perform other duties as assigned. Qualifications. Required Qualifications: Bachelorâ€™s degree in Information Technology and six (6) years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience which demonstrates possession of the required knowledge, skills, and abilities. NOTE: A copy of the transcript reflecting this required education MUST be submitted for consideration and reflect completed coursework and degrees conferred. The candidate must be fully qualified for the position at the time of application. Knowledge of Oracle,i, andi on various UNIX and Windows platforms. Knowledge of Oracle Application Server (OAS: OracleAS,iAS). Knowledge of performance tools on Oracle. Ability to work in a diverse environment and be sensitive to issues of diversity and inclusion. Special Conditions: This is a security-sensitive position as defined under the Texas Education Code, Section.215; the successful applicant will be required to undergo a criminal background check, as permitted and/or required by applicable law, and in accordance with the Collegeâ€™s policies and procedures. Salary negotiable. Extension of application deadline. Other Requirements. Individuals desiring consideration MUST complete and submit an EPCC Application for Employment on-line by the announced deadline. To Apply: https://www.schooljobs.com/careers/epcc/jobs/3286088/database-administrator?page=5and pa getype=jobO pportunitiesJobs. COPIES OF ACADEMIC TRANSCRIPTS MUST BE SUBMITTED by mail, scanned/uploaded with the application, or hand delivered. CURRENT EMPLOYEES ARE ALSO REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THEIR TRANSCRIPTS WITH EACH SUBMITTED APPLICATION; TRANSCRIPTS IN PERSONNEL FILES CANNOT BE ACCESSED BY EVALUATORS FOR THIS PURPOSE. APPLICATIONS SUBMITTED WITHOUT TRANSCRIPTS WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED. Only documents stating 'Transcript' or 'Unofficial Transcript' will be accepted. Other documents (Degree Audit, Degree Summary, Program Summary, etc.), submitted in lieu of transcripts will not be accepted. Transcripts must be received within one week following the closing of the posting. Please mail your transcripts to El Paso Community College, Employment Services, P.O. Box500, El Paso, TX998. Mailed documents MUST include the position title and posting number for this position vacancy. A letter of application, resume, letters of recommendation, and other supporting documents are optional but highly encouraged and may be submitted on-line with the application form or forwarded to the Human Resources Department at the address shown above. Copies of transcripts must reflect completed coursework and conferred degrees. All academic coursework and degrees must be from a regionally accredited college or university or be certified by an acceptable agency that the institution is recognized by the appropriate governmental agency in its home country (this is generally stated in the degree evaluation). Transcripts issued in a language other than English must be accompanied by a full translation (word for word) by a current member of the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services (NACES). Additionally, each foreign transcript must be evaluated for equivalency to United States accredited coursework by an agency certified by the National Association of Credential Evaluation Services or granting institution if accredited by one of the regional accrediting bodies such as the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools. Applications containing foreign transcripts that are not accompanied with the above required documentation will not be considered. Out-of-town candidates invited for an on-campus interview will be reimbursed for one-half of the transportation cost for travel performed within the United States. The College will arrange and pay for up to two nights lodging. The El Paso County Community College district is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or gender identity. name: Senior SQL Server Database Administrator ( AWS)
description: Job Description. Role: Senior SQL Server Database Administrator ( AWS) NICE Actimize is comprised of talented, creative, and dedicated individuals with a passion for delivering innovative solutions to the market.At NICE Actimize, we recognize that every employee's contributions are integral to our company's growth and success. To find and acquire the best and brightest talent around the globe, we offer a challenging work environment, competitive compensation, and benefits, and rewarding career opportunities. Come share, grow, and learn with us you'll be challenged, you'll have fun and you'll be part of a fast growing, highly respected organization. MAIN DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE: The Cloud Operations team at DATAIQ consists of four members of staff who are responsible for all aspects of our software as a service environment. We have a mixture of cloud environments with private, hosted and Public on AWS. The Infrastructure is comprised of windows servers with a growing number of Linux and Kubernetes boxes. The ideal candidate will be an experienced SQL Database administrator, with a good understanding of working with AWS hosted SaaS web-based applications and High Availability Encrypted MS SQL Servers.In addition to these skills we are looking for people keen to lean and develop knowledge and processes. Experience of automation with shell script / PowerShell / ETL. The main responsibilities of the System Administrator role are: Supporting MS SQL AWS Cloud SaaS based infrastructure. Supporting High availability mission critical AWS Cloud SaaS based infrastructure and applications. MS SQL Server support including Local and Distributed Availability Groups / Merge and Transactional Replication and Performance analysis and troubleshooting. Ability to review SQL and make improvements for performance efficiencies. Monitoring of systems and batch import jobs (ETL). Troubleshooting batch job code in Bash and Python. Experience with monitoring systems including setting up new alerts via custom scripts (Nagios ect). Infrastructure as Code in both Cloud Formation and Teraform (YML and JSON). Experience in a Red or Blue security team, disto like Kali and its features. Experience with AWS Security Hub, AWS Network Firewall. Experience in Custom Lambda creation and .net containers. Capacity planning,  security policies, backup and monitoring. Understanding of Secure designs and the ability to act as a security champion. SPECIAL CIRCUMSTANCES(e. g. shifts, travel overseas, hours): W ek nd On-call cover/7 one week in two, weekend work requires active monitoring of batch processes and alerts. WORK AND TECHNICAL EXPERIENCE/BACKGROUND: Ability to work in a challenging and dynamic environment. Experience of providing production and development support for business-critical applications and servers. Ability to communicate and work effectively with other IT staff, e.g. developers, desktop support. Detail and Process  o iented, happy to do the required day to day support while on hand to deal with advanced issues. Acting as LevelApplication Support. Development or Production SQL Server DBA. Previous experience in AWS. Experience of working in a global team (a plus). OTHER REQUIREMENTS The right candidate will possess the majority of all the points below: Excellent communication skills, oral and written. Ability to work in a small team, to manage and share tasks if workload demands make this necessary. Customer facing skills as needed especially in troubleshooting network, application latency. Strong analysis and problem-solving skills. Ability to deliver quality results in the required timeframe. Eagerness to learn and champion new technologies. Ability to work with quantitative analyst and developer groups. Bachelors degree in Engineering or Computer Science preferred.7 years experience in MS SQL Database administration. NICE Actimize is offering a competitive base salary, commissions, and a full benefit package. Benefits include medical, dental,1K, vision, Life, STD, LTD, and a Flexible spending account. NICE is committed to provide an environment based on equal opportunity for all qualified applicants and employees. It is the policy of NICE to afford equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals, regardless of age, race, color, creed, religion, citizenship, ancestry, national origin, sex, gender, pregnancy, mental or physical disability, marital status, veteran status, service in the Armed Forces, sexual or affectional orientation, atypical hereditary cellular or blood traits, genetic information, status as a victim of domestic or sexual violence, and/or any other status protected by any applicable federal, state and/or local statute or regulation.

name: Sr. Oracle DBA
description: Job Description. Description. Job Description: Leidos is hiring an energetic, motivated, innovative individual to be a part of our team supporting Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) in Baltimore, MD. The Sr. DBA works closely with the Program team to manage and maintain the applications and infrastructure that support CMS and the public. You will deliver solutions that ultimately ensure that the functions of Medicare, Medicaid, and Marketplace are carried out for the and contribute to efforts to reduce healthcare costs. Primary Responsibilities Successful candidate will be a member of a cross functional team comprised of well-rounded engineers who can learn new skills rapidly and work across multiple functional domains to carry out end-to-end delivery of infrastructure services. Work closely with Leidos Engineering and Operations staff as well as the customer's application owners to solve technical problems at the network, system and application levels. Help design, test and deploy technical solutions that are innovative and that leverage new both technologies and new methods to shape customer operations. You will have the opportunity to grow in your career as you help us to grow in our value and breadth of services to CMS. The Database Administrator works closely with the Integrated Service Delivery (ISD) teams to manage and maintain the applications data infrastructure that support CMS and public health. You will maintain and deliver solutions that ultimately ensure that the functions of Medicare, Medicaid, and the Healthcare.gov Marketplace are car ried out for the and contribute to efforts to reduce healthcare costs. You must be a team player, but able to work independently on large, complex projects and assignments in an intensive environment. Participate in on-call rotation and respond to incident alerts. Expert in multiple relational and object database platforms and schemas. Understands modeling and optimization of said platforms. Leads database services team in the administration of multiple platforms, supporting and communicating with customers and other stake holders. Provides leadership in problem determination/analysis, isolating system problems utilizing diagnostic and system management tools. Promotes automation and monitoring/alerting for full visibility of database systems and applications. Provides professional and courteous service at all times with excellent communications skills. Models inclusive leadership to teammates by building diversity into activities and meetings. Basic Qualifications BS Degree and12 years of experience in an enterprise Oracle RDBMS environment. Experience may be substituted in lieu of degree. Hands on expertise with Oracle data warehouses using Oracle workflow and Oracle warehouse builder. Some with database design or creating DDLs for creating and updating data structures, and performance improvement. Strong awareness of DBMS trends and their implications. Very strong communications, analysis, and interpersonal skills. Preferred Qualifications Experience in non-Oracle relational and non-relational DBMS environments including, but not limited to MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Informix, etc. Cloud Skills Understanding of cloud terminology, architecture, and tools including provisioning and monitoring. Network Skills Understanding of basic networking design concepts and TCP/IP. Flexibility-comfortable with evolving solutions and finding the most effective path to implementation. Security Skills-Knowledge of information assurance compliance and information security basics. Development Skills Programming/development experience including use of repositories (e.g. GitHub) and deployment in multi-ti er environment. Comfortable in an iterative environment, experience with Agile/Scrum based initiatives. All candidates supporting the CMS programs must have lived in the United States at least three (3) out of the last five (5) years prior in order to be considered. Pay Range:

name: Senior Postgre SQL DBA
description: Job Description. Duties: Provide technical expertise and support in the use of DBMS. Evaluate and recommend available DBMS products to support validated user requirements. Define file organization, indexing methods, and security procedures for specific user applications. Create and maintain database objects such as tables, views, index, constraints, etc. for data platf rm and custom applications. Develop, implement, and maintain database backup and recovery procedures for the processing environments, and ensures that data integrity, security, and recoverability are built into the DBMS applications. Drive end-to-end availability, performance monitoring, and capacity planning for PostgreSQL, using native andd party tools. Design and develop logical and physical database designs from application requirements. Design and implement automation using scripts and database functions. Design and implement replication and backups for mission critical/tier-1 applications. Design and implement automation using scripts, must be proficient in scripting. Education: Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university with a major in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business, or other related scientific or technical discipline. Experience: At least six (6) years of experience in administering on-prem/cloud based multiuser environment with expertise in planning, designing, building, and implementing complex database systems. In depth knowledge of the EDB PostgreSQL DB architecture. AWS cloud base Postgres database administration experience. Driven end-to-end availability, performance monitoring, and capacity planning for PostgreSQL, using native andd party tools. Implemented automated methods and industry best practices for consistent installation and. configuration of EDB PostgreSQL for production, pre-production and non-production environments. Administrated PostgreSQL databases throughout the non-production (Sandbox, development, test. UAT, Training), pre-production (Staging) and production lifecycles in an AWS environment. Experienced with optimizing database performance through exhaustive pro-active testing and ongoing real-time monitoring. Experienced in scripting and database functions. Experience in testing database security and enterprise policy guidelines according to established best practices. Monitored and maintained the backups for database recoverability for all production databases. Must have experience working in the database domain with at least four (4) years of experience. managing all operations of RDBMS databases such as Oracle/SQL Server/DB2 with a minimum of. two (2) years of EDB PostgreSQL DB. Experience with AGILE / DEVOPS a plus. Preferred Qualifications: Functional experience in Federal and/or State health and human services (HHS) programs is preferred (i.e., Child Welfare (CCWIS), Chi ld Support, Adult Protective Services, Juvenile Services, Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF), Women, Infants and Children (WIC), Electronic Benefits Transfer (EBT), Medicaid, Children. Health Insurance Program (CHIP), Care Management, EHR, Child Care).

Experience in Database monitoring and tuning using TKPROF, EXPLAIN PLAN, OEM and custom scripts. Hands on experience in DB backup/recovery process using RMAN. Experience in using Data pump, Export /Import, Sqlplus and SQL Loader. Knowledge of PL/SQL is a must, T-SQL Plus. Experience in backend design and development. Knowledge of Windows and Linux environments. Knowledge of networks and PC operating systems. Extensive technical and design knowledge. Good administrative and applicative knowledge. Proficient and competent in communication, accountability, decision making, intrapersonal and interpersonal skills. Experience in Data Migration among various RDBMS. Cloud working experience AWS preferred, Azure is a plus. Sapiens is an E-Verified and Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, M/F/D/V.

name: Sr. Oracle DBA
description: Job Description. Hybrid Remote Office. Please Apply: https://www.meridian.coop/c ompany. M eridian Cooperative. is looking for an Oracle Database Administrator to support our Database team in our Atlanta, GA office location. We were formed in76 by a group of Electric Membership Cooperatives with a vision for a single enterprise solution provider to serve data processing, IT, and operational needs to cooperatives, public utility districts, and municipal utilities. Through carefully curated acquisitions and partnerships, we have unified multiple leading-edge companies under its umbrella in order to truly execute that vision. Today, the Meridian Co-op Suite serves over0 utilities across the country with industry leading enterprise software solutions. We are a leader in creating innovative software solutions for the utility industry. We are home to a diverse group of developers, designers, analysts, instructors, and a dedicated support team. We are always looking for talented and energetic people to add to our team! Summary: Using expert level experience, manages, develops and maintains Oracle internal and external customer production databases by analyzing department applications, programming, and operations; defines database physical structure and functional capabilities, database security, data back-up, and recovery specifications; recommends best practices and optimum access techniques; troubleshoots performance issues and recommends areas for improvement; coordinates installation requirements. Manages database upgrades to the latest version and updates and installs security patch sets. Roles and Responsibilities: Monitors and ensures the day-to-day administration and maintenance of Oracle customer production databases, ensuring that the databases are available, performing properly and safe. Performs installations, upgrades and patching, backup and recovery, performance tuning, security, monitoring and configuration. Responds to and recovers crashed databases at customer sites and minimizes downtime by recovering it as near to the crash time as possible. Develops and reviews database designs to ensure table normalization's are maintained, standards are met and proper constraints are in place to ensure data integrity is not compromised. Collaborates with team members and confers with managers when needed regarding problems with and capabilities of customer databases. Assists developers in the creation of data objects and migration of data in Development and QA department databases. Configures Oracle RMAN backups on all production databases. Verifies that the Oracle RMAN backups are valid through periodic testing and RMAN restores. Develops customer database reorganizations using PL/SQL scripts to maintain database integrity. Migrates all current customer databases over to the new releases based on schedules. Monitors and implements advanced security features at customer sites to protect data against cyber hacks. Conducts annual version roll over in preparation for coding of the new version cycle. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree; equivalent professional experience may be considered for substitution for the required degree on an exception basis.to years of Oracle DBA experience. PL/SQL programming. Shell Scripting. Linux / Unix experience. Performance Tuning Experience. Oracle Multitenant. Certifications: Oracle Certified Associate. Guided by our Vision25 strategy, our leaders have developedstretch goals to achieve a best-in-class organization for our members, customers, and employees. It is a priority that our future team member embraces these goals and demonstrate the behaviors to guide the company to realize success: Act as One Unified Company. Put Our Members/Customers First in All We Do. Be Known for Our Innovative Products and People. Grow our Reputation and Market Share. Compete on Culture. We offer: Competitive medical benefits package including health, dental, vision, and life.1(k) with up to in company contributions after one year. $4,000 for tuition reimbursement. Wellness reimbursement plan and volunteer days. Meridian Cooperative is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment for all employees. Unfortunately we cannot sponsor employment visas now or in the future for this position.

name: DB2/DBA
description: Job Description. CAI is actively seeking a DB2 DBA to join a growing client in the Central PA area! Responsibilities: Introduction of new functionality of Db2 on z/OS. Application support for changes and problems. Production data updates. Table definitions, design, and modifications. Design/development of Triggers and Stored Procedures. Configure and customize Db2 Tools (Admin Tool, Query Monitor, QMF). Monitoring of Db2 performance IBM tools and TOAD for DB2 LUW. Db2 connectivity direct data drivers, remote system connectivity. DB2 Federated Database on AIX. DB2 LUW on AIX. SQL tuning. Business Recovery. Support for SMARTIS. DB2 Bufferpool tuning. Manage zParms. Acceptance environment refresh with Production Data. name: SQL Database Administrator (DBA)
description: Job Description. UVA Medical Center is seeking a SQL Server Database Administrator. The SQL DBA performs advanced implementation/support for systems application and monitoring; is responsible for installing, configuring, and maintaining operating system workstations and servers, including web servers in support of business processing requirements; performs software installations and upgrades to operating systems and layered software packages; schedules installations and upgrades and maintains them in accordance with established IT policies and procedures; monitors and tunes the system to achieve optimum performance; develops and promotes standard operating procedures; conducts routine hardware and software audits of server to ensure compliance with established standards policies and configuration guidelines; develops and maintains comprehensive operating system hardware and software configuration database/library of all supporting documentation; provides integrated team support and maintenance of Technical Services hardware and software; provides design and implementation support for server hardware Microsoft Windows operating systems virtualization Active Directory Group Policy TCP/IP/DHCP/DNS IIS SQL Exchange, Clustering, Load Balancing, SAN/NAS and advanced support. The preferred candidate will have: Experience installing/upgrading SQL versions, applying SQL patches, backup/recovery, and migration of data. Experience and skills related to Windows Server (Windows Server12 R2, Windows Server16, Windows Server19) administration Experience with the SSRS, SSAS, SSIS, T-SQL, and SQL Server Powershell. Ability to set up and maintain statistics, indexes, and agent jobs. Advanced understanding of SQL Security including hardening and addressing SQL Server health assessment reports. Provide Technical support for MSSQL databases including responding to help desk tickets and working with customers to resolve issues. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related field required. Relevant experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.years of relevant experience with Microsoft SQL Server and Microsoft Windows Server (versions12/2016/2017/2019 for both). Must be available to be on-site in Charlottesville, Virginia. Relocation reimbursement may be provided for the right candidate. PHYSICAL DEMANDS This is primarily a sedentary job involving extensive use of desktop computers. The job does occasionally require walking some distance to attend meetings, and programs. This position will not sponsor applicants for work visas. Position Compensation Range: $32.48 $51.98 Hourly COVID Vaccination Requirement. name: Database Administrator
description: Job Description. Database Administrator. Job no:9162. Work type: Staff. Location: Monterey Bay. Categories: UnitCSUEU Technical Support Services, Probationary, Full Time, Information Systems and Technology. Classification: Analyst/Programmer Career. Anticipated Hiring Salary: Low to mid $7,000's/month. https://www.calstate.edu/csu-system /careers/ compensation/Pages/SalaryScheduleDetails.aspx?RecordId=3584#-Cla ssNum=0400-Class=0-Date=1-PLYear=2021-PLNumber=2104-Recs=15. Hours: Full-time / hours per week. FLSA: Exempt. Priority Screening Date: January22. Recruitment Status: Open Until Filled. ABOUT CSUMB. Powered by an inspiring https://csumb.edu/about/founding-vision-stateme nt, https://csumb.edu/about. (CSUMB) is a mid-sized c omprehensive baccalaureate and masters granting university whose staff and faculty help transform student lives through a focus on student success and engagement through project-based learning, service learning in its regional community, and the promotion of multicultural and global perspectives on and beyond campus. CSUMB is both a Minority Serving Institution (MSI) and a Hispanic Serving Institution (HSI) and has a vibrant, diverse student body of over400 students. The university's https://csumb.edu/about/mission-strategic-plan. prior itizes inclusive excellence through recruiting and investing in the development of a diverse body of faculty, staff, and administrators. CSUMB's sustainability initiative is to be carbon neutral by30. The university's faculty and staff, many of whom live in the East Campus housing development, appreciate living and working so close to the shores of the beautiful Monterey Bay. As one of the campuses in the California State University (CSU) system, CSUMB offers excellent benefits, including access to below-market-rate campus housing and competitive salaries for faculty and staff. PURPOSE: Under the general supervision of the Associate Director of Enterprise Application Services, the incumbent is responsible for the System Administration, System Monitoring, Performance and Tuning, Patches and Fixes, Clones/Backup/Recovery and Infrastructure Configuration for the Information Technology (IT) Enterprise Operations and System Administration Support Group. This includes working independently on assigned tasks in close collaboration with other members of the IT team to address the specific needs of the University. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include, but are not limited to, the following: Setup, configuration, customization and administration of enterprise applications, databases and infrastructure including IaaS, PaaS, and other cloud services. Focus on process automation and documentation with an emphasis on increasing efficiency and effectiveness of environment setup and configuration, processes and workflows. Maintain reliable uptime/operations, security protocols, user permissions, license management, sandbox management and documentation. Monitor and evaluate system performance including performing regular system maintenance, event monitoring, data integrity and data cleansing activities. Coordinates and performs system upgrades and infrastructure, new or modified system and client installations. Assists users with systems problems and troubleshooting. Escalates and coordinates resolutions with appropriate system and user groups. Perform regular backup operations and implement appropriate processes for data protection, disaster recovery, and failover procedures. Collaborates with EAS and cross-functional/technical teams in requirements gathering, planning, coordination and implementation of new campus systems and projects. Other Functions: May direct the tasks of student assistant(s). Perform other job-related duties and special projects as assigned. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Knowledge of: Enterprise systems, applications, and technical standards; Linux/UNIX operating systems, database productivity tools including Oracle Enterprise Manager, SQL, SQLPlus, PL/SQL, and SQLLoader; data administration principles and data modeling concepts; technical and vendor documentation and ability to maintain internal documentation; system development life cycle and structured systems development concepts; system capability, design restrictions, and security requirements; client/server technologies, network connectivity, integration, configuration, and protocols. Ability to: apply consultative skills to assess user needs and communicate technology systems and solutions; maintain databases and middleware applications through performance tuning and applying patches/fixes/upgrades; develop program implementation plans, install software, and apply fixes; identify hardware/software interface problems; perform interactive debugging and to test and analyze program failures; use systems work flow and logic flowchart techniques; use project management tools. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: A basic foundation of knowledge and skills in database management, applications packages and programming, systems analysis and related programming support functions is a prerequisite. This foundation would normally be obtained through a bachelor's degree, preferably in computer science or business, or equivalent training and applied experience. Working knowledge of industry standard applications programming languages and knowledge of standard systems analysis techniques. SPECIALIZED SKILLS: Experience with database technologies (Oracle, MySQL, Redshift) with strong command of PL/SQL, OEM, RMAN and OAS. Subject Matter Expert with cloud end-to-end architecture, including AWS and future providers. Experience with Linux and Windows Server environments including shell script. Experience with deploying/customizingd party add-ons and managed packages. Experience with data integrity, data quality, data migration and data maintenance. Project management skills and experience driving programs independently. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent, in addition to the required experience. SPECIAL CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT and POSITION DESIGNATIONS: All offers of employment are contingent upon the successful completion of a background check (including a criminal records check). The person holding this position is considered a â€œmandated reporterâ€ under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in http://www.calstate.edu/EO/EO-1083-rev-7-21-17.html. as a condition of empl oyment. T his position will have a du ty to report to the Campus Title IX Officer information pertaining to victims of sex discrimination, sexual harassment, sexual misconduct, dating/domestic violence, and stalking as required by http://www.calstate.edu/eo/EO-1095-rev-6-23-15.html. This position is requir ed to com ply with confidentiality re quirements outlined in the Department of Education's Family Educational Rights and Privacy and California's Educational Code Chapter regarding sensitive student issues. This position will have responsibilities that require the employee to possess a license, credential or other certification in order to meet minimum job qualifications and/or to qualify for continued employment. Specify license, credential or certification required: Must possess and maintain a valid license to drive in the State of California, pass the Defensive Training Class, and be insurable under the University's liability coverage. May require occasional evenings and/or weekend work. This position has been designated as a sensitive position with: access to and responsibility for detailed personally identifiable Levelconfidential information about students, faculty, staff or alumni that is protected, personal or sensitive as defined in the https://dl.airtable.com/zgstG8qzSAyuLfU4NKDTData%20Classification.pdf. control over ca mpus busi ness processes, either through functional roles  or system security access. PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT: Office environment with standard equipment and tasks. Position requires working at a computer and desk for extended periods of time. May require travel between campus offices and off-campus locations. There are components of this job which are deemed essential on campus. This position will primarily work on the main campus, with occasional work from home. This position requires working on campus with students. The health and safety of our students, faculty, and staff remain our highest priority. In the fall, students, faculty, staff, and the community can expect that masks will be required and that the appropriate degree of social distancing will be in place in all areas based on evolving guidance. Additionally, all students, faculty, and staff are encouraged to be vaccinated before coming to campus. All community members who work or attend class on campus should expect to participate in a random or periodic testing system. CSUMB will communicate more information about vaccination requirements and testing protocols when the details become available. BENEFITS: CSUMB offers a premium benefit package that includes outstanding vacation, health, dental and vision plans; membership in the California Public Employees Retirement System (CalPERS); and-paid holidays a year. For more information, visit https://www2.calstate.edu/csu-system/careers/benefits/Documents/employee-benefits-summary.pdf.  Additiona lly, University Corporation at CSU Monterey Bay provides access to a ffordable campus housing based on availability; visit https://csumb.edu/corporation/employee-housing. for more information. APPLICATION PROCEDURE: For f ull consideration, applicants must complete the required online application prior to the priority screen date found at http://www.csumb.edu/jobs. Application submissions received after the application screening date  will b e reviewed at the discretion of the University. Materials submitted become the property of CSUMB and will not be returned. CSUMB is not a sponsoring agency for staff or management positions. Reasonable accommodations will be provided for qualified applicants with disabilities who self-disclose by contacting University Personnel at (831)2-3389. All employees must be eligible for employment in the U.S. GENERAL INFORMATION: CSUMB hires only individuals lawfully authorized to work in the United States and is an E-Verify employer. In compliance with federal crime awareness and campus security legislation, including the Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics, you can view the notice of availability and access the Cal State University, Monterey Bay annual security and fire safety reports at https://csumb.edu/clery/asr-and-fsr-notices-availability. CSUMB requires faculty, staff, and students who  are accessing campus facilities to be immunized against COVID-19 or declare a medical or religious exemption from doing so. Any candidates advanced in a currently open search process should be prepared to comply with this requirement. The systemwide policy can be found at https://calstate.policystat.com/policy/9779821/latest. and questions may be sent to mailto:universitypersonnel @csumb.edu.  CSUMB is a smoke and tobacco-free campus. We value and celebrate diversity in all its forms and strive to foster an inclusive culture built on respect that affirms inter-group relations and builds cohesion. We consider qualified applicants for employment for their anticipated contributions and without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetic information, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, veteran status, or disability. name: ATSU
description: Job Description. A.T. Still University (ATSU) has an opening for a Network Database Administrator. The position is responsible for the environmental aspects of database, database systems, files, and file storage systems used on the ATSU network. This responsibility includes administration, monitoring, security, capacity planning, data archival, backup and recovery. The position covers all ATSU users for all schools, programs, and services. It is a position that will focus on making sure all systems stay in compliance with all regulations and policies. The Network Database Administrator also is tasked with making sure database systems are well designed and capable of peak performance. This position may be performed as a remote worker. Network Database Administrator Duties and Responsibilities: Recovery creating and testing archival, backup, and recovery of databases and file systems. Integrity verifying or helping to verify data integrity. Security Defining and/or implementing access controls to the data. Availability ensuring optimum uptime. Performance ensuring optimum performance given budgetary constraints. Development and Testing Support helping software developers and engineers to efficiently utilize the database and file systems. Maintain Core Infrastructure monitoring systems, redundancy, and analyze systems to make recommendations for improvements. Assist with testing and certification of updates on Server infrastructure. Work with and maintain relationships with vendors/partners. Address other technical issues and duties as assigned. Network Database Administrator Required Skills and Qualifications: Four year college degree with a major in Computer Science or Information Technology required.5 years experience required in d atabase management in an Microsoft SQL environment, Microsoft Server operating systems, ODBC driver setup and configuration, familiarity with troubleshooting problems in a network environment. Knowledge of SQL (Structured Query Language). Microsoft SQL Server. Archive, backup and recovery methodologies. Business continuity planning. Microsoft server operating systems. Network security. The OSI model. Database design in SQL, server management and security in both a Microsoft Server and SQL Server. Network connectivity and setup. Disk storage design. Ability to read, analyze and interpret technical literature. Ability to publish technical information. Ability to solve practical problems in the field sometimes under great pressure. ATSU is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. For more information and to apply, visit atsu.edu/atsu-1887.

name: Senior SQL Database Administrator
description: Job Description. Senior SQL Database Administrator. ND Paper, a leading paper product manufacturer in the US with approx. $1 billion annual sales, is a wholly owned subsidiary of Nine Dragons Paper (Holdings) Limited, the largest containerboard producer in China and Asia, with $10 billion annual sales. We are an environmentally friendly company that manufactures various types of high-quality pulp, paper and paper-based packaging materials. Our mills in Rumford, Maine and Biron, Wisconsin are integrated paper and pulp facilities, and our mill in Fairmont, West Virginia is one of only three in the world that produces air-dried, recycled pulp. Our fourth mill in Old Town, Maine produces softwood kraft pulp. We are proud of our00 dedicated employees, who together produce more than2 million short tons of pulp and paper annually. We are looking to hire top talent to join our dynamic team! ND Paper offers full benefits and a competitive compensation and a challenging and exciting face-paced work environment. Come join ND Paperâ€™s progressive IT team and take advantage of all of the opportunities ND Paper offers to expand and grow your career. The Senior Database Administrator will manage and support the SQL landscapes within the environment. This role will coordinate and work with other team members on the technical design, development and ongoing improvements relating to our SQL needs. What we are looking for: able to understand the dependencies that require SQL services and can take technical ownership of the SQL landscape. able to work within a team and ensure that SQL services are available for our needs and that the technology grows to the needs of the company. a self-starter and can not only maintain the landscape, but suggest and execute improvements to it. able to adapt to change and be willing to understand how SQL services are being consumed and not only provide best practices, but mentor and guide others on how best SQL can be used. able to keep the landscape standardized to the limitations of what is consuming SQL services. willing to learn and expand their knowledge outside of just supporting SQL. Job Responsibilities: Demonstrate safety as a core value and establish a safe work environment by Setup and administering of high availability, redundancy, security and performance monitoring of all relational databases in production and non-production environments. Monitor and respond to all issues to ensure success of all scheduled jobs. Execute database related activities for changes to all database objects primarily in OLTP designs Performance tuning (SQL query, stored procedures and DB engine). Assist development teams in creating database procedures and triggers. Ability to identify production performance issues, blocking and deadlocks and long running queries. Aid with client problem escalation where applicable. Participate in our monthly release process. Ability to effectively communicate and document designs, processes and work. Develop, document and institute best practices. Must have experience and be available to provide support in aX7 environment; this role will require on-call support. Attributes for Success. Hard work â€“ tackle each task with determination, passion and creativity; the willingness to put in whatever effort is required to successfully complete the job at hand. Pursuit of Excellence â€“ strive to consistently exceed expectations in our day-to-day work and outperform our competitors in the marketplace, regarding work and company achievements as a collaborative goal with the desire to go above and beyond. Integrity treat the company and teammates with upmost respect, operating on strong moral codes to drive company values and culture. Sense of Urgency â€“ drive forward each day with speed, agility, and flexibility to capture unrealized opportunities and avoid potential risks for the business. Entrepreneurial Spirit â€“ act like an owner, challenging the status quo, asking the right questions, and actively seeking ways to innovate and improve. Adaptability â€“ be fluid with ND Paperâ€™s continuous evolution while driving change in a fast-paced environment, equipped with the ability to acclimate quickly. Servant Leadership â€“ set an example by implementing meaningful leadership with heart, empathy, foresight and stewardship. Experience Required: A passion to work with Microsoft and SQL Server technologies. S. in Computer Science or Computer Engineerin  or equivalent experience. yearsâ€™ experience working with SQL Server technologies. Strong knowledge of OLTP and OLAP environments, design, modeling, performance considerations and SQL internals. Experience with SQL and where Microsoft is going with it. Experience with utilizing XML and Window Functions within SQL. Experience with SSIS and SSRS. Experience with Oracle. Experience using a variety of methods to identify and resolve database related performance issues or errors. Experience with encryption and security (in flight, at rest, and column level). Exposure to network, infrastructure and virtualization technologies as it relates to the successful configuration and run of databases in production and non-production environments. Team Foundation Server (TFS) and GitHub a plus. Exposure to SQL Server Service Broker. Exposure to Microsoft technologies (ASP.NET, C#, etc.) and Object-Oriented Development concepts a plus. Demonstrated creative thinking and problem-solving capabilities. Strong logical organizational skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced, challenging environment and handle multiple tasks simultaneously while maintaining a positive and professional demeanor. No unsolicited resumes ND Paper does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies. Any unsolicited resume you submit to us will immediately become the property of ND Paper. If you would like to become a recruiter for ND Paper, please contact us and we will agree in writing to terms and the specific job roles for which you are authorized to recruit.

name: SQL Database Administrator
description: Job Description. The Department of Technology is the centralized technology services provider within San Francisco City and County government, delivering technology infrastructure and services to approximately,000 employees and0,000 residents. The department has an annual operating budget of over $130M and contains over0 employees. Core service areas include: Infrastructure and Operations, Technology Security, Service Delivery and Management, Enterprise Applications, Project Management Office, Public Safety Systems and Wiring, Affordable Housing Broadband, Technology Administration, Policy and Governance and IT Public Communications. Position: The Department of Technology database team is highly regarded across the City for its excellence in customer support and responsiveness. This team provides centralized database administration services supporting critical applications for City departments. City clients include the Controller Peoplesoft People and Pay, Financials, and BI applications, the Police department Crime Data Warehouse and Incident reporting system,1 Customer Service Center applications, and the Department of Technology service areas such as Security, GIS, and Finance that depend on database platforms. As part of this team, you will be responsible for all aspects of database administration from installation of the most current Oracle, SQL Server, and PostgreSQL technology to architecting and supporting high availability and disaster recovery architectures. We are looking for a highly skilled technician and problem solver who can work independently as well as partner and share knowledge with co-workers. Essential Duties: Participate in overall project planning, providing database tasks and milestones for project plans. Establish and maintain database standards for operational systems. Install, upgrade, and patch database software and related products. Participate in hardware capacity planning and configuration for database environments. Plan and implement database backup and recovery procedures and schedules based on application requirements. Monitor database environments and proactively address issues. Architect high availability and disaster recovery solutions for database environments. Analyze and resolve database-related issues in areas of performance, availability, and production operations as needed within established SLAs. Attend project meetings with Department of Technology and client department staff. Providex7 standby support on a rotational basis. Qualifications. An associate degree in computer science or a closely related field from an accredited college or university OR its equivalent in terms of total course credits/units [i.e., at least sixty (60) semester or ninety (90) qu arter credits/units with a minimum of twenty (20) semester or thirty (30) quarter credits/units in computer science or a closely-related field]; AND. Three (3) years of experience analyzing, installing, configuring, enhancing, and/or maintaining the components of Oracle database environments. SUBSTITUTION: Additional experience as described above may be substituted for the required degree on a year-for-year basis (up to a maximum of two (2) years). One (1) year is equivalent to thirty (30) semester units/ forty-five (45) quarter units with a minimum of semester / quarter units in computer science or a closely related field. Desirable Qualifications. Experience with the Exadata Oracle Engineered system. Experience with Oracleg,c, andc database versions. Experience with the SQL Server database platform. Experience with the PostgreSQL open source database platform. Special Requirements: Criminal Justice Information Services (CJIS) Security Clearance is required. (See Security Clearances and Background Investigations below). Note: Medical Testing: Prior to appointment, eligible candidates must successfully pass the TB testing process. Security Clearances and Background Investigations: Positions in this classification may require that successful candidates who become eligible for appointment may be required to go through a background investigation to determine the candidate's suitability for employment in this classification. Factors considered in the investigation may include employment history, use of illegal/controlled substances. Reasons for rejection based on this investigation may include, but not limited to applicable convictions, repeated or serious violations of the law, inability to accept supervision, inability to follow rules and regulations, falsification of application materials and/or other relevant factors. Failure to obtain and maintain security clearance may be basis for termination. name: Senior Database Administrator
description: Job Description. Job Description. The Senior Database Administrator in the IT department is responsible for planning, directing, and coordinating the design, installation, implementation, and connectivity of database infrastructure to ensure the stable and advanced operation of the organization's databases and data. This includes developing, configuring, maintaining, supporting, and optimizing all new and existing database components and software. Duties. Own, track and resolve database related incidents and requests, fulfilling requests and resolving incidents. Secure database by developing policies, procedures, and controls. Ensures data is protected and backed up. Maintain database results by setting and enforcing standards and controls. Monitor database efficiency and maintains database performance by troubleshooting problems. Analyze customer requirements and provide technical solutions to a wide range of difficult problems. Upgrade hardware and software by assessing transaction processing and database production options. Support and collaborate with database team member(s) in day-to-day activities, including internal and external resources. Create and maintain documentation for processes and policies. Provide technical leadership to database team member(s) with day-to-day support and direction, including internal and external resources. Prepare for database expansion by studying plans and requirements; advising senior technical management; coordinating design and programming. Collaborate with City leadership to design and implement short-term and long-term goals for the City data infrastructure and to ensure that the data and analytics models and architecture is robust, scalable and maintainable. Identify, screen and evaluate new solution opportunities to address unmet customer needs. Collaborate with other data team member(s) and the GIS team to build a critical mass of expertise for agile development and cross-training. Qualifications. Required Credentials and Experience: Bachelor's degree in related studies or equivalent work experience. years of experience in a Senior SQL Server DBA role at the enterprise level (MS SQL and Oracle is preferred). Experience with scripting languages and familiarity with data visualization tools such as PowerBi, Tableau, etc. Preferred Credentials and Experience: Experience with Data Integration platform (e.g. FME) is highly desirable.  Strong understanding of data modeling (i.e. conceptual, logical and ph ys cal model design, knowledge of Operation Data Stores, Enterprise Data warehouses and Data Marts) and of business intelligence and data warehousing design principles and industry best practices. Azure Experience (Wiki, Pipelines, continuous integration). Preferred Qualifications. Mongo and MySQL experience. Experience working with SQL in multiple datacenters. Experience working with Veeam Application Aware backups. Experience with Zerto. Experience running SQL in Azure. Experience with Grafana, specifically integrating with InfluxDB. Experience hosting SQL on Ubuntu. Preferred certifications: SQL MCSA. Languages and Technologies: .NET Framework, .NET Core, C. ASP.NET WebApi, MVC, Web Forms. AJAX, SOAP, XML, JSON. SQL (T-SQL), HTML, CSS. JavaScript and Common JavaScript Libraries: Angular, jQuery, pdf.js. Agile / Scrum, Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery. OAuth Libraries for C#  (implementation/deployment. experience), IdentityServer4. name: Database Administrator
description: Job Description. October,21 Database Administrator Job Description Position: Database Administrator Location: Reston, VA Per Executive Order042, new or prospective Comscore, Inc. employees in the United States, must provide proof of complete vaccination, or approved exemption on the first day of their employment. About This Role: Ensures efficient operation of SQL servers in Comscore Production Environment. Provides level (I) and (II) support, grants appropriate access, handles simple and ad hoc requests, ensures proper maintenance, and adherence to disaster data recovery plans. More senior roles develop, maintain, and ensure adherence to security and disaster recovery plans; develop server capacity forecasts and determine long-range requirements What You'll Do: SQL database development experience in a VLDBs and multi-server production environment, current experience with SQL12/2014/2016/2019. Provides level (I) user support to internal and external clients; troubleshoots and resolves database connectivity issues and escalates issues when necessary. Creates basic applications; handles unique ad hoc requests. Ensures adherence to disaster recovery and backup schedules; ensures backups take place and resolves any backup/restore failures. Handles server restarts on set schedules. Handles user access request, grants and appropriate access level. Excellent analysis skills, ability to research and analyze various different types of data information. Communicate effectively and maintain honest and open communication at all times with individuals at all levels internally. Flexibility to work outside of normal business hours (if necessary) to accomplish business objectives. The nature of the team's dynamics will require an individual that is able to work closely in a collaborative role with other team members, as well as complete tasks individually as assigned. Ability to identify system level bottlenecks in the database and recommended solutions. What You'll Need: BS degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field.4 years of database administration experience of SQL servers. Solid ability to write TSQL queries and to work with SQL Server Databases and Stake Holders. Understanding of database administration, architecture and infrastructure. Willingness to provide after-hour and weekend support if needed. Good communication and documentation skills. Strong attention to detail. Must be able to analyze problems and provide workable solutions. Solid business ethics: ability to maintain strict confidentiality related to all of Comscore's financial matters. About Comscore At Comscore, we're pioneering the future of cross-platform media measurement, arming organizations with the insights they need to make decisions with confidence. Central to this aim are our people who work together to simplify the complex on behalf of our clients and partners. Though our roles and skills are varied, we're united by our commitment to five underlying values: Integrity, Velocity, Accountability, Teamwork, and Servant Leadership. If you're motivated by big challenges and interested in helping some of the largest and most important media properties and brands navigate the future of media, we'd love to hear from you. Comscore (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a trusted partner for planning, transacting and evaluating media across platforms. With a data footprint that combines digital, linear TV, over-the-top and theatrical viewership intelligence with advanced audience insights, Comscore allows media buyers and sellers to quantify their multiscreen behavior and make business decisions with confidence. A proven leader in measuring digital and set-top box audiences and advertising at scale, Comscore is the industry's emerging, third-party source for reliable and comprehensive cross-platform measurement. To learn more about Comscore, please visit Comscore.com. EEO Statement: We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants wil l receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. To comply with federal law, Comscore participates in E-Verify. Successful candidates must pass the E-Verify process after hire. LI-JZ1.

name: Application Database Administrator
description: Job Description. Description. Job Description: Are you interested in providing critical support to one of our largest defense programs, utilizing your database administration talents to ensure mission objectives are met? Leidos Enterprise and Cyber Solutions Defense team is looking for someone who has strong capability with SQL database administration and managing applications across an enterprise. Our customer maintains a highly demanding mission and requires our support to provide expert technical and professional management support to the commands enterprise Information Technology (IT) services. The Application Database Administrator will operate autonomously within a team to support a program that provides sustainment, maintenance, innovation, Problem and Change management services to help ensure secure, reliable, and uninterrupted availability of the Department of Defense IP networks. This position will report directly to the Applications Administrator Lead. What will you do in this role? â€¢Provide SQL infrastructure engineering to include database architecture maintenance, database upgrades, server configurations, and application configurations. â€¢Install, configure, and manage multiple SQL server environments with high availability and disaster recovery, to include monitoring, analysis, reporting, and data warehouse services and solutions â€¢Architect and design the configuration and operation of SQL platforms on all NORAD Northern Command environments. â€¢Ensure proper integration of SQL with applications to include but not limited to SharePoint, TMT, Microsoft Identity Manager. â€¢Provide best practice recommendations related to SQL maintenance procedures, SQL application integration procedures, and design of the overall SQL infrastructure on all NORAD Northern Command domains. â€¢Operate and maintain the front and back end SharePoint infrastructure and perform incident management. â€¢Perform front/back end infrastructure engineering, capability engineering and application integration (primarily MS applications), front/back end infrastructure engineering, and incident management. â€¢Available for on-call support as required â€¢Work in dynamic fast paced environment that requires team interaction and coordination of efforts including remote site support. To qualify for this role, you must have the following:. Bachelor's degree and years of relevant experience, additional years of relevant experience accepted in lieu of a degree. â€¢Must have have a DoD70 IAT Level II (or greater) certification (i.e. CompTIA Security+ and Server+). â€¢Must  have an active Secret Clearance. and be able to obtain a TS/SCI Clearance. â€¢3+ years of Microsoft SQL Database engineering experience in a large enterprise environment. â€¢3+ years of experience working with Windows clustering technology to support SQL clusters and SQL Always On Availability Groups. The following qualifications are preferred, but not required: â€¢ITIL v3 or v4 Foundation. â€¢Adaptable to changing circumstances and operational needs. â€¢Experience with DoD IT security requirements. â€¢Experience in the evaluation and integration of new technologies into existing environments. â€¢Demonstrated background troubleshooting complex IT issue. â€¢Excellent project, technical, interpersonal, presentation and problem management skills. â€¢Ability to communicate orally, and in writing, detailed technical information on troubleshooting and implementation efforts. â€¢Familiarization of NORAD/USNORTHCOM missions and DOD regulations and directives. name: Sr. SQL Developer
description: Job Description. The Cystic Fibrosis Foundation (CF Foundation) and its employees embrace their commitment to its core values. These core values are the pillars on which the CF Foundation stand and will continue to sustain us as we move forward. Keep sight of what really matters: Our decisions are based on what is best for people with cystic fibrosis and their families. Aspire for excellence in all we do: We take pride in our work. We are committed to continuous learning and improvement. Stronger together: We collaborate and work together so that we can learn more and achieve more. Innovate with courage: We embrace challenges. We reach beyond boundaries in pursuit of our vision. Care about our people: We deeply care about each other and all who support our shared mission. We listen with respect. We support one another. POSITION SUMMARY: The Senior SQL Developer will contribute to the development of innovative, complex healthcare applications that would use data collected through the CF Patient Registry or provided by the CF Care Centers network. The Sr. SQL Developer is expected to automate data integration tasks, optimize, and maintain the CF registry data warehouse, support data applications that are tailored to the needs of the medical department and are in line with the Foundationâ€™s business priorities. This position requires close collaboration with the CF Registry team, excellent communication skills and ability to design solutions that are based on creative yet rational approaches. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Works collaboratively with the registry team to design, develop and implement data solutions. Responsible for design and maintenance of the data warehouse with the CF registry data and for adding new data to it daily or as required. Capable of working independently; not only identifies issues and follows instructions, but also suggests and develops intelligent solutions. Executes complex data requests. Analyzes specifications and designs, develops, and tests SQL scripts to ensure compliance with requirements. Ensures accuracy and integrity of data and applications through analysis, coding, profiling, and testing. Provides technical knowledge and subject matter expertise. Adheres to detailed deployment plans, schedules, timelines, and milestones. Conducts data quality control of patient data received from different data sources. Assists with production and maintenance of Annual Registry Reports and IT applications. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED: Bachelorâ€™s required in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field. Minimum ofyearsâ€™ experience in SQL Server data development, SSIS and SSRS. Expert knowledge of MS SQL-Server16 or later, SSRS, T-SQL, TFS, SSIS. High proficiency in Excel or other data tools. C#, Python, SAS, R, or Power BI knowledge is a plus. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Healthcare industry experience preferred. Strong organizational and follow-through skills, and particularly strong attention to detail. REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS: The Senior SQL Developer reports to the Senior Director, Patient Registry Program; no direct reports. WORKING CONDITIONS: Position requires working in a standard office environment. Some travel to meetings is required. Normal office environment with little exposure to excessive noise, dust, and temperature. No heavy lifting required. The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of essential functions, responsibilities, or requirements. The salary for other locations will be based on the local labor market and commensurate experience. Total Rewards: The Cystic Fibrosis Foundation is committed to offering competitive compensation (base pay and incentive), benefits, and professional development opportunities that maximize our ability to recruit, retain, reward, and motivate a highly-qualified and diverse workforce. Our comprehensive benefits package includes medical, dental, and vision coverage; generous time-off and leave policies; a holistic well-being program; health savings and flexible spending accounts; employer-provided life and disability insurance; retirement savings benefits; and a variety of work-life benefits to support employees and their family members. Demonstrated expertise in enterprise application development environments used by IT for the development of Internet applications; demonstrated expertise in administering relational database management systems; and experience in data warehouse support. Experience in process improvement projects. The minimum salary for this position is $65,000.00. Apply online at: https://bsu.peopleadmin.com/postings/28303.
