name: Java Backend Developers
description: Job Description. Overview. Our direct client has multiple contract opportunities for Mid-Level Java Backend Developers to work REMOTE on a Federal program based in Washington, DC. In this role, you will design, build, and configure applications to meet business process and application requirements for an important branch of the Federal Government. Per our Federal Government Contract, candidates must be U.S. Citizens or Green Card Holders, and be able to pass the client's background check. Per the President's Executive Order042 passed in September21, all Federal contractors and subcontractors providing services to the government are required to have full COVID-19 vaccinations (whether onsite or remote), except in limited circumstances where a worker receives an approved medical or religious accommodation. Responsibilities. Develop Java based frameworks for complex data processing. Develop understanding of client business processes, objectives, and solution requirements. Participate in project workgroups with subject matter experts and stakeholders to understand data specific needs. Develop understanding of application processes, coding standards, and performance standards, and learn existing and new processes and technologies. Work with team lead/solution architect on solution design. Analyze and convert business requirements to technical requirements. Design logical and physical ERD diagrams, process flow diagrams, and related data processing design documentation. Code per development, performance, and secure coding standards; resolve defects identified in testing and code reviews. Execute performance test and tuning activities. Support production deployment and production support. Work on sprint team in agile, rapid development, and deployment environment. Support production application investigate and resolve production inquiries and issues. Requires flexible schedule. Qualifications. Bachelor's Degree. years of experience with the following: Java Programming Language. Agile Methods (ADM for Distributed Agile Development). Per our Federal Government Contract, candidates must be U.S. Citizens or Green Card Holders and be able to pass the client's background check.Reasons to Join The Squires Group, Inc.: Our Commitment to You We offer competitive pay, multi-year projects, and a list of exciting clients. Work-Life Balance We work hard; we work smart and have quality time for family and "life." Golden Rule We treat our consultants the way we want to be treated: with integrity, professionalism, and trust. We Care About You We help you meet your career goals and continuously support your efforts in the field. Check out our Referral Program! The Squires Group will pay you up to $3000 for every qualified professional that you refer and we place. If you see a position posted by The Squires Group and know the perfect person for the job, please send us your referral. For more information, go to https://bit.ly/35C7diT. The Squires Group, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. #Di #LI-LJ1.

name: Senior Backend Developer
description: Job Description. Stanley X is Stanley Black and Decker's newly created Innovation business dedicated to launching and growing exponentially scalable businesses to address customers' needs within our strategic markets. We are building a capability within Stanley Black and Decker to identify and seize on new sources of growth. We are a group of innovation and business-building professionals located in Silicon Valley and Atlanta, GA. Stanley X is building a Construction Technology platform to bring new digital services, workflow tools, and data transparency to the construction industry. We are looking for a bright Sr. Backend Engineer to define and own the foundation of the platform and design the architecture to scale it globally. Today's world of construction accounts for over% of the world's GDP, and it's no secret that worker productivity and building complexity are the biggest challenges. As a result, the industry is at an inflection point for disruption. Last year alone, nearly $2B in venture capital was invested across000+ companies in construction technology. Stanley Black and Decker is partnering with contractors and startups to develop new digital products that will increase productivity and on-time/on-budget performance of construction projects. As part of the product's founding technical team, you will play an integral role in helping the company shape the future of the construction industry. About You. You are a Backend engineer with experience working in agile, lean, high performing teams mandated to deliver digital services or SaaS platforms. Ideally, you've built modern-day service-oriented platforms, scalable backends in cloud and/or on-premise environments, and have experience in Machine Learning. You have been part of a journey of a highly ambiguous start up environment from ground zero to a production deployed platform. As an ideal candidate you - Are a Quick learner, self-initiator, doer, and results-oriented. Thrive in an environment of honesty, responsibility, and accountability. Feel passionate about the quality and on-time delivery of your deliverables. Understand the importance of prioritization and positive criticism. Know how to quickly show results while keeping an eye on the bigger vision. Your Professional Experience. As a founding key technical team member for the SaaS/DaaS platform, you have hands-on experience in developing a Data pipeline with resilient, high response backend services for the SaaS platform. As a diverse engineer, you feel comfortable and have experience in developing different types of Eco-Systems such as SaaS, DaaS, and Machine learning in some capacity. As an ideal candidate, you would have the following key qualifications Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent.years of development experience in developing SaaS/DaaS platforms; You also have developed and deployed ML models for Enterprise-grade applications. Development experience with OO (and/or functional) programming languages and OOP. In-depth understanding of Data Structures, Algorithms, and Distributed systems. Experience in ML, Data democratization/exposing using different methodologies e.g. APIs, Databases, BI Tools, etc. Exper ience in Real-time, batch data processing, BI tools, heterogeneous data processing, enrichment, and aggregation is expected. Strong experience in developing Service based backend platforms using Relational Databases, No-SQL, and microservices in a cloud-hosted environment. Good understanding of System design patterns and experience navigating tradeoffs b/w cost, scale, speed, and agility. Experience in using version control tools and modern reactive web frameworks. Experience in task estimation and owning end to end deliverables. Excellent team player, strong communicator, analytical and critical thinker. Nice to have. Experience in Deep Learning and Computer Vision models is a big plus. Experience in developing microservices in cloud/in house settings. Things you will do. We are a small and nimble team, so you'll likely get to experience and participate in many projects in various technical capacities. However, you should broadly expect the following set of responsibilities: Actively contribute towards the development of our Construction and Digital Manufacturing Technology platform and ML models to help it scale globally; Help revolutionize multiple industries leveraging cutting edge technological advancements. Develop Data pipelines, Deep Learning models for Digital Manufacturing Technology platform. Develop consumer agnostic, fault-tolerant, scalable, highly available service-oriented backend(s). Actively contribute in evaluation and adoption of appropriate technology, frameworks. Write unit tests to ensure the quality of your deliverables. Keep your team unblocked by wearing multiple hats, be it quick help in setting up a raw CI/CD pipeline or a helping hand in BI tool visualization, you are a go get it person. Participate in technical design discussions and efforts estimation. Establish a deep technical understanding of our technology partners and customers. Ensure the success of your pod by contributing to the team's deliverables in a quality and timely manner. Develop Data processing platform to process heterogeneous data streams, at scale with state of art technologies. Why work with us. Solve massive problems for customers. We approach problems with a lean startup methodology, focused on in-depth user research and addressing the most critical problems first. We are a technology and innovation team that leads with the voice of customers, value-based pricing, and strong secondary research and competitive analysis. Visibility to senior leadership. Our team reports directly to the CEO and operate autonomously within the company. In this role, you will work closely with Product, Engineering and Innovation Strategy teams. Work with great companies. We work with some of the most innovative companies in construction technology, additive manufacturing, and supply chain. Our partners range from Y Combinator startups to multi-billion-dollar unicorns. You'll have unparalleled access to their technologies and the freedom to explore new and innovative ways of solving customer problems. Other Perks. Compensation. Competitive compensation package (base, bonus,1K contributions) compared to F500 companies in the Bay Area Location. Modern office space located in downtown Sunnyvale, directly across from the CalTrain. Complete with amenities including a full-access gym, stocked kitchen, and table games. Pick your own equipment. Select between the top of the line PC or Mac products plus any software you need. #LI-KB1.

name: Senior Java Oracle Backend Developer
description: Job Description. Summit Technologies, Inc. has several  penings for Senior Java Oracle Backend Developers. In this role, you will design, test, maintain data services and migrate to AWS cloud. This is primarily an on-site position in Ashburn, VA that offers flexibility to work from home. This is a Federal contract requiring US citizenship and a DHS CBP BI clearance (candidates with other DHS agency clearances or a DoD Top Secret are strongly encouraged to apply). Duties and Responsibilities: Solve highly technical software development issues. Participate in the system architecture design, engineering, development, integration testing, and validation aspects of the software life cycle; for a PL/SQL back-end application involving extensive messaging and transaction processing. Develop and test PL/SQL and mentor junior team members. Learn and adhere to the continuous integration, automated unit testing and other AGILE practices. Diagnose and fix issues in existing application components. Interface with internal and external clients. Migrate complicated Oracle PL/SQL stored procedures to the Amazon PostgreSQL database. Required Experience and Skills: Expert SQL Developer with years of Oracle PL/SQL and software development experience. Ability to write monitoring tools, familiarity with MQ, and KAFKA topics. Expertise with Java, Java Frameworks (Spring, JMS), Object-Oriented Design and Development principles; and Java Application Servers such as WebLogic or Apache Tomcat. Expertise in software engineering practices (e.g., reading/generating so ftware specs, design patterns, continuous integration). Data loading experience or exceptional database knowledge. Preferred Experience and Skills: Knowledge of EDIFACT messages. Experience using Enterprise Search Technologies (Solr, Elasticsearch, Lucene, or others). Experience with Java applications development using XA transactions and Spring Boot framework. Experience deploying and managing applications in Docker environment. Knowledge of field of entity resolutions or analytics. Familiarity with Customs or ICE travel-related data. Agile Development experience. Education: Bachelor of Science Degree in a technical field (Computer Science, Engineering, etc.). Security Clearance: Must have a current CBP BI or eligibility to obtain one. Summit Technologies Inc. appreciates your interest. We wil  contact the best matching prospects and will consider you for future opportunities. We will not submit your resume without your prior knowledge and consent. Summit Technologies is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

name: Lead Backend Developer
description: Job Description. About Tassat. Tassat is a New York-based fintech company that provides digital payments solutions for banks to offer their commercial customers. It delivered the first blockchain-based B2B digital payments platform that was approved by a major bank regulator and has transacted billions of dollars to date. For more information, please visit www.tassat.com. Th e Role.  Our back-end engineers are experts at making Tassatâ€™s mission clear and accessible to our customers through intelligent development of well-designed visual elements. An ideal candidate will have a strong aptitude for identifying opportunities to improve user experience, robust experience translating design frameworks into code to improve both internal applications, and a proactive desire to collaborate with fellow developers, engineers, and others to pioneer the digital payments landscape. This candidate will also possess a strong hands-on development track record with the ability to take part and contribute to various stages of the software development and delivery process including analysis, design, implementation, and testing. This Role reports to the Director of Engineering. What You Own. Lead Client Implementation team and manage day to day activities of team members. Collaborate and work with other developers, business analysts and stakeholders on the team to meet the objectives of the business. Adhere to technical and architectural best practices and standards for the company. Implement features and correct software defects within the platform that help drive user adoption for clients. Test features and software defects to ensure high quality of software delivery. Demonstrate features meet business requirements to stakeholders. Participate in the Peer Review process for the organization. Requirements. What You Have. Experience in a Client facing technical role. Strong object-oriented skills. Good working knowledge of Unix/Linux. Clear communication skills, written and verbal. Team player who works well in a diverse environment. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/Engineering or Work equivalent. years in software development (analysis, development, testing, documentation). Strong Java Development skills in J2SE/J2EE applications. Cloud experience, preferably Google Cloud Platform. CI/CD experience, and exposure to Docker. Strong DB skills (preferably with PostGres). Strong understanding of event driven I/O. Strong understanding of distributed systems. Strong understanding of transaction processing. Scripting knowledge is desirable (Perl, Python, Unix Shell scripting). Good knowledge of open-source frameworks especially Spring suite. Experience (minyears) in Agile methodology and working with a SCRUM team. Broad understanding of payments and settlement functions. Hands-on experience in best practices in testing and developing of good/clean code. Proven track record of delivery. Software life cycle with focus on maintainability. Adaptable to a business environment with fast changing requirements and priorities. Working with Us. Tassat is proud to offer an incredible Benefits Package for full-time Tassat Employees. This includes:0% coverage on Health (with a Health Reimbursement Account) Dental, Vision Insurance. Short Term Disability, Life and ADD, Long Term Disability. Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays, Parental Leave.1(k) program, Company Equity. Transit and Parking Pre-tax savings. FSA Dependent Care, FSA Health Pre-tax savings. At Tassat, you will work with incredibly talented engineers, market experts, and thought leaders to shape the future of a financial ecosystem. We offer a uniquely entrepreneurial, supportive culture, where ideas can come from anywhere and execution is everything. We understand the importance of autonomy, mastery, and purpose. We strive to be extremely transparent, organizationally flat, and open-minded. While you will have clearly delineated responsibilities, you are welcome and encouraged to contribute beyond those areas. We value ideas and results, not ranks and titles. We believe great results can only come from great people. If youâ€™re interested in working alongside people wo are bright, creative, and diligent â€“ this is the place. We value people who can bring new perspectives to our company. Here are some traits that are important to us: Ability to solve problems head on (and hands-on) and in simple creative ways. Bring unwavering passion to the team and the work you do. Savvy researcher, continuous learner, and enthusiastic team player. We need you to feel like an owner, motivated to succeed and enthusiastic about helping others. Urgency is key! We all play many roles here and must get our hands into everything to get it done. Tassat Group Inc is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. IMPORTANT NOTICE: Subject to any Federal and State restrictions imposed now or in the future, all Tassat employees based in the New York metropolitan area are required to be in the office in accordance with Tassatâ€™s Return-to-Office Policy. All Tassat employees are required to show proof of receipt of a COVID-19 vaccination before reporting to the office, unless they can demonstrate that they are prohibited from receiving a COVID-19 vaccine because of a closely held religious belief or a disability/medical reason (subject to HIPAA Privacy Rules).

name: Project Assistant (Data Analyst)
description: Job Description. OFFICE OF THE STATE COMPTROLLER. POSITION: Project Assistant (Data Analyst), SG-25. STATUS: Temporary. NEGOTIATING UNIT: PEF. LOCATION: Division of State Government Accountability.0 State Street. Albany, NY236. DUTIES: Research Analysis and Evaluation: Obtain and develop information to plan and execute various initiatives for special projects to determine sources of data and collection methods for specific audits and projects. Develop and implement systems to capture, analyze and report results for use in assessing audit risk. Research, collect, cleanse/process, analyze and evaluate large data sets using advanced analytical software. Analyze and interpret results for audit staff for use in audit planning and audit fieldwork and for audits and special reports on specific programs. Develop data analysis approaches that incorporate data mining and statistical computer modeling techniques using highly specialized software to extract and analyze. Interpret and evaluate results, contribute to establishing project workflows, and document methodology. Prepare written reports of the analysis and findings along with recommended courses of action based on the findings. Assist staff in understanding data files and develop approaches for interpreting and analyzing the data. Make use of results to improve and enhance analytical techniques, and data modeling and data mining efforts. Supervision: Responsible for supervision, development and evaluation of all staff working on projects. Provide formal and informal (on-the-job) training to employees on the most efficient and effective analytical techniques. Supervise and train audit staff on the proper use of analytical techniques and software. Professional Development: Seek out and obtain specialized training in broad range of technical skill sets to provide formal and informal (on-the-job) training to employees on the most efficient and effective analytical techniques. Evaluate Acquisition of New Software: Evaluate acquisition of new software. Learn how to use new software and assesse its usability and functionality for the projects. Transfer knowledge to coworkers so they can become skilled at using new software. DESIRED COMPETENCIES: Exceptional analytical proficiency. Ability to collect, evaluate, and analyze a range of raw data sets from diverse sources; plan and execute initiatives for audits and special projects. Experience using data analytics to assist identifying audit risks and to help address audit objectives. Experience using ACL, SQL and data mining. Highly organized, with the ability to independently develop a major data analytic project collaboratively as part of a team and providing technical support to staff both formally and informally in use of analytical techniques. Strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to explain highly technical information to others and promote strategic organizational plans and goals. Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate with and motivate others, working with internal and external project partners. Attention to detail. Demonstrated ability to document technical methodologies and contribute to developing project work flows and systems. QUALIFICATIONS: At least eight (8) years of progressively responsible statistical, quantitative or data analytics experience, including data mining/modeling and implementing sustainable analytical tools, processes and policies AND. One (1) years of supervisory experience AND. Four (4) years of audit experience. EDUCATION: An Associateâ€™s degree in computer or information science, economics, finance, accounting, mathematics or statistics may be substituted for two (2) years of the general experience. A Bachelorâ€™s degree in computer or information science, economics, finance, accounting, mathematics or statistics may be substituted for four (4) years of the general experience. A Masterâ€™s degree in computer or information science, economics, finance, accounting, mathematics or statistics may be substituted for one (1) year of the general experience. TO APPLY: Interested candidates should submit a cover letter and resume and the attached template https://web.osc.state.ny.recruit/docs/03003ProjectAssistantMQTemplate092021.doc. to no later than January,22. Please referenc e It em #30 03- Dice in the subject line and on the cover letter. PLEASE  NOTE: All candidates MUST complete this template in full to demonstrate. they meet the minimum qualifications. Candidates will be selected for interview based. SOLELY on the contents provided by them on this template. IMPORTANT: It is imperative that you provide specific examples to demonstrate your. experience for each of the required qualifications listed in this template. Please ensure that. you have fully described how you meet the qualifications by providing a FULLY. DETAILED description of your experience. Any ambiguity, vagueness, or omissions. will not be decided in the candidateâ€™s favor.

name: Principal Data Analyst
description: Job Description. An opportunity that will challenge your problem-solving skills, require strong leadership without authority, and provide opportunities to build your work network of both UHC and Optum Senior Leaders it is an exciting time to be a part of Payment Integrity, as old solutions are transformed and new innovations lead us to new heights. Join us for an exciting time of growth and opportunity within UHC Payment Integrity's fast growing Ireland Hub! The Principal Data Analystrole will work with UHC and Optum Payment Integrity Operational Leaders to develop a robust and collaborative oversight Command Center framework that fulfills UHC business needs and Optum's performance optimization. This position will be accountable for understanding UHC business segment goals and translating them, in an oversight and relationship capacity, for Optum's Non-Clinical Operation's team to execute. The Principal Data Analyst will build data tools and controls, in partnership with a seasoned Data Architecture Partner, to monitor Optum's performance and identify areas for improvement using data analyses. This position will require a high degree of Payment Integrity, data analysis, and financial acumen and will need to thrive in a matrixed organization that will require building deep and trusting relationships with many areas within and outside of Payment Integrity. Careers with Optum offer flexible work arrangements and individuals who live and work in the Republic of Ireland will have the opportunity to split their monthly work hours between our Dublin office and telecommuting from a home-based office. About the role: As a Principal Data Analyst you will play a vital role in working with Business Partners in relation to Oversight reporting needs/gaps and building plans to address those needs/gaps then using those inputs to work with a Data Architecture team to map out an automated Command Center of key input, output, and financial reporting for those Business Partners. Once the Command Center is developed, this person will work with the team and Business Partners to refine, maintain, and enhance Command Center dashboards to ensure they update to the business needs. This is an individual contributor role that will work on the most challenging and business-critical work, alongside the opportunity to mentor and become a thought-leader for the wider team. If you're interested in healthcare and innovation, this opportunity will give you the chance to help improve the health of millions of people and to do your life's best work. Responsibilities: Key business point of contact for overall dashboard management and creation. Build relationships with Business Partners that allows for the effective transfer of information allowing for a seamless flow of requirements and inputs into the Data Architecture team. Scope of role responsibilities include the following core elements: Engaged in the development of management reporting to identify meaningful metrics that provide insight into root cause impacts and trending. Ensure SLA's, KPI's and other measures are relevant and conduct regular review of same for changing business needs or the accommodation of additional data streams. Conducts regular review of metric inventory with Business Partners for input/feedback. Work collaboratively with business partners, SMEs, and developers to ensure a shared understanding of business requirements. Partner with cross-functional teams, refine requirements, and use it to shape product development efforts. Work with Director to manage the Payment Integrity portfolio of requests, including prioritization and governance process with Business Partners and delivering monthly updates to executive stakeholders. Required Qualifications: Undergraduate degree or equivalent qualification. Strong SQL experience. Strong experience with data visualization software (e.g. Tableau). Strong experience performing business analysis  and requirement documentation. Experience with Agile development methodology. Proficiency with MS Project, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint and SharePoint. Excellent English communication skills in written and spoken form. Demonstrated effective interpersonal, influence, collaboration and listening skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate ideas clearly and concisely in writing and orally to individuals and groups. Demonstrated understanding of the difference between business requirements and technical solutions. Excellent time management, organizational and prioritization skills with ability to balance multiple priorities. Effective data analysis and interpretation skills, able to draw and present quantitative conclusions. Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment while demonstrating good level of maturity. The ability to work a portion of monthly work hours from our Dublin office is required. Preferred Qualifications: Prior work on data and analytics based projects. Healthcare experience. Knowledge of Payment Integrity operations. Please note you must currently be eligible to work and remain indefinitely without any restrictions in the country to which you are making an application. Proof will be required to support your application. Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organisation around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.SM. All telecommuters will be required to adhere to the Optum Ireland Telecommuter Policy. name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Optum, the fastest growing part of UnitedHealth Group, is a leading information and technology-enabled health services business. Our teams are dedicated to modernising the health care system and improving the lives of people and communities. Serving virtually every dimension of the health system, we work with a diverse set of clients across0 countries from those who diagnose and treat patients to those who pay for care, deliver health services, and those who supply the cures. Optum maintains operations across North America, South America, Europe, Asia Pacific and the Middle East. Our innovative partnerships provide technology and tools that enable unprecedented collaboration and efficiency. As a result, we can tap into valuable health care data to uncover insights and develop strategies for better care at lower costs. About the role: Do you want to impact decisions to help people live healthier lives? Are you an innovative Business Intelligence professional who thrives on developing new solutions to solve tough challenges? Join us and start doing your life's best work. We want to achieve more in our mission of health care, and so we have to be really smart about the business of health care. At Optum, we're changing the landscape of our industry. You will put your Business Intelligence skills to work as you empower business partners and team members improve healthcare delivery. As a Data Analyst. at Optum, you'll be responsible for the products you create from start to finish. You'll help support and be involved in all aspects of data analysis, ETL development, dashboard design and development, from initial customer requirements and brainstorming sessions, to partnering with our partners to obtain the data necessary, to building, testing and scheduling a world-class data pipeline. You will work with the broadest possible range of database technologies including the leading RDBMS and NOSQL solutions. Together with your peers, you will constantly push the boundaries of engineering by introducing and leveraging new technologies to support exceptional data-driven experiences for our users. This position plays a pivotal role in advancing the Analytics and Reporting function within the RQ [Risk and Quality] organisation. Specifically, the successful candidate will work as part of a unique team of developers responsible for creating industry leading client reports leveraging data visualisation best practice and modern technologies. The RQ Analytics team works collaboratively across Optum analytics teams to share knowledge and best practices with a focus on innovative and creative solutions. We are seeking someone who is self-directed yet creative as you will be tasked with very interesting and complex issues. As a key resource to others you must possess strong interpersonal skills, be challenged by delivering against tight deadlines while maintaining a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail and have excellent oral and written communication skills. Careers with Optum offer flexible work arrangements and individuals who live and work in the Republic of Ireland will have the opportunity to split their monthly work hours between our Dublin or Letterkenny office and telecommuting from a home-based office. Primary Responsibilities: Work collaboratively within the team, business partners, SMEs, and BAs to ensure a shared understanding of business requirements. Interact with internal customers to effectively design, implement, operationalise and document reporting that accurately captures business requirements. Support the implementation of reporting enhancements and changes. Create and maintain documentation that chronicles processes related to previous analytic activities and associated results. Support ad hoc data reporting and data analysis. Identify opportunities to improve processes. Leverage new technologies to drive innovation in BI and Analytics. You will be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role, as well as providing development for other roles you may be interested in. Required Qualifications: Experience in an analytical role (e.g. data analysis, data analytics, data science). Undergrad ua e degree in a numerical subject (e.g. Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or Economics) or r elevant experience. Ability to query databases using SQL. Proven experience performing significant data analysis (e.g. SQL) and report development. Business Intelligence/Data Vi sualisation experience: Tableau (preferred), Microsoft Power BI or similar. Strong communication skills, able to work with stakeholders at more senior levels. Ability to interpret, review, and translate data into clear business insights. Strong knowledge of relational databases and database structures. Ability to work a portion of monthly work hours from our Dublin or Letterkenny office is required. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with data blending/ETL tools (e.g. Alteryx, SSIS, Oracle DI, Talend). Experience working with healthcare a nalytical products or datasets. Please note you must currently be eligible to work and remain indefinitely without any restrictions in the country to which you are making an application. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Overview We are not just offering a job but a meaningful career! Come join our passionate team! As a Fortune company, we hire the best employees to serve our customers, making us a leader in the insurance and financial services industry. State Farm embraces diversity and inclusion to ensure a workforce that is engaged, builds on the strengths and talents of all associates, and creates a Good Neighbor culture. We offer competitive benefits and pay with the potential for an annual financial award based on both individual and enterprise performance. Our employees have an opportunity to participate in volunteer events within the community and engage in a learning culture. We offer programs to assist with tuition reimbursement, professional designations, employee development, wellness initiatives, and more! Visit our Careers page for more information on our benefits, locations. and the process. of joining the State Farm team! Responsibilities About the Opportunities: Labs @ State Farm is a highly inventive and dynamic environment. We exist to advance what's possible by transforming and disrupting the present to accelerate our future. We are curious, we are bold and we influence how our company pursues big ideas, turning opportunity into reality. We are diverse, remote friendly and know the value of quality data people! We offer exceptional work/life balance and have a welcoming, fun environment. As a Data Analyst on the Data for Simulation Models and Insights Team, you will be working with both business and technical partners in data acquisition and preparation for our machine learning, model driven environment as well as deriving insights from that data. Your first assignments will be research and POC's in our Experimentation effort along with enabling the data vision portion of our ML Simulation tool suite. This is an unbeatable opportunity for data analysts to immerse themselves in top notch big data and machine learning pipelines as a part of a fun and exciting team. Who you are: You are a change agent. You're a researcher and always learning. You are unwavering and relentless in your desire to see the business benefit from your work. You thrive on diversity, dynamic technology environments and driving out your vision. You are a natural collaborator, comfortable with questioning and being questioned. You are passionate and excel at getting others to buy into your work and ideas. You might want to contribute to the industry through patents, professional articles or presentations. What you will do: Work with high volume and diverse data on distributed systems. Automate a reusable ML data pipeline with an eye on performance and scalability. Work with peers, leaders and the business to engineer solutions that impact our business's ability to grow and serve customers. Bring ideas informed by experience and the industry, turn them into experiments you lead with the goal that they advance our business capabilities. Work with Data Engineers on the execution of POC's, experiment and work. Translate complicated data topics for partners. Work and/or coordinate with other data areas in the enterprise to ensure we are informed where we're disrupting convention vs conforming. Create, contribute or optimize infrastructure to enable the ML data platform. Create and/or enable reusable ML models both for training and inference. research and create/execute work around Model post process analysis including but not limited to: Visualizations and ML insights. Qualifications What skills you bring: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related data field OR equivalent certifications and experience. Knowledge of data as it pertains to ML, data modeling and Big Data patterns. AWS data tools and constructs such as: Glue, S3, RDS, Lambda, etc. Solid understanding of key data concepts such as data acquisition, data grain, eventing, metadata, contextual data (keys, wrappers, etc.), logical conformance of disparate data etc. Experience in large, complex data environments both highly coupled and highly decoupled. Prior work with 'legacy' type data structures. Experience with Python or similar programming language is very helpful. Experience in data mapping for data pipelines and optimizing data highly flexible data structures for performance and scalability. Ability to pick up and learn new technologies and skills quickly. Aside from the above, it's less about what you walk in the door with and more about how you learn and apply what you learn. Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not sponsor applica ts for U.S. work authorization (e.g. H-1B visa) for this o portunitySFARM #LI-LP1 .

name: Adverse Data Analyst (14270)
description: Job Description. The Adverse Data Analyst monitors agent quality by investigating possible adverse behavior in the field. The Adverse Data Analyst will use data gathered from multiple systems to identify outliers that violate company procedures for field personnel. Primary Duties and Responsibilities. Uses MS Excel, QlikView, MS Word, and other tools to identify possible Adverse and then research to identify resolution. Contacting customers or the agent by phone may be required to resolve adverse cases. Using On Base and Excel to pull information needed to research and resolve cases. Accurately reports all case progress and compiles quality reporting used to present to Sales Executives. Identifies additional ways to increase the quality of business submitted by the field by identifying potential training gaps. Coordinates with other departments to gather information when needed to research, troubleshoot, and resolve potential quality issues. Assists the Adverse Coordinator to generate reports and procedures that track agents with poor quality. Required Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications with strong emphasis on Excel (VLookup and Pivot Tables). Must work well under pressure, with a focus on organization and accuracy. Ability to multi-task and drive solutions across departments. Highly organized and detail-oriented. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Strong problem solving, analytical, and collaborative skills. Ability to adapt quickly to a fast-paced environment. Required Experience: High School diploma required, college degree preferred. Insurance industry experience a plus.

name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. About the Opportunity. As a thought leader and professional membership organization, the American Planning. Association is heavily invested in both its digital presence and its internal data resources. APA increasingly employs data analyses to make strategic decisions to better serve our members and communities. We are seeking an intelligent and creative individual who is motivated to join APAâ€™s technology team and help lead APAâ€™s data analysis efforts in a collaborative, fast paced, agile environment. Position Summary. The Data Analyst serves as a steward and enabler for APAâ€™s data, leading efforts to better understand and use data. The role brings analytical and technical expertise to ensure data quality and accuracy, and then to organize, process, design, and present it in ways that help business stakeholders make better decisions. Critical Outcomes. Business questions translated into technical questions that can be answered with data â€“ taking complicated problems and building simple solutions that create insight. Data organized and presented in ways that tell meaningful stories and support evidence-based decision-making. The production, acquisition, and curation of data aligned with analytical priorities, and analytical priorities aligned with APAâ€™s annual strategic scope of work and organizational goals. Best practices for consuming and understanding data fostered throughout the organization. Core Responsibilities. Analysis. Conducts technical data analyses, including regression, statistical, and predictive, analyses. Identifies trends, correlations, patterns, predictions, and actionable insights from data. Approaches analysis with curiosity, creativity, and an eye for discovering what drives business value. Data Understanding. Collaborates with subject matter experts to understand their analytical goals, providing focus for questions to ask of data, and clarifying key metrics. Translates between the business domain and technical domain in order to recommend specific types of technical analyses in response to business questions. Understands and articulates the â€œArt of the Possibleâ€ with data analysis, using this understanding to promote a culture of data-informed decision-making throughout the organization. Reporting. Designs and builds rich, interactive visualizations that distill data into comprehensible structures and presentations. Assists others in delivering self-service reports by offering guidance and training on reporting tools, and by recommending techniques for presenting and consuming data effectively. Platform Management. Designs, implements, and maintains the Business Intelligence platform (Power BI), including connections to data sources, overall structure and user experience, security, and metadata. Data Modeling. Builds data models in the Business Intelligence platformâ€™s semantic layer, ensuring that model structure is conducive to the analysis needs, and that terms adhere to agreed-upon data definitions. Data Definition. Maintains APAâ€™s data dictionary, so that both business and technical users share a common understanding of data, its purpose, and its meaning in reports and analyses. Process Improvement. Recommends opportunities for improving data processes, including improvements to data collection, integrity, quality, efficiency, and structure. Recommends protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data. Data Strategy. Creates strategic approaches to the acquisition, organization, analysis, and delivery of data to support business objectives. Aligns data strategy to APAâ€™s annual statement of work and business goals. Requirements. Proven analytic skills, including experience with core analytical processes and tools such as regression analysis, machine learning, and statistics. Strong written and oral communication skills with the ability to describe data concepts to both technical and business team members. Experience mining, evaluating, analyzing, and visualizing data. Experience with business intelligence platforms, preferably Power BI. Experience with technical writing, such as documenting requirements, data rules, and training. Strong query-writing skills required, and experience with scripting preferred (e.g. Python). Experience working with a Data Warehouse environm ent, and with Microsoft SQL, Power BI and Azure environments preferred. Experience with Agile methodology preferred. Bachelorâ€™s degree, preferably in Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Statistics. Why Join the Team. Join a talented and motivated team. Work in a creative, fun, and collaborative environment using the latest technologies. Build useful tools that service city planners and have a positive social impact on communities. Excellent benefits, vacation, and competitive salary. Excellent opportunity for professional growth. How to Apply. Submit a resume and cover letter addressing. the following: Why have you chosen to apply for this Data Analyst position at APA? How do you envision your career evolving in the near term? In the long term? Briefly describe a situation in which you applied a creative solution to a data analysis problem, including how your solution created business insight. Briefly describe a situation in which you considered multiple viewpoints in the design or delivery of a data analysis or presentation. Salary expectations. APA embraces diversity and equal opportunity in our employment practices. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our impact will be. COVID-19 Policy Disclaimer. The American Planning Association values the safety of our employees, our members, and our visitors. In support of these values, if you are selected for this job, you must show proof of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19, except when vaccination is not medically advised or violates your sincerely held religious beliefs. If you are invited to join our team, you must comply with APA COVID-19 Vaccine Policy. APA Dynamic Office Environment. Beginning January22, weâ€™ll be shifting to a dynamic work environment that will bring those of us in the Chicagoland area together in person two days a week, Tuesday, and Thursday.Weâ€™ll use this time to rekindle relationships, build new ones and connect with each other formally and informally in a way we canâ€™t do online.The other three days can be worked remotely or in the officeâ€”whatever each staff member prefers.

name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. ABOUT THE ROLE. The Data Analyst will be responsible for maintaining and developing Mansueto Ventureâ€™s user data, site consumption data, and general reporting for the organization. This will include collecting, transforming, storing, and visualizing data to develop answers to business questions. This role will be integral in working on building our first party user data system and will also work with stakeholders across the organization to answer import business questions based on on-hand data and develop new data collection where data is lacking. Weâ€™re looking for someone who is organized, can document the models of our data systems, and be able to work with raw data, in addition to understanding what the data means and how to develop answers to business opportunities using our data. The candidate should possess a strong analytical mind set, self-taught spirit, technical aptitude, strong communications, and project management skills with an interest in the publishing space. Candidates who learn new systems quickly, love web technology, think comprehensively about problems, and come up with creative solutions will thrive in this position. This position is temporarily remote due to COVID but may require in-office presence once our NYC office reopens. WHAT YOUâ€™LL BE DOING. Develop and implement databases, data collection systems and data analytics. Manage accuracy and validity of reporting. Identify and define new process improvement opportunities. Manage and set up analytics tools including Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics. Develop Strategies to collect user information including demographics. Extend and maintain our reporting in Domo, through ETL including SQL transformations to support company-wide reports and dashboards. Support day-to-day data processing, updates, and maintenance of reports. WHAT WEâ€™RE LOOKING FOR. Bachelorâ€™s degree preferred.3 yearsâ€™ experience in data analytics or data science. Knowledge of the digital publishing space. Knowledge of Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics. Data Modeling â€“ ER Modeling. Experience with Data Migrations â€“ Between same, similar and dissimilar DBs/Storage. Programming Experience â€“ Python, Javascript (Backend). Expertise in Relational Databases and data-programming (Preferably mysql, including complex queries, functions, stored procs, data import/export (Excel, googlesheets, XML, JSON). Advanced Excel user (very comfortable w/ Pivot Tables, sumifs, index matching, graphs, VBScripts). Comprehensive problem solver. Strong mathematical skills and analytical mindset. Strong communicator whoâ€™s organized with bias toward action. Quick to learn different user systems and technologies. Continuous learn. ABOUT US. As the publisher of both Inc. and Fast Company, Man ueto Ventures is home to two of the most iconic and vibrant brands in the world of business publications. Every day, the content, awards and events we produce help entrepreneurs and innovators succeed. All provide useful insights, spark essential conversations and provide much needed inspiration. We inspire, inform, honor and stand up for the most fascinating people in business: the risk-takers, the innovators, and the ultra-driven go-getters that represent the most dynamic force in the American economy. Fast Company is the worldâ€™s leading business media brand, with an editorial focus on innovation in technology, leadership, world changing ideas, creativity, and design. Written for and about the most progressive business leaders, Fast Company inspires readers to think expansively, lead with purpose, embrace change, and shape the future of business. Just as Inc. and Fast Company pride t emselves on advocating progressive and innovative business practices, all of us at MV are determined to walk the talk. This starts with the people we hire, and ensuring that our processes give us the greatest opportunity to bring aboard individuals who reflect the breadth of backgrounds, experiences and ideas present in society broadly. We strive to be a transparent, dynamic, and responsible organization that gives all of its employees a meaningful role in helping to shape what we do and how we do it. At MV, we prioritize diversity. We celebrate difference and try to embed it into every aspect of our workplace. MV is committed to providing equal opportunity employment to all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, citizenship, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

name: SQL Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Role: Azure SQL Data Analyst. Location: Atlanta, GA or Tampa, FL. Company: Quadratyx AI. Web: https://quadratyxai.com. About Us. Serves as primary owner leading business requirement-gathering and documentation via meetings, individual discussions, and team-based collaboration from an enterprise view. Consults with business stakeholders, Development, Project Management, Administrators/other technical resources, and Analysts throughout the requirements documentation process and drives requirements to meet needs outlined in the project scope. Create detailed requirements documents including: process flows, use cases, user interface designs, scenarios and maintains outputs in project documentation system of record. Performs fact-based data analysis on Azure SQL incorporating key performance indicators, customer interface, and other future state analysis to guide informed requirements development. Assist in translating requirements and use cases into logic and expected results for product, performance, and user acceptance testing. Participate in quality management reviews of the designs, prototypes and other requirements work products to ensure they fulfill the requirements. Ability to review project deliverables for completeness and quality, and compliance with established project standards. Provides ad-hoc analytical documentation and project support to the business. Provides documentation of current and future state processes. Education and Experience.5 yearsâ€™ experience as a Business Analyst demonstrating the Azure SQL Data Sets, Azure HDInsight, Storage, Power BI skill sets for healthcare related projects. End-to-end Analytics or Reporting infrastructure development experience preferred. Experience following Scrum/Agile practices required. Healthcare and/or Medical practice experience required. Data Visualization tools experience required (Azure SQL, Power BI). Computer Information Systems, IT, or Business Bachelorâ€™s or equivalent degree required. Travel Requirements. Position may be required to travel throughout the United States as well as globally to support various engagements. Near term travel should be expected throughout the Southeastern United States. Diversity Commitment. At Quadratyx AI, our commitment to diversity and inclusion is helping us to create a great place to work. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status and other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

name: Data Analyst & Information Manager
description: Job Description. DESCRIPTION SUMMARY. The Living Desert (TLD) is building a data centric environment. To complete this goal, we are looking for a well-rounded individual who can quickly understand our current business environment and who can help lead TLD to reach the lofty goals it seeks, that is, to be a leader within the aquarium, zoo, and botanical garden communities, and to maximize its conservation mission. This candidate must have demonstrated an aptitude to work across functional lines, with all levels of management and employees, to achieve TLDâ€™s objectives. They must develop an understanding of where TLD should strive to be. Then, to establish realistic but dynamically achievable and timely goals; then focus the TLD team members to obtain them. In summary, we desire to have the most current information available and accessible in desired formats at any moment desired. Much time and expertise are required to obtain this goal and then to maintain it. While this type of position can be virtual, we require an onsite presence at this stage of TLDâ€™s data life cycle. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES. Ensure data is accurate and balances between databases. Manage stakeholder technology goals from multiple teams within the Organization. Design, implement, and test new practices and procedures for data management between teams. Ensure data hygiene rules are followed, and â€œcleanâ€ data as necessary. Provide datamining for desired information to the organization. Provide reporting from these databases upon end-user request. Develop and maintain divisional business intelligence dashboards and Operational reporting. Develop and maintain processes for integrating the data from different software packages. Develop an enterprise data model, describing data elements and how they are used. Contributes to desert conservation through reduction of waste, water and energy use, and inspiring guests and team members to take conservation actions. SPECIFIC SKILLS. Knowledge of principles and techniques of computer and network systems, electronic equipment, and related software. Ability to install, upgrade, configure, test, troubleshoot and maintain a variety of computer hardware/software, electronic equipment, and peripheral equipment. Ability to read and comprehend computer hardware and software documentation to solve technical problems. Knowledge of SQL, Power BI, SSRS and Microsoft O365, SharePoint, and OneDrive cloud-based systems. Ability to give and comprehend written and oral instructions, and to accurately carry out such instructions. Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing. Ability to form professional networking relationships with other institutions and companies. Must be a motivated self-starter. Ability to make independent decisions in accordance with established policies and procedures. Must have strong interpersonal, communication and leadership skills. Ability to multitask. EDUCATION AND PRE-REQUISITES. MUST be proficient with SQL/SSMS. MUST be experienced with updating/optimizing stored procedures and relational databases. Desired: Hold a BS in Computer Science or related field. Highly Desired: Experience managing and maintaining a Microsoft Dynamics database. Three years in a data analysis or database development role. Strong analytic and problem solving. Proficient with computers, computer software, software development tools, and relational databases and their architecture. Excellent communication skills. Ability to maintain good working relationships with all levels of employees. Microsoft Office5 (Word, Excel, Outlook and Access). Microsoft Power BI. Microsoft Dynamics5, with CRM focus. Microsoft SQL Server and SQL query language. Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS). Donor Perfect Donor Management software. Donor Search Wealth Management software. Galaxy Gateway Point-of-Sale/Ticketing Software. Galaxy CRM+ add-on to Dynamics5. Strong analytic and problem solving. CONDITIONS OF WORK. PHYSICAL EFFORT: Sitting at computer stations for extended periods; standing, walking, bending, lifting, twisting, climbing, crawling, kneeling, reaching motions. Some lifting up to lbs. DISCOMFORT/RISKS: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome. Extreme temperatures when working outdoors. HOLIDAY/EVENING WORK: Weekend and holiday and some evening work are required. TRAVEL: Conference and workshop attendance, as required. EQUIPMENT USED. Common hand tools, computers and computer related hardware, general office equipment, telephone, radio, golf cart, vehicles. This class specification should not be interpreted as all inclusive. It is intended to identify the major responsibilities and requirements of this job. The incumbents may be requested to perform job-related responsibilities and tasks other than those stated in this specification.

name: GIS/Data Analyst I or II
description: Job Description. The Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments (MWCOG or simply COG) is an independent, nonprofit association that brings area leaders together to address major regional issues in the District of Columbia, suburban Maryland, and Northern Virginia. The National Capital Region Transportation Planning Board (NCRTPB or simply TPB) is the federally designated Metropolitan Planning Organization (MPO) for the Washington, D.C. metropolita  area. The TPB is also one of several policy boards that operate at COG. COG is the administrative agent for the TPB, and the TPB is staffed by COGâ€™s Department of Transportation Planning (DTP). COG has a staff of about0 employees, half of whom work in the DTP. COG was founded in57. The TPB was created in65 and became associated with COG in66. The Council of Governments' Department of Transportation Planning is seeking a GIS/Data Analyst to join the Planning Data and Research Team. The successful candidate for this position will play a key role in the collection, processing, analysis, management and visualization of geospatial data as well as the development of GIS applications to support travel survey, travel volume trend, demographic, and transportation infrastructure data used in regional policy studies, forecasting, and performance-based planning and programming. The successful candidate will also facilitate cooperation and collaboration on GIS-related issues among COG member jurisdictions and other public sector agencies and regional partners in the metropolitan Washington area. Duties will include: creating geospatial products (online maps, static maps and other related content) for a variety of transportation planning programs. updating standard geospatial datasets part of COGâ€™s spatial data library. providing administrative support for COGâ€™s ArcGIS Online organizational account. performing GIS software upgrades and other related systems-related tasks. processing and analysis of travel survey, traffic, and transportation infrastructure data (e.g., bridge and pavement con ditions). processing, analyzing, and synthesizing large datasets (Big Data) and creating visualizations and other data summaries. developing data visualization using Geographic Information System (GIS) software and other data visualization tools. Serving as staff liaison to COGâ€™s GIS Committee. Providing GIS technical support to other COG teams and departments. applying assurance and quality control measures to data; and. writing and/or presenting technical documentation, reports and product-oriented metadata. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES. No direct staff supervisory responsibilities but may be involved in supervising interns. Such responsibilities may include interviewing, hiring, and training interns; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining; addressing complaints and resolving problems. REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES. The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication skills and demonstrated knowledge in the application of geospatial technologies, and specifically Esri ArcGIS Desktop, Online and Enterprise platforms, leveraging these tools in all stages of product development. This candidate will also have a strong academic background in statistical analysis, land use and transportation planning, data science, and research methods. Experience with computer software packages used for database development, statistical analysis, and reporting is also required. Knowledge of the use of survey and other data in regional transportation planning activities is also highly desirable, as is the ability to interpret user requirements and translate them into efficient and effective geospatial products and applications. Background in programming and/or quantitative analysis. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE. To be considered for the Analyst I position, candidates must possess a bachelorâ€™s degree in geography, urban or regional planning, transportation planning, or an appropriately related field, and1 years of directly applicable work experience. To be considered for the Analyst II position, candidates must possess a masterâ€™s degree in geography, urban or regional planning, transportation planning, or an appropriately related field, and3 years of directly applicable work experience. Any equivalent combination of experience and training which provides the required knowledge, analytical and writing skills and abilities will be considered. COMPUTER KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS. Required background using ArcGIS Desktop, ArcGIS Online, ArcGIS Pro, ArcGIS Server/Enterprise. Experience using scripting languages (e.g. Python, R). Experience with Microsoft  Office programs (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, InDesign, Photoshop), statistical software, database software, and data visualization software (e.g. Tableau, Power BI). Familiarity with  basic web page design desirable. COMMUNICATION SKILLS. Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from members, regulatory agencies, community leaders and citizens. Ability to articulate intended project workflows to direct supervisor. Ability to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directors. MATHEMATICAL SKILLS. Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute percentages, rates, and ratios and to draw and interpret numeric charts and graphs. REASONING ABILITY. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to evaluate technical options and implement solutions based on individual project needs. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form and deal with a variety of abstract and concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization may exist. WORK ENVIRONMENT. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. During the COVID pandemic, COG has conducted its work virtually largely through telework. Staff are currently expected to return to the physical office in January22, with continued opportunities for part-time telework. Starting Salary: $57,931 $81,104 Analyst I DOQ or $61,417 $89,239 Analyst II DOQ. Please send a cover letter, resume and salary requirement highlighting the skills and relevant experience you would bring to this position to resumes@mwcog.org or visit www.mwcog.org. Further information can be  found on MWCOGâ€™s  Human  Resources webpage ( https://www.mwcog.org/about-us/human-resources. ) MWCOG is an Equal  Emplo yment Opportunity (EEO) employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation or any other class protected by state or federal laws in admission or access to our programs, services, activities, hiring, and employment practices.

name: Business Intelligence (BI) Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Description. name: Data Analyst I
description: Job Description. Job Description. Join the Cerner ITWorks team onsite at Tiger Institute-Columbia working in partnership for the continuous improvement of healthcare for the Columbia, MO area. As a Data Analyst at the Tiger Institute, you will have the primary responsibility to analyze, prepare, and process data sets to be consumed for direct insights, statistical modeling, or other analytical exploration utilizing the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) and Business Intelligence tools. You will be aligned with the Information Management and Population Health Client Services team to leverage its business intelligence resources to support population health and analytics initiatives at MU Health Care. You will represent a unique opportunity to collaborate with cross-functional teams to transform data and complete analyses to solve business problems. This includes gathering business requirements from end-users, developing data sets, and performing pertinent analyses. Qualifications. Cerner is a place where people are encouraged to innovate with confidence and focus on what is important people's health and the care they receive. We are transforming health care by developing tools and technologies that make it more efficient for care providers and patients to navigate the complexity of our health. From single offices to entire countries, Cerner solutions are licensed at more than,000 facilities in over countries. Cerner's policy is to provide equal opportunity to all people without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other legally protected category. name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. We have an exciting opportunity open for a Data Analyst I/II based in either Fort Smith, AR, or Little Rock, AR. Join our Growing Team and see why Summit Utilities, Inc was named as one of the Fastest Growing Denver Area Private Companies19 and20; Best Places to Work in Maine19,20 and21; and Best Places to Work in Arkansas20. Summit is a growing natural gas utility company providing safe, reliable and clean burning natural gas service to homes and businesses in Arkansas, Colorado, Maine, Missouri and Oklahoma. Being part of the Summit team means embracing excellence, diversity and innovation, committing to safety each and every day, and doing all that we can to serve each other, our customers and the communities where we live. We aim to bring warmth and energy to everything we do. POSITION SUMMARY: A Data analyst assists in the daily management and maintenance of all enterprise reports, as well as the design and creation of queries to fulfill data requests. Successful candidates are self-driven, and comfortable with a fast-paced environment. They have the ability to resolve data quality issues that may be or become present. A Data Analyst II communicates daily with IT personnel for database needs, and personnel outside of IT for data requests and report needs, and therefore must be an excellent communicator. They must be able to work with Data Engineers to resolve data anomalies found in data pipelines. They must have the ability to teach business departments basic reporting skills to allow for self-service driven reporting. PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES. Analyze data in order to fulfill report and ad hoc data requests. Design, create, and deliver fully functioning reports. Provide schema and data assistance and guidance to Analysts. Create and maintain best practice security policies for all reporting platforms. Resolve data quality and anomaly issues within source systems, data pipelines, or target systems discovered by the business end users. Work with stakeholders to understand their needs and translate that into quantitative problems. Communicate data analysis findings with the business. Define common data segments, processes or event models. Document and Catalog data within the enterprise data structures. Building Enterprise Reports for upper management. Create business insights through data and reports. Teaching business departments to build reports for self-services. Utilize data in respective databases to build easily digestible dashboards. EDUCATION AND WORK EXPERIENCE. Bachelorâ€™s degree in Information Technology or Computer Science is preferred or combination of education and equivalent experience. yearsâ€™ related experience in Database or Business Intelligence systems. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES. Power BI experience preferred. T-SQL/SQL. Moderate level knowledge of ETL Tools. Friendly and effective communication skills are a must. SAP experience preferred. Problem-solving attitude. Business Oriented. Business Analytics. Strong mathematical aptitude and analytical skills. Data Modeling. Azure environment experience preferred. SQL Server/Oracle/Excel experience preferred. Summit offers competitive pay and medical/dental/vision and other benefits that provide flexibility, choice and support to our employees when they need it most. We understand that home and family are essential pieces of your life, and our benefits are designed to support you both at work and at home.

name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Description. Job Description: We are seeking a self-motivated Data Analyst to provide technical and analytic support to a small, high-impact team. The Data Analyst will be expected to work with Data Scientists to build statistical models, test hypotheses, and interpret, summarize, visualize, and succinctly report data findings. The Analyst may be required to leverage automation and machine learning models to manage data, predict scenarios, and make recommendations to a non-technical audience. The Data Analyst will contribute to building new analytical tools in support of the IC customer, and will be expected to collaborate with team members in a highly technical environment. The Data Analyst will be expected to learn and leverage technical frameworks and collaboration technologies, including Amazon Web Service (AWS) and Git. Requirements: Experience with scripting in Python or R. Experience (either on-the-job or in an academic setting) working with data manipulation techniques and statistics. Knowledge of computer science concepts, data architecture, and common statistical models. Knowledge of all-source intelligence, including SIGINT, and/or HUMINT collection reports. Familiarity with cable writing styles and classified client databases, including specific targeting tools. Ability to communicate technical findings to non-technical audiences. Familiarity with key US foreign policy and national security Counterterrorism (CT) objectives. Knowledge of IC policies and procedures. Ability to work efficiently in a metrics-driven environment. Bachelor's degree + a minimum ofyears of experience. TS/SCI clearance with polygraph required. Pay Range:
