name: Operations Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Operations Data Analyst Job Description OPERATIONS DATA ANALYST COSTAR REAL ESTATE MANAGER ATLANTA, GA. OVERVIEW. CoStar Real Estate Manager. is a leading provider of technology solutions to the commercial real estate industry. CoStar Real Estate Manager provides web-based software and professional services solutions to corporations, retailers and corporate real estate service providers around the world. We are currently seeking to fill the role of Operations Data Analyst. The Operations Data Analyst. will report to the Operations Manager and will be responsible for analyzing and maintaining accurate business operations data across the company. This individual will partner with representatives across multiple departments to identify and resolve any data inconsistencies as well as demonstrate a clear understanding of, and ensure adherence to, the company's data management policies and procedures. Duties will include identifying, managing, and reporting on key data elements to support ongoing business goals and activities. RESPONSIBILITIES. Analyze and maintain accurate data across multiple company data sources and platforms. Partner with representatives across the company to identify missing, incomplete or inaccurate data and resolve/update as needed (Sales, IT, Finance, Implementation, Support). Establish processes to support daily, weekly, and monthly data management activities. Track and manage upcoming customer software license renewals and related key data elements. Increase Salesforce data quality and hygiene throughout the customer lifecycle. Create reports and dashboards to visualize trends over time from aggregated data. Automate the capture and reporting of key performance indicators and metrics for the company. Ongoing aggregation, data analysis, and reconciliation of operational data. Assist with formalizing company data management policies and procedures. Analyze enterprise sales and operational data and identify opportunities for improvement. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS. Bachelor's Degree. Proficient in MS Office tools.3 years of experience in data analysis. PREFERRED QUALIFCATIONS AND SKILLS. Proven self-starter with the ability to manage multiple activities and deliverables simultaneously. Must be detail-oriented and possess strong organizational, written and verbal skills. Ability to communicate and work effectively across all levels of the organization. Experience consolidating and normalizing data from multiple data sources/formats into meaningful and actionable insights. Experience automating the capture of data on a regular basis for trending and forecasting. Experience developing Executive Dashboards and high-quality reports. Advanced data analytics capabilities and Excel power user. Professional experience with SQL, ETL and data analysis tools a plus. OVERVIEW OF COMPANY: Founded in87, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for r enters, property managers and owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate. Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a sta f of over300 worldwide. WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU: Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to): Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug. Life, legal, and supplementary insurance. Commuter and parking benefits.1(K) retirement plan with matching contributions. Employee stock purchase plan. Paid time off. Tuition reimbursement. On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the day. Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks. Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it - see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0 We welcome all qualif ied cand idates who are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply. However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position. #LI-MP2 CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Ability to recommend and implement industry best practices for information/data and analytics.. Presentation skills with a comfort to work effectively with both business and technical stakeholders.. Strong written and verbal communication skills to develop proposals, reports and papers. name: Senior Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Job Description. Cerner's Health Network Consulting team is hiring a Senior Data Analyst to analyze, prepare, and process data sets to be consumed for direct insights, statistical modeling, or other analytical exploration for internal and external clients. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for consulting on data and modeling impacts, guiding clients through interdependencies and analysis decision impacts; evaluating data sets for analytical possibilities and pitfalls, and creating data visualizations leveraging the design and data presentation guides. You will also apply subject matter expertise to complex data analytic challenges and transform data as appropriate for specific team functions or processes. Finally, you will execute project deliverables with other data analytics team stakeholders; conduct statistical testing and exploratory data analysis; and pinpoint trends, correlations, and patterns in complex data sets. If you believe health care is too important to stay the same, apply today! Qualifications. Basic Qualifications At leastyears of total combined higher education and related work experience, including:years data analytics and/or statistics work experience, including experience in quantitative or statistical analysis, data mining, predictive or statistical modeling, applied programming, data management, data transformation, data visualization and/or quantitative or statistical research.years higher education and/or additional work experience directly related to the duties of the job, including: Bachelor's degree in Actuarial Science, Analytics, Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or related field, or equivalent, relevant work experience. Preferred Qualifications At leastyear of experience troubleshooting and resolving complex data issues. Expectations Willing to travel up to% as needed. Willing to work additional or irregular hours as needed and allowed by local regulations. Work in accordance with corporate and organizational security policies and procedures, understand personal role in safeguarding corporate and client assets, and take appropriate action to prevent and report any compromises of security within scope of position. Perform other responsibilities as assigned. Must current reside in, or be willing to relocate to, Kansas City, MO. Applicants for U.S. based positions with Cerner Corporation must be legally aut orized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. As of March,22, as a condition of employment, all US-based employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless a medical or religious exemption is approved. Some Cerner positions may be obligated to comply with additional client-facing requirements and occupational health requests, including but not limited to, an immunization set, an annual flu shot, an annual TB screen, an updated background check, and/or an updated drug screen. Cerner is a place where people are encouraged to innovate with confidence and focus on what is important people's health and the care they receive. We are transforming health care by developing tools and technologies that make it more efficient for care providers and patients to navigate the complexity of our health. From single offices to entire countries, Cerner solutions are licensed at more than,000 facilities in over countries. Cerner's policy is to provide equal opportunity to all people without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other legally protected category. Cerner is proud to be a drug-free workplace. EEO is the Law (English). E-Verify Participation (English). Right to Work (English). EEO is the Law (Spanish). E-Verify Participation (Spanish). Right to Work (Spanish).

name: Associate Data Analyst
description: Job Description. December,21 Associate Data Analyst Custom Products Job Description Job Title: Associate Data Analyst Custom Products Location: Pune, India Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, ALL Comscore positions will be Remote until further notice! About This Role: This analyst will extracts, transform, and analyse data, finding insights and answering questions about the content of the data. He or she will perform analytical hypothesis testing and modeling to provide key insight to internal and external clients. You'll work with global sales teams by providing data expertise, feasibility reviews, and detailed analysis of questions raised by internal and external stakeholders. This analytical role crosses all Comscore product areas, including digital, mobile, OTT, and TV. What You'll Do: Extract, transform and analyse data. Own discrete research tasks. Interpret data and report key findings to internal and external clients. Assist in the development of automating and streamlining custom work using ETL software and database query tools. Work cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data quality issues. Perform QA checks on custom work created by team. Troubleshoot data collection issues. Write complex SQL. Responsible for established and reoccurring custom analysis projects. Escalate issues when appropriate. Manage time appropriately in order to meet internal and external deadlines. Document report production and quality control processes. What You'll Need: Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Decision Sciences, Economics, Physics, Mathematics, or related field.2+ years of professional experience. Proficient in statistical software (i.e. SQL), relational databases and MS Office Suite. Uses database query  tools and ELT software (SQL, Python, Alteryx, Qlik, etc.). Experience analyzing data sets. Strong analytic, statistical and quantitative skills. Shift Timing: The regular hours for this shift will bepm --11 pm IST. Occasionally, earlier or later hours may be required for meetings with teams in other parts of the world. Benefits: days of privilege leave and days of casual leave, earned on an accrual basis. days of paid sick leave per annum. days off for National Holidays and Festival, which ones are communicated by HR early in the calendar year. Overtime pay and double wages for working a minimum ofhours on Public Holidays. Default one day a week off. Medical insurance through Care Health Insurance Limited. Internal Career Development Opportunities (minimum ofmonths tenure in current position and in discussion with supervisors). Access to hundreds of professional e-learning courses, specifically created for Comscore. Be creative: You don't have to follow the norm to be successful we encourage you to think outside the box. Our culture is built on encouraging innovative ideas, communication and joint success. Informal Work Atmosphere: We believe in getting the job done in a comfortable, casual environment! The ability to become a truly global engineer, with exposure to markets across the world. With more than offices around the world, many Comscore teams work together across locations. About Comscore: At Comscore, we're pioneering the future of cross-platform media measurement, arming organizations with the insights they need to make decisions with confidence. Central to this aim are our people who work together to simplify the complex on behalf of our clients and partners. Though our roles and skills are varied, we're united by our commitment to five underlying values: Integrity, Velocity, Accountability, Teamwork, and Servant Leadership. If you're motivated by big challenges and interested in helping some of the largest and most important media properties and brands navigate the future of media, we'd love to hear from you. Comscore (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a trusted partner for planning, transacting and evaluating media across platforms. With a data footprint that combines digital, linear TV, over-the-top and theatrical viewership intelligence with advanced audience insights, Comscore allows media buyers and sellers to quantify their multiscreen behavior and make business decisions with confidence. A proven leader in measuring digital and set-top box audiences and advertising at scale, Comscore is the industry's emerging, third-party source for reliable and comprehensive cross-platform measurement. To learn more about Comscore, please visit Comscore.com. LI-DNI.

name: Associate Data Analyst
description: Job Description. December,21 Associate Data Analyst Job Description Job Title: Associate Data Analyst Location: Reston, VA. Per Executive Order042, new or prospective Comscore, Inc. employees in the United States, must provide proof of complete vaccination, or approved exemption on the first day of their employment. Job Function: The Data Analyst is responsible for working directly with clients to evaluate all digital properties for design and implementation of Comscore measurement technologies across multiple platforms. The successful candidate will simultaneously maintain integration workflows and communication with numerous clients. A love of problem solving in challenging situations along with the ability to extract and communicate technical requirements from client communications is critical to success What You'll Do: Advise and assist Comscore clients with the implementation of measurement SDKs. Collaborate with Product, Engineering, Sales and Operations, to create and implement client solutions for application measurement. Perform bug fix verification, validation and troubleshoots internal and external client issues. Report product bugs to engineering teams and track resolution of technical issues. Explain complex technical problems to internal and external clients in a clear and concise manner Prototypes and writes SQL queries to compare various data sets. Create scripts to extract and manipulate data for reporting and analysis. Work with clients and peers to define technical requirements and translate these into an analytics strategy. Work independently, however still receive direction from manager. Lead meetings with client technical resources and present Comscore solutions. Work with clients and peers to define technical requirements and translate these into an analytics strategy. What You'll Need: Bachelors degree (B.S.) in Computer Science, Information Technology, or analytically-oriented field. Results oriented team player who leads by example, holds themselves and their team accountable for performance, takes ownership, champions efforts with enthusiasm and conviction. Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to create and manage multiple strategic relationships. Experience with JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, CSS / HTML, Web services / APIs, browser compatibility issues and solutions required. Programming experience with Java, Objective-C, JavaScript, and/or ActionScript. Hands-on experience with mobile applications for iOS and/or Android Experience with database technologies: SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Greenplum. Ability to troubleshoot client implementations. Ability to perform data testing and validation for current and newly developed product features Strong data analysis skill Experience with content management systems or ad serving systems a plus Deep knowledge of the advertising ecosystem a plus. Experience with complex technical projects or business issues requiring state of the art technical knowledge or industry experience. name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Data Analyst Job Description Position Overview: Apartments.com is the leadin g online apartment listing website, connecting renters to more thanm rentals across the country. Powered by CoStar, the Apartments.com network of home  rental sites includes Apartments.com, ApartmentFinder .com, Apartamentos.co m, ForRent.com, Ap artmentHomeLi ving.com, and WestsideRen tals.com. These unique re ntal sites offer advertisers expansive exposure for their available rental listings of all kinds. The Apartments.com analytics and re porting team is looking for a self-starter with5 years of hands-on data analytics or reporting experience. In this role, analysts will be expected learn essential business functions, develop key metrics, and deliver analyses and reporting that contribute to business decisions across the organization. Candidates will be required to work cross-functionally with management, analysts, developers, and product teams to meet objectives and deliver actionable insights to the business. Within the role, analysts will have the opportunity to explore all areas of the data analysis discipline including database design and architecture, query creation and optimization, ETL creation and maintenance, on-demand report creation, and analytic modeling. Essential Team Functions: Partner across departments to identify key information gaps and plans to provide or obtain that information. Utilize multiple data sources (primarily MS/T-SQL) build datasets and perform ad hoc analyses that drive actionable insights for the business. Design and build reports, create models and analyses to identify trends and improve existing business processes. Develop metrics and create dashboards to understand trends and track progress against key metrics. Experience, Skills and Qualifications:5 years of data analytics experience with experience, including: SQL experience including query writing, dataset creation. Analytical programming experience. Strong technical aptitude with the ability to analyze data, interpret information and trends in large amounts of data to develop actionable recommendations. Ability to work on multiple projects and deliverables simultaneously and quickly adapt as business needs and objectives change. Ability to work both as an individual and within a team to resolve issues, create new approaches to analyzing data, and drive decisions and consensus within the business. BA/BS degree required. Technical Skills: Intermediate SQL knowledge and experience. Familiarity with other scripting languages (R, Python, JavaScript, etc.). Intermediate experience in data visualization (PowerBI, Tableau). CoStar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

name: Sr Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Store Operations, Process Operations. Right on pace with Target's distinctive retail brand, Target Store Operations is continuing to transform the way it operates. Here, your work directly supports the store mission to be the guest favorite through successfully developing and communicating the processes for operations, style and experience, new structures, new operating models and new technology, and utilizing workforce management activities for our800+ locations nationwide. Store Operations manages and enhances the informational resources for researching and resolving operational issues, while guiding and communicating with the field team and leaders who use them. Are you a customer service enthusiast who can actively listen to many points of view and then visualize how they'll perform when operationalized in a store? Are you happy to partner with leaders as well as field team members who are often the experts on how well a process is working? Can you creatively envision more efficient processes and how they'll deliver a better experience for guests and team members? Do you possess the innovative mindset to question the status quo, and the confidence to work under varying degrees of ambiguity and well-informed experimentation? Then you'll have success on one of our dynamic teams. A role with Process Operations. means a big opportunity to apply your logistics, supply chain and fulfillment experience to continuously improve the strategies that fuel behind-the-scenes processes like fulfillment, replenishment and inventory accuracy. Primary Function: As a Sr. Data Analyst, you'll be part of a team of analysts supporting Stores through active exploration of data, technologies and the application of mathematical techniques that enables actionable business insights to include the development of metrics, reports and statistics. A very critical role you'll play is sharing out these insights through training/communication opportunities with end users to gather feedback, apply learned insights and testing in partnership with business users. Along the way you'll be applying best practice s. for data wrangling, analysis and visualization by sharing well documented solutions with others (clients, peers, etc.) while upskilling on new and emerging technologies with a continuous improvement mindset. In addition, active participation in team meetings and contributing to agile ceremonies. Principal Duties and Responsibilities: Actively exploring data for specific use cases. Creating measurable insights from the data to be shared. Developing metrics, reports, and statistics. Documenting calculations, code, and adhering to data management principles. Validating and testing data assets of others in the form of peer review. Exploring statistical analysis that could be applied to the data. Performing descriptive statistics including mean, variance, median, correlation. Applies insights and testing in partnership with business users. Active participant in team meetings. Contribute in agile ceremonies. Reporting/Working Relationships: Works directly with product owners, process owners, other analysts and engineers to gain insight and access to relevant data. Engages with product owners and users to deliver completed work. Active participant in Data and Analytics functions and training. Job Requirements: BA/BS in a quantitative degree Math, Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science or equivalent work experience. Experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, Java, Scala, etc. years relevant experience in reporting and data visualization. Extensive exposure to: visualization, coding, business consulting, database architecture, data mining, statistical analysis, and collaboration with business partners. Strong problem solving and analytical skills. Ability to learn, use, and teach reporting tools. Understand BI and Data dependencies. Demonstrate Testing and Research design; apply the scientific method and experimental design; generate insight from observation data. Stays current with new and evolving technologies via formal training and self-directed education. This position may be considered for a Full-Time Remote or Hybrid work arrangement based on Target's needs. A Hybrid work arrangement means the team members core role will be a blend of virtual and onsite at a Target location. A Full-Time Remote work arrangement means the team member worksfull-time from home oran alternatelocation that's not a Target location, does not have a desk at their primary HQ work location and may travel to HQ up totimes a year. Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). Target will provide reasonable accommodations (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or Distribution Center or reach out to Guest Services atfor additional information.

name: Data Analyst-LoopNet-Marketing
description: Job Description. Data Analyst-LoopNet-Marketing Job Description Data Analyst. LoopNet Richmond. OVERVIEW. LoopNet, the most popular place to find a space, is growing quickly and we're looking for a powerhouse Marketing and Communications Team, based in Richmond, to accelerate our growth and build the brand. With more than million monthly unique visitors and overx the traffic of the next competing site, LoopNet has established itself as the most effective digital advertising solution for owners and brokers. Together with a group of like-minded creative individuals, our Marketing Team will generate brand awareness and grow our client base through national multi-million-dollar marketing campaigns across TV, streaming, digital channels, social direct mail, email, mobile, print and events. LoopNet prides itself on continually improving, innovating, and setting the standard for commercial real estate advertising. We're building a brand on the cusp of defining the industry. We're looking for big thinkers, brave leaders, and creative advertising wizards ready to influence a new age of CRE digital marketing within a tried-and-true, award-winning company. Data Analyst. We are searching for a full-time, highly qualified Marketing Analyst to join our Marketing Team for LoopNet, the real estate industry's leading advertising network. The ideal candidate should be innovative with a data-driven approach to help shape our marketing strategy and uncover opportunities for growth. Given the scale and scope of our marketing, from industry-defining cross-platform ad campaigns to large-scale CRM efforts, the ideal candidate is ready to attack complex, interesting, and impactful questions. You will be responsible for the entire program, including data flow, in-depth analysis, ad-hoc reporting, and self-serve dashboard creation. We're looking for a fine-tuned candidate ready to provide expertise and leadership to ensure our campaigns and initiatives are well-planned, well-communicated, and well-executed. Collaboration is key, and this position will be working closely with marketing, design, product management, and sales teams to deliver analytic solutions to reach our goals. The ideal candidate jumps on new opportunities, gets nerdy about what they do, and works fast and flexibly to get the job done. This is a fast-paced work environment, so attentiveness and the ability to handle multiple projects with ease are a must. Responsibilities: Partner across the business to support marketing programs and growth goals, report on performance, determine measurement approaches, create insights and set strategy for new challenges. Build and expand existing dashboards to surface insights and democratize data that empowers marketers and product teams to make decisions. Perform exploratory analyses on large volumes of data; extract, package and present recommendations to inform decisions. Establish success metrics and measurement plans that explain the incremental impact of marketing campaigns. Translate business questions into appropriate analytical projects that will inform strategic and tactical business decisions. Conduct end-to-end analysis autonomously and communicate insights effectively. Identify and communicate insights to management and cross-functional stakeholders for better decision making. Act as a business partner to teams within marketing to understand, analyze, and provide quantitative insight into their business. Qualifications: years' experience in a Marketing Analytics, Business Analytics, Data Science or relevant data-driven role. Mastery of SQL, experience with Python, BI reporting and databases (dimensional and relational), including data ingestion and transformation. Experience with Google Data Studio or similar data visualization tools. Experience developing analytical frameworks, metrics to measure ongoing performance and understand performance drivers. Ability to transform data into a digestible and presentable story based on different audiences. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Proactive, resourceful, and gritty, when you have a goal, you find a way to meet it. A team player with project management skills and high attention to detail. An analytical and growth-oriented mindset. Comfortable operating in a fast-paced environment. Bachelor's degree required/Master's degree preferred. Sense of humor a plus. #LI-SB1 NOTE: This position requires that you present a portfolio of past projects as part of your application. What's in it for you? The Richmond CoStar office overlooks the scenic James River, with a front-row seat to Richmond's best view. Here, we're more than just a commercial real estate company. We're creative teams of collaborators who take pride and love the work we do. To get there, we believe in putting our people first. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program. Plus, we can't forget about company events, paid lunches, and avocados. Lots of avocados. Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it - see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVbJRnJ2sX0 We welcome all qualified candid ates who  are currently eligible to work full-time in the United States to apply. However, please note that CoStar is not able to provide visa sponsorship for this position OVERVIEW OF COMPANY: Founded in87, CoStar Group is the leading provider of commercial real estate information, analytics, and online marketplaces. Our suite of online services enables clients to analyze, interpret and gain unmatched insight on commercial property values, market conditions and current availability. Behind some of the most well-known brands in the industry, CoStar Group includes CoStar, the largest provider of CRE research and real-time data; LoopNet, the most heavily trafficked mobile and online real estate marketplace; Apartments.com, the premier rental home resource for renters, property managers an d owners; STR, the leading provider of performance benchmarking and comparative analytics to the hotel industry; BizBuySell, the largest online marketplace for businesses-for-sales; and Lands of America, the leading operator of online marketplaces for rural real estate. Headquartered in Washington, DC, CoStar Group maintains offices throughout the U.S. and in Europe, Canada, and Asia with a staff of over300 worldwide. CoS ar Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer; we maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

name: Data Analyst II
description: Job Description. Job Description. It's an exciting time to join Cerner! Our Health Network Deployment team is hiring a Data Analyst II, where you will analyze, prepare, and process data sets to be consumed for direct insights, statistical modeling or other analytical exploration for internal and external clients. In this role, some of your responsibilities will include to access and compile complex data sets from various sources for exploratory and pre-defined analyses; audit complex data sets for completeness, validity, and other pertinent data health measures; and evaluate complex data sets for analytical possibilities and pitfalls with some assistance. You will transform complex data with some assistance for specific team functions or processes as appropriate; conduct basic statistical testing and exploratory data analysis; and create basic data visualizations leveraging design and data presentation guides. Finally, you will have the opportunity to consult with stakeholders or clients on data availability and quality and outcomes of analysis, while pinpointing trends, correlations and patterns in complex data sets with some assistance. Apply today to learn more about this role! Qualifications. Basic Qualifications At leastyears total combined higher education and related work experience, including:year data analytics and/or statistics work experience, including experience in quantitative or statistical analysis, data mining, predictive or statistical modeling, applied programming, data management, data transformation, data visualization and/or quantitative or statistical research.years higher education and/or additional work experience directly related to the duties of the job, including: Bachelor's degree in Actuarial Science, Analytics, Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or related field, or equivalent, relevant work experience. Expectations Willing to travel up to% as needed. Willing to work additional or irregular hours as needed and allowed by local regulations. name: Marketing Data Analyst
description: Job Description. At a glance: Are you an experienced marketing reporting and analytics professional skilled at translating reporting requirements and developing custom reports? Can you commit to a position performing deep-dive analyses to address key business issues and presenting findings to stakeholders at all levels of the organization? Do you desire a competitive salary with lucrative benefits and a focus on professional development? Our company: At Spectrum Enterprise, our goal is to foster an engaging work environment that encourages our team members to reach their full potential. We promote a culture of excellence that celebrates diversity, innovative thinking and dedication to consistently exceeding client expectations. Spectrum Enterprise, a part of Charter Communications, Inc., is a national provider of scalable, fiber technology solutions serving America's largest businesses and communications service providers. The broad Spectrum Enterprise portfolio includes networking and managed services solutions: Internet access, Ethernet access and networks, Voice and TV solutions. Spectrum Enterprise's industry-leading team of experts works closely with clients to achieve greater business success by providing solutions designed to meet their evolving needs. More information about Spectrum Enterprise can be found at enterprise.spectrum.com. Highli ghts: You  are passionate about empowering business leaders with concise, high-quality information and assisting them in leveraging it to identify and address business opportunities and threats. As a Marketing Data Analyst, you ensure that business needs and goals are realized by building reports to track key metrics, empower stakeholders with analytics and investigate key performance indicators (KPIs). You improve initiative outcomes by providing consultation on the interpretation of data to various business partners. You drive project success by collaborating with key stakeholders to translate reporting requirements and the development of custom reports. You perform deep-dive analyses to address key business issues and present findings to stakeholders. You improve key metrics and marketing KPI outcomes through proactive recommendations for new tests and initiatives. You excel at guiding your projects as an individual contributor and collaborating with multiple teams across Spectrum Enterprise. You report to the Director of Marketing Analytics and Reporting for goals, guidance and assistance. Position benefits: Competitive salary with bonus. Health, vision and dental insurance.0% company match1(k) up to Company funded retirement accumulation plan for an additional Education assistance. Pretax childcare spending account. Paid holidays, vacation days, personal days and sick days. Employee discount on Spectrum services where available. What you will do: Work closely with stakeholders to gather detailed reporting and analysis requirements, recommend and identify metrics and KPIs, create reporting and visualization mockups, translate into data requirements and gain approval. Ensure successful user adoption by presenting data in a fashion that is easy to understand with the proper documentation. Align business needs, timelines and department standards by working with cross-functional teams. Promote efficiency by supporting the reporting automation team to automate reporting and analyses. Perform additional duties related to this position as assigned. Required keys for success: Prior experience and passion for leveraging data to drive significant business impact. Beginner to intermediate SQL skills. Sound critical thinking abilities in data analysis and process. Detail-oriented and attention to quality. Solid team and relationship building skills. Proven prioritization and organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and assignments in a fast-paced environment. Familiar with data visualization standards and techniques to visually summarize data and insights. Proficient in Microsoft Excel. Effective written and spoken English communication skills with all levels of an organization. How you will stand out from the crowd: Experience with cable TV, internet or phone products and services or other related industry. Technical experience with managing a Data Management Platform to perform transformations and manipulations. Demonstrated ability to develop new tools to extract data from Salesforce and Eloqua and automate reports using Alteryx, SQL and Datorama. Hands-on experience using Teradata or Python. Knowledge of reporting and visualization tools such as Tableau and Datorama. Proven technical experience managing a Data Management Platform to perform transformations and manipulations. Proven report development skills using basic and advanced Excel power user features. Understanding of business-to-business (B2B) marketing and sales funnel data. Knowledge of Salesforce data and structure. Familiar with data, metrics, analysis and trends and applied knowledge of measurement, statistics and program evaluation. Distinctive issue resolution skills with various technologies. Your education: Bachelor's degree in economics, mathematics or business administration or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience (required). BBL3167372-27372BR.

name: Metrics and Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Job ID:19877 Location: REMOTE WORK , CA , US Date Posted:21-12-16 Category: Information Technology Subcategory: Metrics and Data Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Travel: No Minimum Clearance Required: Interim Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: Secret Potential for Remote Work: Yes Description. SAIC is seeking a Metrics and Data Analyst. Note. this is a Flexwork position however Candidate will need to be on location periodically and would need to reside in the San Diego, CA area to support this function. Job Description: The Metrics and Data Analyst. position will assist in data collection, research and analysis, designing analytics dashboards and KPI reports. Development and support of enterprise reporting and analysis systems and software. Assist with the integration of business intelligence software into databases and data warehouses. Work in conjunction with data governance to monitor consistency and reliability of source data, as well as assess the quality of the data coming from multiple sources. Possess an interest and willingness to learn new toolsets, templates, and workflows as business needs evolve. Responsibilities include but not limited to: Gathering, cleaning, and integrating data into a data repository. Collecting data across Navy reporting enterprise systems to assist in analysis and extraction of actionable insights in support of Fleet sustainment activities. Creating reports and briefs based on findings. Engaging with business or management teams to understand both user requirements and strategic goals. Developing business intelligence reports and dashboards shared online or locally. Fulfilling reporting requests for both recurring and ad-hoc instances. Working with team members within the organization to identify opportunities for improvement in reporting; propose new features or enhancements for existing reports, or design new reporting capabilities. Extracting feature sets and business logic from existing toolsets. Required Qualifications : Strong analytical skills in order to extract meaning from complex data relationships and articulate to technical and non-technical stakeholders. Knowledge of data gathering, cleaning, and transforming techniques. Proficiency in SQL, Python, Tableau, and Statistical Analysis. Excellent people and written/verbal communication skills. Demonstrated ability to work independently and prioritize multiple projects. Comfortable with engaging with site customers under minimal supervision. Creative problem solving skills and ability to work within areas that have no set guidance or processes. EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: Required bachelors in mathematics, statistics, economics, and finance or computer science. four (4) years of experience accepted in lieu of degree. Minimum Clearance Required: Interim Secret. Qualifications. Preferred Qualifications : Mi nimum ofyears of progressive experience in business analysis or related field. Knowledge in AGILE. and SCRUM. methodologies. Experience in programming with VB Script/Excel VBA, Python, SQL. Adaptable and willing to learn new technologies and methods. Degree in a STEM based field of study a plus! COVID Policy: Prospective and/or new employees are required to adhere with SAIC's vaccination policy. All SAIC employees must be fully vaccinated and they must submit proof of vaccination on their first day of employment. Prospective or new employees may seek an exemption to the vaccination requirement at Contact Us and must have an approved exemption prior to the start of their employment. Where work is performed strictly at a customer site, customer site vaccination requirements preempt SAIC's vaccination policy. Target salary range: $75,001 $100,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors. SAICÂ® is a premier Fortune0Â® technology integrator driving our nation's technology transformation. Our robust portfolio of offerings across the defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets includes secure high-end solutions in engineering, digital, artificial intelligence, and mission solutions. Using our expertise and understanding of existing and emerging technologies, we integrate the best components from our own portfolio and our partner ecosystem to deliver innovative, effective, and efficient solutions that are critical to achieving our customers' missions. We are more than,500 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. SAIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer, fostering a respectful work culture based on diversity, equity, and inclusion that values all contributors. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $7.1 billion. For more information, visit saic.com. My SAIC Benefits.

name: Senior Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Senior Data Analyst Job Description Position Overview: Apartments.com is the leading on line apartment listing website, connecting renters to more thanmm rental s across the country. Powered by CoStar, the Apartments.com network of home rental site s includes Apartments.com, ApartmentFinder.com, Apart amentos.com, ForRent. com, ApartmentHome Living.com, and  WestsideRentals.com. These  unique rent al sites off er advertisers expansive exposure for their available rental listings of all kinds. The Apartments.com analytics and reporting team is loo king for a self-starter with years of hands on data analytics or reporting experience. At a high level , the role will provide quantitative support, business understanding, and strategic insight to leaders throughout the business. C andidates will be expected to rely on their technical skills, critical thinking, and creative problem solving to provide meaningful and actionable information that continue to drive the business forward. Strong candidates will exhibit the desire and willingness to create and deliver abstract solutions to overcome challenges and possess the technical knowledge needed to synthesis different data sources into comprehensive data sets and analyses. Essential Team Functions: Partner across departments to identify key information gaps and plans to provide or obtain that information. Build analyses and reporting for departments to increase efficiency and visibility across the business, including: Creat ing datasets in SQL from existing company applications. Writ ing SQL stored procedures, jobs and/or ETL scripts. Creat ing dashboards for internal stakeholders to measure KPIs. Perform predictive analysis using both newly created and existing data sets to identify process improvement opportunities and/or trends to determine effectiveness. Perform adhoc analys es at request of senior leadership. Experience, Skills and Qualifications: years of data analytics experience with experience , including : Strong SQL experience including creation of tables, stored procedures and jobs. Analytical p rogramming experience including predictive analytics and forecasting. Strong technical aptitude with the ability to analyze data, interpret information and trends in large amounts of data to develop actionable recommendations. Ability to work on multiple projects and deliverables simultaneously and quickly adapt as business needs and objectives change. Ability to work both as an individual and within a team to resolve issues, create new approaches to analyzing data, and dri ve decisions and consensus within the business. Technical Skills: Programming languages: SQL, R, Python, JavaScript , other. Data visualization: PowerBI , Tableau. Web/App deve lopment: HTML, CSS, nodeJS , xml, JSON. name: Data Analyst

Excellent verbal communication skill. Ability to submit high quality dashboards and reports and follow quality standards outlined by the Quality Management team. Experience supporting large-scale Program Management Office efforts. Previous Government contracting work experience. Working knowledge of SharePoint Pay Range: #Remote.

name: Science and Technology (S&T) Intelligence Exploitation Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Job ID:17800 Location: COLLEGE PARK , MD , US Date Posted:21-11-18 Category: Program Management Subcategory: Project Analyst Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Travel: Yes, % of the Time Minimum Clearance Required: TS/SCI Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: None Potential for Remote Work: No Description. SAIC is seeking a Science and Technology (Sand T) Intelligence Exploitation Data Analyst within the Office of the Under Secretary of Defense for Research and Engineering (OUSD(Rand E)). This is an exciting position that requires close interaction with top department leadership within the Pentagon and across the Department of Defense (DoD), including Service Components, industry partners, academia, international partners, and associations to achieve mission success. This position supports the development of models and analytical assessment capabilities of various data analytic platforms to assist in formulating new policy options involving Sand T exploitation and protection practices. Job duties include: Perform data analysis on Science and Technology (Sand T) Enterprise initiatives and activities using various data platforms to conduct statistical and comparative analysis of information contained within these analytic platforms. Develop actionable insights and recommendations for current operations or future technology protection efforts. Work closely with an array of relevant DoD stakeholders to identify key analytical information requirements, and implement or recommend data platforms that capture operational information needs that support Sand T protection requirements. Identify, develop, and compare data analytic platforms to address customer information requirements to promote and protect emerging academic and commercial research activities emanating from the National Security Innovation Base (NSIB. Develop and execute industrial base assessments to identify risks, issues, and opportunities to advance the protection of the DoD's technology modernization priorities in order to maintain a secure innovation base. Qualifications. Education and Experience. Bachelor's degree in Information Technology or related field. Ten (10) years of experience using commercial data analytic platforms. Technically proficient in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Palantir, Interos, etc. Exceptional skills in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills. Clearance. Active Top Secret/SCI. Desired Qualifications. At least three (5) years' recent and relevant experience in data management and analysis in support of the DoD enterprise. Strong knowledge of OSD-level organizational structure and understanding of the National Defense Strategy and DoD Modernization Priority Activities. name: Sr. Data Analyst
description: Job Description. A role with the Merchandise. Analytics. team is a chance to shape how core merchandising teams place product and build strategies that directly impact the guest. We see analytics as a driver of decisions and an opportunity to inform and influence our clients to build the optimal guest experiences. Our purpose is to create the most data driven team in retail by delivering industry-leading insights and products and fuel Target's growth. We connect teams with trusted data, provide a complete view of company , competition , and consumer insights, deliver world-class product solutions in partnership with product teams, and embrace a continuous-learning mindset. This is a role for someone passionate about analytics, driving business decisions and strategy, and building trusted relationships with partners. As a Sr Data Analyst. you willspend your time determining the best approach to gather, model, manipulate, analyze and present data. You will work within an agile environment which requires active participation in ceremonies and team meetings. In this role, you'll have opportunities to continuously upskill to stay current with new technologies in the industry via formal training, peer training groups and self-directed education. Core Responsibilities and : Serve as an advocate of our data-driven culture, work closely with Product, Engineering, and Data Science teams, helping then understand business needs that will direct their efforts towards initiatives with the highest impact. Synthesize analysis and results in compelling storylines and communicate to key stakeholders. Help define data to be collected for measuring the success of new product features, define KPIs, and work with engineering on tracking and instrumentation of data. Design and build self-service dashboards using a mixture of analytical and visualization techniques to derive actionable insight from data to influence business and product decisions. Democratize data and insights as you strive to deliver self-service tools to your partners and enable them to make better decisions more quickly. Deliver dashboard reporting and hold products and businesses accountable for results against goals and objectives. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs. About You: BS/BA or strong equivalent experience. years of work experience in analytics or masters level education in business analytics, data science, etc. Intermediate SQL experience writing complex queries; experience in analytical tools such as: Excel, Python, R, Hadoop/Hive, or equivalent technologies. Solid problem solving and analytical skills; intellectually curious, high energy with strong work ethic. Advanced proficiency in at least one visualization tool (ie. Domo, Tableau, Power BI) with willingness and ability to learn additional visualization tools. Ability to identify and succinctly summarize roadblocks, constraints, and trade-offs, propose potential solutions, and drive toward resolution. Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA). Target will provide reasonable accommodations (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or Distribution Center or reach out to Guest Services atfor additional information.

name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Description. Job Description: Are you smart, versatile, and resourceful? Do enjoy the rush of working on concept design, analysis, detailed design, prototype development, lab testing, and field testing? If so, we are looking for you, our next Data Analyst to work in San Diego, CA, as part of a small team to interface with Customers and End Users to tackle their most stressing multidiscipline design challenges. Be an integral part of an energetic, highly engaged small team where there are many overlapping roles and opportunities for cross-over skillsets to develop and contribute across a range of technologies. We know you'll take great pride in applying theory and technical creativity to rapidly develop impactful solutions. Primary Responsibilities. Perform computational analytics, to include CAD manipulation, finite element mesh development, engineering code development, and data processing with statistics. Work with all aspects of the Electromagnetic (EM) Low Observables (LO) design cycle; from concept design, requirements definition, multidiscipline trade studies and analysis, to detailed engineering design, up to prototype fabrication and testing. Provide direct engineering support for customers and end-users. Basic Qualifications. Bachelor's Degree in Science and/or Engineering with years of related experience. Must have a Secret Security Clearance and the ability to obtain a Top Secret Security Clearance. Must have excellent computer skills, with MATLAB, LINUX/UNIX, Windows. Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills. Must have the ability to work independently as well as with a team. Must have excellent problem-solving skills, and must be meticulous, organized, responsible, and self-motivated with a can-do attitude. Must thrive in fast-paced environment. Preferred Qualifications. Background in Physics, Mathematics, and/or Electrical Engineering. Advanced degree is a plus. Programming experience, C/C++, Visual Basic. Aptitude and desire to perform programming for the purpose of data manipulation and processing. Working aptitude for surfacing, manipulation, and meshing of CAD geometries for use in analytical codes. Proficiency in Geometry, Trigonometry, and Linear Algebra. Familiarity with computational electromagnetic (CEM) methodology. Experience with MS Office. Pay Range:

name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Description. Job Description: Leidos' Military and Veterans Health Solutions Group is seeking a full time Data Analyst. to support our operations at the Naval Submarine Medical Research Laboratory (NSMRL) in Groton, CT. NSMRL conducts research on the health and performance of naval personnel in operational and non-operational settings. Specific responsibilities include: Build and maintain a relational database in support of the Undersea Health Epidemiology Research Program (UHERP) research effort. Perform database administration tasks including installation, configuration, monitoring, maintenance, tuning, and backup/recovery using Microsoft SQL Server. Perform database maintenance tasks such as dumps/uploads and upgrades. Import data into a Microsoft SQL environment using scripts or other automated methods. Monitor data integrity, manage data cleaning/quality control, and perform data validation and integrity checks. Write and manage complex SQL data queries, stored procedures, schema, trigger, etc. from end user requiremen s. Work with SAS and Microsoft Access in conjunction with SQL to merge datasets from various formats and sources into a single cohesive repository for the synthesis of project specific datasets. Maintain compliance with applicable security protocols. Manage database logins/permissions and oversee database access. Ensure database availability. Consistently meet task deadlines while maintaining high quality of deliverables. Author procedural and standards documents for databases. Promote adherence to database policies within the program. Perform troubleshooting investigations of databases and coordinate resolution of problems. Stay abreast of Microsoft SQL server updates and implement plan for rolling out relevant features and upgrades. Transfer paper-based records from external sources onto computerized systems. Build and manipulate analytic datasets. Perform basic data analyses independently and support senior NSMRL staff on complex analyses, including data modeling. Participate in formation of research questions and epidemiological analysis plans. Interact and effectively communicate both written and orally with a wide variety of people. Perform other administrative, analytic, and database duties as needed to support UHERP. Adhere to security procedures to protect the database from accidental or intentional damage or loss. Perform backup of databases, as needed. Development and implementation of applications for data retrieval and entry. Document database design and development. Design and distribute free standing as well as ad hoc reports. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in computer science and8 years of relevant experience preferred; however, significant SQL and database experience may be considered in lieu of education. COMP TIA Security+ Certification is required withinmonths of employment. Due to Federal contracting requirements, only U.S. citizens are eligible. The position requires, at a minimum, a SECRET classification access level. Preference will be given to a candidate who already has this clearance level. The position requires an understanding of handling personally identifiable information (PII)/protected health information (PHI), including a thorough knowledge of HIPAA policies and procedures. Candidates must demonstrate the ability to interact and effectively communicate both written and orally with a wide variety of people. Ideal Skills: DoD database experience, particularly Military Health Systems. Skills should include a foundational and theoretical understanding of general scientific principles. Understanding of machine learning techniques, metrics, and processes. Experience in a human subject research setting and/or experience in the US federal government or military system is highly desired. Understanding of military lifestyles and occupations. Work Location: Work is to be primarily performed on a government installation. Naval Health East NHE Pay Range:

name: Metrics and Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Job ID:17285 Location: HUNTSVILLE , AL , US Date Posted:21-11-04 Category: Information Technology Subcategory: Metrics and Data Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Travel: No Minimum Clearance Required: Interim Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: Secret Potential for Remote Work: No Description. SAIC is seeking a Data Analyst. to support the Project Management Office for Aircraft Survivability Equipment (PMO ASE) located in Huntsville, AL. Primary Responsibilities Include: The candidate will function as an integral member of a team of Government, Military, and Contractor Personnel that provides program, engineering, and technical support to PMO ASE. PMO ASE is an acquisition management organization under the Program Executive Office for Intelligence, Electronic Warfare and Sensors (PEO IEWand S). The team provides acquisition management support, program research, engineering, logistics, and technical support for the development and fielding of world class aircraft survivability equipment. The candidate will work within PMO ASE supporting Product Offices by providing in-depth detailed analysis of data recorded/collected during test execution of various U.S. Army Aircraft Survivability Equipment (ASE) on rotary and fixed wing aircraft. As part of the SAIC ASE Test Team, the candidate will write data analysis plans and provide onsite and post-test analysis of U.S. Army laboratory, ground, flight, and free flight missile testing results using custom developed analysis tools. Post-test activities include the candidate providing detailed technical out-briefs of analyses to senior U.S. Army Officers and Civilians. Other daily duties include providing technical input to test directors and review of testing requirements and test readiness. Develop the planning and executing analysis of ASE level capabilities, draw conclusions and report results from the testing to determine engineering sufficiency to declare the system upgrades ready for implementation. Lead team analysis efforts and presentation of individual and team results to the customer. Evaluate system level requirements to determine adequacy of ASE capabilities, interfaces and associated behaviors and interpretation of model results and test results from prior testing to guide future assessment needs. Apply practical knowledge to flight testing principles and concepts applicable to the developmental and system qualification testing of DoD aircraft. Qualifications. Required Education: Bachelors and years or more experience; four (4) years of experience accepted in lieu of degree. Required Skills: Experience with MATLAB a must. Additional experience with Java, C, etc. Expertise in Missile Systems, Weapon Systems, Infrared Seeker Systems and Radar Engineering and Analysis; Modeling and Simulation; Testing, and Software Development. Experience with aircraft survivability equipment and test and evaluation programs and practices. Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Required Clearance: Must possess an Interim Secret Clearance to start. All SAIC employees must be fully vaccinated and they must submit proof of vaccination on their first day of employment. name: Senior Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Job Description. "Our Applied Analytics team in our Continuous Improvement organization is hiring a Sr. Data Analyst. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing, preparing, and processing data sets to be consumed for direct insights for our clients. You will access and compile data sets from various sources for exploratory and pre-defined analyses and audit the data sets for completeness, validity, and other pertinent data health measures. Additionally, you will evaluate the complex data sets for analytical possibilities and pitfalls and transform the data for specific team functions or processes. You may also be expected to conduct basic statistical testing and exploratory data analysis and create basic data visualizations leveraging design and data presentation guides. You will have regular communication with our stakeholders or clients on data availability, quality, outcomes, trends, correlations, and patterns from your analysis. We are looking for motivated candidates that can serve as "analytic translators" that also have experience using SQL, Excel, Power BI, and Tableau. If you are passionate about continuous improvement and using data to help others, apply today!" Qualifications. Basic Qualifications. At leastyears total combined related work experience and completed higher education, including:year of Data analytics and/or statistics work experience, including experience in quantitative or statistical analysis, data mining, predictive or statistical modeling, applied programming, data management, data transformation, data visualization and/or quantitative or statistical research.years higher education and/or additional work experience directly related to the duties of the job including: Required: Bachelor's Degree in Actuarial Science, Analytics, Information Systems, Management Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or related field, or equivalent relevant work experience. Expectations. Hybrid and remote location. Willing to work additional or irregular hours as needed and allowed by local regulations. Work in accordance with corporate and organizational security policies and procedures, understand personal role in safeguarding corporate and client assets, and take appropriate action to prevent and report any compromises of security within scope of position. description: Job Description. JOB DESCRIPTION: SAIC is seeking a Data Analyst to support an Army National Guard contract. You will work with our government client and our agile software implementation teams, bringing your strong SQL skills, ability to independently manage multiple complex tasks with tight deadlines, and leverage existing knowledge/subject matter expertise in HR data. You will analyze data sets, design dimension data stores, implement data exchanges, write metric algorithms and produce reports/outputs. Your focus will assess and improve data quality, create and validate business logic, and obtain, translate, and address customer requirements for solutions that use Microsoft SQL Server. This is a remote position from the DC Metro area. Travel to the Fairfax, VA office will be required from time to time. You will manipulate application metadata in admin tools and manage data model, data, and metadata directly in Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio. You will recommend design and analytic approaches to customers, then implement their requirements into new solution specifications and content. The success of these implementations will depend on your knowledge and understanding of the data, as well as your ability to envision and implement the required solution using technical data and metadata applications. Job Duties: Work on one or more agile software implementation teams and with customers to design user interfaces, reports and dashboards, automate work flows, design data models, and obtain, translate, document customer requirements. Create and manage SQL Server application data models using SQL Server Management Studio. Create and manage application metadata using internal admin tools and SQL Server Management Studio. Satisfy Ad hoc requests for reports or information, leveraging internally developed tools and/or direct SQL. Clearly communicate highly technical details to customers who have little or no programming, database, or software development knowledge. Provide customer with understandable explanations based on complex SQL/data-based characteristics. Identify necessary additional fields and review new metrics and presentations for accuracy and refinement. Assist in updating metadata for products. Perform quantitative and qualitative analyses. Qualifications. TYPICAL EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: BS/BA degree. Three (3) years or more of related experience. SQL expertise required to be considered for this position. Existing knowledge of federal civilian agency or DoD human resource systems and data is a plus. Strong knowledge of SQL, including the ability to read and design queries and stored procedures. Knowledge of relational and dimensional database designs, metadata management techniques, and a working understanding of tools used for database, content, and metadata management. Demonstrated expertise in the structure/capabilities/limitations of a data warehouse. Functional knowledge of DoD or federal civilian agency human resource data, personnel management, personnel management lifecycle, and a solid understanding of automated personnel management systems. Executing business process re-engineering and/or improvement projects, supporting mission-oriented business functions or research (e.g., data assessments, functional evaluations, gap analyses, etc.) and related applications or automated systems.  Ad hoc reporting and other customer support and interaction. Presenting and creating customer briefings, demonstrations, and training. Microsoft Office suite expertise. Microsoft Visual Studio experience desired. Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills including the ability to write in layman's terms when defining metrics, reports, and dashboards. Certification: CompTIA Security+ CE certification required. Clearance Requirement: Candidates must be US citizens who are clearable for a DoD Secret clearance due to military contract requirements. Can start work with a Public Trust clearance. COVID Policy: Prospective and/or new employees are required to adhere with SAIC's vaccination policy. name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Job Summary: Join our team of over000 employees globally, who provide the insights through data and next generation technology that help millions of people find, buy and protect the homes they love. From the beginning, CoreLogic has been driven by a single purpose to innovate and create solutions that solve our clients' toughest challenges in the housing market. CoreLogic is the trusted source for property intelligence, with deep knowledge of powerful economic, social, and environmental forces that promote healthy housing markets and thriving communities. We apply that same dedication to creating a diverse and inclusive work culture that inspires innovation and bold thinking. A place where individuals can work on small teams, feel valued, and directly impact the real estate industry. We believe our team members are the best in the business, and we will continue to recruit, retain, develop and reward our most important asset our people! Job Description: We're looking for someone that can not only find-and-pull and slice-and-dice data, but can also put that data to work. As a Business/Data Analyst at CoreLogic, you will support the decision makers that drive this company's strategy and profitability by providing informative reports in Tableau, and performing advanced analytics, such as data mining and trend analysis. We need someone whose attention to detail and work ethic set a high standard for everyone around them.Those skills will prove invaluable as you play a crucial role in our marketing goals, sales efforts, and product development, too.It's not just marketing and sales' job to increase the number of people who know about us and stick around to get the most out of our products and services it's also the Data Analyst's job. The success of this company is each and every person's job and we take a lot of pride in our work. You live by that notion, too: that everyone working in silos leads to a disjointed team and epic fail. You're excited to work with us because you love a team that creates and reaches company goals together, while also recognizing individual efforts. You want people to notice your keen technical and analytical skills, as well as your impressive task and time management skills. Last, but not least, people have complimented you on your ability to always stay positive and professional, even during really challenging projects or situations. This position is not just a technical position but a blend... you need to have great commu ication skills, including presenting at times to business users What you get to do.. Answer fundamental questions about our business using tools such as Tableau, SQL, and Excel to display a visual story that will help our management teams assess market conditions, identify profitable opportunities, and measure the performance of their respective business areas.. Translate marketing, sales, and technical support objectives to SQL scripts and data mining initiatives.. Identify data quality problems and their root cause. Propose fixes and create data audits to ensure the problem is resolved.. Leverage data warehouse technology such as Microsoft SQL Server and Amazon RedShift to convert large amounts of data to useful information.. Provide expert advice in the usage and interpretation of data for all business areas.. Play a key role in defining reporting standards and metrics. This position offers a hybrid Flexible Working Model (FWM) where you can work up todays remote anddays onsite. Job Qualifications: What you know.. Tableau,years minimum experience You make Tableau dance, and are a master at using it to transform data and information into insight.. T-SQL and relational databases,years minimum experience SQL is second nature to you.When given access to a DB, you can easily find data without even being given a roadmap.. Spreadsheets, specifically Microsoft Excel,years minimum experience You love data, and making it sing in Excel.VLOOKUP, Pivot tables, Regression? Child's play.. ETL software and processes Getting data from here to there is just part of the fun for you.. Brilliant communication skills, both written and verbal gathering requirements and doing analysis is second nature to you.You find yourself at home presenting to Officers or Customers.. You are a master of time and task You often deliver your work ahead of schedule, and never drop a task.If not given direction, no one has to tell you what to do next, because you're busy gathering new insights for management.. Financial and Business principles, through degree or similar professional experience You're quite at home shooting the breeze about SaaS metrics like ARPA, Churn, or LTV, and talking to Accountants about the Pand L statements.. BS Degree required or equivalent work experience Bonus points for.. Public recognition/awards. Training/teaching experience. Leadership/management experience Candidates chosen for an interview will be required to pass an exam covering T-SQL and relational database design, and will need to demonstrate Tableau and Excel knowledge. Only qualified candidates need apply. CoreLogic's Diversity Commitment: CoreLogic is fully committed to employing a diverseworkforce and creating an inclusive workenvironment that embraces everyone's uniquecontributions, experiences and values. We offer anempowered work environment that encouragescreativity, initiative and professional growth andprovides a competitive salary and benefits package. We are better together when we support and recognize our differences. EOE AA M/F/Veteran/Disability: CoreLogic is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Actionemployer committed to attracting and retaining thebest-qualified people available, without regard torace, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexualorientation, gender identity, age, disability or statusas a veteran of the Armed Forces, or any other basisprotected by federal, state or local law. CoreLogicmaintains a Drug-Free Workplace. Please apply on our website for consideration. Privacy Policy http://www.corelogic.com/privacy.aspx Connect with us on social media! Click on the quicklinks below to find out more about our compan y and asso ciates.

name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. CCS Global Tech is a rapidly growing Information Technology company with a diverse portfolio of technology products and services and a large network of industry partnerships. With over years of being a successful business with a global talent pool and presence, CCS is a certified Microsoft Gold Partner and specializes in delivering expert Microsoft based solutions for technical and business needs. We have been recognized by Inc.0 Magazine as one of the fastest growing small companies in the Unites States. we are a Tiervendor for the City and County of San Francisco for Cloud Services, Staffing Services and Training Services. For this multi-year opportunity with a diverse set of needs to address, we are currently focusing on establishing partnerships with individuals as well as companies who can help us enhance our overall service portfolio, cut lead times, and ultimately help us deliver successfully. We currently hold sizable Government accounts in the San Francisco bay area including City and County of San Francisco, San Mateo County, and Santa Clara County. We take great pride in our global reach and local influence. Your experience alongside our highly skilled and talented internal team who guide you along the way, offers key insights into what helps you stand out in a competitive job market. If you are a partner company, please submit resumes with contact information of your own W2 Consultants only. Submitted consultants are expected to have excellent communication skills. Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Data analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements. Responsibilities Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports. Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems. Work with management to prioritize business and information needs. Locate and define new process improvement opportunities. Requirements One to two years of experience. Minimun bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field. Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques. Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks). Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc). Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
