name: Senior Principal Software Engineer (Artificial Intelligence)
description: Job Description. Optum, the fastest growing part of UnitedHealth Group, is a leading information and technology-enabled health services business. Our teams are dedicated to modernising the health care system and improving the lives of people and communities. Serving virtually every dimension of the health system, we work with a diverse set of clients across0 countries from those who diagnose and treat patients to those who pay for care, deliver health services, and those who supply the cures. Optum maintains operations across North America, South America, Europe, Asia Pacific and the Middle East. Our innovative partnerships provide technology and tools that enable unprecedented collaboration and efficiency. As a result, we can tap into valuable health care data to uncover insights and develop strategies for better care at lower costs. About the role: Do you want to impact healthcare using Artificial Intelligence at the largest healthcare company in the world? If so, this is a chance to do just that. You will serve as a Senior Principal Software Engineer. within the Advanced Technology Collaborative and create innovative solutions that help us achieve our north star goal of "Fully Autonomous Healthcare". We have investment areas within the Home Care, Predictive Healthcare and/or Conversational Voice domains. The Advanced Technology Collaborative seeks to shape the future of healthcare through new, emerging, and leading technologies that help people live healthier lives. Within Optum, we possess the best healthcare data sets in the world. We have the largest scale in the industry covering Insurance, Care Delivery, Fraud Detection and Analytics. We need you to help us turn that "data advantage" into operational insights that lead to healthier outcomes and a more efficient healthcare system. Careers with Optum offer flexible work arrangements and individuals who live and work in the Republic of Ireland will have the opportunity to split their monthly work hours between our Dublin office and telecommuting from a home-based office. Primary Responsibilities: Collaborate to define and shape the 'Art of the Possible. Develop (from scratch) Deep Learning models that solve complex problems in the healthcare domain. Build out distributed training of large models for large datasets. Mentor and develop junior engineers in the AI/ML spaces, supporting a culture of collaboration and innovation. Develop a prioritized set of technical issues/shortcomings and/or data access challenges that would benefit from the application of general AI and NLP solutions. Deliver strategic technical recommendations to address current, near-term and future technical needs. Make recommendations relative to when to modernize, rewrite, and/or leveraged party technical assets. You'll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in. Required Qualifications: Master's degree or equivalent in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning or adjacent fields. Demonstrated experience in the fundamentals, practical application, and best practices of AI. Proven track record of advanced AI Development. Fluency in R, Python, Scala, Java, C/C++ or other programming languages to demonstrate the results of algorithmic approaches. Strong software design and architecture skills with an eye towards avoiding and reducing technical debt. Ability to work a portion of monthly work hours from our Dublin office is required. Preferred Qualifications: PHD level education. Experience with Spark, Hadoop, MPI, or other distributed frameworks. Experience with Tensorflow, Pytorch and/or equivalent AI libraries. Please note you must currently be eligible to work and remain indefinitely without any restrictions in the country to which you are making an application. Proof will be required to support your application. All telecommuters will be required to adhere to the UnitedHealth Group's Telecommuter Policy Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.SM Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Keywords: #RPO, Artificial Intelligence, AI, ML, Machine Learning, NLP, Natural Language Processing, R, Python, Scala, Java, Spark, Hadoop, Tensorflow, Pytorch.

name: Artificial Intelligence, Consultant
description: Job Description. Artificial Intelligence, Consultant Applied Artificial Intelligence (Full Stack Developer) While analytics isn't new, we're experiencing a renaissance in the science, technology, and application of business analytics today, which makes it hard to keep up. Many business leaders are now facing the dilemma of how best to quickly get up to speed on what analytics can actually deliver in practice. That's where Deloitte's Applied AI team can help. Work you'll do We are looking to add a Developer to our team. As a Developer, you will specialize in building powerful yet elegant products using cutting edge technologies. The Developer will have the opportunity to design and build innovative applications that offer measurable business value to our clients. The individual in this role may work in either a pure development role, helping architect and design a solution, or act as a lead, managing a development team. Evaluate client business challenges and work with the team to arrive at the best-fit technology solution components. Design, document, and develop world class web applications leveraging the full spectrum of front-end and back-end technologies and cutting-edge design patterns. Collaborate with clients and business analysts to translate business requirements into technical requirements. Mentor and assist with training junior developers. The team Analytics and Cognitive In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment. As the premier data-powered and platform-enabled cognitive consultancy, we help clients achieve competitive advantage through data and cognitive powered transformations that promote enterprise intelligence, autonomous processes, and precision stakeholder engagement The Analytics and Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy and Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting organizational intelligence programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen market Minimum Qualifications: years of relevant work experience. year of experience developing architecture solutions for AI use cases. Travel up to% (Monday Thursday/Friday) (While% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice. Limited immigration sponsorship may be available. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's degree oryears of relevant work experience. Understanding of the technology landscape including open-source, commercial on-premises, and cloud-based tools: Microsoft Cognitive Services, IBM Watson, IPSoft, Pega, Salesforce Einstein, Google Cloud Platform/Tensor Flow, Amazon Web Services/Sagemaker, PowerBI, SparkCognition, Expert System, Numenta, Deepmind, CognitiveScale, CustomerMatrix. Strong database development skills. Full-Stack web application development experience. User Interface (UI) design knowledge. Experience in Hadoop, Spark, Storm or related paradigms and associated languages such as Java/C++, R, Python, etc. Experience with developing web applications with SOA, RESTful, and/or MVC architecture. Experience with scripting languages (JavaScript (Node.js) / Python). Experience with the entire software de velopment lifecycle (SDLC). Experienced programming knowledge in both SAS and SQL, Operating system experience with UNIX and relational database knowledge such as ORACLE/TERADATA. SAS/Base, SAS/Stat, SAS/Macro preferred. Significant development experience with a lower level language (Java or C#). Expert HTML, JavaScript, and CSS skills. Deep experience designing modular, object-oriented programming. Strong experience with server-side Web frameworks (Django (Python), Express (Node.js), Play (Java)). Strong experience with relational  databases (Microsoft SQL Server, PostgresDB, MySQL). Experience with NoSQL databases (MongoDB, Neo4j). Experience developing across Windows/UNIX. Experience developing for mobile platforms. Knowledge of professional software engineering practices for the full software development lifecycle including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing and operations. Experience mentoring and/or training junior developers. Aand CConsulting21.

name: Artificial Intelligence Senior Engineer
description: Job Description. Job ID:15884 Location: CHANTILLY , VA , US Date Posted:21-12-06 Category: Engineering and Sciences Subcategory: Systems Engineer Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Travel: No Minimum Clearance Required: TS/SCI with Poly Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: TS/SCI with Poly Potential for Remote Work: No Description. Job Description: Join a winning team! SAIC's National Security and Space (NSS) Sector is currently hiring for a customer within the Intelligence Community (IC) in Chantilly, VA. This customer is responsible for designing, building, and operating national security-related systems based in space, in the air, and on the ground. SAIC is a strong company providing opportunities for energetic individuals with a strong desire to expand their knowledge while increasing their responsibilities. NSS Sector has an opening for a senior artificial intelligence engineer to provide Systems Engineering and Technical Assistance (SETA) services to an IC customer. The customer organization we support provides the enterprise architecting, analysis, and systems engineering solutions that determine the current and future national space systems. The explosion of data and complexity of problems facing our customer requires an innovative approach which SAIC is leading through the application of new technology and techniques. As an artificial intelligence engineer you will work on real world problems related to cybersecurity, infrastructure and constellation protection, network information and transport usage and many others. Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Working across multiple Directorates and Offices to identify and define future space capability needs. Frequent interaction with government, SETA, FFRDC, and mission partner stakeholders. Analyzing and executing technical solutions in support of high value asset indications and warning, resiliency, defense, and cyber protection. Identifying required system analysis for the definition, allocation, assessment, and prediction of system performance requirements and capabilities. Identifying key architecture and system level trades. Developing Concepts of Operations (CONOPS) for new capabilities and coordinating them across the affected organizations. Developing enterprise, system, functional, performance, and interface requirements. Manage the Request for Change (RFC) process as it relates to updating requirement baselines. Developing project-level schedule content for analysis and assessment. Preparing briefings for senior decision makers. Qualifications. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in STEM (computer science, computer engineering, science, technical, engineering, math) or including specialization in an Al-related field of study, or related job experience, with at least years of relevant experience. Active TS/SCI clearance with polygraph. Proven experience in planning / use / understanding of multiple types of AI (Reactive, Limited Memory, Theory of Mind, and Self-Aware). Significant experience working with data wrangling, and analyzing large and diverse datasets and expertise with at least one modern programming language such as Python, Java or Scala. Proven skills related to machine learning and artificial intelligence to include assessment of model effectiveness, predictive analytics, explainability and bias. Proven experience with one or more of the following: computational linguistics, computer vision, or natural language processing. Experience with cloud-based environments such as Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, or Microsoft Azure. Experience visualizing multi-dimensional data using tools such as Tableau, Kibana, neo4j, ggplot2, Plotly, matplotlib, or D3.js. Experience with databases technologies (e.g., PostgreSQL, Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server, MongoDB, Neo4j). Exper ience in the preparation of comprehensive writte n reports, presentations, and charts based on research, collection, and analysis of data. Direct experience building machine learning solutions. Strong desire to gain or apply experience in the application of machine learning, data mining, and statistical algorithms for development of autonomous systems and predictive models. Proven experience with large acquisition systems engineering efforts, methods, and processes. Proven experience in requirements development and definition activities to include stakeholder engagement and customer needs elicitation. Demonstrated ability to work in a fast paced, dynamic, and energetic environment. Strong oral and written communication skills. Desired Qualifications: Advanced degree in STEM (computer science, computer engineering, science, technical, engineering, math) or related discipline. Familiarity with popular machine learning software libraries (e.g. Tensorflow/Keras, PyTorch, OpenAI Gym) and current algorithms. Broad background in Machine Learning technologies, including reinforcem ent learning, deep learning, computer vision and knowledge graphs. Experience with business intelligence platforms such as Tableau, AWS QuickSight, Looker, or Qlik. Hands-on experience with the development of AI-enhanced decision system prototypes. Innovative, strong work ethic, able to think critically, and able to take initiative and work both independently and within a team. Prior US military and/or IC customer experience. COVID Policy: Prospective and/or new employees are required to adhere with SAIC's vaccination policy. All SAIC employees must be fully vaccinated and they must submit proof of vaccination on their first day of employment. Prospective or new employees may seek an exemption to the vaccination requirement at Contact Us and must have an approved exemption prior to the start of their employment. Where work is performed strictly at a customer site, customer site vaccination requirements preempt SAIC's vaccination policy. name: Data Scientist (AWS Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence SME)
description: Job Description. Data Scientist (AWS Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence SME) Position Description CGI Federal is seeking a Data Scientist with AWS machine learning and artificial intelligence expertise. The candidate will have expertise in AWS Sage Maker suite of services and other AWS supporting services. The Data Scientist will work with our CTO team within the office of the CTO of a large government agency. We are seeking a strong SME that is able to apply ML/AI AWS capabilities to address complex use cases that are identified by the CTO and other business leads. Your future duties and responsibilities. Data Science responsibilities including providing expertise and guidance of the application of AWS Sage Maker suite of services and related services. Labeling data and/or confirming labeled data for use in ML processes. The application of AWS Translate to provide translation services, leveraging localization options and customizations for the agencies context. Also provide text analytics expertise related to translation services. Apply classification and regression concepts to model development for data analysis. Provide guidance of the integration of APIs with applications and Service Design/Service Delivery Strategy support. Apply appropriate supervised ML algorithms, e.g., XGBoost, Linear, ne arest neighbor to model functions, relationships and dependencies. Apply appropriate unsupervised ML algorithms, e.g., K-Means, Random Cut  Forest depending on the use case and input data. Apply Agent or Markov reinforcement algorithms depending on use case and data. Apply Natural Language Processing (NLP) algorithms, e.g., Seq2Seq, to perform tr anslation and other applications. Includes machine translation, modeling hyper parameters Required qualifications to be successful in this role. Programming: Python, SQL.. Software: AWS AI/ML Services. Experience selecting models, training models and executing models to achieve desired results. Clustering/Segmentation (including K means and other ML methods).. Tree-based models, Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Time Series Modeling, T-tests.. Experience in interpreting results from statistical and mathematical models.. Experience in endpoint rendering, machine learning, and predictive modeling. Desired qualifications:. Statistical modeling experience with strong team leadership and communication skills. Programming: Python. Software: Jupyter Notebooks and AWS ML algorithms and services. Federal security credentials Education:. Master's degree and years of experience OR Bachelor's degree and+ years of experience #CGIFederalJob #DICE Build your career with us. It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change-supporting our clients' digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities. At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create. Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world. Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com. No unsolicited agency referrals please. CGI is  an  equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at USEmploymentCompliance@cgi.com. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI's legal duty to furnish information. name: Cyberspace Engineer
description: Job Description. Job ID:17358 Location: REMOTE WORK , VA , US Date Posted:21-12-06 Category: Cyber Subcategory: Cyberspace Ops Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Travel: Yes, % of the Time Minimum Clearance Required: None Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: Top Secret Potential for Remote Work: Yes Description. SAIC is looking to hire a Cyberspace AI/ML Engineer to work on advanced detection of malicious cyber activity. As a Cyberspace AI/ML Engineer, you will leverage knowledge of data science, methodologies, and processing techniques to perform predictive analytics in the cyber domain. As a cyber domain expert you will leverage knowledge of cyber threat vectors and cyber logging information, and understand Adversarial AI and AI model testing. The candidate will possess knowledge in Applied Mathematics, to include: statistical analysis, and the methods of AI/ML temporal and pattern analysis, correlation of events, predictive probability analysis, regression testing and deep learning. The candidate will employ programming skills including python and Splunk to perform analysis. The candidate will document and visualize data both temporally and spatially, and present data to managers. Ad-hoc informational briefings may also be required to explain methodologies and analytical findings to peers and customer stakeholders. The candidate will also investigate and implement new scientific analysis and methodologies to lead new cyber analytics efforts and stay current with evolving technologies and capabilities. This job can be worked anywhere within the US. Responsibilities Gathers, analyzes, and interprets a wide variety of cyber and network data. Conceive and prepare thorough, well-articulated tactical or strategic data science products (e.g. technical articles, visualizations, graphics, and intellige nc  reports) that summarize the methods and results of cyber analytic solutions. Design range of research projects, cyber data collection and methodologies. Identify, retrieve, manipulate, relate and/or exploit multiple structured data sets from various sources. Conduct analysis of metadata Exploit, fuse and use data and data sources Identify and analyze anomalous data (including metadata) Evaluate research for practical application Design and develop cyber analytics in the context of Adversarial activity Requires a US citizen This role can be worked from anywhere within the United States Qualifications. Experience US citizenship is required Must be able to obtain a Top Secret security clearance Experience in Cyberspace Operations Experience in the analysis of cyber and network data Familiarity of Adversarial AI Familiarity with one or more types of quantitative data analysis. Experience cleaning and manipulating data Experience with predictive modeling Experience with developing and implementing complex algorithms Experience using analysis tools (ie. Python, R, Spark,...) Experience with big data platforms such as Splunk, Elastic, Graylog,... Experience in data science, math, statistics, computer science or a related field Cyber certifications preferred Bachelor Degree and nine (9) years or more of experience; Masters Degree and seven (7) or more of experience; PhD and zero (0) years experience. COVID Policy: Prospective and/or new employees are required to adhere with SAIC's vaccination policy. All SAIC employees must be fully vaccinated and they must submit proof of vaccination on their first day of employment. Prospective or new employees may seek an exemption to the vaccination requirement at Contact Us and must have an approved exemption prior to the start of their employment. Where work is performed strictly at a customer site, customer site vaccination requirements preempt SAIC's vaccination policy. Target salary range: $125,001 $150,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors. name: 408 Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning Engineer
description: Job Description. Riverside Research is seeking an Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning Engineer to support existing contracts to prototype and develop automation solutions to NASIC's most difficult Scientific and Technical Intelligence problems. As a highly valued and sought-after Riverside Research employee, you will be part of a highly skilled and integrated team that analyzes intelligence data to discover opportunities for automated solutions. All Riverside Research opportunities require US citizenship. Job Responsibilities: AI/ML algorithm development for prototype applications in remote sensing: Develop prototype AI/ML algorithms and associated software tools using Python and the Python/TensorFlow API. Train AI/ML models and tune their hyperparameters for a given dataset and algorithm objectives. Visualize hyperparameter optimization spaces with Tensorboard for selection of optimal parameters for a given parametric (functional) TensorFlow model. AI/ML dataset generation, curation, and management: Provide customized solutions to data quality control that ensure accurate functional mappings for AI/ML algorithms on complex remote sensing datasets. Develop databases / data lakes / data warehouses for organizing both structured and unstructured datasets. AI/ML algorithm Rand D: Apply machine learning and general computer vision best practices and methods to analyze and exploit large, complex remote sensing datasets from a variety of remote sensing phenomenology. Keep up with the SoTA practices for AI/ML, perform relevant Rand D, and implement new and innovative ideas in machine learning and high-performance computing to solve long-standing remote sensing "big-data" exploitation problems. Software development, documentation, and coding best practices: Contribute and adhere to the AI team's standards for reviewing and unit-testing code, lead or participate in team-wide code reviews, and adhere to standardized documentation practices. Utilize Python PEP8 standards. Required Qualifications: US Citizen able to obtain and maintain a clearance (up to a TS/SCI minimum). Bachelor's Degree in either Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or related field of study. Must demonstrate proficiency in Python-based end-to-end AI/ML model development lifecycle using a recent deep learning platform (TensorFlow preferred). Awareness of version control, branches, merge conflict resolution, and git in general. Proficient in collaborative Office5 tools such as MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Ability to work closely with subject-matter experts to develop tools, algorithms, and datasets needed for developing relevant and useful AI/ML prototype algorithms. Self-driven, strong analytic, inferencing, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving skills. Communicates highly technical results and methods clearly and succinctly. Desired Qualifications: Advanced degree (MS/PhD) in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, a Physical Science or Engineering is strongly desired. Active Secret Security Clearance. Experience with DoD intelligence production processes and workflows. years operational experience in radar signal processing analysis, overhead imagery analysis, orbital mechanics, and/or electronic warfare data analysis. years experience using data visualization tools and libraries in Python. Visualizations/Web Development Skills (e.g., Tableau, MEAN stack MongoDB, ExpressJS, AngularJS, NodeJS). Experience with large (1 GB +)  image data and formats such as HDF5, JSON, GEOTIFF, TFRecords, etc. Experience in development of distributed, web-based systems, service-oriented architectures, front-end user interfaces, and back-end databases are a plus. Experience with interpretability of deep learning computer vision models including visualization and reasoning about model latent spaces and activation maps to assess model effectiveness / weaknesses. Familiarity in differences of supervised learning vs. unsupervised learning techniques. Riverside Research strives to be one of America's premier provid rs of independent, trusted technical and scientific expertise. We continue to add experienced and technically astute staff who are highly motivated to help our DoD and Intelligence Community (IC) customers deliver world class programs. As a not-for-profit, technology-oriented defense company, we believe service to customers and support of our staff is our mission. Our goal is to serve as a destination company by providing an industry-leading, positive, and rewarding employee experience for all who join us. We aspire to be a valued partner to our customers and to earn their trust through our unwavering commitment to achieve timely, innovative, cost-effective and mission-focused solutions. Riverside Research remains committed to the safety of our employees and customers. Under Executive Order042, effective January22, all Riverside Research employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Fully vaccinated means at least two weeks after the final shot in the required timing and dosage. Riverside Research will grant reasonable accommodation to those where a medical or religious exemption has been approved by the company. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated by January22, unless an approved accommodation has been granted by Riverside Research. All new hires starting after January22 must be fully vaccinated by their start date. All positions at Riverside Research are subject to background investigations. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a background investigation including criminal history and identity check. Our EEO Policy Riverside Research is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate and promote without regard to race, religion, sex, color, national origin, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, disability/veteran, status as a protected veteran, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state and local law. If you need assistance at any time in our application or interview process, please contact Human Resources at7-427-7074 or email HR@RiversideResearch.org. A member of the HR team will be available to assist. This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of CFR-741 .5(a). This regulation prohibits discrimination against qualified individuals on the basis of disability and requires affirmative action by covered prime contractors and subcontractors to employ and advance in employment qualified individuals with disabilities. This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of CFR-300.5(a). This regulation prohibits discrimination against qualified protected veterans and requires affirmative action by covered contractors and subcontractors to employ and advance in employment qualified protected veterans. For more information on "EEO is the Law," please visit: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf.

name: Sr. Machine Learning Artificial Intelligence Software Engineer
description: Job Description. We are unable to sponsor for this permanent full-time role. Position is bonus eligible. Prestigious Fortune0 Company is currently seeking a Sr. Machine Learning Artificial Intelligence Software Engineer. Candidate will be responsible for multiple major technical aspects and forward engineering in the field of machine learning, information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, and ontology engineering technologies. Candidate will be responsible for researching, designing, and building various scales and complexity systems by implementing supervised and unsupervised machine-learning techniques. This individual will apply technologies and methodologies associated with machine learning, information retrieval, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, and/or ontology engineering technologies. Responsibilities: Lead Applied Machine Learning software engineering technical competency. Identify, research and realize key machine learning technical capabilities in the industry. Lead design and build mid to high complexity machine learning systems. building data pipelines in getting the data required to build and evaluate ML models. Leverage continuous integration and continuous deployment best practices, including test automation and monitoring, to ensure successful deployment of ML models and application code. Collaborate as part of a cross-functional Agile team to create and enhance software that enables state-of-the-art, next generation big data and machine learning applications. Apply applicable policies and standards while working toward specific objective. Independently directs implementation of new initiatives for machine learning technology solutions. Senior Machine Learning Engineer role This is a senior Individual Contributor role not a manager. Qualifications: Bachelorâ€™s Degree (MS+ is preferred) in Computer Science/Engineering or a related quantitative discipline. Minimum of years full time hands-on software engineering experience. Minimum of5 years full time hands-on machine learning or artificial intelligence software engineering experience. years of experience with programming languages such as Python, Java. Experience in deploying machine learning models in microservice architecture on a cloud environment. Experience in building models for deep learning, speech recognition and natural language processing systems. Experience using frameworks for machine learning and data science like scikit-learn, keras, pandas, numpy, XGBoost, TensorFlow, pytorch. Experience of software delivery practices including Git and CI/CD tools.

name: Artificial Intelligence Co-op / Intern
description: Job Description. We are looking for an experienced technical contributor to join development of cutting-edge artificial intelligence applications for manufacturing applications. You will build prototypes and explore conceptually new solutions in a fast-paced environment. You will be at the heart of a growing and exciting focus area for Stanley Industrial and work with variety of its business units (including automotive, infrastructure, inventory management and tools) to apply artificial intelligence techniques to our most difficult problems with global impact. Job Responsibilities. Utilize Artificial Intelligence(AI), signal processing and big data analysis methods to work within cross-functional teams to engage the internal clients and broader customer base. Understanding and formalizing clients' most complex business challenges, architecting a solution that delivers a measurable outcome, testing the solution, and implementing the transformation. Apply extensive domain expertise to develop multiple insights and theories for complex problems in the Industrial, Manufacturing. Contribute to the development of strategies for deploying AI techniques into existing business, development of road map and requirements analysis considering both AI and business potential analysis. Develop new concepts and experiments for variety of these ideas, translate these ideas into executable action plans, and communicate these plans to a diverse client base. Basic. Required: MS or PhD students in computer science, electrical engineering, physics, statistics, applied mathematics, data science or related field. years of experience in one or more data analysis, machine learning, big data analysis, signal processing or related areas including graduate/advanced studies on the topics. Deep understanding of machine learning, working knowledge of cloud services and HPC and embedded AI. Confident in development of quantitative models for probabilistic problems in engineering systems (reliability data, noisy sensor measurements, maintenance data). Ability to communicate effectively with internal clients or other quantitative analysts and programmers using expertise in hardware or software technologies. Existing publications in related fields or referral from research teams about individual contributions to ongoing research. Understanding of cutting-edge research around deep learning and signal processing, unsupervised and active learning. Appreciation for startup culture around fast prototyping. Preferred Qualifications. Capable of handling, managing and reporting on multiple projects in parallel. Capable of training, coaching commercial product managers, data scientist and software engineers around cutting edge research topics. Capable of creating original ideas and implementing prototypes to test these ideas in a very short time. Excellent communication skills and critical thinking. About Us. Stanley Black and Decker Digital mission is to infuse digital into the DNA of the company. The focus is on rapid development and deployment of cutting-edge technologies, analysis and software into our products and business processes to change the way we win, serve and retain customers. Stanley Black and Decker, an Sand P0 company, is a diversified global provider of hand tools, power tools and related accessories, mechanical access solutions and electronics security solutions, healthcare solutions, engineered fastening systems, and more. Learn more at www.StanleyBlackandDecker.com. Stanley Black and Dec ker is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer supporting diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants to Stanley Black and Decker will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.

name: Data Scientist (AWS Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence SME)
description: Job Description. Data Scientist (AWS Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence SME) Position Description CGI Federal is seeking a Data Scientist with AWS machine learning and artificial intelligence expertise. The candidate will have expertise in AWS Sage Maker suite of services and other AWS supporting services. The Data Scientist will work with our CTO team within the office of the CTO of a large government agency. We are seeking a strong SME that is able to apply ML/AI AWS capabilities to address complex use cases that are identified by the CTO and other business leads. Your future duties and responsibilities. Data Science responsibilities including providing expertise and guidance of the application of AWS Sage Maker suite of services and related services. Labeling data and/or confirming labeled data for use in ML processes. The application of AWS Translate to provide translation services, leveraging localization options and customizations for the agencies context. Also provide text analytics expertise related to translation services. Apply classification and regression concepts to model development for data analysis. Provide guidance of the integration of APIs with applications and Service Design/Service Delivery Strategy support. Apply appropriate supervised ML algorithms, e.g., XGBoost, Linear, ne arest neighbor to model functions, relationships and dependencies. Apply appropriate unsupervised ML algorithms, e.g., K-Means, Random Cut  Forest depending on the use case and input data. Apply Agent or Markov reinforcement algorithms depending on use case and data. Apply Natural Language Processing (NLP) algorithms, e.g., Seq2Seq, to perform tr anslation and other applications. Includes machine translation, modeling hyper parameters Required qualifications to be successful in this role. Programming: Python, SQL.. Software: AWS AI/ML Services. Experience selecting models, training models and executing models to achieve desired results. Clustering/Segmentation (including K means and other ML methods).. Tree-based models, Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Time Series Modeling, T-tests.. Experience in interpreting results from statistical and mathematical models.. Experience in endpoint rendering, machine learning, and predictive modeling. Desired qualifications:. Statistical modeling experience with strong team leadership and communication skills. Programming: Python. Software: Jupyter Notebooks and AWS ML algorithms and services. Federal security credentials Education:. Master's degree and years of experience OR Bachelor's degree and+ years of experience #CGIFederalJob #DICE Build your career with us. It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change-supporting our clients' digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities. At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create. Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world. Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com. No unsolicited agency referrals please. CGI is  an  equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics. CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. name: Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence Software Engineer
description: Job Description. A diversified ocean engineering company is looking for a Machine Learning/AI Software Engineer to come join there growing team! This Jobot Job is hosted by: Julie Massey Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume. Salary: $100,000 $130,000 per year A bit about us: A diversified ocean engineering company is looking for a Machine Learning/AI Software Engineer to come join there growing team! The company has developed a broad spectrum of engineering expertise and provides services in research and development, design, construction engineering support, construction management, testing, and systems analysis, cable lay planning, analysis and support and other diverse operations in the marine field. Why join us? This company has developed a unique and powerful culture where creativity, intelligence, hard work, and independence are celebrated. These values are tempered with respect, humility, flexibility, and an open, cooperative demeanor. Their engineers truly love working here and they feel as though they are part of a carefully selected team of only the very best engineers. We have about employees, with engineers who hold advanced degrees and experience in mechanical or civil engineering, computer science, physical oceanography, physics, and chemistry. We are seeking engineers who want to be the best at what they do. Here you will have the opportunity to make significant contributions that advance the state-of-the-art of your profession. Job Details The company is looking for a Machine Learning / Artificial Intelligence (ML/ AI) Software Engineer with a strong background in ML/AI algorithm development and utilization. Candidates should have interest and experience in solving real world problems via ML/ AI software development. This candidate will have the opportunity to shape the future of the world's #1 subsea cable modeling software, as well as take on challenging problems in our subsea technologies group that may include processing of large datasets, machine vision, object identification, classification, tracking, autonomation, and more. The chosen candidate will immediately start working on Navy and DARPA projects with ML components. Candidates should be self-starters with the ability to take a project from inception to usable software prototype or product. The candidates should have strong programming skills to perform in-house development of ML/ AI software algorithms, and be able to use existing ML/ AI algorithm databases. This is a permanent, full-time position in Waimanalo, Hawaii. Remote work will be considered for this position. Develop and apply ML/ AI algorithms for marine systems. Interface AI/ ML algorithms with in-house,d party, and Government systems. Write, edit and review Technical Reports and test results in clear, concise language. Provide input to technical proposals seeking future research and development funding. Possession of a technical degree (B.S. or M.S.) in any engineering or related  ield is required. Candidates with an M.S. degree shall haveyears' professional ex erience, and candidates with a B.S. shall haveyears' professional experience a  a software engineer or data scientist working with ML/AI algorithms. Strong computer programming skills in Python, .NET, or C. Ability to learn other computer programming skills. Ability to communicate concepts to team members or clients. Willingness and ability to obtain a Department of Defense Security Clearance; persons with clearances that are active or were previously held and currently in good standing are preferred. Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

name: Artificial intelligence/ Machine learning engineer
description: Job Description. AI/ML Software Engineer (Mid). Newton, MA. No visas please. No remote. SUMMARY. The Artificial Intelligence Engineer is responsible for understanding our medical imaging business problems, identifying/applying the right AI or cognitive computing technologies. Our AI chatbot is designed to enable direct interaction with our PACS system through voice commands allowing providers to seamlessly review relevant patient data, create study comparisons and more. This is an in-office based position in Newton, MA, and requires someone who is excited to be involved in a fast paced and exciting environment with growth potential. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Develops required machine learning models or prototype applications, applying formulated AI recipes and verifying the problem/solution fit. Understands the challenges in medical imaging and using state of the art solutions in AI and DL. Participates in building new experiences, improves existing products, ensures quality assurance test designs and contributes to test systems architecture discussions. Works alongside leading innovators in the field of deep learning and health care, plays a critical role in algorithm development. Analyzes and evaluates data and builds deep networks to detect or predict features, while effectively balancing quality, availability, timeliness and cost factors. QUALIFICATIONS, EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE.3 years of AI/ML experience with a degree in quantitative field like Computer Science, data science, Engineering or related field required, with significant focus on deep learning. BA/BS degree in computer science or related discipline is required, MS degree is preferred. Good command of the English language required (spoken and written). REQUIRED SKILLS. Strong background in machine learning and parallel processing pipelines, with significant experience in image processing. Experience in working with large datasets and relational databases (SQL). Experience with deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow, Caffe, Torch, Theano; projects on computer vision are a strong plus. Intuitive sense of how to architect high performance distributed computing systems for machine learning and tie them to business problems.

name: Artificial Intelligence Business Analyst (Hybrid Locations)
description: Job Description. Swoon is seeking a Business Analyst focused on Artificial Intelligence for our leading client! This is a month contract with benefits (medical/dental/vision insurance) and likely extension. This position will split time between our Innovation Center in Romeoville, IL and our headquarters in Chicago, IL.We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst with hands-on experience to partner with our technical and business teams to design, implement, and deploy technically sound Drive-Thru solutions as part of Drive Thru Product Engineering team. This role will specifically focus on the Enhanced Vehicle Detection (EVD) solution and exploration of potential future computer vision use cases, working with a cross-functional team spanning technologies and product functional areas. Responsibilities: Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of the needs of the business from the business and technical perspective, translating that understanding when refining requirements and defining solutions for the Enhanced Vehicle Detection (EVD) solution. Lead discovery (spike), requirements gathering, and refinement agile ceremonies. Lead and participate in project meetings to ensure understanding of requirements, timing, and resource requirements. Identify integration, cross-team alignment, and improvement opportunities. Participate in other agile ceremonies and cross-functional program sessions to ensure understanding of requirements, timing, and resource requirements. Maintain detailed knowledge of the key business processes and systems and identify integration, alignment, and improvement opportunities. Effectively analyze and prioritize high impact solution improvement opportunities in partnership with EVD customers and internal stakeholders. Develop and maintain productive partnerships across technical and business teams to align on cross-product opportunities, prioritization, and requirements. Partner with EVD Product Engineering Manager to author and create supporting requirements, technical objectives, and solution approaches for EVD features. Partner with EVD Product Engineering Manager to author and decompose features into Epics and stories, including granular details for acceptance criteria. Support EVD development team day to day by providing functional clarifications and answering any questions related to acceptance criteria. Perform analysis, design, test plan creation, build and execution of test scenarios/scripts, as well as participate in validation and testing activities. Author acceptance criteria for each story so it is easily transferrable to story validation (and ultimately folded into automated regression tests). Design and execute UAT for each release. Assist with product support issues when necessary. Provide business process and technical direction to the support team when needed. Assist with data analysis and cross-functional RCA activities when needed. Partner closely with the Support / SRE team on cross-team collaboration, training and knowledgebase documentation opportunities. Work with onsite and remote development teams, coordinating with both internal and third-party vendor development teams. Assist in troubleshooting in-store canary deployments and operational tests, with focus on system integration and data integrity, providing input to triage activities and subsequent issue prioritization. Build and execute experiments to validate, optimize, and prioritize features; design tests to validate technology solutions in support of business use cases and provide input to business cases. Required Qualifications: years of technology experience writing technical product requirements. years as a business analyst/business technical analyst or equivalent role. Working knowledge of Agile Methodology and experience driving technical requirements ceremonies and processes. A deep understanding of the software development life cycle (SDLC). Technical integration and data-driven (metrics/telemetry) decisioning experience. General understanding of XML, JSON, Python, and API service layers. Experience with customer-facing technology systems. Retail or Hospitality technology experience. Proficient in Microsoft Office suite, specifically Word, Excel, PowerPoint. Proficient in process flow and decision tree diagramming. Experience with Agile/Scrum management tools, i.e. JIRA, Confluence. Proven ability to understand, configure, and dissect co mplex technical solutions. A passion for innovation and leveraging new technology to solve complex business and technical problems. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, as well as demonstrated ability to prioritize, problem solve and build productive working relationships across functional and technical areas. Curious, detail-oriented, and a self-starter with a proven track record of "getting things done. Desired Skills: Experience with Artificial Intelligence (AI), deep learning, computer vision a plus. Experience with AWS, cloud applications, edge computing a plus. Experience with hardware, i.e. small form factor computers and cameras, a plus. Experience with JIRA Align a plus. In -s ore technology experience a plus. #dcejobs Id:852.

Breadth of skills and experience in Machine learning (diverse types of data and sources, different types of learning models, diverse learning settings) Ability and inclination to work in multi-disciplinary environments, and a passion for ideas realized in practice Strong analytical, written, and verbal communication skills.

name: Artificial Intelligence Architect, Manager
description: Job Description. Limited immigration sponsorship may be available. Work you'll do At Deloitte you will manage and deliver components of client engagements that identify, design, and implement technology and creative business solutions for large companies. Key responsibilities will include: Architect, position, design, develop and deploy enterprise solutions which include components across the Artificial Intelligence spectrum such as Chatbots, Virtual Assistants, Machine Learning, and Cognitive Services. Manage teams in the identification of business requirements, functional design, process design (including scenario design, flow mapping), prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures. Formulate planning, budgeting, forecasting and reporting strategies. Manage full life cycle implementations. Develop statements of work and/or client proposals. Identify business opportunities to increase usability and profitability of information architecture. Experience with program leadership, governance and change enablement. Develop and manage vendor relationships. Lead workshops for client education. Manage resources and budget on client projects. Assist and drive the team by providing oversight. The team Analytics and Cognitive. In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment. The Analytics and Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Together with the Strategy practice, our Strategy and Analytics portfolio helps clients transform their business by architecting enterprise programs and differentiated strategies to win in their chosen markets. The Analyticsand Cognitive team works with our clients to: Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance and the integration of structured and unstructured data to generate insights leveraging cloud-based as well as client-owned platforms. Deploy automation and cognitive and science-based techniques to manage data, predict scenarios and prescribe actions. Drive operational efficiency by maintaining their data ecosystems, sourcing analytics expertise and providing As-a-Service offerings for continuous insights and improvements. Qualifications: years of relevant work experience. years of experience leading and managing project teams. Travel up to% of the time (While% travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.). Preferred: years of consulting experience on AI projects. Experience architecting, designing, developing and deploying enterprise solutions, based on client or business vision, which include components across the Artificial Intelligence spectrum such as Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning and Data Science. Experience in Hadoop, Spark, Storm or related paradigms and associated languages such as Pig, Hive, Mahout, plus advanced skills in Java/C++, R, Python, etc. Experienced programming knowledge in both SAS and SQL, Operating system experience with UNIX and relational database knowledge such as ORACLE/TERADATA. SAS/Base, SAS/Stat, SAS/Macro preferred. Demonstrated expertise in at least one of the following: machine learning, deep learning, time-series modeling, propensity and prediction, behavioral nudges, recommenders, anomaly detection, segmentation, AI architecture, AI interface design. Experience with quantitative modeling (design, development and implementation) using types of algorithm (e.g., Decision Trees, Naive Bayes Classification, Ordinary Least Squares Regression , Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, Ensemble Methods, Clustering Algorithms, Principal Component Analysis, Singular Value Decomposition, Independent Component Analysis). In-depth theoretical and practical knowledge in a few select areas from across the AI spectrum. Bachelor's Degree preferably in applied mathematics, statistics, computer science, data science, electrical engineering, physics, or closely related field. Formal training in one or many of the following: signal processing, optimization, machine learning, linear algebra. Expertise in at least one functional application preferred (e.g., prediction models, behavioral analytics, etc.). years' experience working with Mi crosoft Cognitive Services, IBM Watson, IPSoft, Pega, Salesforce Einstein, Google Cloud Platform/Tensor Flow, or Amazon Web Services/Sagemaker, MS LUIS Chat, MS Azure Cognitive/ML. Expertise in domains preferred (e.g., Customer and Marketing, Finance, Mand A, Operations, Pricing, Risk, Supply Chain, Workfor ce, etc.). Example of expertise includes: Supply Chain: Knowledge of operations, manufacturing, quality or operations strategy for pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device organizations. Payments: Experience with use cases such as fraud detection, cashierless stores, hyper-personalized credit scores, enhanced customer service, etc. Customer: Experience with use cases such as reduce customer churn, accurately price products / services, increase up-sell / cross-sell, reduce service Center call times, etc. HR: Experience with use cases such as improve workforce / role matching, workforce optimization, increase learning effectiveness, align total rewards by employee type, etc. IT: Experience with use cases such as optimize infrastructure use, optimize system / application performance, reduce IT security breaches, etc. Risk: Experience with use cases such as improve safety/standards compliance, improve fraud detection, improve regulatory compliance. Operations: Experience with use cases such as eliminate underperforming SKUs, optimize fleet size and logistics, optimize inventory management. Strong experience running pursuits. Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a concise and actionable manner. Ability to work independently, manage small engagements or parts of large engagements. Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint) (US Practitioners). Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment. An advanced degree in the area of specialization is preferred. Aand CConsulting21.

name: Artificial Intelligence /NLP Developer #Contract /Fulltime
description: Job Description. Artificial Intelligence /NLP Developer. Alpharetta, GA.+Months or Fulltime. This position will help with development of virtual assistant using natural language processing and artificial intelligence systems. You will work with multi-functional engineering, Knowledge Management, project management and QA teams. You help build product and identify quality issues and deliver an outstanding Chatbot experience. Required Skills: Proven experience in working with NLP, AI , Chatbot systems. Expert in Python, SQL, Javascipt, knowledge of SQL is plus.+ years of experience in designing and maintaining a UX, middle tier and API integration. years of experience to work with and manage offshore and onshore teams on multiple projects/tasks as needed. Proven python coding skills to move and transform data from multiple sources to a data store/warehouse Good to have statistics knowledge, such as hypothesis testing, experimental design and sample size determination Excellent presentation skills, distilling complex analysis and concepts into concise business-focused takeaways for leadership and peers Creativity to engineer novel features and signals, and to push beyond current tools and approaches. Desired Skills:5 years of experience within the financial services industry. Experience of DevOps process. Experience of working in Agile setup.

name: Fulltime///Staff Artificial Intelligence Machine Learning Engineer
description: Job Description. The essential requirements of the job include: Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. statistics, s ta istical genetics, imaging science, computational biology, computer science, applied mathematics, applied physics or similar) or equivalent practical experience.years or more experience. Experience developing, training, evaluating, (and perhaps deploying) deep-learning models using popular machine learning frameworks such as PyTorch. and TensorFlow. / Keras. A firm understanding of deep neural network architectures such as CNNs. and GANs. Experience applying deep learning and computer vision techniques for image preprocessing, classification, object detection, segmentation, and feature extraction. Experience developing, training, and evaluating tradition machine algorithms such as PCA, SVM, Random Forests, and Gradient Boosting. Well-versed in current deep learning literature and neural network optimization techniques such as batch norm, pruning, model quantization, residual/skip connections, inception modules, F1 and FID metrics etc. Familiar with NVIDIA deep learning ecosystem including CUDA, GPU compute as well as Jetson Nano and Quadro GPU hardware. Technical writing of design documents. It would be a plus if you also possess: Experience working with Docker containers and cloud-based compute environments; other tools: Git, Microsoft Azure, AWS. Experience in hematology domain.

name: Sr. Developer w/ BOTS, Automation, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Developer
description: Job Description. Software Guidance and Assistance, Inc., (SGA), is searching for an Sr. Developer w/ BOTS, Automation, Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Developer. for a CONTRACT. assignment with one of our premier Financial. clients in Irving, TX. True Contract to Hire An initial.+ months contract to hire (could convert at earlier ) Senior Developer with strong Automation, Bots, and AI/ML Not Looking for a DevOps Developer/EngineerLooking for a Developer with some scripting (any) skills Need to have some exposure to automation like conversational or other BOTS, (also any AI/ML would be of interest). Looking for a minimum ofyear experience, ideally in automation. Contract To Hire and unable to sponsor at this time. No C2C through an employer, agency, or third-party firm Responsibilities: Identify opportunities for automation through data analysis. Categorize and prioritize opportunities through value-add lens. Identify opportunities through predictive analytics. Optimize and Improve application support reliability through automation. Reduce repetitive tasks and support activities and re-engineer support process where needed. Deliver support service using automated tools. Required. Skills: years software development experience. years hands-on experience with Linux and Windows (shell / batch scripting and server management), Java, .Net, LDAP, Active Directory, Oracle / SQL Server database (SQL, backup and recovery). year of exposure to AI/ML, NLP ( Natural Language Processing ) is a plus. year of exposure to kore.ai or other automated conversational technologies. Experience with conversational and other BOTS. Enjoys han ds-on programming / scripting work. Strong understanding of various automation tools / solutions used in production support organization. Exposure to cloud based technologies and frameworks. Working to deep knowledge of financial products and financial industry experience. Excellent problem solving skills, including the ability to grasp new concepts quickly, lead diverse partners toward reasonable recommendations, and prepare decisions in a logical fashion with supporting impact, to aid in timely decision making. Must be a self-starter, effective listener, problem solver and team player. Excellent written and verbal communication skills; must be able to understand detailed problem resolution discussions and condense pertinent facts for senior leadership. SGA is a technology and resource solutions provider driven to stand out. We are a women-owned business. Our mission: to solve big IT problems with a more personal, boutique approach. Each year, we match consultants like you to more than000 engagements. When we say let's work better together, we mean it. You'll join a diverse team built on these core values: customer service, employee development, and quality and integrity in everything we do. Be yourself, love what you do and find your passion at work. Please find us at https://sgainc.com. EEO Employer: Race, Color, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, Religion, National Origin, Disability, Veteran Status, A ge, Marital Status, Pregnancy, Genetic Information, or Other Legally Protected Status.

name: Technical Program Manager (AI/Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence exp.) || Austin, TX/MTV, CA!
description: Job Description. Technical Program Manager. Austin, TX/MTV, CA. Become a subject matter expert (SME) on Doc AI products and solutions for Google's sales and technical teams, including both technical and market aspects. Evangelize Doc AI best practices to customers, sales people, and engineers to improve the design and integration of their solutions. Manage "Office Hours" Program for Doc AI including but not limited to, helping to answer technical and market questions, documenting and quantifying key gaps in products and technical assets, sending out a monthly newsletter with consolidated information for relevant stakeholders, etc. Compile, track and respond to quality issues, features, bugs, call outs by sales teams; working directly with PMs, TLs, engineers, and customers to surface information. Have visibility into support mail threads, support chat rooms. Escalate as needed. Be an execution partner internally, coordinating with engineers, PMs, TPM to understand the product capabilities, roadmaps and communicate effectively with external pilot customers. Generate internal reports on issues, risks and overall status. Manage our Doc AI Explorer's program (internalmany support channel), create incentives for engagement. Job Requirements: Excellent and empathetic communication skills. Practical experience in software engineering, a related technical field, or a BA/BS degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science, or UX. Good enough skills in HTTP, TCP/IP, REST/RPC, JavaScript, a backend technology such as NodeJS to implement something like a small website by hand and debug issues. Ability to collaborate effectively over video conferencing. You must be comfortable being on video during most meetings due to the highly collaborative nature of the job. Experience in document processing or records management (preferred if experience is with procurement or lending document process or records management). Experience in FinServ (preferred not required). Experience working with Cloud or Google Cloud services.

name: Data Science Architect Manager
description: Job Description. Data Science Architect/Manager-Artificial Intelligence Limited immigration sponsorship may be available. Work you'll do At Deloitte you will manage and deliver components of client engagements that identify, design, and implement technology and creative business solutions for large companies. Key responsibilities will include: Architect, position, design, develop and deploy enterprise solutions which include components across the Artificial Intelligence spectrum such as Chatbots, Virtual Assistants, Machine Learning, Computer Vision and Cognitive Services. Manage teams in the identification of business requirements, functional design, process design (including scenario design, flow mapping), prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures. Formulate planning, budgeting, forecasting, and reporting strategies. Manage full life cycle implementations. Develop statements of work and/or client proposals. Identify business opportunities to increase usability and profitability of information architecture. Experience with program leadership, governance and change enablement. Develop and manage vendor relationships. Lead workshops for client education. Manage resources and budget on client projects. Assist and drive the team by providing oversight. Leverage automation, cognitive and science-based techniques to manage data, predict scenarios and prescribe actions. Drive operational efficiency by maintaining their data ecosystems, sourcing analytics expertise, and providing As-a-Service offerings for continuous insights and improvements. Qualifications: years of relevant work experience. years of experience leading and managing project teams. At leastyears of experience working with quantitative modeling (design, development and implementation) using types of algorithm (e.g., Decision Trees, Naive Bayes Classificatio n, Ordinary Least Squares Regression, Logistic Regression, Support Vector Machines, Ensemble Methods, Clustering Algorithms, Principal Component Analysis, Singular Value Decomposition, Independent Component Analysis). years of experience using statistical computer languages (Python, SQL, R, SAS, etc.) to prepare data for analysis, visualize data as part of exploratory analysis, generate features, and other similar data science driven data handling. Demonstrated expertise with one full life cycle analytics engagement across strategy, design, and implementation. Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Empirical Statistics, oryears equivalent professional experience. Travel up to% of the time (Monday Thursday/Friday). (While% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.). Preferred: Experience architecting, designing, developing, and deploying enterprise solutions which include components across the Artificial Intelligence spectrum such as NLP, Chatbots, Virtual Assistants, Computer Vision, and Cognitive Services. Demonstrated expertise in at least one of the following: machine learning, deep learning, time-series modeling, propensity and prediction, behavioral nudges, recommenders, anomaly detection, segmentation, AI architecture, AI interface design. Formal training in one or many of the following: signal processing, optimization, machine learning, linear algebra. Expertise in at least one functional application preferred (e.g., prediction models, behavioral analytics, etc.). Expertise  in Python machine and deep learning frameworks and libraries, e.g. PyTorch, Keras, Tensorflow, Scikit-learn, Numpy, SciPy. Ex perience designing and implementing Apache Open Source (Kafka, Storm, Spark) frameworks to process end to end data management life cycle. Experience with Cloud services and ML tools e.g. (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure). Familiarity with Scal a, Java, C++, or other similar technological support languages. Javascript experience at User Interface (UI) level. Expertise in domains preferred (e.g., Customer and Marketing, Finance, Mand A, Operations, Pricing , Risk, Supply Chain, Workforce, etc.). Example of expertise includes: Supply Chain: Knowledge of operations, manufacturing, quality, or operations strategy for pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device organizations Payments: Experience with use cases such as fraud detection, cashier-less stores, hyper-personalized credit scores, enhanced customer service, etc. Customer: Experience with use cases such as reduce customer churn, accurately price products / services, increase up-sell / cross-sell, reduce service center call times, etc. HR: Experience with use cases such as improve workforce / role matching, workforce optimization, increase learning effectiveness, align total rewards by employee type, etc. IT: Experience with use cases such as optimize infrastructure use, optimize system / application performance, reduce IT security breaches, etc. Risk: Experience with use cases such as improve safety/standards compliance, improve fraud detection, improve regulatory compliance Operations: Experience with use cases such as eliminate underperforming SKUs, optimize fleet size and logistics, optimize inventory management Strong experience running pursuits. Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a concise and actionable manner. Ability to work independently, manage small engagements or parts of large engagements. Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills (MS Visio, MS PowerPoint) (US Practitioners). Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgement. An advanced degree in the area of specialization is preferred. ANCAAI.
