name: Full Stack Developer for Next Gen Portfolio Management Platform
description: Job Description. Description About this role. Are you interested in building innovative technology that shapes the financial markets? Do you like working at the speed of a startup, and tackling some of the world's most interesting challenges? Do you want to work with, and learn from, hands-on leaders and experts in technology and finance? At BlackRock we are looking for Software Engineers who like to innovate and solve complex problems. We recognize that strength comes from diversity and will embrace your unique skills, curiosity and passion while giving you the opportunity to grow technically and as an individual. The Aladdin platform that we build is used by BlackRock investors and we also sell this to over0 global financial clients. It is used to invest, protect and manage over $10 trillion (USD). We have an extraordinary responsibility to our clients all over the world, and a complete focus on high quality product development. Our technology empowers millions of investors to save for retirement, pay for education, buy a home and improve their financial well-being. With our focus on sustainability and ESG in the investment process, Aladdin is also increasingly used to help investors build climate-aware sustainable portfolios. Being a technologist at BlackRock means you get the best of both worlds: working for one of the most advanced financial companies and being part of a FinTech software development team who build great products using next generation technology and solutions. You are: Passionate about technology with personal ownership for the work you do. Curious and eager to learn new things, and willing to challenge the status quo. Love working within a successful team, learning from and helping others. Willing to embrace work outside of your comfort zone, and push boundaries. Data and quality focused, with an eye for the details that make great solutions. You sometimes make mistakes, but always learn from them. We are: Passionate about building high quality scalable software to meet the needs of tomorrow. Delivering solutions for both BlackRock investment users and over0 global financial firms. Building a greenfield platform that will provide streamlined user workflows and scalable investment process automation. Automating the investment process using Algorithms, Optimization, APIs, Microservices and distributed computing backed by an intuitive exception-based UX. Building working, testable software every day, enabled by a scaled agile process and tools. A team who loves to innovate and continuously deliver value to our users through technology. The position is in the Portfolio Management Engineering team in Aladdin. This team is building a greenfield project to transform a mature PM tool set into an integrated persona-based platform with streamlined user workflows and a high degree of automation at scale. This is enabled by investment algorithms, optimization, APIs microservices, distributed computing technology and an exception-based UX. The team works closely with BlackRock portfolio managers as well as helping deliver this to external clients. They also partner closely with world class Product Managers, UX designers, Quality Assurance Engineers and Client Support teams to deliver high quality, scalable and resilient PM capabilities within the Aladdin platform The team is looking for an ambitious hands-on software developer to work on this exciting strategic product and upgrade the Aladdin Platform. As a key member of our engineering team, you will be encouraged and empowered to bring your ideas forward to help shape our technology, process and solutions. This will help you become a respected and successful player in our diverse team. This position will also give you opportunities to learn and master some of the best technologies such as Angular, Kafka, Ignite, APIs, gRPC, Protobufs, Spring, Azure DevOps, Node.JS, Cassandra and more. You will also learn about the financial industry and the exciting world of investing and portfolio management. Responsibilities include: Develop and maintain investment functionality used by portfolio managers. Help design and build the next generation of the world's best investment platform. Contribute to an agile development team working with designers, analysts, users and leads. Apply quality software engineering practices through all phases of development. Collaborate with team members in a multi-office, multi-country environment. Ensure resilience and stability through quality code reviews, unit, regression and user acceptance testing, DevOps and level two production support. Being a great teammate, helping and respecting others, continually improving our skills, product and agile process. Partner with client support staff to help ensure our tools are reliable and easy to use. Skills and Experience: A proven foundation in core Java and related technologies, with OO skills and design patterns. Track record building high quality software with design-focused and test-driven approaches. Exposure to Front-end development exposure, ideally with Angular and TypeScript. Exposure to high scale distributed technology like Kafka, Mongo, Ignite, Redis. Exposure to building microservices and APIs ideally with REST, Kafka or gRPC. Great analytical, problem-solving and communication skills. Some experience or a real interest in finance, investment or portfolio management processes, and an ability to translate business problems into technical solutions. For VP candidates: experience leading dev teams, projects or being responsible for the design and technical quality of a significant application, system or component. Ability to form positive relationships with partnering teams, sponsors and user groups Nice to have and opportunities to learn: Experience working in an agile development team or on open-source development projects. Experience with optimization, algorithms or related quantitative processes. Experience with relational databases, SQL and Cassandra. Experience with Cloud platforms like Microsoft Azure, AWS, Google Cloud. Experience with DevOps and tools like Azure DevOps. A degree, certifications or opensource track record that shows you have a mastery of software engineering principles. Our benefits. To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about. About BlackRock. At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children's educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress. This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment the one we make in our employees. It's why we're dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit careers.blackrock.com. | www.blackrock.com/corporate. | Inst agram: @bl ackrock. | T witter: @b lackrock. | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock. BlackRock is proud to be  an Equal  Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law. BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

name: Lead Full Stack Developer
description: Job Description. This role is remote, based in the following areas: Denver, New York, or Cincinnati. As pandemic restrictions ease, there will be regular in-person collaboration on a flexible cadence. We're seeking a Lead Full Stack Engineer to join our growing team and help us build out a suite of new software products to improve the user experience of healthcare professional job seekers as well as internal users. You'll be leading a small team of developers at a project level. We expect you to work with your team to give feedback on product designs, break down requirements into tasks/stories, and be able to architect well-tested code solutions to meet product requirements. As Lead Full Stack Engineer, you'll lead the team and make decisions around tech stack, third-party library choices, software architecture, testing strategies, and more! And you're a hands-on coder who leverages your previous experience to lead projects and offer advice and reviews on architecture, design, and implementation. Our current front-end tech stack is Typescript and React and our backend tech stack is Python and Flask, but we always like to make sure we are using the right tools for the job we already see ourselves writing some backend services in Node.JS in the future. Some of the things you'll do: Providing technical leadership, code reviews, and mentoring to fellow engineers. Architecting solutions, building features, creating tools, maintaining code, and writing tests for new and existing products. Guiding the evolution of our tech stack selections to meet business needs. Working closely with product and design team in the specification of new features and systems. And to do this, you'll have: years of experience as a software engineer/developer. years of experience contributing to modern front-end codebases leveraging technologies such as React, Typescript, and the associated ecosystem. years of experience building REST APIs and other backend systems that interact with a persistent database (with Python or Node.js). Strong knowledge of JavaScr ipt/Typescript ecosystem (Open-Source packages, yarn, npm, etc.). Understanding of software development life cycle, including CI/CD and testing best practices. Ability to read and understand existing codebases as well as working on new projects. An understanding of what it takes to make code "production-ready' on both the front-end and back-end: how to handle and log errors, maintain, and publish metrics, etc. Experience effectively organizing and mentoring more junior colleagues technically. Ability to communicate effectively with both product management and fellow engineers. Ideally: exposure to AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure. Applicants for employment in the US must have valid work authorization that does not now and/or will not in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the US. We are also unable to do C2C. We are an equal opportunity employer and make hiring decisions based on merit. Recruitment, hiring, training, and job assignments are made without regard to race, color, national origin, age, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, disability, or any other protected classification. name: Full Stack Developer III (Remote)
description: Job Description. Black Knight is the premier provider of integrated technology, services, data and analytics that lenders and servicers look to first to help successfully manage the entire loan life cycle. Our deep understanding of regulatory and compliance issues complements the knowledge, technology and solutions we offer to help our clients achieve their business goals. Black Knight offers leading software systems; data and analytics offerings; and information solutions that facilitate and automate many of the business processes across the mortgage life cycle. JOB FAMILY DESCRIPTION Works closely with customers, business analysts, and team members to understand business requirements that drive the analysis and design of quality technical solutions. These solutions must be aligned with business and IT strategies and comply with the organization's architectural standards. Involved in the full systems life cycle, design, coding, testing, implementation, maintenance and support of applications software that is delivered on time and within budget. Responsibilities may also include participation in component and data architecture design, performance monitoring and product evaluation. Has a solid understanding of systems analysis, design, development, and quality assurance and integration methodologies. GENERAL DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES. Provides design development of projects involving application development, migrations, and additions to existing applications. Participates in project meetings with other technical staff, business owners and subject matter experts. Assesses and develops design requirements for project and communicates in writing or in meetings with development team while assessing detailed specifications against design requirements. Reviews application in progress of development to ensure compliance with overall design parameters and corporate development standards. Develops and/or reviews development of test protocols for testing application before user acceptance. Reviews test results and directs further development. May serve as technical lead, architect, project lead or principal developer. May provide, or guide provision of technical support to applications currently in production. May mentor or guide work of less experienced programming and development staff. Performs other related duties as assigned. EDUCATIONAL GUIDELINES Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience. GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS and ABILITIES. Experience working with full stack development technologies. Experience working with React is highly preferred. Strong experience in .NET preferred. Experience building and supporting applications. Excellent analytical, decision-making and problem-solving skills. Ability to develop partnership-oriented relationships with business executives and functional leaders, especially as it relates to operations and technology. Must be able to multitask in a fast-paced environment with focus on timeliness, documentation, and communications with peers and business users alike. Experience with project management. Ability to communicate well both verbally and in writing to technical and non-technical audiences of various levels within Black Knight or outside the organization (executives, regulators, clients, etc.). Results oriented, business focused, and successful at interfacing across multiple organizational units. Applications Programmer III Advanced professional level role. Works independently on medium to large development projects that require an in-depth technical and business knowledge in multiple disciplines/processes. Defines and discerns key aspects of problems that require analysis and research, and develops a solution within a broad technical and business context of significant impact. Works on multiple projects as a project team member and frequently as a project team leader. May coach and/or mentor more junior technical staff. Typically requires six (6) or more years of programming/systems analysis experience. Black Knight is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, and protected veteran or military family status. Our employees' diversity is our strength, and when we embrace our differences, it makes us better and brighter. Black Knight's commitment to inclusion is at the core of who we are, and motivates us in how we do business each and every day.

name: Full Stack Developer- (REMOTE)
description: Job Description. Full Stack Engineer-REMOTE. Why you want to work at Flexion: We're looking for a Full Stack Engineer with an unwavering passion for working in autonomous, self-directed teams to build complex systems using lean, agile mindsets-this means delivering incremental business value with each sprint and enabling options at all scales. For this project, y. ou and your team will be building an enterprise scale data warehouse and working with other teams to effectively consume and use the data to improve the healthcare digital experience of millions of Americans. At Flexion (an agile software company that's been delivering excellence for over years), our company culture is built on autonomy, trust, and transparency. We empower teams to remain autonomous and self-directed by hiring people who can solve complex problems by functioning collaboratively-this means lending a hand and flexing your multi-skilled muscles (business application software engineering, database engineering, DevOps, security engineering, etc.) as needed. Every member within a cross-functional team is a leader who takes responsibility for the entire team's success, which mirrors the company's overall flat structure. What the job looks like: You'll be part of a multi-disciplinary, agile application development team tasked with modernizing an enterprise government system. The project work is primarily remote but may require some client on-site work estimated at <10. Swarming and pairing with your team to Design, code, test, debug, deploy and document software in an agile environment. Write code from a test-driven development perspective, striving for0% code coverage. Work with a team that is committed to DevSecOps. Tackle a wide variety of technical problems, contributing to all parts of the product code base. Exercise your full tool-belt of skills and experience. Why we want to hire you: You thrive working in a dynamic environment and think, design, and code with the knowledge that things will change. You want to work with team members that challenge you every day. You demonstrate an unwavering commitment to automated code coverage. You have: years of application development experience (Python). A Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Computer Science or a related field. or equivalent experience. Experience with building an enterprise data warehouse, data mart or data lake. Strong collaborative and communication skills. A passion for learning new technologies and the ability to do so quickly. Ability to write high-quality code efficiently. Strong core Linux networking, shell scripting, and administration skills. Knowledge and experience with several of the following: Experience building APIs using a microservices architecture. Experience developing cloud application architectures, specifically AWS, include experience in some of the following: Athena, RDS, EC2, S3, Glue. Engineering experience with Terraform. Experience with Data Analytics tools such as AWS Redshift. Experience with tools supporting DevOps and Continuous Delivery. Experience with automated unit testing, end to end testing, smoke tests striving for0% automated test coverage. Experience with application logging, monitoring and alerting. Experience designing systems for extremely high availability with.999% uptime. At Flexion, we live by these principles: Speak openly and honestly with your colleagues and clients about problems and proposed solutions. Welcome and handle changing requirements and priorities with little or no warning. Collaborate online in small groups about% of the time. Encourage simple and minimal solutions that keep options open. Expect and vocally advocate for quality first. Learn new practices and techniques as the situation demands. Ensure the teams develop demonstrable software every week or two. Do what needs to be done to deliver the product or project without ego or attitude. Dig deep to find the root causes of problems so we can create the right solutions. Relentlessly improve yourself, your team, and your processes. The most efficient way to reach our recruiting team is to submit your resume through the URL provided. If you have questions or would like more information about this job posting or if you'd like to know more about Flexion Inc. in general, please contact SALLY HARRIS at8.205.8785.

name: Database Administrator
description: Job Description. Description. Job Description: Join a team committed to a mission! At Leidos, we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customers' success. We empower our teams, contribute to our communities, and operate sustainable. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business. Are you ready for your next career challenge? The Leidos Defense Group is seeking a Database Administrator at our Chesapeake, VA office. The primary function of this position is to support the development of AN/SQQ-89A(V)15 system operational manuals and training products created within databases associated with US Navy ships in support of Program Executive Office Integrated Warfare Systems (PEO IWS). Are you ready to unleash your potential? Leidos Defense Group. provides a diverse portfolio of systems, solutions, and services covering land, sea, air, space, and cyberspace for customers worldwide. Solutions for Defense include enterprise and mission IT, large-scale intelligence systems, command and control, geospatial and data analytics, cybersecurity, logistics, training, and intelligence analysis and operations support. Our team is solving the world's toughest security challenges for customers with "can't fail" missions. To explore and learn more, click here! Are you ready to make an impact? Begin your journey of a flourishing and meaningful career, share your resume with us today! Responsibilities Key Responsibilities: Oracle database administrator. Proficient in developing ad hoc reports from database tables. Proficient with Linux, and script writing. Experience in understanding and applying DISA STIG guidance, and its impact on the database system. Ability to interact effectively with developers, system end users, and the US Navy Customer. Required Experience, Skills, and Education To Land this Gig You'll Need: Requires BS and years of prior relevant experience or Masters with years of prior relevant experience (additional experience, education and training may be considered in lieu of degree). Excellent written communication and grammatical skills. Excellent organizational skills. Experience working directly with operational SMEs. Ability to collaborate effectively across multiple teams. Preferred Experience, Skills, and Education Favorable if you have: System LAN operation and administration. Experience with NAVSEA programs and their lifecycle support. Travel may be required for this position. Experience working with S1000D or similar collaborative product data system. Experience working with Windchill and Arbortext. Experience working with Moodle or similar dashboard products. Clearance Required: Must have and be able to maintain a DoD Secret Security Clearance. Pay Range: #Featuredjob.

name: Oracle DBA
description: Job Description. Description. Job Description: Leidos is hiring an energetic, motivated, innovative individual to be a part of our team supporting Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) in Baltimore, MD. The DevOps engineer works closely with the Program team to manage and maintain the applications and infrastructure that support CMS and the public. You will deliver solutions that ultimately ensure that the functions of Medicare, Medicaid, and Marketplace are carried out for the and contribute to efforts to reduce healthcare costs. Primary Responsibilities Successful candidate will be a member of a cross functional team comprised of well-rounded engineers who can learn new skills rapidly and work across multiple functional domains to carry out end-to-end delivery of infrastructure services. Work closely with Leidos Engineering and Operations staff as well as the customer's application owners to solve technical problems at the network, system and application levels. Help design, test and deploy technical solutions that are innovative and that leverage new both technologies and new methods to shape customer operations. You will have the opportunity to grow in your career as you help us to grow in our value and breadth of services to CMS. The Database Administrator works closely with the Integrated Service Delivery (ISD) teams to manage and maintain the applications data infrastructure that support CMS and public health. You will maintain and deliver solutions that ultimately ensure that the functions of Medicare, Medicaid, and the Healthcare.gov Marketplace are carr ied out for the and contribute to efforts to reduce healthcare costs. You must be a team player, but able to work independently on large, complex projects and assignments in an intensive environment. Participate in on-call rotation and respond to incident alerts. Basic Qualifications BS Degree and8 years of experience in an enterprise Oracle RDBMS environment. Experience may be substituted in lieu of degree. Hands on expertise with Oracle data warehouses using Oracle workflow and Oracle warehouse builder. Some with database design or creating DDLs for creating and updating data structures, and performance improvement. Strong awareness of DBMS trends and their implications. Very strong communications, analysis, and interpersonal skills. Preferred Qualifications Experience in non-Oracle relational and non-relational DBMS environments including, but not limited to MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Informix, etc. Cloud Skills Understanding of cloud terminology, architecture, and tools including provisioning and monitoring. Network Skills Understanding of basic networking design concepts and TCP/IP. Flexibility-comfortable with evolving solutions and finding the most effective path to implementation. Security Skills-Knowledge of information assurance compliance and information security basics. Development Skills Programming/development experience including use of repositories (e.g. GitHub) and deployment in multi-tie r environment. Comfortable in an iterative environment, experience with Agile/Scrum based initiatives. All candidates supporting the CMS programs must have lived in the United States at least three (3) out of the last five (5) years prior in order to be considered. Pay Range:

description: Job Description. Description. name: Associate Database Administrator
description: Job Description. Company Summary. Join a team that puts its People First! Since89, First American (NYSE: FAF) has held an unwavering belief in its people. They are passionate about what they do, and we are equally passionate about fostering an environment where all feel welcome, supported, and empowered to be innovative and reach their full potential. Our inclusive, people-first culture has earned our company numerous accolades, including being named to the Fortune0 Best Companies to Work For list for six consecutive years. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com. Job  Summary . Essent ial Functions. Designs, develops, implements and maintains moderately complex databases systems including MS SQL server, AWS RDS, NoSQL or similar database technology. Reviews database usage and provides analysis to management for system improvements and enhancements. Work on indexing, replicating and performing disaster recovery services across multiple AWS regions. Tunes and optimizes database performance. Support production priority issues, troubleshoots and resolves database problems, escalating more complex issues to senior level DBAs. Adapt database and related software to ensure a working interface and effective performance between applications software, systems software, and installed hardware. Implements security according to defined standards. Required to perform duties outside of normal work hours based on business needs. Code review database changes to ensure minimal risk of database code deployment. Assist Sr. DBAs by choosing the best course of action by establishing decision criteria and evaluating alternatives. Acts and responds quickly to stated business, people or stakeholder challenges. Ensures optimal database performance and availability. Resolve incident tickets in timely manner and seek for long term solution to prevent similar issues from occurring. Improving data quality through data analysis, monitoring, gap analyses, and working with the teams to provide solutions and resolve errors. Developing, implementing, maintaining, and following change control and testing processes for modifications to databases. Establishing backup and recovery or replication plans to minimize data loss and system downtime. Maintaining data integrity and security (manage roles and permissions of database users). Reviewing the security logs from the SQL Server Error Logs to determine if you had a breach or a violation in one of your policies. Technical Skills: Structured Query Language (SQL), e.g. SQL/PSM, Transact-SQL queries, writes  SQL scripts in SQL Server00/2005/12/16, etc. Experience working with cloud-based database technologies from AWS and Azure (RDS, Aurora, etc). Solid knowledge of several database management systems to install, upgrade, configure, design, develop, implement, secure, tune, monitor and maintain as required. Solid knowledge of database design to produce sound logical and physical data models. Experience with varied forms of data design, such as online transaction processing, online analytical processing, data warehousing, operational data stores, and decision support systems. Knowledge of scripting and programming languages to support automation tasks a plus. Familiar working in an agile DevOps environment a plus.5 years of directly related experience. First American invests in its employees' development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer. Based on eligibility, First American offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision,1k, PTO/paid sick leave and other great benefits like an employee stock purchase plan.

name: Sr. Database Administrator
description: Job Description. Company Summary. Join a team that puts its People First! Since89, First American (NYSE: FAF) has held an unwavering belief in its people. They are passionate about what they do, and we are equally passionate about fostering an environment where all feel welcome, supported, and empowered to be innovative and reach their full potential. Our inclusive, people-first culture has earned our company numerous accolades, including being named to the Fortune0 Best Companies to Work For list for six consecutive years. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com. Job  Summary . Active ly participate in the organization's transition of database application design, development, and maintenance to the cloud. We are seeking a talented Cloud database professional with a proven track record of administration, engineering and operationalizing the Cloud Data Platform including integration with associated AWS Services and on-premise infrastructure. Responsibilities: Migrate on-prem MS SQL Server database systems to AWS/Azure Cloud native database platforms such as RDS/ DynamoDB or Azure datelake/snowflake. Analyze on-premises database environments such as SQL Server, Oracle, or other Commercial DB Engines to Open Source Engines like Aurora PostgreSQL/MySQL or RedShift, DynamoDB. Consult for optimal design of database environments, analyzing complex distributed production deployments, and making recommendations to optimize performance. Develop innovative solutions to complex business and technology problems. Perform physical implementation of databases, storage structures, high-availability solutions such as multi-AZ, replication, and disaster recovery solutions. Monitor database efficiency and maintains database performance by troubleshooting problems, fine tune the database environments and performs capacity planning. Audit user activity to ensure integrity and performance of the database. Troubleshoot and resolves database performance issues. Implement and maintains multiple database environments. Manage, support and maintain Cloud database environment as well as MS SQL Server databases and infrastructure, adhering to the architectural guidelines and policies. Provide technical expertise and hands-on support in consolidation and migration of databases to new hardware and platforms. Skills and Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience.years of data engineering and/or data warehousing experience. years of deep experience building cloud database solutions (RDS, DynamoDB, Redshift). years of experience with administration and tuning of RDBMS database platforms, developing database and analytical applications with languages, such as: SQL/NoSQL, Python. Proficiency in writing SQL scripts and packages for administration and application support. Hands-on experience with big data application development and/or with cloud data warehousing (e.g. Spark, Redshift, Snowflake, Azure SQL DW, BigQuery ) is a big plus. Strong knowledge and extensive experience with AWS native database cloud technologies. Experience with AWS EBS Volume technologies. Knowledge of design and integration principles for complex, heterogeneous databases. Strong knowledge and extensive experience with Microsoft SQL server technologies and database concepts is mandatory. Excellent in troubleshooting production or development environments issues and problem solving (in both infrastructure and database performance). Excellent database infrastructure knowledge, including the surrounding technologies that support complex database systems (Physical and VM Compute Infrastructure, SAN Infrastructure, Network Infrastructure, etc.). Self-starter, faster learner, and the ability to multi-task are mandatory. Team player and the ability to work effectively within a group as well as independently motivated with minimal supervision. Excellent problem solving, collaboration, and communication skills. Able to perform after-hours and/or weekend support when required. name: Database Administrator
description: Job Description. JOB SUMMARY Responsible for the implementation and maintenance of production databases in compliance with application specifications and company policies, standards and procedures. Manages and maintains all production and non-production databases. MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILTIES Actively and consistently supports all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience Performs installations and configurations of grid infrastructure, databases, clients etc. Maintains standards and design of physical data storage, maintenance, access and security administration Creates/maintains backup and recovery strategies on Database Management Systems Supports multiple services and multiple databases of medium complexity with multiple concurrent users, ensuring control, integrity and accessibility of data Knowledge of Always-On, High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for MSSQL Server. Troubleshoots alerts (alert log, Jobs, Disk Group, Tablespace etc.) and performance issues. Performs database performance tuning tasks Experience in Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO), using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools Implements multiple projects along with the Production Support REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS Skills/Abilities and Knowledge Ability to read, write, speak and understand English Knowledge of Database Architecture and its implementation Good knowledge of PL/SQL programming language Good knowledge of Instance, database and query tuning to improve the performance of the database/application Good understanding of Capacity Planning of Microsoft SQL Server environment to sustain business growth Good understanding of Disaster Recovery (DR) methodologies Good understanding of SAN technologies related to Oracle disk layouts Good knowledge of Windows/Linux/Solaris operating systems and shell scripting Good understanding of Change Management procedures Ability to communicate orally and in writing in a clear and straightforward manner Ability to communicate with all levels of management and company personnel Ability to handle multiple projects and tasks Ability to make decisions and solve problems while working under pressure Ability to prioritize and organize effectively Ability to show judgment and initiative and to accomplish job duties Ability to use personal computer and software applications (i.e. word processing, spread sh et, etc.) Ability to work independently Ability to work with others to resolve problems, handle requests or situations Ability to effectively consult with department managers and leaders Education BA/BS in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field or equivalent work experience Related Work Experiencetoyears of experience working with Oracle database management systems in testing, implementation, maintenance and administration in a multiple platform environment WORKING CONDITIONS Office environmentx7 on-call support IDB38083198319BR.

name: Database Administrator III
description: Job Description. Job Description. Cerner is seeking an experienced Oracle Database Administrator III to join the CernerWorks project team supporting clients and patients around the world. As a CernerWorks DBA, you will perform project work that keeps critical systems current with the latest technology and best practices while ensuring a stable environment for users. Responsibilities for this role are installing, configuring, and performing major upgrades to Oracle database software, replications and backups, implementing and maintaining database security, conducting proactive and reactive database maintenance. This includes applying database updates and stand-alone hotfixes to client environments, as well as evaluating, implementing, and improving processes for database management. We are looking for someone who can create and maintain comprehensive documentation for supported database technologies outside of the day-to-day performance of upgrades, patching, hardware migrations and client migrations to CernerWorks from on-premises datacenters. Qualifications. Basic Qualifications: At leastyears total combined completed higher education and related work experience, including: At leastyear of Database, system administration and/or system engineering work experience. At leastyears completed higher education and/or additional work experience directly related to the job Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, Software Engineering, Electronics, Mathematics, Operational Research, or related field. Due to the client contract, you will be assigned, this position requires you to be a U.S. citizen. Receipt of the appropriate gove nment security clearance card applicable for your position. Preferred Qualifications: At leastyears of experience installing and configuring, maintaining, and/or upgrading Oracle databases. At leastyear working in Linux command line environments. At leastyear of experience managing/maintaining a relational database management system. At leastyear of experience upgrading Oracle Databases. At leastyear of experience configuring backups and restoring data. At leastyear of experience troubleshooting database/host performance issues. At leastyear of experience tuning SQL performance issues. At leastyear of experience in automation and scripting skills. Expectations: Willing to work additional or irregular hours as needed and allowed by local regulations. Work in accordance with corporate and organizational security policies and procedures, understand personal role in safeguarding corporate and client assets, and take appropriate action to prevent and report any compromises of security within scope of position. Perform other responsibilities as assigned. Applicants for U.S. based positions with Cerner Corporation must be legally authorized to work in the Unit d States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. As of March,22, as a condition of employment, all US-based employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless a medical or religious exemption is approved. Some Cerner positions may be obligated to comply with additional client-facing requirements and occupational health requests, including but not limited to, an immunization set, an annual flu shot, an annual TB screen, an updated background check, and/or an updated drug screen. Cerner is a place where people are encouraged to innovate with confidence and focus on what is important people's health and the care they receive. We are transforming health care by developing tools and technologies that make it more efficient for care providers and patients to navigate the complexity of our health. From single offices to entire countries, Cerner solutions are licensed at more than,000 facilities in over countries. Cerner's policy is to provide equal opportunity to all people without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other legally protected category. Cerner is proud to be a drug-free workplace. EEO is the Law (English). E-Verify Participation (English). Right to Work (English). EEO is the Law (Spanish). E-Verify Participation (Spanish). Right to Work (Spanish).

name: DBA and Integration Manager
description: Job Description. Complete Description. IT Integration Manager Position Overview The Integrations Manager will be responsible for managing a team and individually contributing that ensures system uptime, database administration ("DBA"), systems administration and other technical functions which support operations and software development. Responsibilities and Functions Your team will be responsible for the functions described below. In most cases, you will hire individual contributors to carry out functions based on work demand, and in some cases, you will need to be an individual contributor based on your technical expertise. Become an expert in your field, capable of being an individual contributor for the most technically complex challenges, and a mentor/manager to more junior team members for more common work. Systems DBA: installation, configuration, patching, upgrade, backup, restoration and/or disaster recovery, refresh, performance optimization, and other maintenance tasks. Application DBA: provide application DBA support to a variety of internally hosted applications. Work with other departments to migrate toward third-party SaaS applications for the majority of business functions where suitable products/solutions exist to meet the needs of business stakeholders. Examples include an internally hosted accounting application which will require application DBA work immediately but which we will migrate to third-party SaaS solution in conjunction with other business stakeholders such as the CFO and head of internal IT. Make changes to application databases as necessary to support operational functions. Examples include adding entries to tables or adding/editing/removing users to support client configuration. Manage the company's instances of Amazon Web Services (AWS). Manage the company's internally hosted serves and network appliances, including interfacing with the data center, troubleshooting/replacing equipment, and optimizing network configuration. Work with other parts of the development team to migrate the company from internally hosting infrastructure to a cloud-based platforms such as AWS or Microsoft Azure. Support releases of the company's internally developed applications in conjunction with the development team. Implement, maintain, and monitor systems which will ensure system uptime, and maintain procedures to be able to quickly respond to performance degradation or outages in proportion to the severity of the incident. Implement and maintain integrations between the company's applications and third-party applications, using HL7, JSON, and other common integration protocols. Work collaboratively with the company's Information Security Manager to ensure adherence to the company's information security policies, to ensure systems and application resilience to threats (i.e., ransomware, employee data manipulati on, and other similar issues). Create and keep current the sections of the company's business continuity and disaster recovery policies and procedures relevant to systems and applications managed by your team. Supervision Received You will report to the CTO. Your performance will be evaluated based on your ability to work with minimal supervision. Supervision Exercised You will manageDBAs. We envision your team will also include at leastother individual contributor who will development and maintain integrations. Your team will grow overtime as the scope of work changes. Qualifications and Skills Required A bachelor's degree.years of experience performing DBA functions.or more years of experience performing DBA functions in an AWS environment.or more years of experience performing DBA functions in an internally hosted environment.or more years of experience with relational database (such as MS-SQL or MySQL).or more years of experience with document databases (such as MongoDB or Amazon DocumentDB). Preferredor years of experience performing DBA functions.or more years of experience managing a DBA team. Experience with and/or exposure to AWS, MongoDB, Java, .NET, Tableau. SaaS, healthcare, payments industry and/or high growth company experience. General knowledge of the Revenue Cycle Management Industry.

This is a very unique career opportunity reporting directly to the CTO and managing a team that ensures system uptime, database administration, systems administration, and other technical functions which support operations and software development for an established software company in the healthcare industry. RESPONSIBILITIES. Becoming an SME capable of individually contributing to more technically complex challenges, and a mentor/manager to junior team members for day-to-day work. Managing and growing a team ofDBAâ€™s andDeveloper/Integrator. Performing as a systems DBA in installation, configuration, patching, upgrades, backups, restoration and/or disaster recovery, refreshes, performance optimization, and other maintenance tasks. Working with other departments to migrate toward third-party SaaS applications for the majority of business functions where applicable. (i.e., an internally hosted  accounting application which will require application DBA work immediately but which we will migrate to third-party SaaS solution in conjunction with other business stakeholders such as the CFO and head of internal IT). Making changes to application databases as necessary to support operational functions. (i.e., adding entries to tab les or adding/editing/removing users to support client configuration). Managing the company's instances of AWS. Managing the company's internally hosted servers and network appliances, including interfacing with the data center, troubleshooting/replacing equipment, and optimizing network configuration. Working with other parts of the development team to migrate the company from internally hosting infrastructure to a cloud-based platforms such as AWS or Microsoft Azure. Supporting releases of the company's internally developed applications in conjunction with the development team. Implement, maintain, and monitor systems which will ensure system uptime, and maintain procedures to be able to quickly respond to performance degradation or outages in proportion to the severity of the incident. Implement and maintain integrations between the company's applications and third-party applications, using HL7, JSON, and other common integration protocols. Work collaboratively with the Information Security Manager to ensure adherence to information security policies, to ensure systems and application resilience to threats (i.e., ransomware, employee  data manipulation, and other similar issues). Create and keep current the sections of the company's business continuity and disaster recovery policies and procedures relevant to systems and applications managed by your team. REQUIREMENTS. A bachelor's degree in a technical field. years performing DBA functions. years performing DBA functions in an AWS environment. years performing DBA functions in an internally hosted environment. years with relational databases (i.e., MS-SQL or MySQL). years with docume nt databases (i.e., MongoDB or Amazon Document DB). name: Cyber Security Analyst (DBA)
description: Job Description. Cyber Security Analyst (DBA) Position Description CGI has an immediate need for a Cyber Security Analyst (DBA) to join our financial services team in one of our selected CGI locations. Due to the current COVID-19 status, candidates will not be required to work within the physical work location at this time. When COVID-19 restrictions are lifted, they will be required to be located within the proximity of the assigned CGI location. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced team environment supporting one of the largest leaders in the secondary mortgage industry. We take an innovative approach to supporting our client, working side-by-side in an agile environment using emerging technologies.. We partner with of the top banks globally, and our top banking clients have worked with us for an average of years!. We have over,000+ CGI Members in countries and over+ loyal Clients who are leveraging our end-to-end services across the globe This position will be part of an cyber security team as a Database Administrator (DBA) to perform data base administrator activities on the identity access management area utilizing CyberArk. Your future duties and responsibilities The Cyber Security DBA will be responsible for performing data base administrator activities on the identity access management area utilizing CyberArk. Required qualifications to be successful in this role. Minimum of+ years overall IT experience; years of end-to-end database administration with hands-on Oracle (System DBA as well as application DBA). Expert level skills using SQL, skills tuning queries. Strong shell scripting skills Unix shell scripting (3+ years hands-on) , Python scripting (hands-on experience). Preferred Experience with CyberArk Privileged Access Management toolset. Strong troubleshooting/root cause analysis hands on experience. Self-starter with demonstrated ability to work independently. Good communication skills and can work in team environment Desired qualifications. Plus/nice to have: Support of other RDBMS Sybase, MSSQL, etc. EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENT B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics,  inance  r related field Build your career with us. It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change-supporting our clients' digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities. At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create. Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world. Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com. No unsolicited agency referrals please. CGI is an equal oppor tuni ty employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics. CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at USEmploymentCompliance@cgi.com. You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in whi ch you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned. We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members. All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to successfully complete a background investigati n. Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held. CGI will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrests and conviction records in accordance with all local regulations and ordinances. CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI's legal duty to furnish information. name: Senior Oracle Database Administrator
description: Job Description. PGand E is a publically traded energy company and is currently hiring an Oracle Database Administrator. This role is currently0% remote but when it is safe to do so, the plan is to come back into the office in San Ramon. Duties vary day to day, and as an Oracle Database Administrator, you will touch a wide breadth of the environment. The Oracle Database will be collaborating and consulting with DBA teammates on project tasks. Oracle Database Administrator will be installing, upgrading, patching, and recovering assigned Oracle databases as specified by project requirements. The Oracle Database Administrator will setup monitoring and ensure databases to adhere to build standards. The Oracle Database Administrator will also manage work according to criteria of costs, scheduling, and functional and technical performance. The Oracle Database Administrator will be maintaining open and honest communications with clients, teammates, and management for purposes of providing ongoing, timely status reporting. Let us know what your passion is because this team values growing their members and want to collaborate with you on your professional development whether you are early on or firmly established in your career. This is a full time hour a week contract position for up to one year in duration. Required Skills and Experience years of experience as a Senior Oracle DBA. Bachelor's Degree in computer science, job-related discipline, or equivalent experience. Good verbal and written communication. Experience with upgrading Oraclec. Desired Skills and Experience Recent experience with upgrading Oracle19c. Experience with OracleG,C, orC. Experience doing performance tuning for Oracle databases. Experience with DDBoost. Scripting with Perl, Shell or Bash. What You Will Be Doing Tech Breakdown0% Hands on with Oracle DBA. Daily Responsibilities Install, upgrade, patch, backup, and recover assigned Oracle databases as specified by project requirements. Setup monitoring and ensure databases adhere to build standards. Refresh or migrate data. Create database objects. Enforce company change control, patch management, and information security standards and procedures. Collaborate and consult with DBA teammates on project tasks. Provide off-hour and weekend support as needed for the projects. Demonstrate consistent and independent ability to manage projects and the workload. Manage work according to criteria of costs, scheduling, and functional and technical performance. Maintain open and honest communications with clients, teammates, and management for purposes of providing ongoing, timely status reporting. Communicate status, issues and concerns in both written and oral formats. Provide proper documentation for knowledge sharing and transition. The Offer Competitive Pay: Up to $85/hour, DOE. Full Time,hours Monday through Friday. Contract Duration:12 months. You will receive the following benefits: Medical and Dental Insurance. Health Savings Account (HSA).1(k). Paid Sick Time Leave. name: Senior Database Administrator

name: Oracle Database Administrator
description: Job Description. Oracle Database Administrator. Winston Salem, NC. Full-Time/Permanent. Salary range + Bonus + Relocation assistance. POSITION SUMMARY STATEMENT: The Database Administrator III is responsible for data analysis and database management. Performs Business Continuity/Disaster Recovery activities during Business Continuity Plan events. Plans, schedules, and implements operating system software installs and patches (includingd party tools) using change management and release management processes. Plans, schedules, and implements operating system software installs and patches (includingd party tools) using change management and release management processes. Implements database security and auditing features and periodic reviews. Conducts root cause analysis for repeated incidents. Conducts team training. Also responsible for resource management. Provides escalation LevelandTechnicalx7 support. Researches new technologies to address operations reliability and compliance. Implements and performs configuration management of database cluster and replications. QUALIFICATIONS: Skills: Required. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Bachelor's in Information Technology or equivalent.

name: Senior SQL DBA
description: Job Description. Why Conduent: You'll have an opportunity to work on innovative technology while being surrounded by a culture that recognizes each person's contributions. Each day you'll feel challenged and know you are making a difference. At Conduent, we believe everything touches everything -and to that end we value our work and each other in the process, making it an award winning place to work. In21, we won Best Places To Work, Best Global Culture and Best HR Team. You have an opportunity to personally and professionally thrive, make a difference, and be part of a culture where individuality and participation is valued. As a Senior SQL DBA, you will perform physical and logical database administration functions as required for Application to Sustain Services in MS SQL Server environments. This is a wonderful opportunity to make your mark in an enterprise level business unit, be trusted and valued overall for your contributions. We need someone who can bring our database administration to the next level, produce high quality work and be surrounded by a team of individuals with the same level of passion that you have with your work. We need someone who can: Perform physical and logical database administration functions as required for Application to Sustain Services. Assist in analyzing, performance tuning and maintain test and production databases. Experience in database support in MS SQL Server environments. Experience in troubleshooting and resolving database integrity issues, performance issues, blocking and deadlocking issues, log shipping issues, connectivity issues, security issues etc. Experience in Performance Tuning, Query Optimization, using Performance Monitor, SQL Profiler and other related monitoring and troubleshooting tools. Experience with High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for MSSQL Server. Experience in implementing operational automation using scripts. Experience with backups, restores and recovery models. Propose database changes to ease monitoring and administrative effort. Document and implement changes to databases via proper Change Management methodology. Monitor and analyze database activity to proactively identify and prevent potential Incidents and recommend performance improvements. Participate in situation management of incidents related to database operations. Test and evaluate impact on Applications of new DBMS Software releases. Ensure integrity of all database components, e.g. Table definitions,  structure definitions, statistic and indexes status etc. Report and remediate all security violations. Be familiar with tuning utilities and reports. For example SQL trace, System Monitor, Activity Monitor, and Database Engine Tuning Advisor etc. Be familiar with MS Service Pack patching procedure. Be capable of evaluating new RDMBS technology with the objective to improve the quality of database administrative tasks. Basic Qualifications for Consideration: Minimum ofyears of SQL Server database administration and design. Minimum ofyears experience T-SQL tuning experience. Experience with Power Shell Scripting. Strong communication, decision making and interpersonal skills. Strong organizational and time management skill. Able to work under pressure and take responsibility during situation management. Agree to work independently to carry out on-call duties as scheduled. Preferred Qualifications For Consideration: Experience working with multiple versions of SQL server: individually, in parallel, and using cross-server connectivity. Experience creating, configuring, monitoring, managing, and remediating SQL Server in on-prem VM and physical scenarios. Experience creating, configuring, monitoring, managing, and remediating SQL Server on Azure VMs. Experience setting up, configuring, and troubleshooting MSDTC. Experience with SQL encryption processes and procedures. Experience Installing, configuring, monitoring, and managing SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups. Experience with migrating SQL server data from on-prem to an Azure environment. Experience performing data migrations from older SQL versions to newer versions on separate systems. Basic SQL server and connectivity troubleshooting skills. Effective written and oral communication with team members and coworkers from other teams, including developers, testers, configuration management, and others. #Techjobs.

name: Db2 Mainframe DBA Support
description: Job Description. Db2 Mainframe DBA Support Location: Whitehouse Stationonth cth Overview: Seeking an experienced DB2 z/OS DBA to join its Database Administration team providing administrative and technical support to a wide variety of DB2 customers across the enterprise. Skills / Qualifications: Minimum of7 years of experience as a DB2 Database Administrator on mainframe z/OS platform with DB2 data sharing experience. Should be experienced at the v11 release level or beyond and conversant with recent advances and implementation of the new features and functions.. Prior insurance or financial industry experience a plus Experience in IMS database administration will be a significant plus for the successful applicant; at minimum, an active interest in learning IMS as practiced and participating in its administration is highly desirable. Timely, efficient and accurate production support and problem resolution Proficient in SQL performance evaluation and tuning Logical and physical database design skills Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills Experience with IBM and BMC DB2 utilities; BMC NGT (formerly CDB) Reorg and Image Copy experience preferred Experience with DB2 performance monitoring tools and metrics evaluation; BMC s MainView for DB2 and APPTUNE as well as IBM Tivoli Decision Support for z/OS preferred. Knowledge of managing DB2 ODBC entries; e.g., cataloging z/OS DB2 database and node entries . Familiarity with debugging connectivity issues between client/ODBC and z/OS platforms. Experience with DB2 Connect/Gateway administration Experience with SAP DirectConnect is a plus Strong experience with JCL, TSO/ISPF, and z/OS utilities Experience supporting a multi-terabyte data environment Experience supporting high throughput OLTP applications Experience supporting Sarbanes-Oxley and other compliance and security related implementation and reporting requirements Experience collaborating with application development and systems programming teams across multiple organizations and global locations a plus. Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills; high proficiency in query performance and tuning, log and monitor interpretation, and analysis and resolution of resource utilization issues Detailed experience with DB2 utilities and database maintenance processing Clear, concise and effective written and verbal communication skills Exhibit good time management skills, independent thinking and decision-making capabilities Experienced in providing quality off-hours on-call support Self-motivated individual and a team player; is highly responsible and accountable. Demonstrates professional integrity at all times. Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline or equivalent work experience required. DBA staff covers full range of environments. We are not backroom DBAs, nor are we production only or development only DBAs. We are more of logical or Application DBAs but called upon as SMEs for the Db2 zOS environment. We work with IBM-System Programmers. This position is not limited to just mainframe DB2 support, the candidate will also support DB2 middleware (DB2 Connect and SAP's DirectConnect) as well as DB2 cataloging operations on the DB2 Client. Summary of key skills: Educational requirements Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline or equivalent work experience required. Required skills, knowledge, abilities, etc. DB2 zOS v11 or beyond Experience with IBM and BMC DB2 utilities; BMC NGT (formerly CDB) Reorg and Image Copy experience preferred Experience with DB2 performance monitoring tools and metrics evaluation; BMC s MainView for DB2 and APPTUNE as well as IBM Tivoli Decision Support for z/OS preferred. Strong experience with JCL, TSO/ISPF, and z/OS utilities. Additional skills: IMS DBMS experience a plus DB2 Connect Gateway experience a plus SAP DirectConnect experience a plus.

name: Oracle DBA
description: Job Description. Oracle DBA Position Description Become part of a growing team implementing software solutions to the utility industry. Manage, support and maintain database technology and infrastructure, adhering to the architectural guidelines and policies. Create scripts to migrate data from one software version to another. Automate recurring or redundant database tasks using scripts. Provide technical expertise and hands-on support in consolidation and migration of databases to new hardware and platforms. Provide the physical implementation of databases, storage structures, high-availability solutions, replication, and disaster recovery solutions. Proactively and reactively perform analysis, monitoring, troubleshooting and resolution of escalated issues.. Work closely with product development, project support, and technical operations to ensure delivery of database services within the SLAs' and performance targets. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Business or equivalent (experience in lieu of a degree). Demonstrated ability to solve complex systems, data, and database environment issues. Experience with Oracle Data Guard setup a plus. Experience with configuration, load balancing, backup/recovery, sizing and space management, PL/SQL tuning, diagnostics, and proficiency in the use of Oracle's Enterprise Manager. Outstanding troubleshooting skills. Strong written and oral communication skills, good presentation skills. Demonstrate the ability to work in a complex organization to determine business and customer needs, providing the best solution to meet those needs.. Ability to travel-80%. Located in proximity to either the CGI Houston office or the CGI Montreal office. Ability to work independently, establish priorities, meet deadlines. Self-motivated team player with a positive attitude and good work ethic is essential to success Skills Desired: Previous experience in project based work Familiarity with cloud-based and/or integrated software solutions Solution Architecture Build your career with us. It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change-supporting our clients' digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities. name: Senior Database Administrator
description: Job Description. Description. The Senior Database Administrator (DBA) is responsible for providing analytical and operational support for the database environment including all aspects of database administration, architecture analysis and design, installation and configuration, performance monitoring and tuning, database security, backup, recovery planning, capacity planning, and troubleshooting. In this role, the Senior DBA will work with architecture, application development and operations to meet current and future business objectives. Primary Duties and Responsibilities. Develop and maintain installation and configuration procedures; contribute to and maintain system standards; create and maintain documentation as it relates to configurations. Works with business and IT partners to eliminate system and application inefficiencies by identifying and resolving routine problems through utilization of various database analysis tools and monitoring of the system to ensure an efficient operation environment. Develop, manage, test and tune back-up and recovery plans and High Availability solutions. Refine physical design of databases to meet storage requirements. Architects and analyzes the organization's database needs and develops a long-term strategy for data storage. Work with compliance group to ensure databases meet audit and security standards. Deploy database change scripts provided by third party vendors. Automate processes with tools internal and external to databases. Work closely with developers and BI team in writing optimizing database access. Patch, upgrade, and migrate databases. Support for Disaster Recovery (DR) and business continuity of DB system. Liaise with network administrators, systems analysts, and software engineers to assist in resolving problems with company software systems. Requirements. Minimum Job Requirements. Bachelor's degree. years of experience with SQL Server. Experience with MySQL is a plus. Well versed on performance troubleshooting and tuning. Experience with setting up, maintaining and troubleshooting databases in a High Availability andx7 environment. Experience on performance monitoring and tuning. Effectively communicate with senior technology and business executives. Demonstrates organizational and communications skills both written and verbal. name: SAP Database Administrator
description: Job Description. Genesis10 is currently seeking a SAP Database Administrator with our client in the financial industry in their Charlotte, NC or TX location. Database monitoring with both ad-hoc tools and automated scripts or procedures. Support/recommend reporting, query and analysis tools ensuring efficient database utilization. Experience working with SAP Data Warehousing and DB2 DPF environment. Experience with Database HA/DR technologies. Experience with database backup and recovery solutions. Experience with database configuration, monitoring, and performance tuning. Strong analytical, problem solving, organizational, and planning skills. Good working knowledge of AIX and Linux. Good Experience in Shell/PHP/Perl scripting is highly desirable. RDBMS: SAP HANA and DB2; SAP HANA and Db2 DBA support, including DB installation and upgrade, DB maintenance, monitoring, performance tuning, DB backup and recovery. SAP Basis Admin: SAP Installations, Configurations, Parameter Updates, and Upgrades.+ years of database administration experience, preferably with DB2 LUW and/or SAP HANA. Able to work as a W2 employee of Genesis10 (no Corp-to-Corp). If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, please apply! name: SQL Developer/Admin
description: Job Description. Currently, we are looking for talented resources for one of our listed clients. If interested please reply to me with your updated resume or feel free to reach out to me for more details at. Title: SQL Developer/Admin. Location: Saint Louis, MO. Duration: Months. Job Description: Client uses a legacy Warehouse Management system, originally a COTS application but now owned and maintained by Client IT. We are in the middle of a long project to replace this application across all our North American factories, but we still need to support and maintain the legacy application until mid-2021. This position is for a combination Developer/Administrator who can help maintain the legacy application during that time. THIS IS NOT AN ACTIVE SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT POSITION. PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU ARE SEEKING A SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT POSITION. Responsibilities of this position include support (including off-hours support); patching; infrastructure work (OS upgrades, database upgrades, etc.); business support (including SQL query writing, bulk data loads, etc.); troubleshooting and resolution; and help with cutover/migration activities during go-lives of the new WM solution. Technical Skills: The ideal candidate would be someone who has a background in software development as well as system or software administration. Although this is not a development position, code fixes and minor enhancements are part of the job, so experience coding in C, VB.Net, and SQL (DB2 and Oracle) are required. Experience in application troubleshooting is also required. Candidate must know about Windows Services, log files, etc. and be able to work backward from an error message to identify the root cause of an issue. Issues can occur in the source code, data, middleware, SAP/IDocs, and/or Windows. The ideal candidate will also have some background in physical logistics, warehouse management, manufacturing, order management, etc. Experience with SAP, especially with IDocs, is highly desired but not required. Education Required: A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related discipline, or equivalent work experience, is required.
