name: Software Engineer II (Frontend Developer)
description: Job Description. Overview Who we are Imagine working in a place where continuous improvement and innovation is celebrated and rewarded; where fast-paced, high-impact teams come together to positively drive results for one of the largest and most iconic brands in the world. As the only rapidly growing retailer, you may know us as your friendly neighborhood store. You probably know our familiar name, have seen our pervasive logo, and have tried our highly sought-after products, such as SlurpeeÂ® and Big BiteÂ®. "Brain Freeze" is aEleven registered trademark for our-year old SlurpeeÂ® and with over,100 stores globally (more than any other retailer or food service provider), we sell over million a month. But there's a lot more to our story and much more left to be written. We are transforming our business, ensuring we are customer obsessed and digitally enabled to seamlessly link our brick and mortar stores with digital products and services. AtEleven the entrepreneurial spirit is in our DNA and has been ever since our inception+ years ago. It's what drove us to invent the convenience industry in27 by envisioning how a simple ice dock could provide household staples such as milk and eggs to better serve the needs of our customers. Today we are redefining convenience and the customer experience in big ways...we are fundamentally changing our culture and we want  talented, innovative, customer obsessed, and entrepreneurial people like you to come make history with us. How we lead AtEleven we are guided by our Leadership Principles. Be Customer Obsessed. Be Courageous with Your Point of View. Challenge the Status Quo. Act Like an Entrepreneur. Have an "It Can Be Done" Attitude. Do the Right Thing. Be Accountable. Each principle has a defined set of behaviors which help guide theEleven team to Serve Customers and Support Stores. About This Opportunity Responsibilities Responsibilities: Develop code; write automation tests ; communicating status and issues to teammates and leadership. Work with technical leads on low level design and develop code as per design specification. Write clean, readable, and maintainable code. Follow 'clean code' practices. Stays on the leading edge of software development tools and best practices. Self-directed with a start-up/ entrepreneur mindset. Qualifications Required: Expertise in React.8.0+ (React Hooks), have extensive experience on hooks API. JavaScript Experts, know ES6+ features, and performance profiling. Hands on experience with Typescript. Comfortable and confident to use type in implementation (The projects are all in typescript, proper typing is required). Hands-On exposure with multiple styling solutions, css -in js , Sass or less. Have experience with state manage solutions like Redux or Flux. Know how to design states of the application/component properly. Experience in Integrating the REST and SOAP APIs. Able to write unit test and integration test. Exposure to CICD pipelines and Kubernetes Deployment. Able to do performance profiling for React application. Have a clear understanding for modern front-end engineering. Node js b ackground. Have a solid understanding of React fram e works. Independent Contributor and Quick Learning Capabilities. Ability to design modularized component s. Micro frontend architecture. Qualifications: A Bachelor's Degree in information technology discipline is required. Total years of experience required istoyears. Minimumyears ' experience building web applications with a JavaScript framework, preferably+ years using React. #DCE-APH #DICE.

name: Software Developer
description: Job Description. At. e. X. cell, you re more than just a number. Our employee relationship managers support you throughout your engagement, provide career guidance and reemployment assistance. Join. e. X. cell. Our client is currently in search of qualified Software Developer Angular and .NET. to join their team for an on-site position in Kent, WA. Our client is the world's leading supplier in the horizontal directional drilling (HDD) industry. This global innovative company is comprised of smart, committed, and fun people who are dedicated to making their customers more efficient and profitable. They are dog-friendly and use large live plants to separate the different areas which adds to the ambiance, gives energy, and fuels creativity. They provide an open, supportive, collaborative, and fun workplace. Their benefits are unparallel% of health care is completely covered no premiums or deductibles! Their products solve real-world problems in the Horizontal Drilling Industry and are used by real customers. As such, the candidate will be responsible for writing production-level code. The ideal candidate has a proven track record of extraordinary problem-solving skills and embraces mentoring others. Our client offers a highly collaborative work environment with a very challenging domain problem. As a Software Developer, candidate will first be responsible for contributing to the development of both webservices and desktop application using the latest .NET Core technologies. Afterwards, candidate will be exposed to all parts of the product eco-systems on a variety of stacks where only high quality, object-oriented coding practices are accepted. Our client does not sacrifice product quality for schedules. Responsibilities: Self-driven, results oriented developer who strives to write clean, modular, and well commented code without taking short-cuts and drives their software through the 'final%' to take a product to market. Willingness to work on a team and can work in a fluid, highly collaborative environment. Work effectively as a member in our Scrum Agile process. Contribute to the development of both ASP.Net webservices and UWP / WPF desktop applications. Develop software as per established Product Development Life Cycle processes. Peer-reviews of designs, implementations (code) and documentations. Communicate effectively. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering from an accredited university oryears equivalent experience. 2+ years recent .NET development experience. Experience with C#. Experience developing UWP, WPF, Xamarin, and / or ASP.NET applications. Experience doing Unit Testing / TDD with an expectation of high code coverage. Understanding of design pattern principles like MVC, MVVM. Understanding and experience with software design and architecture patterns. Ability to architect efficient and reusable software abstractions. Experience with the asynchronous programming model. Knowledge of Agile software development processes. Experience with Confluence and Jira. Excellent attention to detail. Fun Perks: Work hard, play often... Our client's open (forest-like) work environment creates free flowing conversations across all functions. They have gaming days; Lego challenges and ping pong matches to build on creativity when one hits a roadblock. If that is not enough, employees bring their four-legged companions (dogs) to work and can take them for a walk around the Green River trail. They take pride in caring a lot about their employees. They believe that employees should not be burdened with benefits expenses, so they provide lucrative health care plans unmatched in most other companies. They also like to eat and find any excuse to celebrate the most random holidays (Pi Day, Chocolate Ice Cream Day, etc.) They have monthly catered lunches, a fully stocked snack area, sporting tickets, wellness competitions, and most importantly a team of people who will tell you that this is the best place they've ever worked. This is evident by their long service team and low turnover. Full COVID-19 vaccination may be required. W2 only, no Corp to Corp. We are unable to sponsor H1B visas at this time. e. X. cell. Supports Equal Employment Opportunity. e. X. cell, a division of CompuCom Systems, Inc., a global company headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, provides IT staffing services and solutions to Fortune00 companies as well as small and medium business. For more information, visit. www.excell.com.

name: Software Engineer
description: Job Description. Overview. The Bethesda.net team is s eeking a talented software engineer to contribute to the Bethesda Softworks Digital Publishing Platform. This role focuses on full stack feature development that supports online games, administrative tools, web, and mobile applications. Our front-end systems primarily use JavaScript and React while our backend systems primarily use Go and Python. Our systems are cloud-based, using both AWS and Azure as our cloud provider. Our systems are running at scalex7, and all engineers participate in architecture discussions, live support, and our continuous improvement processes. We are always exploring ways to improve our scale, reliability, and efficiency. Engineers are expected to learn and support new technologies, as well as propose new solutions that solve observed problems. Responsibilities. Implement and maintain new and existing features under the direction of a Lead Engineer. Write clean, maintainable code that is scalable, reliable, and observable. Support systems in ax7 environment including troubleshooting, hot fixing, and root cause analysis. Actively provide code review and feedback for other developers. Learn new technologies and programming languages as needed. Ensure consistency with security policy standards and security plan. Understand and define infrastructure as code to support systems developed. Collaborate with other engineers and engineering teams to delivery high quality, complex systems this includes Ops Infra, Security, QA, NOC, and Game Developers. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (or equivalent experience). years of experience as a software engineer. Possess a strong technical background and deep knowledge of software engineering principles, exceptional problem solving, design, programming, and testing skills. years of HTML/CSS and JavaScript/TypeScript experience, preferably using Node.js. years of Go and/or Python experience, preferably b uilding web services. Professional experience using frameworks like React, Angular, or Vue. Experience working with bundling tools such as Webpack. Experience designing and implementing backend systems to support user interfaces. Professional experience working with either AWS or Azure. Working knowledge of containers (e.g., Docker) and container orchestration (e.g., Kubernetes). Wor king knowledge of databases (SQL and NoSQL)  and caching technologies (e.g., Redis). Working knowledge of UI/UX principles and prototypin g tools. Experience with version control systems (GitHub preferred). Experience supporting live systems at scale. Desire to learn new languages and technology. Pragmatic approach to providing engineering solutions that solve business needs. Excellent written and verbal skills. We embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion in everything we do from recruiting for our studios, publishing and operations to fostering safe and respectful workplaces that encourage collaboration. Our culture is based on principles of respect, inclusion, and fair treatment and we welcome anyone into our family without regard to race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, or age. Our diversity fuels our innovation and inspires us to create game worlds that bring us closer to the global community of players we serve.

Since83, when it launched the Nintendo Entertainment Systemâ„¢, Nintendo has sold billions of video games and hundreds of millions of hardware units globally, including Nintendo Switch and the NintendoS family of systems, as well as the Game Boyâ„¢, Game Boy Advance, Nintendo DSâ„¢ family of systems, Super NESâ„¢, Nintendoâ„¢, Nintendo GameCubeâ„¢, Wiiâ„¢, and Wii Uâ„¢ systems. It has also created industry icons that have become well-known, household names, such as Mario, Donkey Kong, Metroid, Zelda and PokÃ©mon. A wholly owned subsidiary, Nintendo Technology Development, based in Redmond, Washington, creates future hardware/software technology and researches North American-based technologies. Nintendo is an equal opportunity employer. We offer a welcoming and inclusive environment in service to one another, our products, the diverse consumers we represent, and the communities we call home. We do all of this with kindness, empathy and respect for each other. NTD's Software Development Support Group (SDSG) supports Nintendo licensees in development of software on Nintendo hardware platforms. Members of the group are experts in Nintendo hardware and software development tools, providing frontline support to developers around the world. SDSG members work with AAA development teams to help solve some of their hardest problems, while also educating new developers on the basics of Nintendo development. SDSG members are engineers and educators, utilizing both communications and software development skills to help development teams large and small. If you are ready to enable developers to create the best possible experiences, we want to hear from you. DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES. Develop and share expertise on Nintendo software development procedures and techniques. Answer technical questions and advise developers that are creating content for Nintendo platforms. Help to create tutorials, demos, and documentation for Nintendo platform development. Assist in the creation of content for developer workshops and technical conferences. Participate in the design, development, and support of various software development tools. Documents work according to defined processes. May assist with on-boarding new hires. Up to% travel; domestic and international. SUMMARY OF REQUIREMENTS.2 years game development experience or relevant academic experience. Basic understanding of fundamental engineering concepts and programming languages. Basic understanding of development tools and processes. Solid understanding of C, C++, C# or equivalent. Fluency in Japanese a plus. BS or MS in engineering or equivalent. Valid passport may be required. This is not a remote opportunity and you will be required to work onsite in Redmond, WA NOA-RG.

name: UI Implementation Artist
description: Job Description. As an UI Implementation Artist, you will collaborate with the Design, UX and Engineering teams to implement features and maintain UI systems, help build rapid prototypes, hook up states, data, and animation using the Blueprint Visual Scripting system in the Unreal Engine. You will also work with Engineering to optimize workflow with suggested tools to aid in the UI development process. This is both an artistic and technically oriented art position. Working as an UI Implementation Artist requires a combination of art and design sensibilities, technical knowledge related to the game dev environment, and a high degree of communication and collaboration. As a member of the team, you will help your fellow team members to continue to meet and raise the quality bar at the studio. Responsibilities: Design and Implement memory efficient artwork into the Unreal game engine Script UI using the Blueprint Visual Scripting system in the Unreal Engine Ensure UI assets are optimal as possible by balancing the art needs with tech restraints Work with various teams to ensure UI assets and features are functioning correctly in the client Collaborate with other artists in various sub-disciplines as needed Required Qualifications: +2 years of experience in Tech Art or UI Art for games Experience working with Unreal Engine Experience with industry standard art creation pipelines, workflows and tools Willingness to roll-up sleeves and directly contribute to all aspects of the art/creative process Experience working and collaborating with with developers in various disciplines Strong written and oral communication skills Desired Qualifications: Experience working in one or more related disciplines art, animation, technical art, visual effects Experiencing working on a AAA game title Experience working with external partners. Familiar with the basic outsource workflow. Experience with basic scripting languages such as Python or Mel.

Your responsibilities include system software development, performance optimizations, architectural improvements, bug fixes, and other enhancements for Nintendo gaming systems. The ideal candidate should have strong communications skills and a collaborative working style. DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES. Architect, design, and develop software to support multimedia use cases. name: Sr. Architect
description: Job Description. Nintendo of America Inc. The worldwide pioneer in the creation of interactive entertainment, Nintendo Co., Ltd., of Kyoto, Japan, manufactures and markets hardware and software for its Nintendo Switchâ„¢ system and the NintendoSâ„¢ family of portable systems. Since83, when it launched the Nintendo Entertainment Systemâ„¢, Nintendo has sold billions of video games and hundreds of millions of hardware units globally, including Nintendo Switch and the NintendoS family of systems, as well as the Game Boyâ„¢, Game Boy Advance, Nintendo DSâ„¢ family of systems, Super NESâ„¢, Nintendoâ„¢, Nintendo GameCubeâ„¢, Wiiâ„¢, and Wii Uâ„¢ systems. It has also created industry icons that have become well-known, household names, such as Mario, Donkey Kong, Metroid, Zelda and PokÃ©mon. A wholly owned subsidiary, Nintendo of America Inc., based in Redmond, Wash., serves as headquarters for Nintendo's operations in the Americas. For more information about Nintendo, please visit the company's website at http://www.nintendo.com. Nintendo is a n equal o pportunity employer. We offer a welcoming and inclusive environment in service to one another, our products, the diverse consumers we represent, and the communities we call home. We do all of this with kindness, empathy and respect for each other. Seasoned, experienced professional with unique knowledge and recognized expertise in multiple business and technical domains including enterprise architectures and standards and the research and experimentation of current and evolving trends. Performs and reviews complex business and technical analysis, design and supports the software development cycle using appropriate technologies to support department and company objectives. Performs and reviews complex enterprise architectures and standards, focusing on cloud based application and data architectures. DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES. Networks with senior internal and external personnel across multiple areas. Define long-term plans for NOA IT evolution, partnering with other IT leadership, with a focus on: Creating well-informed application and data architecture strategies. Regularly evaluate cloud services, frameworks and best practices. Work closely with IT Security to adopt and implement application and data security best practices. Support development teams in selection and use of data technologies and practices. Work with the application teams to define and implement roadmaps for services and applications as we transition to cloud. Participates in the development of a common, enterprise-wide cloud strategy. Review adherence to our selected architectural principles, standards, and tools through architectural reviews and/or testing. Help to maintain compliance with regulations (e.g. JSOX, HIPAA, COPPA) with regard to areas like secu rity frameworks, control systems, etc. Assist the overall architect team in developing the foundational frameworks for creation and delivery of software and infrastructure services across NOA, and in some cases across NCL, in areas like: Serverless Applications, Containers, tools and standards, including monitoring, SLAs, security. Infrastructure layers to support services, working closely with the infrastructure teams. Security (application and infrastructure layers). Enterprise-scale Cloud Integration Platforms. Assessing technical architectures, infrastructures and applications to identify opportunities to document and define reusable processes, components, objects and data. Defining and documenting processes, services, data and objects to ensure that technical solutions take advantage of defined standards and ensure interoperability between and across solutions. Participating in architectural assessments (along with Chief architect and other architects) to drive reusability and adoption. SUMMARY OF REQUIREMENTS. Typically requires a minimum ofyears of related experience in design and implementation of enterprise applications, IT architectures, IT modeling. Experience in the development of a common, enterprise-wide cloud strategy. Wide-ranging professional experience, including proven experience participating in work on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. Experience in multiple technical and business domains including Oracle, Microsoft, and Open Source technologies. Proven track record as a team or project team significant contributor. Experience with Enterprise Architecture constructs. Full understanding of software lifecycle for both package and custom developed software. Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Technology, Information Systems, Industrial Engineering, or related field; or equivalent combination of education and experience. NOA-RG.

name: Product Design Intern II
description: Job Description. Description. SHIFT: Day Job SCHEDULE: Full-time Your Talent. Our Vision. At Anthem, Inc. , it's a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which we're creating greater access to care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will drive the future of health care. This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America's leading health care companies and a Fortune Top Company. The Anthem Technology Intern Program allows graduate-level design students to gain real-world work experience in a professional design studio environment. During the summer months, interns will engage in challenging projects evolving around the rapidly changing healthcare tech industry. Interns are paired with senior designers and mentors and will be given opportunities to apply their craft in actual projects to enrich their knowledge base to achieve a greater understanding of designing products for real-world, healthcare use cases. If the intern performs well throughout the internship, there will be opportunities for full-time employment once the intern graduates. Interns will participate in activities to enhance the connection to the company as a whole and encourage personal growth. Some of these activities include: Formal onboarding event for all students to ensure integration to the organization and program. Additional onboarding with a senior designer to learn our tools and workflow. A one on one mentorship with a design director for the duration of the program. Regular critiques and feedback sessions to received feedback on their work, increase their understanding of how their work fits into a larger product ecosystem. Opportunities to grow and develop through social and networking events. What we are looking for: Design Interns will be assigned to a specific group within Digital and Information Technology based on the skillset and needs of the business. Design interns should have experience and education in: The ability to work independently to interpret and adapt a defined style or design language to different areas, respective features, or elements of a larger project. Strong rapid visualization skills for quickly generating, iterating, and visually pitching your ideas as concept sketches, storyboards, etc. Strong foundational visual design skills (e.g., layout, composition, typography, color) that show  you can work with complex visual information and maintain awareness for information hierarchy, flow, and context, including states and transitions. Exceptional attention to detail. A breadth of artistic/design styles. Flexibility in your ability to work at the appropriate level of visual fidelity (thumbnailing, sketching, wireframing, designing, and polishing). Ability to remain faithful to project's creative direction regardless of style, technology, platform, or user demographics. The Summer22 Internship will take place from Juneth August th. This is a remote opportunity. The ideal person will possess the willingness and capacity to learn quickly and apply new knowledge. They will also have proven analytical skills, excellent written and oral communication abilities. We are in search of an energetic self-starter with a willingness to work hard, take on significant and multiple responsibilities, and with dedication towards excellence and achieving results. In addition to being an intellectually curious self-starter with the ability to work in a fast-paced, flexible team environment...We want to hear from you! Qualifications. Students in Master's level programs for one of the following fields: Graphic, Interaction, Industrial or Production Design, Game Design, Motion Graphics, Medical Illustration, Scientific Visualization, User Experience. A portfolio/demo reel online, including at least one project that demonstrates your work progression from start to finish. Graduation date between August22 May24. Anthem, Inc. has been named as a Fortune0 Best Companies to Work ForÂ®, is ranked as one of the20 Wo ld's Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine, and a20 America's Best Employers for Diversity by Forbes. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.antheminc.com. An Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran. Anthem promotes the delivery of  services  in a culturally competent manner and considers cultural competency when evaluating applicants for all Anthem positions.

name: Product Owner
description: Job Description. Description: (Remote). Have you built products from scratch? Have you launched new initiatives and grown them to billions in revenue? Have you dabbled in the new Web3 world? Are you a gamer to your core? If so, you belong here with us. GameStop is looking for a unique individual who can help accelerate the future of gaming and commerce. In this future, games are the places to go, and play is driven by the things you bring. Future creators wonâ€™t just build games but also the components, characters, and equipment. Blockchains will power the commerce underneath. An ideal candidate will have experience across several domains in gaming, content creation, partnerships, game design/development/mechanics, and a general understanding and experience with Ethereum, NFTs, and blockchain based gaming platforms. Job Responsibilities: Deeply understand what our gaming partners are trying to achieve and how NFTs can be a key business driver. Drive GameStopâ€™s future growth engine by building relationships with the newest, and largest game publishers in the world. Build a team to help creators launch their projects on the GameStop platform. Contribute to team projects to develop and refine our processes and vision for the future. Build deep relationships with executive stakeholders across multiple functions. Develop strategic plans for your target accounts and identify required supporting resources. Research and stay abreast of all new NFT/crypto projects and global gaming brands signaling interest in the space. Understand and lead integrations with different blockchains and Ethereum Layerenvironments. Job Requirements:10+ years in the gaming industry in Corp Dev, BD/Partnerships, Strategy roles OR in a sales role selling to C-level decision-makers across top global game publishers. Experience working in the blockchain/crypto space, especially with Ethereum and NFTs, or demonstrates domain knowledge and expertise. Proven record of delivering visionary new products. Proven ability to lead complex negotiations involving custom commercial agreements. Ability to operate in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment. Ability to take accountability for achieving metrics. Strong industry knowledge from experience working with large game publishers or selling to gaming companies. Nice to Have: Experience building and launching a technical product. An industry thought leader.

name: Cloud Security Compliance Manager
description: Job Description. BE PART OF A BANK LIKE NO OTHER. When you work with the world's most innovative companies, you know you're making a difference. Our clients are the game changers, leaders and investors who fuel the global innovation economy. They're the businesses behind the next medical breakthroughs. And the visionaries whose new technologies could transform the way people live and work. They come to SVB for our expertise, deep network and+ years of experience in the industries we serve, and to partner with diverse teams of passionate, enterprising SVBers, dedicated to an inclusive approach to helping them grow and succeed at every stage of their business. Join us at SVB and be part of bringing our clients' world-changing ideas to life. At SVB, we have the opportunity to grow and collectively make an impact by supporting the innovative clients and communities SVB serves. We pride ourselves in having both a diverse client roster and an equally diverse and inclusive organization. And we work diligently to encourage all with different ways of thinking, different ways of working, and especially those traditionally underrepresented in technology and financial services, to apply. Job Description. Silicon Valley Bank serves many of the most innovative companies in the world. Our clients are forward thinkers. True believers. Optimists. Game-changers. Inspired by them, we're changing the face of banking. We need technology experts with the same can-do attitude as our clients. We're looking for creative thinkers who want to create a truly seamless banking experience on a global scale. We have an exciting opportunity in our Governance, Risk and Compliance team. The Cloud Security Compliance Manager defines, specifies, contributes, implements, monitors, reviews, and measures effectiveness of security controls and security operations in SVB's AWS cloud environment. Ensures SVB is compliant to internal and industry security standards. This individual will be an integral part of the Global Services organization and will help improve the maturity level of cloud security risk practices across the bank, as the organization continues to grow at a rapid pace. Responsibilities: Testing of AWS technical and operational security controls that are considered safeguards and/or countermeasures to prevent unauthorized access, modification and disclosure of data, software and infrastructure. Audit cloud-based architectures that utilize AWS andd party services to enforce IAAA (Identification, authentication, authorization and accounting), principle of least privilege and need to know, separation of duties, fail-safe and secure, defense-in-depth, encryption, logging and monitoring of AWS infrastructure and applications. Perform ongoing evaluations of operations against prescribed security standards. Align security deliverables with legal, regulatory and contractual requirements that conforms with security framework and standards such as FFIEC (e.g. Handbooks, Cybersecurity Assessment  Tool) NIST SP0-53, PCI-DSS, CIS Controls. Establish processes and procedure for continuous monitoring to allow operational visibility, change control, incident response, alerting and maintenance of secure systems. Skills/Qualifications. years of IT audit and/or IT risk management experience at a Bigfirm, a financial services company or other regulated organization. Ability to effectively complete control testing work papers, collect supporting evidence from different stakeholders and share the testing results with control owners to work on defining action plans to remediate the gaps. Proactive, strong interpersonal skills. Bachelor's degree in information technology field. AWS Professional and Associate level certifications are a plus (e.g. Solutions Architect Professional, Security Special ty). Preferred Skills. Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent work experience. Years of Relevant Security and Risk Experience. AWS Cloud Experience. Prior BigIT Audit experience a plus. One or more professional certifications highly desirable, such as CGEIT, CISA, CISM, CISSP, CRISC. Working knowledge of (or willingness to learn) key regulations within risk management and financial services industry, such as FFIEC, GLBA, GDPR, PCI. Familiarity in IT risk, Information Security, and compliance activities and general understanding of industry frameworks (as such FFIEC CAT, FFIEC IT Handbooks, CIS Controls, NIST0-53, COBIT). Information security certifications (e.g. CISSP, CISA, GIAC, CCSP Certified Cloud Security Professional, et c.) are a plus. For more than years, SVB Financial Group (NASDAQ: SIVB) and its subsidiaries have helped innovative companies and their investors move bold ideas forward, fast. SVB Financial Group's businesses, including Silicon Valley Bank, offer commercial and private banking, asset management, private wealth management, brokerage and investment services and funds management services to companies in the technology, life science and healthcare, private equity and venture capital, and premium wine industries. Headquartered in Santa Clara, California, SVB Financial Group operates in centers of innovation around the world. Learn more at svb.com. SVB Financial Group is an equal opportunity employer. name: Sr. IT Risk Manager
description: Job Description. BE PART OF A BANK LIKE NO OTHER. When you work with the world's most innovative companies, you know you're making a difference. Our clients are the game changers, leaders and investors who fuel the global innovation economy. They're the businesses behind the next medical breakthroughs. And the visionaries whose new technologies could transform the way people live and work. They come to SVB for our expertise, deep network and nearly forty years of experience in the industries we serve, and to partner with diverse teams of passionate, enterprising SVBers, dedicated to an inclusive approach to helping them grow and succeed at every stage of their business. Join us at SVB and be part of bringing our clients' world-changing ideas to life. At SVB, we have the opportunity to grow and collectively make an impact by supporting the innovative clients and communities SVB serves. We pride ourselves in having both a diverse client roster and an equally diverse and inclusive organization. And we work diligently to encourage all with different ways of thinking, different ways of working, and especially those traditionally underrepresented in technology and financial services, to apply. Job Description. Silicon Valley Bank serves many of the most innovative companies in the world. Our clients are forward thinkers. True believers. Optimists. Game-changers. Inspired by them, we're changing the face of banking. We need technology experts with the same can-do attitude as our clients. We're looking for creative thinkers who want to create a truly seamless banking experience on a global scale. We have an exciting opportunity in our Governance, Risk and Compliance team. The Sr. IT Risk Manager will be responsible for running and improving the IT risk management program based on industry-accepted risk frameworks and SVB standards. This individual will be an integral part of the Global Services organization and will help improve the maturity level of IT risk practices across the bank, as the organization continues to grow at a rapid pace. This position will be focused on risk management activities for a the Technology Division at Silicon Valley Bank. This function has the core responsibility of leading and supporting the Technology organization in its efforts to identify, measure, monitor, and control IT risks. The IT Risk Manager will help provide support to other Business Risk Officers around identification and managing of risks. The role will focus on proactive identification and mitigation of Technology risks as well as responding to observations identified by third party auditors or examiners. The IT Risk Manager will also assist in developing periodic reports and dashboards presenting the level of controls compliance and the current IT risk posture. Primary Responsibilities: Lead various risk management activities for the IT Systems and Processes that support the Technology Function at SVB. The IT Risk Manager's primary responsibilities will be to identify, manage and report on risks related to IT systems/processes. Horizontal Relationships: Build effective relationships with various Business Lines within Technology, IT management and staff, as well as external stakeholders in Security, Compliance, Enterprise Risk Management, and Internal Audit. Broaden and deepen knowledge of the business and environment of IT with respect to the delivery of projects, strategic initiatives and systems portfolio to effectively assist IT managers and staff with risk and compliance management. Audit Coordination and Action Plan Development: Assist IT managers and staff with the audits and facilitate management response and remediation efforts. Verifying appropriate remediation measures are taken and effectively completed. Ensure overall IT compliance with regulatory requirements including SOX, GLBA and PCI through proactive planning and communication, ownership and relationships. SOX Coordination: Assist IT managers and staff with quarterly SOX walkthroughs, SOX control testing, IPE Co-ordination with the business. Identification and Verification of controls Hands on experience in identification of controls and testing controls specifically in security and privacy technology processes, data management process area preferred. Working with stakeholders to track and report control deficiency remediation progress. IT Risk Self-Assessments: Conduct information technology risk self-assessments to identify gaps and make sound recommendations for improvement. Identify acceptable levels of residual risk, and assist with action plans, policy and procedural changes for risk mitigation. Tracking and reporting the status of management action plans for the deficiencies identified through IT risk self-assessments, control self-testing, security assessments, and internal / external audits. Interpreting regulatory requirements into actionable internal IT controls and validating compliance with these requirements. IT Self-testing: Perform self-testing in areas within Information Technology to determine adherence to controls, policy, procedures and standards. Follow up on deficiencies identified in monitoring reviews, self-assessments, automated assessments, and internal and external audits to ensure appropriate remediation measures are taken. Active Action Plan Monitoring: Track mitigation steps (from self-assessments, exams, audits etc.) and ensure that risks are remediated appropriately and in a timely manner. Ensure all risks are logged in the appropriate GRC tool and actively tracked and managed. Policies, Standards, Procedures and Methods: Assist IT management and staff with the development of IT policies, standards, guidelines, procedures and methods. Champion industry best practices and standard frameworks such ISACA, COBIT, ITIL, CMMI, etc. Skills and Requirements: years of IT audit and/or IT risk management experience at a Bigfirm, a financial services company or other regulated organization. years hands on experience with SOX audit and experience in performing tests of design and effectiveness over IT controls. Technology Risk Management Experience with strong understanding of various Technology Functions. Ability to effectively complete control testing work papers, collect supporting evidence from different stakeholders and share the testing results with control owners to work on defining action plans to remediate the gaps. Capability to work on the multiple tasks simultaneously with minimal direction in in fast-paced environment. Proactive, strong interpersonal skills. Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Bachelors Degree Required. One or more professional certifications highly desirable, such as CGEIT, CISA, CISM, CISSP, CRISC. Experience with using or implementing GRC tools. Working knowledge of (or willingness to learn) key regulations within risk management and financial services industry, such as FFIEC, GLBA, GDPR, PCI. Familiarity in IT risk and compliance activities and general understanding of industry frameworks (as such COBIT, ITIL), and technology (Oracle database, Active Directory). Â©21 SVB Financial Group. Wealth Management Business Domain knowledge. Ability to effectively complete control testing work papers, collect supporting evidence from different stakeholders and share the testing results with control owners to work on defining action plans to remediate the gaps. Working knowledge of (or willingness to learn) key regulations within risk management and financial services industry, such as FFIEC, GLBA, GDPR, PCI. name: Sr. IT Risk Manager
description: Job Description. BE PART OF A BANK LIKE NO OTHER. When you work with the world's most innovative companies, you know you're making a difference. Our clients are the game changers, leaders and investors who fuel the global innovation economy. They're the businesses behind the next medical breakthroughs. And the visionaries whose new technologies could transform the way people live and work. They come to SVB for our expertise, deep network and nearly forty years of experience in the industries we serve, and to partner with diverse teams of passionate, enterprising SVBers, dedicated to an inclusive approach to helping them grow and succeed at every stage of their business. Join us at SVB and be part of bringing our clients' world-changing ideas to life. At SVB, we have the opportunity to grow and collectively make an impact by supporting the innovative clients and communities SVB serves. We pride ourselves in having both a diverse client roster and an equally diverse and inclusive organization. And we work diligently to encourage all with different ways of thinking, different ways of working, and especially those traditionally underrepresented in technology and financial services, to apply. Job Description. Silicon Valley Bank serves many of the most innovative companies in the world. Our clients are forward thinkers. True believers. Optimists. Game-changers. Inspired by them, we're changing the face of banking. We need technology experts with the same can-do attitude as our clients. We're looking for creative thinkers who want to create a truly seamless banking experience on a global scale. We have an exciting opportunity in our Governance, Risk and Compliance team. The Sr. IT Risk Manager will be responsible for running and improving the IT risk management program based on industry-accepted risk frameworks and SVB standards. This individual will be an integral part of the Global Services organization and will help improve the maturity level of IT risk practices across the bank, as the organization continues to grow at a rapid pace. This position will be focused on risk management activities for a the Technology Division at Silicon Valley Bank. This function has the core responsibility of leading and supporting the Technology organization in its efforts to identify, measure, monitor, and control IT risks. The IT Risk Manager will help provide support to other Business Risk Officers around identification and managing of risks. The role will focus on proactive identification and mitigation of Technology risks as well as responding to observations identified by third party auditors or examiners. The IT Risk Manager will also assist in developing periodic reports and dashboards presenting the level of controls compliance and the current IT risk posture. Primary Responsibilities: Lead various risk management activities for the IT Systems and Processes that support the Technology Function at SVB. The IT Risk Manager's primary responsibilities will be to identify, manage and report on risks related to IT systems/processes. Horizontal Relationships: Build effective relationships with various Business Lines within Technology, IT management and staff, as well as external stakeholders in Security, Compliance, Enterprise Risk Management, and Internal Audit. Broaden and deepen knowledge of the business and environment of IT with respect to the delivery of projects, strategic initiatives and systems portfolio to effectively assist IT managers and staff with risk and compliance management. Audit Coordination and Action Plan Development: Assist IT managers and staff with the audits and facilitate management response and remediation efforts. Verifying appropriate remediation measures are taken and effectively completed. Ensure overall IT compliance with regulatory requirements including SOX, GLBA and PCI through proactive planning and communication, ownership and relationships. SOX Coordination: Assist IT managers and staff with quarterly SOX walkthroughs, SOX control testing, IPE Co-ordination with the business. Identification and Verification of controls Hands on experience in identification of controls and testing controls specifically in security and privacy technology processes, data management process area preferred. Working with stakeholders to track and report control deficiency remediation progress. IT Risk Self-Assessments: Conduct information technology risk self-assessments to identify gaps and make sound recommendations for improvement. Identify acceptable levels of residual risk, and assist with action plans, policy and procedural changes for risk mitigation. Tracking and reporting the status of management action plans for the deficiencies identified through IT risk self-assessments, control self-testing, security assessments, and internal / external audits. Interpreting regulatory requirements into actionable internal IT controls and validating compliance with these requirements. IT Self-testing: Perform self-testing in areas within Information Technology to determine adherence to controls, policy, procedures and standards. Follow up on deficiencies identified in monitoring reviews, self-assessments, automated assessments, and internal and external audits to ensure appropriate remediation measures are taken. Active Action Plan Monitoring: Track mitigation steps (from self-assessments, exams, audits etc.) and ensure that risks are remediated appropriately and in a timely manner. Ensure all risks are logged in the appropriate GRC tool and actively tracked and managed. Policies, Standards, Procedures and Methods: Assist IT management and staff with the development of IT policies, standards, guidelines, procedures and methods. Champion industry best practices and standard frameworks such ISACA, COBIT, ITIL, CMMI, etc. Skills and Requirements: years of IT audit and/or IT risk management experience at a Bigfirm, a financial services company or other regulated organization. years hands on experience with SOX audit and experience in performing tests of design and effectiveness over IT controls. Technology Risk Management Experience with strong understanding of various Technology Functions. Ability to effectively complete control testing work papers, collect supporting evidence from different stakeholders and share the testing results with control owners to work on defining action plans to remediate the gaps. Capability to work on the multiple tasks simultaneously with minimal direction in in fast-paced environment. Proactive, strong interpersonal skills. Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Bachelors Degree Required. One or more professional certifications highly desirable, such as CGEIT, CISA, CISM, CISSP, CRISC. Experience with using or implementing GRC tools. Working knowledge of (or willingness to learn) key regulations within risk management and financial services industry, such as FFIEC, GLBA, GDPR, PCI. Familiarity in IT risk and compliance activities and general understanding of industry frameworks (as such COBIT, ITIL), and technology (Oracle database, Active Directory). Â©21 SVB Financial Group. name: Senior Software Engineer/Java/Kotlin/AWS/Marina del Rey/$165K base
description: Job Description. A well-funded start up in Marina del Rey is on the hunt for a senior software engineer for their backend engineering team. In a world where the word "disruptor" is flying around constantly, these guys are truly disrupting an industry whose archaism is truly shocking in today's world of artificial intelligence and NLP. This engineer should also have a very open-minded perspective when it comes to the day to day work responsibilities of a lean-Agile environment in the AI space. You'll get to work with a very collaborative and smart engineering team and this role comes with full benefits, stock options, unlimited paid time off,1K matching at and they can offer a base of $165K. Required Skills and Experience At leastyears of experience in a JVM language. Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science. Prior startup experience a plus. What You Will Be Doing Tech Breakdown0% Hands on Java development. The Offer Competitive Salary: Up to $165,000/year, DOE. You will receive the following benefits: Brand new office space. Competitive health, dental, and vision insurance. Stock options. Free snacks, beer, drinks, cold brew on tap. Game room. Highly valued engineering environment where everyone is super collaborative and smart. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future.

name: Sr. Producer
description: Job Description. Sr. Producer. New Iron is seeking a Sr. Game Producer to join a highly successful Austin studio. You will be responsible for the growth and management of backend developers, including game development, platform tech, database, DevOps, and infrastructure. The ideal candidate: Manage multiple game production projects. Ensure the delivery and requirements aligned with the organization goals. Solid understanding of software development life cycle. Passionate about mobile games. You will have the opportunity to leave a direct impact on the performance of the product and player satisfaction while having your work seen by millions of players! You would be responsible for: Act as the coach, champion, and guardian of the team's development processes, goals, and commitments. Drive development meetings with clear agendas, capture action items, and information to the team. Enhancing and fostering existing Agile project delivery processes. Mentor, evaluate, resolve conflicts, and recognize the achievements of the teams to encourage growth and improvement. Manage various large-scale initiatives from concept through production such as maintenance, updates, enhancements, redesigns, etc. Help drive and ensure development and QA processes for overall product quality and testing. Facilitate off-shore development initiatives to develop and drive long-term strategies for production discipline. Remove roadblocks and successfully drive features to completion. Own production for the development team by focusing on important initiatives, predictable and/or regular deliveries, and ongoing pipeline improvements. Scope proposals and own project plans and deliver projects on time. Work closely with business stakeholders and discipline leads on upcoming releases, roadmaps to maintain alignment and meet expectations. Should Have: years of experience in game production. Closely worked with product/backend development team. Deep knowledge of game development such as team dynamics, common development hurdles, game engines, development milestones, etc. Ability to prioritize product initiatives by balancing both team and business. Demonstrated experience using modern production software to schedule, track work, and version control tools. Ability to work with global cross-functional teams. Able to take direction, problem-solving and adapt in a fast-paced, analytical and creative environment with professional consideration for deadlines and quality standards. Works well within an open, highly collaborative environment. Comfortable working in a-hour live environment. Team player, high level of initiative, and intellectually curious self-starter. Experience practicing Agile development (E.g.,Scrum/Kanban, CI/CD) with hard deadlines. Ability to com municate both business and technology concepts effectively across all organization levels. Nice to Have: Experience with casino games platforms. Previously shipped or supported mobile games. Deep understanding of mobile free to play games. Experience using Azure DevOps for project management. Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer. Principals only. name: Lead Cloud Automation Engineer-OPEN TO 100% REMOTE
description: Job Description. What you'll do. Do you have a passion for Cloud technologies and Automation? The Lead Cloud Automation Engineer works closely with architects, application development and cloud delivery teams to develop and maintain automation and self-service solutions that support Hand R Block application teams. This position uses state of the art tools, languages, coding standards and best practices to develop new features and capabilities. You will be challenged to continuously improve our automation and self-service capabilities through innovation in order to simplify and improve the developer experience. About the Job: Serve as Azure technology lead, thought leader and technology expert for Hand R Block. Lead Team providing technical expertise to design, develop and maintain automation platforms responsible for delivering cloud infrastructure that is scalable, highly available, and fault tolerant on Microsoft Azure Cloud. Lead efforts to design and implement self-service cloud offerings using Terraform Enterprise, working closely with App/Dev teams to accelerate the adoption of new MS Azure Cloud features and services. Implement Architecture and Security standards through automation to ensure cloud infrastructure adheres to approved design patterns and security posture. Serve as a thought leader incorporating DevOps practices for automation of application installation, code deployment, configuration, and ongoing support tasks. Positively and proactively lead and influence the team providing coaching and mentorship to junior members. Benefits: Unlimited vacation and sick day policy. Competitive salary,1(k) and bonus plan. Opportunity for career development in a fast-paced, progressive company. Team volunteering events and off-site outings. Game rooms with pool tables, ping pong, foosball. Onsite Cafeteria and Fitness Center. Downtown location in the Power and Light District. It would be even better if you also had. Experience coaching and mentoring a team in large enterprise environments. Experience with cloud based serverless, storage and developer tools technologies. Familiar with build and deployment automation. Comfortable programing against an API. Implementing Pipelines for infrastructure automation. Understanding of GitOps principles for configuration management. What you'll bring to the team. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, or the equivalent through a combination of education and work experience. Experience in object-oriented software design and development. Experience working in an Agile/SCRUM software development team.+ Years development/architecture experience. Years Cloud Orchestration and Automation experience Azure (Preferred), AWS or Google Cloud Platform. Years experience in languages and infrastructure such as Terraform, Go, Python, C, C++, and scripting. About Hand R Block. We're here to live our purpose-to provide help and inspire confidence in our clients and communities everywhere. We take our work personally, because we know what it represents: Families and homes. Livelihoods and lives. We've been true to that purpose since brothers Henry and Richard Bloch founded our company in55. Since then, we've grown to approximately,000 tax offices throughout the United States and around the world. When you join our team, you'll add to the momentum of a forward-thinking company-one that defined an industry and is now leading its transformation. Sponsored Job. #hrbjob #LI-SH1.

name: Senior Application Security Engineer
description: Job Description. Overview. Bethesda Softworks is looking for a world class Senior Application Security Engineer to join a highly skilled team of senior security professionals responsible for security of AAA titles, digital platforms, and data in live and studio development environments. The ideal candidate has a proven record of developing, testing, and reviewing security measures within products at a source code level. Prior game development experience and an ability to understand the unique challenges facing the industry is a definite bonus. Responsibilities. Read and write professional-grade source code in a variety of languages. Perform security reviews of applications (including games) and source code, policies, systems, and solutions in order to continue to strengthen Zenimax commercial products, platforms, and services. Reverse-engineer and manipulate Zenimax games and applications, by request, to identify and help correct vulnerabilities that may be exploited for illicit cheating or hacking. Provide detailed security review reports to developers and other stakeholders. Adhere to high-quality standards and best practices, high performance, and scalable, repeatable processes and deliverables in accordance with applicable regulations. Keep up with development and security trends in the video game industry and in the technology sector in general. Occasional travel required. Qualifications. years application security experience; or years software engineering experience including some application security experience. Advanced experience reading and writing source code in a variety of languages. Knowledgeable in security aspects of operating system internals. Introductory knowledge of scripting languages or similar (Python, GoLang, Rust, etc). Advanced low-level debugging experience using tools such as IDA Pro, Ghidra, WinDbg, etc. Strong engineering skills with attention to detail. Significant Git version control experience. Ability to multi-task and thrive on a small team in a fast-paced environment. Passionate about security technologies, techniques, and trends. Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal skills. Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science, or similar, or equivalent experience. Preferred Skills. Visual Studio. Experience with C. Usage and understanding of cryptographic libraries and implementations. Build system implementation using cmake/make. Perforce version control (P4V). Cloud computing and infrastructure (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure, OpenStack, etc). Software product deployment. Game industry technologies. Job Details RESPONSIBILITIES Participate in all aspects of the project life-cycle, from design to release. Design, code, unit test, and maintain codebases that work at scale for large communities. Enjoy collaborating with others to deliver high quality team results. Happy to use the code review process to communicate and mentor oneself and others. REQUIREMENTS Computer Science degree, or equivalent work experience. Skilled in multiple languages (JS, TS, C#, C++, Java, or Python). Solid foundational development skills / concepts (OOP, TDD, SOLID, GOF, data structures, algorithms, etc.). Advanced debugging skills, involving multithreading, memory leaks, etc. years demonstrable experience in server technologies (C#, Node.js, Java, etc.). years demonstrable experience in client technologies (React, TS , CSS, etc.). Experience working as part of a lean, agile engineering team. A passion for games, and an understanding of how they work. Good communication skills. POSITIVES Cloud infrastructure experience (AWS, Google Cloud Platform). Experienced with AWS Features (S3, Lambda, Xray, EventBridge, EC2, Route, etc.). Unity. Open Source Contributor. Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

name: Accessibility Program Manager
description: Job Description. Apex is partnering with a large Video Game Enterprise to hire an Accessibility Program Manager. This is a contract role; candidates can work remotely but availability for meetings during PST is preferable. The gaming accessibility team is responsible for ensuring all products meet compliance standards as well as expanding the understanding of accessibility both internally and externally. The team also focuses on driving accessibility of products in the market that go beyond compliance in order to create a usable and efficient experience for all players and game creators. Job Description: Manage content updates and drive partner reviews of SharePoint sites, technical documentation, and accessibility training content. Review accessibility and developer documentation for accuracy and updated content. Gather resources, content and supporting documentation for accessibility projects including translating requirements into content. Generate status update mails and follow-ups, with attention to details. Provide daily support for managing delivery of project tasks, activities, milestones, and resources across several projects. Develop, maintain, and manage project requirements, plans, timeline, issues, risks, and challenges. Maintains process documentation, supervises task distribution and scheduling of consultations. Responsible for creating, monitoring, and maintaining quality control of content, including HTML markup. Organize and facilitate accessibility focused training and education efforts. Typical task breakdown and rhythm -hours of planned meetings.hours of research, managing content, inbox triage, bug tagging, reviews.hours of heads down. Chance for flex hours or remote? Possibility for flex hours (EST hours) but will mainly be PST hours, may work remote but have the opportunity to go into office from time to time The gaming accessibility team are driven in the evolution of gaming and inclusivity. In this role you will be exposed to industry experts and insights that relate to accessibility. This team is extremely diverse, welcoming and collaborative Degrees or certifications required? - Bachelor's degree. Certifications: Trusted Tester, CPACC, PCWA or accessibility user research. Disqualifiers Lack of experience in accessibility and the disability community, Lack of knowledge of gaming and technology requisites Best vs. average Great personality and drive to be a part of the accessibility community. Exceeds years of  xperience and well adverse in the required skillset. Accessibility knowledge3 years. Program management experience3 years. Gaming knowledge and experience (gaming frameworks, engines and hardware is preferred)3 years. Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Visual Studio ADO and HTML mark-up skills.

name: Sr. Cloud Automation Engineer
description: Job Description. What you'll do. Job Summary: Do you have a passion for Cloud technologies and Automation? The Sr. Cloud Automation Engineer works closely with architects, application development and cloud delivery teams to develop and maintain automation and self-service solutions that support Hand R Block application teams. This position uses state of the art tools, languages, coding standards and best practices to develop new features and capabilities. You will be challenged to continuously improve our automation and self-service capabilities through innovation in order to simplify and improve the developer experience. About the Job: Provide technical expertise to design, develop and maintain automation platforms responsible for delivering cloud infrastructure that is scalable, highly available, and fault tolerant on Microsoft Azure Cloud. Automate deployment, configuration, monitoring, and lifecycle management for Cloud Components. Design/Implement self-service cloud offerings using Terraform Enterprise, working closely with App/Dev teams in the adoption of new MS Azure Cloud features and services. Implement Architecture and Security standards through automation to ensure cloud infrastructure adheres to approved design patterns and security posture. Serve as a thought leader incorporating DevOps practices for automation of application installation, code deployment, configuration, and ongoing support tasks. Positively and proactively lead and influence the team. Benefits: Unlimited vacation and sick day policy. Competitive salary,1(k) and bonus plan. Opportunity for career development in a fast-paced, progressive company. Team volunteering events and off-site outings. Game rooms with pool tables, ping pong, foosball. Onsite Cafeteria and Fitness Center. Downtown location in the Power and Light District. It would be even better if you also had. Desired Experience: Serverless technologies. Familiar with build and deployment automation. Comfortable programing against an API. Implementing Pipelines for infrastructure automation. Understanding of GitOps principles for configuration management. Relevant Technologies: Terraform. Go. Python. NET/.NET Core. Ansible. PowerShell. Bash. Kubernetes/AKS. Git. VSCode. Azure DevOps. Azure Functions. What you'll bring to the team. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, or the equivalent through a combination of education and work experience. Experience in object-oriented software design and development. Experience working in an Agile/SCRUM software development team. Years Cloud Orchestration and Automation experience Azure (Preferred), AWS or Google Cloud Platform. Years experience in languages and infrastructure such as Terraform, Go, Python, C, C++, and scripting. About Hand R Block. We're here to live our purpose-to provide help and inspire confidence in our clients and communities everywhere. We take our work personally, because we know what it represents: Families and homes. Livelihoods and lives. We've been true to that purpose since brothers Henry and Richard Bloch founded our company in55. Since then, we've grown to approximately,000 tax offices throughout the United States and around the world. When you join our team, you'll add to the momentum of a forward-thinking company-one that defined an industry and is now leading its transformation. Sponsored Job. #hrbjob #LI-SH1.

name: Senior Data Engineer
description: Job Description. Overview. Bethesda Game Studios is seeking a qualified Data Warehouse Engineer to work with the BGS game analytics team in building and maintaining back end data solutions, utilizing AWS technologies, to support analytics initiatives to improve player experience and game performance as well as increase player retention and monetization. Responsibilities. Work with other data engineers and game analysts to build new and extend existing data structures to support game analytics. Develop, maintain, and support ETL processes for loading data from multiple data sources into a Redshift data warehouse. Maintain and develop all physical data models for EDW. Maintain large, multi-terabyte data warehouse which includes performance tuning and data retention/purge processes Research and troubleshoot data quality issues, providing fixes and proposing both short and long-term solutions. Prepare designs for database systems and recommend improvements for performance. Maintain and develop various database scripts and tools to facilitate automation process. Provide support to all data warehouse initiatives. Evaluate all proposals requests and assist to improve structure of data warehouse. Qualifications. years of experience in a data warehousing, data engineering, or data architect role. years of experience in developing, managing, and maintaining large, multi-terabyte data warehouse environments including the pipelines of data and ETL processes feeding into it. Experience with full life cycle development, architecture, and implementation, of an enterprise data warehouse. Strong experience with AWS Redshift or similar databases. Experience working with other AWS data technologies such as S3, Redshift Spectrum, Athena, Data Pipeline, Glue, EMR, RDS, and Kinesis. Expert level SQL skills. Data modeling experience for both transactional and data warehousing environments including familiarity with Kimball dimensional andF modeling standards. Experience working with a variety of data sources such as MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, S3, HDFS, and MongoDB. Strong interpersonal skills and problem-solving ability. Preferred Skills. Apache Spark experience a major plus (Spark RODs, Spark DataFrames, Spark SQL). Streaming Data Technologies (Pub/Sub, Kafka, Kinesis, etc). Experience with the Spark / Hadoop Eco-System (Hive, Parquet). Understanding of Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Compute, or Microsoft Azure. Experience with nonrelational databases or NoSQL Databases encouraged. Experience working with very large datasets highly encouraged. Working experience with an agile development framework. Experience with AWS CloudFormation for creating and managing a variety of AWS resources. Experience with Python and Linux shell scripting. Experience using source control systems (Git, Perforce, SVN, etc.). Familiarity or experience working with big data solutions such as Apache Spark, PrestoDB, Kafka, etc. Familiarity or experience with statistics and data analysis. Familiarity or experience with DevOps and infrastructure automation. Prior experience working in a game development studio or gaming company developing online titles. Passion or personal interest in video gaming and or BGS games. BS Degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, or equivalent. A personal interest in video gaming is a plus. We embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion in everything we do from recruiting for our studios, publishing and operations to fostering safe and respectful workplaces that encourage collaboration. Our culture is based on principles of respect, inclusion, and fair treatment and we welcome anyone into our family without regard to race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, or age. Our diversity fuels our innovation and inspires us to create game worlds that bring us closer to the global community of players we serve.

name: Node.js Backend Developer
description: Job Description. As our Node developer you will be part of the team that contributes to developing the services which connect the platforms which drive the company's technology strategy. The developer ensures code quality, tests and distributes code updates, and monitor the health and stability of production systems. You will be part of an exciting and forward-thinking team that leverages latest technology to advance our technology platforms. Responsibilities. Design and build enterprise webservices for our Conduit platform. Collaborate with various development teams to define, design, and develop new features. Write unit tests to ensure robustness, usability, and general reliability. Resolve bugs and improve application performance. description: Job Description. About CF Industries: At CF Industries, our mission is to provide clean energy to feed and fuel the world sustainably. Our employees are focused on safe and reliable operations, environmental stewardship, and disciplined capital and corporate management. By joining CF, you will be part of a team that brings their varied experiences, wide-ranging knowledge and diverse talents together to deliver important work and you'll be able to pursue complex, exciting opportunities that help you continue to grow and achieve your potential in different areas. You'll take pride in working for a company that lives its values and where you can be yourself at work, as part of an authentic team that encourages you to share your views and opinions. Our nine manufacturing complexes in the United States, Canada, and the United Kingdom, an unparalleled storage, transportation and distribution network in North America, and logistics capabilities enabling a global reach underpin our strategy to leverage our unique capabilities to accelerate the world's transition to clean energy. Function: Information Technology Job Summary: Accountable for the full range and end-to-end design of business intelligence and data visualization solutions to meet complex business challenges. Equally skilled using business intelligence technology tools and understanding the operational reporting and analytics needs related to Environmental Health Safety and Quality I.T. solutions. Job Description: Job Responsibilities: Read and review existing process documentation and business reporting to understand current state. Contribute to the development of business requirements documentation and user test case scenarios. Extracts data from existing databases using established and routine reporting techniques. Builds basic data visualization reports and dashboards. Assists end user analysts with data analysis and interpretation. Possesses in-depth knowledge of the processes within a functional area of the business and the corresponding data. Understands the data available, including detail definition and the relationships of core business elements. Works across multiple functional business areas to bring data together in ways that enable end-to-end business process reporting and analysis. Mentors junior Business Intelligence Data Analysts. Internal Controls: Understands and complies with established departmental processes and procedures designed to support internal controls efforts. Identifies and brings to the attention of department management internal controls deficiencies. Successful candidates will have: BA/BS degree or its equivalent in business, information systems, or data analytics.plus years of professional work experience. Prior experience remotely supporting multiple geographically dispersed plants. Prior experience with Tableau and MS SQL Server. Ability to work effectively with all levels of management in a deadline-oriented environment. Excellent oral and written communication skills with organization and time management skills. Ability to learn, demonstrate and apply knowledge of the business over to information systems solutions and processes. Prior experience with the following technologies and applications: Velocity EHS, Labvantage, Lenel, Kallidus eLearning, SQL server, C#, and Angular technology experience a plus. Prior experience working with EHS business partners and familiarity with the following terms and concepts: incidents, events, observations, management of change Process Hazard Analysis and risk are also pluses. Position Scope/Contribution: This position is responsible for data extraction, reporting and analytics. The incumbent must evaluate and determine needs appropriately and within scope. Some travel may be required. What We Offer: You'll enjoy competitive compensation, consisting of base pay plus an incentive program available to all full-time employees, and a comprehensive benefits package including high-quality healthcare options, a well-being incentive program,1k, pension, life and disability insurance, generous time off (with time off to volunteer) and much more! Additionally, we offer several Flexible Work Arrangements to support a healthy work-life balance. You will be part of a team that brings their varied experiences, wide-ranging knowledge and diverse talents together to deliver important work, and you'll be able to pursue complex, exciting opportunities that help you continue to grow and achieve your potential in different areas. You'll take pride in working for a company that lives its values and gain a sense of fulfillment knowing that you're working with purpose, to provide clean energy to feed and fuel the world sustainably. CF Industries is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status. Employees in the US can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster (PDF). and others as detailed below: CF Industries is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status. If you need any assistance seeking a job opportunity at CF Industries, or if you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please call7-405-2400 or contact us at cfhire@cfindustries.com. Knowledge of programming languages across various software platforms, using DB2, SQL, and/or relational databases. Ability to analyze data results, determine the source of aberrant statistics, and resolve data issues. Preferred Skills and Abilities: Computer programming skills. Negotiation or persuasion skills.
