name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. About: Infostretch is a pure-play digital engineering services firm focused on helping companies accelerate their digital initiatives from strategy and planning through execution. We leverage deep technical expertise, Agile methodologies, and data-driven intelligence to modernize systems of engagement and simplify human/tech interaction. We deliver custom solutions that meet customersâ€™ technology needs wherever they are in their digital lifecycle. Backed by Goldman Sachs and Everstone Capital, Infostretch works with both large enterprises and emerging innovators - putting digital to work to enable new products and business models, engage with customers in new ways, and create sustainable competitive differentiation. Job Description: Infostretch is looking for a Data Analyst. Our mission is to build the next generation, web scale platform for Client. Environment: Complex. Highly elastic. Based on some of the latest and greatest cloud native technologies. Very fast paced. Your team will be. Enabling a proper enterprise Data Lake in AWS. Engaging regularly with stakeholders to understand and implement business logic. Building models and tools to get value out of the mass amounts of data we have in our environment. Enabling the best, most personalized and resilient customer experience possible. In order to be successful in this role, you will need to be. Highly motivated, driven and hard working. Not afraid to fail and comfortable working independently and with a team. Comfortable working with massive datasets in real time and batch processing with superior analytics skills. Comfortable talking to and working with Senior Executives. Apply data mining techniques, do ad-hoc analysis and present results in a clear manner. Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis. Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems. Basic Requirements: Basic statistical hypothetical testing. years professional enterprise experience. Working knowledge of data analysis and visualization tools, such as Microsoft PowerBI and Tableau. Functional experience with database software, such as AWS Athena, Redshift, MySQL. Signicant attention to detail and an ability to quickly spot and x problems. Experience working in a team setting and desire to take leadership roles within a team. Detail-oriented and a strict attention and appreciation for deadlines. Technologies in our environment. Here are some of the key technologies that make up our environment. While we do not expect you to have a detailed understanding of each, the more of these you are familiar with the better. MUST HAVE visualization tool experience along with below skills. Strong SQL experience. Dashboarding experience using Tableau or similar tools. Python. GOOD TO HAVE. New-Relic. AWS Big Data Tools: S3, Kinesis, Red Shift, Athena. Education Qualification: B.S .in computer science, software engineer ing, computer engineering, electrical engineering, or related area of study. Why join Infostretch Corporation? An excellent salary and bonus package are just the start with an Infostretch career. We also provide medical, dental, vision,1k with company match, company paid life insurance, paid time off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, gym reimbursement is standard here. Add to that annual performance evaluations, company parties and family picnics and you ve got a career that continually rewards your effort. There s nothing more important to our success than our employees and we prove it every day. This is a direct hire full-time position. If you feel that this is a good match for your skill-sets please send a current word version of your resume along with a cover letter describing your skills, experience and salary expectations. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).

name: Data Analyst II
description: Job Description. Career Opportunity: Job Title: Data Analyst II. About CodeForce0. Making a career choice is amongst the most critical choices one can make, and it's important for the choice to be calculated with factors such as a company's run of success since its inception and more. But, when you come across a company that has reputation proven with nothing but an illustrious run of success since the day it began, you don't need to think of anything else. That's precisely what some of our employees and prospective employees think when they came across CodeForce0. Position Overview. Data Analyst II. Qualified individuals will be contacted for an interview.

name: Senior Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Position: Sr. Data Analyst. Location: Remote. Duration: Long Term. Data Analyst Need to stay ahead of the competition on the newest tools that can be implemented to create efficiency. However, the skills required for managing the operations usually come through the experience or by enrolling in specific development programs, which can help further the career in the set direction. The Daily.. Help build and maintain data products such as but not limited to Subscriber, Product, Content and Ads Analytics.. Work closely with stakeholders to understand and document requirements â€“ both strategic and tactical in nature â€“ educate stakeholders by providing data and insights where needed.. Conduct deep data analysis in large consumer data in order to understand and support stakeholder needs.. Work closely within data engineering sprint team to prioritize and build data products to meet the requirements, act as product lead when needed to educate engineers and clarify stakeholder requirements, support the team by conducting validation (UAT) when needed.. Change how we think, act, and utilize our data by performing exploratory and quantitative analytics, data mining, and discovery.. Work closely with data engineers and business stakeholders to make data easily accessible and understandable to them.. Ensure data quality by using data quality frameworks in place.. Be passionate about growing team â€“ participate in hiring analysts and interns. The Essentials. Expertise in analyzing large amount of data using big data tools and frameworks such as Spark, Hadoop, Hive, Snowflake, RedShift or similar.. Expertise in SQL, Spark SQL, Hive etc.. Expertise in OLAP databases such as Snowflake, Redshift. ETL, Hadoop,. Experience with Analytics Tools such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI, RShiny, Redash, Google Analytics, D3.js, GIT is preferred.. Cloud (AWS) experience  is preferred AWS, Google cloud, S3, AWS Lambda. Machine Learning experience is preferred.. Ability to learn and teach new languages and frameworks.

name: Supply Chain Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Data Analyst ( Supply Chain). Contractyears Remote with ocassional travel. Job Duties: Build and distribute data analytics reports. Review and resolve electronic order exceptions for contract, price, packaging, and catalog number discrepancies. Maintain contract file, providing proactive contract management, to include scanning, tracking, and renewal notices for contracts. Proactively manage group purchasing organization (GPO) contracts. Complete cost analysis on GPO contracts. Conduct a monthly review of GPO contracts for tier validation. Review price change notifications against existing and potential contracts. Conduct a daily review and analysis of purchase order price changes. Generate data to support PAR level reviews for departmental customers. Maintain daily departmental dashboard. Maintain documentation of department savings. Prepare monthly departmental scoreboard. Other duties as assigned.

name: Senior Data Analyst

name: Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Knoxville, TN | Sr. Data Analyst | Full time. We are actively recruiting an Sr. Data Analyst. for our client in Knoxville, TN. This position is a direct hire position that will be working remotely but will have to come onsite once a quarter for meetings etc. As the Data Analyst you will be held accountable for providing data analytics to our client's ecosystem utilizing a no code/low code approach. The data reported will maintain a high level of integrity and accuracy. This will include preparing and distributing various reports as well as gathering requirements for new reporting needs from relevant interested parties. This will be done by developing the data architecture, identifying data locations, and ensuring appropriate controls are in place to ensure data integrity. The Data Analyst will be expected to provide seniority and leadership to the growing Data Analytics practice inside the Enterprise Applications functional group. Due to client request, qualified candidates must be eligible to work in the United States without sponsorship. Responsibilities: Build strong and effective relationships with internal and external business partners. Analyze the current data architecture. Recommend solutions and methods to modernize data architecture. Lead projects delivering reporting and analytical solutions to internal customers. Complete data discovery projects â€“ identify all data, obtain/build data dictionaries. Identify key indicators to link data and assist with selection of data warehouse options. Build necessary data pipelines to support a modern data architecture. Build, maintain and improve new and existing ETL pipelines between Microsoft SQL. Server databases, H360 (DB2), Cognos, Power BI, online data sources, and SaaS applications. Create and maintain flow chart and internal control structure/process around data. Work with business partners to drive the evolution of data analytics processes. Plan, review, and/or support preparation of internal and external reports,reconciliations, tables, and schedules. Identify opportunities to streamline, automate, and improve efficiencies to reduce costs. Maintain general knowledge of bank products, processes, and procedures to ensure proper reporting and classification of system level data. Maintain and develop database and other related tools to support data reporting and transform needs as assigned. Participate and adhere to change management and documentation required by IT policy. Design SQL database tables and structures along with creating views, functions and stored procedures; create database triggers for use in automation and maintain data quality for overseeing database security and performance. Performs other duties as assigned. Assist with development and implementation of data governance program. Complies with all applicable federal, state, and local banking and industry related laws and regulations. Experience: Microsoft SQL (Views, Stored Procedures, Subqueries, Common Table Expressions, etc.) and Power BI. IBM Cognos. Python and its related data transformation. Excel (Power Query and Power Pivot). Data Visualization (experience making the data tell a story). Banking industry. Qualifications: Bachelorâ€™s Degree.years of experience in Data Analysis. Banking or financial industry experience. â€œEqual Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.

description: Job Description. Lighthouse Investment Partners, LLC ("Lighthouse") is an alternative investment manager with assets under management of approximately $13 billion. Lighthouse's global investors include pension plans, corporations, insurance companies, endowments, public and private foundations, family offices and individual investors. Lighthouse currently has approximately0 employees and offers a full range of benefits that include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability coverage, and a1(k)-retirement plan with company match. The position of SQL Report writer and data analyst primary reporting line is to the Associate Director of software development. The ideal candidate is proficient in T-SQL including creating tables, views, stored procedures that would be used in the reporting process. Competent in other disciplines like RDBMS concepts, query optimization, database normalization concepts, coding and naming standards, scheduling and delivery of reports. Candidate needs to be self-motivated, resourceful, excellent in time management, comfortable working with onshore and offshore resources in cross-functional teams. date: november21. Strong knowledge of T-SQL including creating views, tables, stored procedures, scalar and table values functions for reporting purposes. Strong knowledge of RDBMS database structures, normalization concepts, indexes and query optimization concepts, ability to work with large amounts of data. Knowledge of working with Visual Studio, TFS and GIT environment with multiple team members. Knowledge of standards in software development and implementation. Proficient knowledge of Excel and VBA. Required Skills/Characteristics. Highly motivated self-starter with an appetite for knowledge. Ability to manage multiple reports and tasks at once with strong attention to detail. Experience in capital/stock markets is a plus. Strong organizational skills with the ability to set, organize and meet priorities. Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. name: Senior Full Stack Engineer (Remote or Hybrid)
description: Job Description. About Us: Ezoic is an Artificial Intelligence company that works with thousands of online publishers, helping them use machine learning to make smart decisions about the layouts, advertisements, and features that users see. These publishers range from individuals to small and medium-sized companies. We have our headquarters in Carlsbad, CA, with a team of very smart free-thinking individuals. Ezoic is a VC-backed startup that is growing quickly. It's a unique opportunity to both be part of a revolutionary product in its earlier stages and work on something that already touches hundreds of millions of people a month. About You: You must be a tech-savvy professional who enjoys learning about new technologies and solving problems. This is a fast-moving engineering role where you will be able to work on core products and develop designs and functionality from scratch. You must enjoy collaborating with other smart engineers, creating scalable solutions to improve publishersâ€™ digital properties. Qualifications include: years relevant work experience. Strong knowledge of SQL. Experience with Node/PHP/GOLANG to retrieve and process data. Strong client-side HTML/CSS/JavaScript/AJAX skills and experience. Ability to create wireframes and designs that result in a great user experience. Familiarity with cross-browser testing and debugging. Experience developing Chrome extensions is a plus. About the role: Your contributions will have a meaningful and visible impact on the company on a daily basis. You will be building tools for three distinct audiences: Our publishers, providing tools to control and customize their sites and provide feedback on key performance metrics from the artificial intelligence engine. Our users, creating widgets and features used across thousands of sites to provide advanced functionality, which will be automatically enabled or disabled via the Ezoic engine at a granular level. The Ezoic team, providing access to data and features to allow the team to analyze performance, identify issues, and make changes to manage site performance. Technologies used: Javascript, Vue.js. CSS. HTML5. MySQL. Linux. GO LANG. PHP. Life as an Ezoic engineer: Ezoic is a technology-first company. Our CEO is a developer by trade, and our engineers are given all the tools needed to succeed. We empower our engineers to make a lot of their own decisions about both design and implementation and encourage them to come up with new ideas to improve the application. We also aim to keep a good work-life balance, based on our philosophy that happy engineers are more productive. We want you to be working on something that you are passionate about and allow engineers to move around to keep things fresh. We have a new office in Carlsbad, CA, which is currently open to employees who have been fully vaccinated and wish to work in the office. We want to get back to in-person work this spring but plan to allow engineers to work from home regularly if they can be more productive there, and are open to fully remote for the right candidates. Every engineer works at their own quad-monitor set up on a standing desk. We pride ourselves on getting stuff done, but when you need a break, Ezoic offers great perks, including unlimited vacation time, catered lunches, snacks, flexible hours, ping pong, video games, and pool. This position can be remote or hybrid.

name: Senior Autonomy Software Engineer
description: Job Description. Sea Machines is a venture-funded, fast-growing startup specializing in autonomous technologies. We are passionate about applying AI and technological advancements to our largest domains: the oceans. A team of technologists, mariners, autonomy scientists, and people who can play nice with both humans and machines. We work on products that provide marine vessels the intelligence to work remotely and give operators the tools to effectively communicate with them the SM Series.21 saw a year of history making with the first on-water000 NM autonomous journey, The Machine Odyssey; partnerships with names like Rolls Royce; and a team that over doubled leading to a new office in the heart of Boston! www.sea-machines.com. Job  Summary. We  are seeking an Autonomy Software Engineer to join existing software team working on advanced autonomy software for our marine product. The candidate will work closely with the user interface team, system team, artificial intelligence team, and customer support team. Responsibilities and Duties. Architect autonomy stack and deliver on roadmap. Develop, test, and integrate autonomy software for marine vessel autonomy. Test, debug, and maintain reliable, safe, and production quality code. Maintain software documentation and assist in the development of user documentation. Participate in field testing and trials. Work closely with customer support team and resolve customer issues. Participate in daily scrum meetings. Work cross-functionally with technical teams to execute functional testing, system integration verification and performance validation on new products in automated simulation and in vessel trials. Qualifications and Skills. BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Robotics, or other related engineering field. years of experience in C++ and Python software development for commercial products. years of experience developing autonomy software in complex integrated dynamic hardware applications. Has developed software in path planning, motion control, map building, obstacle avoidance, and sensor fusion. Deep understanding of radar processing. Experience in robotics architecture. Familiarity with Shell Scripts in UNIX /Linux environment. Knowledge of TCP/IP networking is a plus. Experience with software version control. Understanding of Agile SW Development Methodology. Experience collaborating with other functional teams to seamlessly integrate software and hardware systems. Good communications skills (verbal and written), ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and convincingly. Comfortable with a fast paced development schedule.

name: Predictive Analytics Data Scientist
description: Job Description. Description. Job Description: Looking for the opportunity to work on problems that matter, with colleagues that share your interest and expertise in AI and machine learning all working from the luxury of your own home. Leidos is looking for a Predictive Analytics Data Scientist. to apply their strong general knowledge of machine learning and artificial intelligence to operational problems. These problems can require searching for phenomena and analytic answers across multiple modalities (image, video, audio, lidar, and more). You should be comfortable working independently, leading a technical team, and collaborating with other researchers to implement and customize algorithms, with the goal of making them deployable and maintainable in a modern model CI/CD environment. Our environment requires strong Python coder skills with knowledge in using ML libraries (e.g., SciKit Learn) on  both CPU and GPU compute architectures. We are looking for people that are intellectually adaptive, inquisitive, and capable of conducting original science. You will work alongside junior and senior research/data scientists and software engineers with expertise in multi-modal information retrieval, UI development, computer vision, metrics, information science, artificial intelligence, and autonomous systems You will work to make their predictive ML models and results deployable into customer environments, as an AI/ML subject matter expert. They will contribute to Rand D of new approaches that produce measurable advances over state of the art. Challenges you will work on in this job: Develop AI and machine learning approaches to solve operational use cases with time series, unstructured text, and relational data Develop predictive analytics over time series data Develop analytics using Python and Jupyter notebooks Setup and use AWS instances to train and operate analytic models Communicate the potential for predictive analytics to improve operations. Develop and apply quantitative measures of model performance. This is you: Bachelor's degree with eight years of experience, or Master's degree with six year experience, in Mathematics, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or Natural Language Processing oradditional years of experience in lieu of Bachelor's degree Practical hands-on experience with developing data analytics, and the ability to explain predictive analytics and machine learning over time series data Hands-on software development skills with Python Able to obtain a Top Secret security clearance with a polygraph security clearance You will wow us even more if you have these skills: Experience with algorithm and tool development and deployment in both unclassified and classified Dev/Test/Preprod/Prod environments Big Data Skills (Azure, Hadoop, Spark, recent deep learning platforms) Experience with Deep Learning Frameworks such as Keras, Tensorflow, PyTorch, Mxnet, etc. Practical hands-on experience and the ability to explain reinforcement learning and transfer learning Experience with interpretability of deep learning models LInC AIML Pay Range: Pay Range $91,000.00 $140,000.00 $189,000.00 #Remote.

If you are interested in fulfilling work, being part of a diverse team, and solving complex problems through technology, business intelligence and analytics, then SAIC is right for you! SAIC is seeking a Technology Protection and Export Controls Analyst to join our team of qualified, diverse, and highly motivated individuals supporting the Office of the Under Secretary of Defense, Research and Engineering (OUSD(Rand E)). The qualified candidate will provide extensive research, technical, and financial assessments, as well as policy recommendations on existing and emerging technologies essential to the United States maintaining superior military capabilities. Work will be performed primarily in Alexandria VA and Arlington VA including at the Pentagon, the Mark Center, and local company offices, supporting DoD, Research and Engineering (OUSD(Rand E)), Department of Commerce (DoC), Department of State (DoS), and other Departments and Agencies. Travel is currently restricted but would be required in the future, less than% of the time, and predominantly within the continental United States. Primary responsibilities include: Serve as the team lead for all export control cases and reviews with OUSD(Rand E) equities; track review progress, ensure completeness of review, and assist in executing and monitoring outcomes as required; mitigate foreign ownership, control, influence, cyber penetration, and other exploitation threats to the US technology and manufacturing industrial bases; review International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and Export Administration Regulations (EAR) rules, policies, and procedures and other related export control activities; assist in supporting OUSD(Rand E) efforts related to the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) and the Foreign Investment Risk Review Modernization Act (FIRRMA). Provide analysis and recommendations about export controls and other related protection methods to the Director, Technology Manufacturing Industrial Base (TMIB) responsible for supporting OUSD(Rand E) Principal Directors for DoD Modernization Priorities. Represent OUSD(Rand E) and TMIB in activities related to export control policies, procedures, tools, and support services; serve as primary liaison with OUSD(Aand S)/Industrial Policy, Defense Technology Security Administration (DTSA), intelligence, counterintelligence and law enforcement organizations, and interagency partners like DoC and DoS. Facilitate assessments of the confluence of technology concerns, business concerns, foreign involvement, and how that involvement might affect DoD modernization priorities, warfighting capabilities, technology advantage, and associated RDTand E investments, or otherwise compromise national security. Formulate risk mitigation strategies to address technology and technical stakeholder interests, facilitating involvement of Science and Technology (Sand T) and system development communities as appropriate; conduct integration of multiple case management, technology and business awareness, and technology assessment systems as necessary to conduct risk assessments and responses; monitor vulnerability risk mitigation implementation actions. Maintain awareness of DoD critical technology and manufacturing ecosystem needs, the latest technological developments through technical journals, continuing education and participation in professional engineering societies and other science and technology forums; identify and foster appropriate vulnerability mitigation actions. Evaluate the results of past and current assessments, and apply strategies to protect and promote the U.S. industrial base, technology development, and investment strategies; develop, i plement, and monitor metrics to determine the success of implemented strategies and policies. Prepare executive-level decision briefs, develop courses of action for short and long range implementation and administration of strategic objectives; chair meetings of standing and ad-hoc groups and committees, as well as lead teams commissioned to resolve problems; arbitrate and determine courses of action in various engineering technical forums to resolve challenges and incompatibilities. Qualifications. Education and Experience. Bachelor's degree in engineering discipline or related science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) field; or Bachelor's degree in related fields with substantive technology acquisition and development experience. years of related experience. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Excellent customer service skills, with an advanced understanding of customer relationship building. Knowledge of DoD acquisition processes, policies, and guidance. Knowledge of the Defense Technology Security Administration (DTSA), Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS), OUSD(Aand S)/Industrial Policy, Department of Commerce's Bureau of Industry and Security (BIS), intelligence, counterintelligence and law enforcement organizations, interagency partners like DoC and DoS. Knowledge of relevant USG/DoD policies, procedures, tools, and support services. Proficient in MS Word, PowerPoint, and Excel. Clearance. Active TS/SCI clearance. Desired Qualifications. Master's degree in engineering discipline or related science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) field. Knowledge of Office of the Secretary of Defense (OSD) organizational structures, functions, and communication protocols. Knowledge in one or more of the DoD technology modernization areas to include Microelectronics, Directed Energy, Space, Hypersonics, Autonomy, Quantum Cyber, Artificial Intelligence, Biotechnology, Command, Control, and Communications (C3), and other related technologies. SAIC has an opening for a GEOINT Radar Subject Matter Expert (SME) Engineer to provide Systems Engineering and Technical Assistance (SETA) services on advanced Radar programs to an IC customer. name: Transformational R&D Systems Engineer
description: Job Description. Job ID:19644 Location: CHANTILLY , VA , US Date Posted:21-12-13 Category: Engineering and Sciences Subcategory: Systems Engineer Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Travel: Yes, % of the Time Minimum Clearance Required: TS/SCI with Poly Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: None Potential for Remote Work: No Description. SAIC seeks a Transformational Rand D Systems Engineer to join our team of professionals providing technical and program services to the U.S. Government (USG). SAIC provides research, engineering, design, analysis, acquisition, development, integration, test, and operations support USG Intelligence Community (IC) and Department of Defense (DoD) customers. We support development and delivery of next generation and generation after next national security systems based on land, at sea, in air, and in space. The engineer sought here serves a USG Program Office leading Research and Development (Rand D) of evolutionary, revolutionary, and transformational space systems and technology. This position provides Systems Engineering and Technical Advisory (SETA) support services. Your responsibilities include some or all of the following depending on your personal desires and capabilities: Technical review and assessment of concepts, systems, technologies, designs, architectures, interfaces, and operation of space and ground systems. Feasibility and applicability of relevant systems and technologies to future spacecraft, payloads, communication systems, ground systems, launch systems, and operations concepts. Analysis of alternatives to optimize technical, cost, and schedule performance and improve knowledge and understanding of system, technology, and architecture tradeoffs. Technical and programmatic support through the entire project life cycle including concept development, system definition, acquisition planning, source selection, system design, development, integration and test, system delivery, and mission operations. Mission operations support includes planning, execution, monitor and control, and anomaly support plus evaluation, conclusions, recommendations, and capture of lessons learned. Briefings and reports including technical and programmatic assessments presenting analysis, results, conclusions, and recommendations. Brief USG staff and industry partners, as requested. Active member of enterprise Rand D, learning, and innovation environment creating, gathering, and sharing knowledge to grow organizational competency and capability. Qualifications. Active TS/SCI clearance with Poly. Must have bachelor's degree in science, technology, engineering, or math discipline with minimum of years of relevant work experience or years with master's degree. Knowledge, skills, and abilities in space systems. Proficient skills using Microsoft Office applications (i.e., Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Sharepoint). Critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical s kills. Interpersonal and communication skills for written reports, group discussion, and oral presentations. DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Knowledge, skills, abilities, and/or experience in one or more of the following: Systems engineering and integration applied to spacecraft, ground, and launch systems. Rand D of space and/or ground systems. System acquisition, design, development, integration, test, and/or flight operations. Spacecraft subsystems (power, thermal, attitude control, guidance, navigation, data processing, space-to-ground and/or space-to-space communications, payloads). Overhead space systems collection in one or more domains (signals, imagery). Small Satellite (SmallSat) systems (single vehicles, clusters, and/or constellations). Flight safety and/or Mission Assurance of space systems. Artificial Intelligence and/or Machine Learning technologies applied to space systems. System modeling and simulation and/or system performance analysis. IC mission, organizations, disciplines, systems, and/or processes. name: Scientific Programming and Machine Learning Engineer
description: Job Description. Description. Job Description: Leidos is looking for scientific programmers, computer scientists, or mathematicians with an Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) background to support our growing work in the Eglin office. In this capacity you will propose, design and develop new Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) tools to support the design and analysis of high speed weapons systems. Leidos presently uses deep learning Artificial Neural Networks (ANN)s for the purpose of providing fast running models, and thus you would maintain existing ANN's in addition to developing new ANN based fast running models. In this position you will work directly with accomplished aerospace, mechanical, and electrical engineers both internal to Leidos and with external customers. You will need to effectively propose new research ideas to the customer, execute on the research, and present verbal and written status reports. The ability to publish research papers in academic journals and present conference papers is a requirement. Apply your skills to develop advanced AI/ML techniques to model aerodynamic, structural and thermal phenomena. Perform research that develops new techniques to improve the modeling of emerging high speed weapons systems. Develop tools that enable the future of Digital Engineering. Join a team that is helping to secure the nation. Be part of a close knit team and work with world class experts. The Aerophysics group operates in a small team environment where individual creativity is rewarded and continuous learning is the norm. Our engineers typically work directly with DOD personnel and regularly interact with contracting teams from Lockheed Martin, Boeing, Northrup Grumman, etc. The Destin-Fort Walton Beach-Niceville area is home to world famous beaches and a relaxed 'salt-life' lifestyle. Experience Level: BS andyears of experience required. MS or PhD in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Machine Learning, plusor more years of experience preferred. Citizenship: Must be a US Citizen and have an active SECRET clearance. Locale: Candidate must be located in or relocate to the Eglin AFB, FL area Machine Learning: Experience with POD or PCA, scikit, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, or equivalent is required Programming Skills: Python, C/C++, Matlab, Fortran, Linux, Bash scripting Engineering Skills: Preferred candidates will be familiar with at least one of the following Modeling and Simulation disciplines: Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD), heat transfer, dynamics, controls, Finite Element Analysis (FEA), structural/materials engineering. Communication Skills: Successful candidates should be able to effectively communicate with Leidos aerodynamics, airframe, and guidance and control personnel, and interact daily with customers, team members and end users. Must develop a clear understanding of customer goals and objectives and shape work activities to satisfy them. Must present both verbal and written status on a regular basis, and prepare manuscripts for publication at technical conferences and for professional journals. Desire Skills: Candidates with the skills described below will be given preference. Programming: OOP, Numpy, Scipy, LAPACK, BLAS, MPI, Git, CUDA CFD: CART3D, Kestrel, FUN3D, US3D, CFD++, Pointwise FEM: ANSYS, Sierra Tool suite, LS-Dyna CAD: Solidworks HPC: PBS or Slurm or other demonstrated skills on utilizing HPCs LInC Electronic Warfare Pay Range:

name: Manager of Data Science- 100% Remote
description: Job Description. Data Scientist Manager REMOTE USA EST Business Hours. Weâ€™re located in Norfolk, VA But you donâ€™t need to be. We invite you to explore a future with us at PRA Group, a diverse and growing company that has a tangible impact on the global economy. Summary. Data Scientist Manager is responsible for leading a team of Data scientists in research and development design, development, test, and deployment of the ML technologies to turn data into actionable insight to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness, make pricing decisions, improve customer experience that will include but not limited to performance evaluations and financial projections. The Data Scientist Manager has a strong technical ability, excellent project management skills, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment. Requirements. PhD. in Computer Scienc  or related field with research in machine learning is preferred or a MS in Computer Science or related field with research in machine learning. years of professional commercial work experience building machine learning or AI systems. years of prior management experience. Strong knowledge and demonstrated experience of artificial intelligence, machine learning, self-learning systems and deep learning with proven track record of innovation solving business and real problems, including mastering the mathematical underpinnings of these methods. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Solid software engineering skills across multiple languages including but not limited to Python, C/C. Experience with machine learning software packages and deep learning tools and packages (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFl ow, Caffe, Theano, Torch). Passion for teaching and mentoring. Experience working with finance industry. Ability to communicate the results of analysis. Additional Desired Qualifications: Any experience with one or more of the following: natural language processing, deep learning, Bayesian reasoning, recommendation systems, learning for search, speech processing, learning from semi structured data, reinforcement or active learning, ML software systems, machine learning on mobile devices. Responsibilities: Lead project teams to develop innovative solutions to drive innovative business solutions. Lead the implementation of data modeling solutions. Work within the Machine Learning Team to design, code, train, test, deploy and iterate on large scale machine learning systems. Mentor less experienced team members on AI/machine learning methodology and techniques. Manage scope and pace of execution across multiple projects for high quality and on time delivery. Solve business problems by leveraging advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning approaches. Ensure data integrity by leveraging proven methodologies, including data reconciliation, data integration and data audits. At PRA Group, we're committed to helping our employees reach their highest potential by offering competitive salaries, proprietary training programs, bonus plans, tuition reimbursement programs, comprehensive benefits, an employee assistance program, and valuable opportunities to establish a long career within our organization.

name: Sr. Data Scientist
description: Job Description. Job Purpose. The Senior Data Scientist performs advanced predictive modeling and analysis in support of the Data Science group within the Data and Artificial Intelligence team. This position assists in the delivery of data science models based on machine learning and advanced statistics that provide context-sensitive and data-driven rich insights to power intelligent customer interactions that can help Jackson differentiate itself from its competitors. This position also works with different groups to help create alignment on various analytics initiatives and provides technical guidance and coordinates work of more junior level Data Science associates. Essential Responsibilities. Designs, develops and implements scalable, sustainable analytic capabilities, leveraging advanced statistical modeling and machine learning to unlock value and provide efficiencies across Jackson's business units. Identifies, generates, and selects features from various structured and unstructured data sets. Identifies approaches to model high dimensional sparse data that may require the use of imputation methods. Partners with product and technology teams to make sure that relevant data is captured; collaborates with data engineering teams to get appropriate datasets built in a format that streamlines analysis and enables automation and reporting; works with AI engineering teams to implement developed solutions. Leverages supervised and unsupervised AI/ML methods to create descriptive, predictive and prescriptive models. Creates data structures and pipelines to organize, collect and standardize data for analysis and model development purposes. Prepares and analyzes data to develop recommendations and strategies that helps generate insights and addresses reporting needs. Works in a high-performance computing cloud environment to analyze complex data from a variety of sources using a diverse set of tools and techniques. Uses data visualization techniques to effectively convey insights and support business decisions across Jackson. Monitors and evaluates the impact and effectiveness of predictive models or analytics tools in production. Assists in the creation of alignment and the development of project requirements. Consults with business stakeholders on appropriate experimental design to satisfy requirements and ensure new features/initiatives are tested rigorously. Leads complex analytical projects and initiatives. Provides innovative recommendations to make an impact at Jackson using data science and AI/ML. Other Duties. May provide training to users on new/updated systems. Provides trending and related support for production issues as needed. Ability to work extended hours as needed. Mentors junior engineers on practices within Jackson. Performs other duties and/or projects as assigned. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities. Excellent knowledge of the fundamentals of probability, statistics, and machine learning, as well as advanced topics such as boosting, ensemble methods and deep learning with their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Excellent programming abilities in SQL, Python and/or R and writing maintainable, modular and concise code. Ability to learn languages and frameworks, such as Spark, as needed. Strong communication skills to convey complex and technical information in an understandable, compelling, and persuasive manner both orally and in writing. Strong interpersonal skills to interact effectively with Jackson senior leadership, co-workers, and the broader public and to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to achieve results against competing priorities. Strong ability to influence others through effective presentation of concepts and action plans. Understanding of business fundamentals. Familiarity with one or more script-based data visualization tools, such as matplotlib, ggplot, Shiny or D3. Proficiency in computer processes and methods, and familiarity with languages such as C/C++, Java, C#, SQL, Perl, Python; familiarity with UNIX/Linux, shell scripting, distributed/parallel computing, a scripting language such as Python or Perl or similar; familiarity with regular expressions; familiarity with state-of-the-art database concepts, techniques and technologies. Fluent in the use of notebooks (e.g. Jupyter or Databricks notebooks); ability to a dhere to documentation standards using version control and code repositories (e.g. Git, Github, Markdown). Ability to mine datase ts and develop models built on large volumes of information collected by Jackson. Strong project management skills; ability to successfully manage multiple highly complex projects with aggressive deadlines. Ability to work independently and make appropriate decisions when faced with less than ideal data management or model development conditions. Ability to provide technical guidance and leadership for team members. Qualifications. Master's Degree in statistics, math, computational or mathematical finance, computer science, engineering or related technical field required. years of quantitative experience in a data science, artificial intelligence, advanced analytics or related role required. Experience in leading complex projects involving data manipulation, model development and tool deployment required. Experience in communicating predictive models and analytics results by authoring reports or giving presentations required. Strong background in machine learning, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, causal inference, statistics and probability theory, as well as experience creating predictive models on high dimensional, noisy data that may also contain missing values required. Experience in major machine learning frameworks and tools such as Spark ML/MLlib, Scikit-Learn, Pandas, PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc. required. Experience working with large volumes of structured an  unstructured data, coming from different sources, for back-testing models, algorithms, and strategies required. Hands-on experience working with big data platforms as Hadoop, Apache Spark or Databricks using Python / SQL or comparable languages for manipulating and analyzing complex data required. Experience in bringing predictive models and other analytics tools to production required. Experience with model deployment on a cloud platform (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud Platform) preferred. Experience in natural language processing and text mining required. Experience with developed solutions implemented in a production environment strongly preferred. Experience with Machine Learning orchestration frameworks/platforms (e.g. Databricks, MLflow, SageMaker, Azure Machine Learning, Kubeflow) pr eferred. Report authoring/development. experience using various tools like Tableau or Power BI preferred. Financial services background preferred.

name: Technical Sales Engineer
description: Job Description. Job ID:19484 Location: REMOTE WORK , VA , US Date Posted:21-12-08 Category: Program Management Subcategory: Project Analyst Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Travel: No Minimum Clearance Required: None Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: Top Secret Potential for Remote Work: Yes Description. SAIC is looking for talented, highly motivated, and experienced Technical Sales Engineers to join the AI Innovation Factory. This exciting customer-facing role will work in partnership with our account teams, leading innovative conversations that help shape the growth of our enterprise customers as they embrace their digital transformation journey. This job can be performed anywhere within the U.S. As a Technical Sales Engineer at SAIC AI IF, you will report to the AI IF Management team and create technical content alongside the SA's across SAIC business units. You will be responsible for selling product, process, and tools that leverage ML technologies in support of SAIC AI product offerings.. Technical Sales Engineers design and architect solutions utilizing our family of AI/ML service offerings.. Must have a strong desire to leverage their technical and sales skills, including business acumen, to understand business requirements, develop a technical sales strategy, and effectively present solutions that address our customers' requirements and provide business value.. The Technical Sales Engineer will be responsible for analyzing customer needs and requirements through strategic discovery, utilizing technical thought leadership, discussing industry best practices, and presenting our product offerings to prospects and customers based on each customer's specific business requirements.. Leads and attends customer meetings in person and via collaboration tools.. Prepares and delivers technical proposals and presentations with the appropriate level of business acumen for the audience.. Provides broad scope responses to solution and technology questions.. Demonstrates strong solution selling abilities and effective, pro-active customer communications.. Advises customers, sales and customer success on technical aspects of proposed solutions including fit to customer's needs, features, availability, etc.. Internal feedback loop to product management, sales and customer success leadership teams regarding the customer experience, product features/functionality, and service implementation/management.. Collaborate with Account teams, Program management teams, and Product Management to deliver the appropriate solution and establish credibility and trust with the customer. Qualifications. Required:. US Citizenship is required with the ability to obtain up to a Top Secret level DoD clearance upon request. Active DoD Secret (or above) clearance is strongly preferred. B.S. Computer Science, Engineering, MIS or equivalent work experience in the private sector or military and six (6) years or more of related experience. Masters and four (4) years or more experience.. Three (3) years of experience with technology focused in pre-sales, engineering, consulting or similar background.. Technical pre-sales and/or consulting experience with Data Science and AIML.. Possess knowledge of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.. Technical knowledge across one or more AI/ML processing systems (Global network infrastructure, edge AIML capabilities, connected security, communication and collaboration services).. General problem-solving skills and ability to methodically understand and resolve complex issues.. Must demonstrate the ability to focus ambiguous customer needs into specific, deliverable requirements.. Ability to work independently, or as part of a team to build complex customer solutions.. Must be able to build strong team relationships and easily transfer technical information.. Ability to work under pressure with tight deadlines and on multiple projects simultaneously.. Must be very detail oriented and demonstrate a high degree of accuracy.. Ability to prioritize with good time management skills.. Strong presentation skills as well as the ability to build and present high-quality solutions to both technical and executive audiences.. Strong listening, reasoning and objection handling skills.. Some Travel required COVID Policy: Prospective and/or new employees are required to adhere with SAIC's vaccination policy. All SAIC employees must be fully vaccinated and they must submit proof of vaccination on their first day of employment. Prospective or new employees may seek an exemption to the vaccination requirement at Contact Us and must have an approved exemption prior to the start of their employment. Where work is performed strictly at a customer site, customer site vaccination requirements preempt SAIC's vaccination policy. Target salary range: $95,001 $105,000. The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors. Using our expertise and understanding of existing and emerging technologies, we integrate the best components from our own portfolio and our partner ecosystem to deliver innovative, effective, and efficient solutions that are critical to achieving our customers' missions. We are more than,500 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $7.1 billion. For more information, visit saic.com. My SAIC Benefits.

name: Senior Data Analytics Consultant
description: Job Description. Senior Data Analytics Consultant Position Description We are seeking a Senior Data Analytics Consultant who is passionate about solving challenging client problems with emerging technology solutions. As a CGI Senior Data Analytics Consultant, you will be joining the International Affairs (IAF) group to support the mission of U.S. security, econo ic well-being, and worldwide relations. Working with various clients in the US federal space, IAF supports missions that foster national security, foreign relations and resilient democratic societies. Since76, CGI has partnered with the U.S. federal government to support a wide variety of organizations and unique missions building solutions that support clients around the world. Your future duties and responsibilities. Apply problem-solving skills to modernize overall Business Intelligence technology solutions that will directly impact client missions.. Advance data analytics offerings through proof of concept demonstrations including techniques such as Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Predictive Analytics and Natural Language Processing.. Lead data analytics solution efforts by interfacing with feature and product teams to understand business needs working alongside cross functional team members.. Stay up to date on technology trends within the Cloud and Analytics solutions landscape to inform clients of benefits and value with the future technology adoption.. Participate in team problem solving efforts and offer ideas to solve client issues.. Provide technical leadership and mentorship to team members on analytics concepts and approaches. Required qualifications to be successful in this role The ability to obtain an interim Secret clearance is required to begin working with our client, and a Secret clearance must be maintained throughout the project duration. Due to the nature of the government contract requirements and/or clearance requirements, US citizenship is required. Basic Qualifications:. Bachelor's degree or master's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or STEM related discipline.. years of experience working on Enterprise Analytics and Business Intelligence focused initiatives.. years of experience in defining and executing advanced analytics projects and demonstrating business value and optimization of furthering a business mission or outcomes.. Experience working with various self-service business intelligence and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Business Objects, Qlik, etc.. Strong SQL knowledge and understanding of various relational databases such as Oracle Exadata, SAP HANA, MS SQL Server, Redshift, Snowflake, etc.. Understanding of enterprise analytics tooling and architecture.. Understanding of Cloud migrations and Cloud-based analytics solutions.. Experience working in an Agile based environment.. Strong technical and troubleshooting techniques. #Dice #ClearanceJobs #CGIFederalJob Build your career with us. It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change-supporting our clients' digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities. At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create. Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world. Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com. No unsolicited agency referrals please. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics. name: Data Engineer
description: Job Description. DATA ENGINEER (IND-21-1529-W): Bowhead seeks a Data Engineer to support the INDOPACOM JIOC, conducting strategic topic research and analysis for new intelligence requirements located in Honolulu, HI. Specific needs are identified for support in collaborative intelligence planning, collection strategy development. Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR ) mission management, foreign disclosure support. Counterintelligence (Cl ). Human Intelligence (HUMINT). collection operat ons management, exploitation, and innovative Rand D, and Cyber Forensics. Responsibilities may include:. Conduct data analytics, data engineering, data mining, exploratory analysis, predictive analysis, and statistical analysis, and uses scientific techniques to correlate data into graphical, written, visual and verbal narrative products, enabling more informed analytic decisions.. Proactively retrieve information from various sources, analyzes it for better understanding about the data set and builds Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools that automate certain processes. Duties typically include: creating various Machine Learning (ML)-based tools or processes, such as recommendation engines or automated lead scoring systems.. Perform statistical analysis, applies data mining techniques, and builds high quality prediction systems.. Design how data will be stored, accessed, used, integrated, and managed by different data regimes and digital systems.. Work with data users to determine, create, and populate optimal data architectures, structures, and systems.. Plan, design, and optimize data throughput and query performance.. Participate in the selection of backend database technologies (e.g. SQL. NoSQL. UPC. etc.), their configur ation and utilizati n, and the optimization of the full data pipeline infrastructure to support the actual content, volume. ETL. and periodicity of data to support the i tended kinds of queries and analysis to match expected responsiveness. Requirements In accordance with Executive Order042: Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, candidates should be aware that they may be required to have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire.. Master's degree in a related field is highly preferred; Bachelor's degree in a related field is required.. Five to seven (7+) years of experience with Computer/Data Science Languages including but not limited to: Java, Flash, C++, C#, Macromedia, HTML, XML, Analysis, Python, Corona SDK, JavaScript, WordPress, CSS, PHP, jQuery, Python, R, Watson IBM, Tableau, SAS. Experience with databases/applications/operating systems including: MySQL, Access, Oracle, SQL Server. MS Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Eclipse, SharePoint, Windows, Azure (cloud). Familiar with formats/medium/tools including but not limited to: Blitz, Cognos, Kibana, JEMA, SENTIENT, MIST, MOVINT, SOCET GXP, DotMatrix, Google Earth, SNAPGLASS or related tool.. Intermediate to advanced level skills in Microsoft Office software suite Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint.. Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of employees and outside contacts.. name: Product Manager II
description: Job Description. Product Manager II. Location: Salt Lake City, UT. The Product Manager's overall objective is to maximize revenue and margin growth. He/she is the product champion both within and outside the company and will be viewed as the "expert" for accurate and credible information on the product. The Product Manager interacts with vendors, engineering, operations, management, training, sales, marketing, prospects, and clients to guide new product development efforts of assigned products. The Product Manager is responsible for creating the concepts, requirements, product marketing materials, and a variety of analyses for new products and product improvements. Financial Responsibilities: Product Manager will create, analyze, and propose pricing structures. Implement processes that increase margins. Improve profitability in products assigned. Ensure product integrity during set-up process. Major Functions/Responsibilities: Proactively seek feedback from customers and prospects. Analyze, document, and communicate intelligence regarding client and prospect feedback looking specifically for unfulfilled needs for new opportunities. Analyze, document, and communicate intelligence regarding industries and markets including trends and new opportunities. Analyze, document, and communicate intelligence regarding competitors capabilities, key strengths and weaknesses, pricing, and competitive positioning. Facilitate collaborative meetings to research and document product development ideas and concepts across multiple departments. Plan, document, and communicate new product development and product improvement projects with accompanying revenue opportunity documents, use cases, features and requirements, interaction design stories, and launch plans. Perform analyses to aide in decision making regarding feature improvements and new feature developments. Acting subject matter expert expected to know and understand new features and feature improvement. Train employees and agents to better understand new products and product improvements. Occasionally work with sales to assist with sales opportunities. Day to day project management, coordination, and delivery of projects related to assigned products. Occasional travel for client visits, tradeshows, and sales support. Perform other duties as assigned. Follow the company Code of Ethics and CXone policies and procedures at all times. Communicate in an effective and professional way with customers in and outside of CXone. This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive, and employee will also perform other reasonable related business duties as assigned by immediate supervisor and other management as required. This organization reserves the right to revise or change job duties as the need arises. This job description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment. Required Education, Experience, and Specific Job Related Skills Education Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field or equivalent work experience required. Bachelor's degree preferred. Experience Requirements: years of product management experience with formal product management techniques, tools, and principles involved in planning and delivering new software products and services. Demonstrated ability to understand and translate non-technical feature descriptions into structured use cases, requirements, and specifications for technical audiences. Requires interaction with customers, prospects, sales, executive management, and technical engineering resources, adjusting communications to the situation and successfully understanding and communicating product capabilities and priorities to each audience. Excellent oral and written communication skills in English including vocabulary, spelling, composition, and grammar. Reading and comprehension and understanding technical information well enough to convey in original written communications to multiple audiences. Personal interaction with technical resources and listen carefully, taking time to understand the points being made, and asking questions where appropriate. Excellent skills with specialized computer software for drafting and producing documents and diagrams. Driven self-starter; detail oriented, clear, logical thinker, technical thinker, bright and energetic. Works well in fast paced, high pressure environments with the ability focus on goals and objectives. Experience Preferred: Project management and project communication techniques and tools. This includes alternative ways to inform via written, oral, and visual media. Time management experience (managing own time and balancing many different projects simultaneously in a fast paced environment). Telecommunications, software development, networking, hosted applications, or other similar technical products experience. Ability to personally interact with technical resources and listen carefully, taking time to understand the points being made, and asking questions where appropriate. ABOUT NICE CXone: NICE CXone makes it easy and affordable for organizations around the globe to provide exceptional customer experiences while meeting key business metrics. NICE CXone provides the world's #1 cloud customer experience platform, NICE CXone CXoneâ„¢, combining best-in-class Omnichannel Routing, Workforce Optimization, Analytics, Automation and Artificial Intelligence on an Open Cloud Foundation. NICE CXone is a part of NICE (Nasdaq: NICE), the worldwide leading provider of both cloud and on-premises enterprise software solutions.

Analyze, document, and communicate intelligence regarding industries and markets including trends and new opportunities. Analyze, document, and communicate intelligence regarding competitors capabilities, key strengths and weaknesses, pricing, and competitive positioning. Facilitate collaborative meetings to research and document product development ideas and concepts across multiple departments. Plan, document, and communicate new product development and product improvement projects with accompanying revenue opportunity documents, use cases, features and requirements, interaction design stories, and launch plans. Perform analyses to aide in decision making regarding feature improvements and new feature developments. Acting subject matter expert expected to know and understand new features and feature improvement. Train employees and agents to better understand new products and product improvements. Occasionally work with sales to assist with sales opportunities. Day to day project management, coordination, and delivery of projects related to assigned products. Occasional travel for client visits, tradeshows, and sales support. Perform other duties as assigned. Follow the company Code of Ethics and CXone policies and procedures at all times. Communicate in an effective and professional way with customers in and outside of CXone. This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive, and employee will also perform other reasonable related business duties as assigned by immediate supervisor and other management as required. This organization reserves the right to revise or change job duties as the need arises. This job description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment. Required Education, Experience, and Specific Job Related Skills Education Requirement: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field or equivalent work experience required. Bachelor's degree preferred. Experience Requirements: years of product management experience with formal product management techniques, tools, and principles involved in planning and delivering new software products and services. Demonstrated ability to understand and translate non-technical feature descriptions into structured use cases, requirements, and specifications for technical audiences. Requires interaction with customers, prospects, sales, executive management, and technical engineering resources, adjusting communications to the situation and successfully understanding and communicating product capabilities and priorities to each audience. Excellent oral and written communication skills in English including vocabulary, spelling, composition, and grammar. Reading and comprehension and understanding technical information well enough to convey in original written communications to multiple audiences. Personal interaction with technical resources and listen carefully, taking time to understand the points being made, and asking questions where appropriate. Excellent skills with specialized computer software for drafting and producing documents and diagrams. Driven self-starter; detail oriented, clear, logical thinker, technical thinker, bright and energetic. Works well in fast paced, high pressure environments with the ability focus on goals and objectives. Experience Preferred: Project management and project communication techniques and tools. This includes alternative ways to inform via written, oral, and visual media. Time management experience (managing own time and balancing many different projects simultaneously in a fast paced environment). Telecommunications, software development, networking, hosted applications, or other similar technical products experience. Ability to personally interact with technical resources and listen carefully, taking time to understand the points being made, and asking questions where appropriate. name: Director of Geospatial Data Science
description: Job Description. When you join New York Life, you're joining a company that values development, career growth, collaboration, innovation, and diversity and inclusion. We want employees to feel proud about being part of a company that is committed to doing the right thing. Through various resources and programs, you can grow your career while developing personally and professionally. New York Life, the largest writer of retail life insurance in the U.S. and a top pla er in annuities, long-term care and mutual funds, is seeking a Geospatial Analytics Lead in its Center for Data Science and Artificial Intelligence. The company has over5 years of history and while usable data does not quite go back this far, we have a wealth of internal information on consumers, policies and their performance, as well as applicants, prospects and our,000 agents. We also have a multitude of external data from a great variety of sources. We believe New York Life is the most data-rich company in the life insurance industry. Data science challenges range from sales optimization to mortality risk, agent recruiting and retention decisions, consumer analytics (segmentation, response, conversion, retention, up-sell), fraud detection and digital advertising placement. As the Director of Geospatial Data Science, you would be part of the Center for Data Science and Artificial Intelligence, the innovative corporate data science group within New York Life. You would join an entrepreneurial department which aims to design, create and implement state-of-the-art model-driven solutions for multiple areas of the enterprise. Application fraud detection, agent success prediction and client prospecting analytics (off-line and on-line) are among exciting examples of enormous incremental value from data science. Our models are implemented into real-time core business processes and decisions that drive the company (e.g. underwriting, pricing,  ag nt recruiting, prospecting, new product development). In your role as Director of Geospatial Data Science, you will lead projects that touch every business area that we serve. You will have the freedom to explore and introduce new external data sources and new techniques. This is an opportunity to share and work directly with our business partners and thereby experience firsthand the impact your work has on the business. We have a vast amount of data that is available to us ranging from demographics, credit and geo data to detailed medical data (medical test results, diagnosis, prescriptions) and social media information. We have a modern computing environment with a solid suite of geospatial tools, and a group of well-trained professionals at various levels ready to support you. This is a chance to apply your spatial data science skills, your high energy level and keen business sense to collaborate with different areas within New York Life on projects such as geographic market opportunity, agent recruiting, prospecting, and many others. You will be expected to lead complex geo-analytics projects and work with our internal stakeholders to develop new projects using geospatial and GIS methods, ingest and wrangle data, propose geospatial analytics strategy, create related business cases, drive several large initiatives, build and implement solutions at scale and give presentations as a subject matter expert. Responsibilities: Independently leads geospatial data analysis projects from proof of value concept, design, business review meetings with internal and external clients deriving requirements/deliverables, reception and processing of data, performing analyses, developing maps and mapping applications to final reports/presentations, communication of results and implementation support. Demonstrates to stakeholders how geospatial analytics can be implemented to maximize business benefits. Provides support, which includes strategic consulting, needs assessments, project scoping and the preparation/presentation of proposals. Drives the use of geospatial analytics within New York Life by active internal partnership management, discovering business opportunity and creating business value by executing on high-priority projects. Utilizes advanced geospatial / GIS techniques to create advanced and creative geospatial analyses and mapping applications to address business objectives and client needs. Works closely with business and technology partners in designing, building and implementing mapping and geospatial solutions. Closely collaborates with other data scientists on the team on multi-disciplinary projects, and mentors data scientists on utilizing GIS methods and workflows. Proactively and effectively communicates in various verbal and written formats with internal stakeholders on product design, data specification and implementations of GIS projects. Partners with technology to problem solve technical issues within the ESRI ecosystem. Develops scripts and tools for managing data, including designing data standards, structures, forms, and reports within ESRI environment. Formats and generates a variety of GIS products including custom maps and mapping applications. Uses cartographic and design principles throughout the process. Maintains, updates and designs shapefiles, geodatabases, and metadata; Extracts, cleans, adjusts and converts data and information from non-GIS systems into GIS formats; Uses scripts, queries, and other tools to obtain and/or correct missing or incorrect spatial and attribute data. Stays abreast of new trends and technology in geospatial analytics and GIS applications, and insurance industry trends. Functions as the geo analytics expert in meetings with other internal areas and external vendors. Assures compliance with regulatory and privacy requirements during design and implementation of geospatial projects. Travels to events and vendor meetings as needed (<%). Required qualifications Degree in Geography, Demography, Information Systems, Mathematics, Economics, Finance or other quantitative degrees. years of relevant geographic data and GIS geo-analytics experience. Expertise in the full suite of ArcGIS Products (including Pro, Portal / ArcGIS Online, Business Analyst). Ability to create spatial datasets and perform geographic data processes on spatial data. Experience creating interactive maps and applications in ESRI environment. Ability to manipulate data and automate geospatial processes using Python. Experience with third-party (Claritas, Acxiom, InfoGroup/Data Axle, SafeGraph) and Census geographic data. Strong data management, communication, and quality assurance skills. Experience producing high quality error-free mapping and data visualization products and analytic deliverables in high-pressure contexts. Strong attention to detail and data quality checks. Strong analytical skills and ability to manage and report complex information. Ability to prioritize and work in fast-paced environment with hard deadlines. Excellent verbal and written communications skills, listening and teamwork skills, and effective presentation skills. This is absolutely essential since you will have a lot of exposure to different internal groups (data, IT, Agency, Legal, government relations, etc.) as well as third-party data partners. Demonstrated experience in strategic and analytical leadership. Executive presence on high-level meetings. Credible functional expertise in geospatial analytics. Substantial programming experience with several of the following: Python, R, PySpark, SQL, Hadoop. Exposure to GitHub, Domino Data Labs. Experience with data visualization (e.g. R Shiny, Spotfire, Tableau) is a plus. Proficiency in creating effective  and visually appealing PowerPoint presentations. SF:LI-KV1 Recognized as one of Fortune's World's Most Admired Companies, New York Life is committed to improving local communities through a culture of employee giving and volunteerism, supported by our Foundation. We invite you to bring your talents to New York Life, so we can continue to help families and businesses "Be Good At Life." To learn more, please visit LinkedIn , our Newsroom and the Careers page of www.NewYorkLife.com. Job Requisition ID:989.
