We invite you to bring your talents to New York Life, so we can continue to help families and businesses "Be Good At Life." To learn more, please visit LinkedIn , our Newsroom and the Careers page of www.NewYorkLife.com. Job Requisition ID:878.

name: Associate Data Scientist
description: Job Description. November21 Associate Data Scientist Job Description Position: Associate Data Scientist Location: Portland, OR or Remote Per Executive Order042, new or prospective Comscore, Inc. employees in the United States, must provide proof of complete vaccination, or approved exemption on the first day of their employment. About This Role: Comscore is a media measurement company providing multiscreen reporting and analytics with cutting-edge technology to serve clients in the entertainment, media, retail, and advertising industries. Comscore's Data Science team helps design the intelligent engines that power the company's advanced Media Ratings, Movies and TV Everywhere measurement systems. Through our research, Comscore builds projections that make the massive amount of raw data we take in from screens across the world meaningful and useful for our clients. What You'll Do: Use attention to detail and problem-solving skills to find and correct data problems, applying statistical methods to adjust and project results when necessary. Develop analytical approaches to answer high-level questions and develop insightful recommendations. Select appropriate methods and techniques in performing experiments. Utilizes software including SQL, Python/R, and UNIX/Linux as well as internal and third-party tools to generate, analyze, and deliver data driven insights. Convey cohesive story lines grounded in quantitative and qualitative analysis, and utilize software including Excel to present analysis to audience. Author analytical summaries and methodology evaluations. Exercise your experience in the development lifecycle through analysis, design, development, testing and deployment of this system. Serves as subject matter expert on Comscore's TV methodologies. Collaborate with Analytics, Engineering, and Best Practices teams to meet and support business goals. Provide suggestions to advance and improve methodologies. Provide complex troubleshooting of analytical methods. Support industry audit requirements. Develop and test new methodologies, features and concepts, and integrate into production process. Participate in ongoing research and evaluation of new technologies and analytical solutions. Responsible for the timely and error-free operation, production and delivery of syndicated product data. Ensure the integrity and validity of data for On Demand, Linear TV, Digital, and Cross Platform products. What You'll Need: Degree in a quantitatively focused discipline (i.e., Statistics or Biostatistics, Economics, Data/Computer Science or Engineerin g, Systems Engineering, Computation Finance, Operations Research, Mathematics or Physics, etc.). years of experience in the synthesis of research findings and making data-driven arguments. Expertise at querying and manipulating data in preparation for analytics or data visualization using SQL, Spark, Python etc. Ability to learn complex methodologies quickly and draw on your creative problem-solving skills to achieve results. Ability to convey complex analytical approaches and findings; writing skills are essential. Intrinsic ability to look at data and identify patterns, problems, or analysis opportunities. Ability to autonomously manage simultaneous projects in a fast-paced business environment. Ability to multi-task and work with manager to prioritize efficiently to meet deadlines. Proficiency in Excel is a plus. About Comscore At Comscore, we're pioneering the future of cross-platform media measurement, arming organizations with the insights they need to make decisions with confidence. Central to this aim are our people who work together to simplify the complex on behalf of our clients and partners. Though our roles and skills are varied, we're united by our commitment to five underlying values: Integrity, Velocity, Accountability, Teamwork, and Servant Leadership. If you're motivated by big challenges and interested in helping some of the largest and most important media properties and brands navigate the future of media, we'd love to hear from you. Comscore (NASDAQ: SCOR) is a trusted partner for planning, transacting and evaluating media across platforms. With a data footprint that combines digital, linear TV, over-the-top and theatrical viewership intelligence with advanced audience insights, Comscore allows media buyers and sellers to quantify their multiscreen behavior and make business decisions with confidence. A proven leader in measuring digital and set-top box audiences and advertising at scale, Comscore is the industry's emerging, third-party source for reliable and comprehensive cross-platform measurement. To learn more about Comscore, please visit Comscore.com. EEO Statement: We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will re ceive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. To comply with federal law, Comscore participates in E-Verify. Successful candidates must pass the E-Verify process after hire. LI-JZ1.

name: Senior Data Scientist
description: Job Description. Job Description. Real-Time Health System is an innovative organization within Cerner focusing on communications, hospital system operation, and clinical intelligence. We seek the best and brightest talent to join the team individuals who thrive on analytical problem solving and data-driven analysis who are smart, ambitious, and inquisitive. As a Data Scientist, you will update current models, as well as discover and develop mathematical models to improve clinical, financial, or operational outcomes. A few of the responsibilities include supporting feasibility studies, applying modern data storage techniques, discovering explanatory features in high-dimensionality collections of data, exploring data using scientifically valid techniques to apply a modern software or analytic development lifecycle methodology. Additionally, you will work closely with the clinical team on publishing outcomes to peer-reviewed journals to support the clinical nature of our algorithms. Apply today! Qualifications. Basic Qualificationsyears total combined related work experience and completed higher education, including:year Data analytics and/or statistics work experience, including experience in quantitative or statistical analysis, data mining, predictive or statistical modeling, applied programming, data management, data transformation, data visualization and/or quantitative or statistical research.years additional work experience directly related to the duties of the job and/or completed higher education, including: Master's degree in Analytics, Mathematics, Biostatistics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Physics, Economics, Biomedical Engineering, Operational Research, or related field. Preferred Qualifications Experience with SAS or Python. At leastyears of statistical programming and applied programming work experience. At leastyears of data mining, quantitative analysis, and/or statistical modeling including predictive performance and algorithm optimization work experience. Ph.D. in Statistics, Computer Science, Analytics, Biostati tics, Applied Mathematics, Software Engineering, or equivalent relevant work experience. At leastyears of end-to-end machine learning including deployment and operations. Experience with relational databases and SQL; NoSQL databases (hBase, Cassandra, MongoDB, Couch DB, Riak) and unstructured data; Spark; Pig and Avro. Published research paper and ability to drive research projects. Experience working in a cloud environment, especially AWS. Experience with agile software development methodologies. Expectations Willing to work additional or irregular hours as needed and allowed by local regulations. Work in accordance with corporate and organizational security policies and procedures, understand personal role in safeguarding corporate and client assets, and take appropriate action to prevent and report any compromises of security within scope of position. Perform other responsibilities as assigned. Must currently live within miles of a virtually approved city. Applicants for U.S. based positions with Cerner Corporation must be legally authorized to wo k in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. As of March,22, as a condition of employment, all US-based employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless a medical or religious exemption is approved. Some Cerner positions may be obligated to comply with additional client-facing requirements and occupational health requests, including but not limited to, an immunization set, an annual flu shot, an annual TB screen, an updated background check, and/or an updated drug screen. Cerner is a place where people are encouraged to innovate with confidence and focus on what is important people's health and the care they receive. We are transforming health care by developing tools and technologies that make it more efficient for care providers and patients to navigate the complexity of our health. From single offices to entire countries, Cerner solutions are licensed at more than,000 facilities in over countries. Cerner's policy is to provide equal opportunity to all people without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other legally protected category. Cerner is proud to be a drug-free workplace. EEO is the Law (English). E-Verify Participation (English). Right to Work (English). EEO is the Law (Spanish). E-Verify Participation (Spanish). Right to Work (Spanish).

name: Data Scientist
description: Job Description. Job ID:19556 Location: WASHINGTON , DC , US Date Posted:21-12-14 Category: Information Technology Subcategory: Data Scientist Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Travel: No Minimum Clearance Required: None Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: Public Trust Potential for Remote Work: No Description. SAIC is currently seeking a motivated, career and customer oriented Data Scientist to join our team in Washington DC to begin an exciting and challenging career with SAIC. The candidate will be required to work closely with data analysis, development, and other project managers to analyze and validate data visualization and business intelligence requirements. The candidate must have experience with the product, Tableau. The candidate must have excellent written and oral communication skills and experience as a client facing representative. Additionally, the candidate must understand the Software Development Lifecycle and the supporting software necessary to perform change management. The successful candidate for this position must have experience with the following: Designing and developing Tableau work books. Demonstrated experience with Tableau Server Infrastructure, specifically publishing and back end administration. Skills using DB2, Postgres databases. Knowledge of best practices for dashboards and BI reporting. Experience with Business Intelligence tools. Experience with dashboard design and publishing. Candidates should be interested in learning additional skills and technologies Day to Day Job Responsibilities. Design, develop and integrate functional executive dashboard systems using Tableau Desktop and Server to enable easy interpretation of portfolio status, workflow, and actions. Provide expertise developing Tableau code that provides predictive results from analytical trending and modeling. Establish standard methodologies for data assessment and interpretation across multiple dashboards to ensure consistent information representation. Develop, maintain and continually enhance a strategy around Tableau Data (TDE) files. Partner with the security team to develop standards for hosting Tableau services/application. Participate in design reviews of prototypes, and applications ready for production. Develop a solution/framework for provisioning data for consumption by business users who create Tableau reports. Develop a solution/framework for provisioning data for consumption by business users who create Tableau reports. Maintain existing and developed Tableau code and optimize/streamline informational lining and feeds. Integrate tasks/activities into project plans in support of product enhancements. Qualifications. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree andyear of professional experience. Must pass a DOJ Minimal Background Investigation, MBI, Levelbackground investigation. Valid EQIP JPAS transfers acceptable. Due to public trust, citizenship is required. Candidate must be located in the DCMV area. Demonstrated experience utilizing Tableau. Experience with requirements gathering working with customers to determine analytical needs, and carrying those needs through the development of data-driven tools to facilitate the requirements. Expertise in visually representing complex databases and data modeling. Strong problem solving and analytical skills. Strong communication and presentation skills, particularly with clients, team leads, and managers. Ability to work in a dynamic, and often fast-paced environment. Comfortable working in a collaborative / team-based approach. Track record of taking initiative. Desired Qualifications: Experience/exposure to SAP BIP tools and Crystal Reports. Experience using Tableau's JavaScript API. Experience in a scripting language such as R and/or Python. Knowledge of Tableau optimization and tuning. Educational emphasis in Information Design and Visualization or other related studies. Experience in Human Computer Interaction, Data Science, Graphic Design or another related discipline. COVID Policy: Prospective and/or new employees are required to adhere with SAIC's vaccination policy. All SAIC employees must be fully vaccinated and they must submit proof of vaccination on their first day of employment. Prospective or new employees may seek an exemption to the vaccination requirement at Contact Us and must have an approved exemption prior to the start of their employment. Where work is performed strictly at a customer site, customer site vaccination requirements preempt SAIC's vaccination policy. name: Data Scientist
description: Job Description. Huntington Ingalls Incorporated Job Description Come join our Cyber and Intelligence team! Our cyber professionals are defining the future of cybersecurity, providing the most effective prevention, detection, and responses to the broad spectrum and constant evolution of threat actors. Our experts provide actionable, timely intelligence that protects our nation from adversaries intent on disrupting our freedoms and harming our nation. Together, we are an integral part of an important mission - we go to work every day with the knowledge and pride that our accomplishments make a difference. HII Technical Solutions Division (HII-TSD) Cyber and Intel Business Area is currently seeking a Data Scientist with a background in digital networking to work out of their Ft Meade, Maryland office. Essential Job Responsibilities Performs data analysis of network and computer systems and/or integrates existing system frameworks, performance models and algorithms, threat models and command and control models. Foundation may include Statistical analysis, Modeling/machine learning , graph theory and algorithm design. Develops, integrates and uses graphical user interfaces and visualization tools. Models operational environments, performs trade studies via computer simulation and provides decision support for alternative architectures. Performs operational analysis and mission effectiveness analysis. May build and design ML training models. The following competencies are needed in the job. Analysis Process automation Data Normalization Data Visualization Machine Learning Statistics Cloud Analytics Scripting Prototyping Analytics Minimum Qualifications 15 years relevant experience with Bachelors in related field or High School Diploma or equivalent and years relevant experience. Shall have a minimum of years in Computer Science Electrical Engineering, or Computer Engineering. Also experience in network analysis or target analysis with domain experience at least two of the following. Mathematics/Statistics Computer Science Data Mining Data visualization Clearance: Must possess and maintain an active TS/SCI w/poly Preferred Requirements At least two years experience leading a data science project or team. Huntington Ingalls Industries is America s largest military shipbuilding company and a provider of professional services to partners in government and industry. For more than a century, HII s Newport News and Ingalls shipbuilding divisions in Virginia and Mississippi have built more ships in more ship classes than any other U.S. naval shipbuilder. HII s Technical Solutions division provides a wide range of professional services through its Fleet Suppo t, Mission Driven Innovative Solutions, Nuclear and Environmental, and Oil and Gas groups. Headquartered in Newport News, Virginia, HII employs more than,000 people operating both domestically and internationally. Huntington Ingalls Industries is an Equal Opportunity/Vets and Disabled Employer. U.S. Citizenship may be required for certain positions.

name: Health Informatics Data Scientist
description: Job Description. The NorthTide Group is seeking a Health Informatics Data Scientist to provide support services on a government contract with the National Intrepid Center Of Excellence (NICoE). The Health Informatics Data Scientist will conduct research and development of state-of-the-art machine learning techniques that can be used to better understand the complex effects of concussion and mTBI. LOCATION: Bethesda, MD. HOURS: M-Fhours/day, not to exceeddays/40 hours per week, excluding Federal Holidays. Requirements. A Ph.D. in computer-science or  elated field or an M.S. or B.S. with equivalent work ex erience, and with a strong record of scholarship. Candidates should possess the interest to work in multi-disciplinary environments. Strong analytical, written and verbal communication skills. Proven ability to undertake and publish research in data mining, machine learning, and artificial intelligence at an international level. Excellent programming skills in Python, C/C++, Perl, R, Matlab, or Java. A strong background in unsupervised, semi-supervised, and supervised machine learning techniques. Knowledge in text analytics. A strong background in Markov Random Fields, HMMs, part-based models, graph-based models, neural networks, and deep learning required. Knowledge of modern machine learning and optimization methods, clustering analysis, probabilistic inference, predictive analytics, and dimensionality reduction techniques. Knowledge of analytical and predictive models, clinical decision support systems, data mining, and the design of patient-specific models is required. Knowledge of programs such as SAS and SPSS. Proficiency in standard data analytics toolkits such as WEKA, R, Python, Matlab, MALLET, SciPy, RapidMinder, Orange, etc. is required. Experience in manipulating and analyzing large data sets using existing technologies such as Hadoop, MapReduce, or GPUs are a plus. Experience with boosting techniques including AdaBoost, decision trees, and neural networks. Knowledge of hidden Markov models and graphical models. Knowledge in machine learning algorithms including supervised, unsupervised, semi-supervised, transductive, and reinforcement learning. Possesses oral and written communication skills. Proven publication record. Must be able to obtain and maintain a government security clearance. The NorthTide Group, LLC. offers a comprehensive benefits package that offers: Competitive pay. Medical and Dental Insurance. Life Insurance. Short and Long Term Disability.1k Plan with company match. Paid Time Off. Training and Certification Reimbursement. Tuition Reimbursement. Visit our website at www.northtidegroup.com. for company  information. T he NorthTide Group, LLC is an EOE/M/F/VET/Disability.

name: Data Scientist
description: Job Description. Actimize Premier is seeking a Data Scientist to develop, analyze and program cutting-edge algorithms that will be at the core of Premier fraud prevention and Anti-money Laundering applications. Our behavioral analytics / machine-learning platform is the leader in providing Fraud Detection and Anti-money Laundering solutions. You will extend, develop, program and implement new algorithms and underlying mathematical theory, and use your analytics skills to help design and implement core components of our algorithms and models. You can have a daily, direct impact on the continued evolution of our innovative products. Skills and Experience Required: PhD/MS in Statistics, CS, Applied Mathematics, Electrical Engineering or other quantitative fields with focus on machine learning, mathematical algorithms, probability, and statistical modeling. Interest in Big Data and the associated methodologies. years of experience in algorithm development and statistical analysis of massive datasets, or equivalent coursework. Desire to balance theory with pragmatic problem-solving skills to develop and apply advanced algorithms to real-world problems and data. Hands-on experience with statistical analysis, visualization, and data mining tools such as R or Python.2 years of scripting experience (Python, Perl), writing SQL queries and working with databases (MySQL preferred). Ability to work with product managers and engineers to translate requirements into design that can be implemented into code for both fraud detection, anti-money laundering and data visualization. Passionate about being at the forefront of Fraud detection, Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and cyber-crime in general. Resourceful, flexible, and adaptable team player. Additional Preferred Qualifications: Experience in developing User Behavior Models. Past experience in Natural Language Processing (NLP). Knowledge of Social Network Analysis. Understanding of Bayesian Statistics. Experience with Java/Hadoop/MapReduce/Spark. Familiarity with AWS, Azure and/or Google Cloud AI/ML Platforms.

name: Principal, Advanced Analytics
description: Job Description. Principal Advanced Analytics uses mastery skills in the use of predictive modeling, multivariate analysis, clustering/segmentation analysis, data mining, test and control experimentation, trend analysis and other statistical or data analysis techniques to analyze large data files from both internal and external sources to explain or predict behavior and or solve a variety of business problems. This role is crucial to the development of useful models for media spend and performance as noted above. Principle Responsibilities Include: Gathers, analyzes, and interprets a wide variety of data to make predictions on future outcomes or identify differences in relationships amount sources of information% Crucially, these predictions span not only volume predictions for sales based on a host of variables and media spend levels, but also the efficiency of specific tactics and holistic efficiency given a host of tactics. These predictions are essential to our understanding of performance marketing. These predictions are also essential to harnessing our cost structure going forward. Builds predictive models using data, tests the model on results outside of the sample size and verifies the model in the real world% From a methodology perspective, this involves a constant test and learn approach to the efficiency of media as well as top down modeling that articulates the relative contribution of media to overall sales outcomes by channel. Advises business partners with regards to patterns and relationships in data to recommend business direction or outcomes% Specifically, this position will advise our AVP of marketing on the ideal deployment of media spend and the efficient outcome of performance marketing efforts. This position will also advise the working teams within marketing at a functional level to deliver on volume commitments at optimal efficiency. This is a remote position that can be located anywhere in the United States. #LI-Remote Qualifications External Qualifications: Education: Preferred advanced college degree in Statistics, Mathematics and or Computer Science or Ph.D. in related fields; Data Analytics, Machine Learning, or Bus ness Analyst nanodegree; or related expertise. Experience: Typically possesses strong understanding of internal business segment or stakeholders and strong presentation skills. Typically requires10 years related experience in advanced analytics, big data, relational database structures, research methods, sampling techniques, and system testing.

name: Peoplesoft Functional/ Integration Tester
description: Job Description. Job Title: Peoplesoft Functional/ Integration Tester. Location: New York, NY. Duration: Months. Job Description: Peoplesoft Functional/ Integration Tester to support ongoing production maintenance and system enhancements of the HR, Benefits and Payroll functions. Under the direction of the Manager, the Peoplesoft Functional/ Integration Tester shall have the primary responsibility of ensuring the quality of the software and any associated custom development to meet the City's functional and technical requirements and enable client to operate and maintain the software application in a cost effective manner after the implementation.This person should have working knowledge of the following modules PeopleSoft HR,Payroll, Benefits, eHire (TAM and Candidate Gateway), eProfile, ePerformance, Employee Profiles (Accomplishments),NA Payroll(Garnishments) and Global Payroll / Absence Management. Primary Responsibilities:. Develop and maintain formal test cases for specific releases based on the business requirements and technical specifications;. Execute test scripts/cases for releases or on-going maintenance and record test results in ALM / Quality Center (QC);. Report defects in ALM / Quality Center (QC), provide development team with necessary defect documentation, re-test fixes and record results;. Perform data mining to ensure proper test population coverage for test cases;. Assume responsibility for timely test cases completion to achieve targeted system cycles dates ;. Timely reporting of all critical milestones and slipping deadlines to the Testing Lead;. Work on multiple projects and ability to shift the effort based on the timelines established;. Conducting peer reviews prior to test execution (i.e., proper test cases coverage,  test cases documented appropriately);. Working with developers and system analysts on resolving any open questions while working on test cases preparation;. Working with automation team on debugging automation scripts. Qualifications:. Extensive PeopleSoftx/9.x (v.2 is plus) testing experience in  Peo pleSoft HR ,Benefits,NA Payroll(Garnishments) and Global Payroll/ Absence Management.. Experience in creating test cases for HR, Payroll, and/or Benefits modules, should have five (5) full-lifecycle PeopleSoft HR and/or Payroll and/or Ben Admin implementation and PUM upgrade and people tools experience.. Working knowledge of app messaging (integration broker) is a must.. Extensive knowledge of different types of Garnishments like Creditor, Federal Debt. NY State Tax Levy, Student Loan, Bankruptcy, IRS Tax Levy, and Child Support.. Experience with PeopleCode, SQR, SQL, App Designer, Toad.. Extensive experience in Manual Functional Testing such as creating test plan, building and executing manual test scripts.. Experience using ALM / Quality Center (QC) for creating, executing test cases and tracking defects.. Knowledge of PeopleSoft HCM Database model.. Proficiency running back-end/database queries for data set-up and verification (DB2 and Oracle). Experience in developing and maintaining automated Client Quick Test Pro (QTP) scripts using Keyword Driven Framework and Descriptive programming is a plus. Preferred Qualifications:. Experience working with PeopleSoft Implementations in a government or civil service environment.. Experience working with an enterprise wide, large-scale implementation.. Excellent Communications skills (Oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills are required. About our Company:nd Century Technologies is a business enterprise that supports demanding staffing programs for Corporations and State and Local Government Agencies. Its journey began in97 by supporting large Federal contracts which nudged us in the direction of creating large candidate pools across the country. Over the last years, we have built a strong business model that is carefully constructed to deliver on multiple facets. We have proven past performance of providing services that exceed our clients' expectations. Todaynd Century technologies supports clients in all states and has grown to be a company that is trusted and sought for providing a complex mix of workforce solutions. With a firm grip on the entire spectrum of staffing solutions, we have placed more than0,000 skilled resources and delivered million+ man-hours. â€œ22nd Century Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer" and â€œUS Citizens and all other parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

name: Business Intelligence Developer
description: Job Description. Leading international watch company seeks a Business Intelligence Developer. Business Intelligence (Power BI) Developer. Full-time, permanent position. New York City. Salary: Up to $125k + bonus + Fully paid benefits. What you will be doing: Ensures that the Company BI environment is consistently updated and that new features are evaluated and deployed through the Company. Ensures that new reporting is developed and deployed consistent with industry best practices and performance optimized. Validates the accuracy of all reporting prior to user deployment. Successfully maintains and develops data solutions in multiple technical environments. Maintains an ongoing awareness of the BI and reporting needs in the Company and ensures that IT is able to accommodate these needs. Ensures the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of our organizational data. Ensures that the new data sources are ingested properly into our environment and key metrics are aligned with Geneva. Ensures the Data warehouse updates have run properly and proactively resolves issues updates. Ensures the successful design, maintenance, storage access and security of data. REQUIREMENTS. BA in Computer Science, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, or Finance. MUST have development experience working with SQL and Power BI and Azure Data Factory (ADF). Must have experience working in a user-facing capacity so they should have good interpersonal skills and experience communicating with clients. Data management. Data mining. Data sharing standards such as XML or NIEM also a plus. Must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by date of hire.

name: Managed services team lead- callcenter/telephony
description: Job Description. Managed Services Team Lead. Tampa, FL. We are the leading provider of cloud customer engagement hub software for leading brands powered by AI and analytics. For over a decade, our solutions have helped improve customer experience, optimize service process, and grow sales across the web, social, and phone channels. Hundreds of the world's largest companies rely on our platform to transform their fragmented sales engagement and customer service operations into unified Customer Engagement Hubs (CEHs). Duties/Responsibilities. Coordinate and manage the day-to-day activities of the team by monitoring and managing the distribution of the daily workload evenly across all team members. Ensure all Managed Service tickets are completed on time and in accordance with customersâ€™ expectation, compliance, and meeting milestones set with customer. Build reports and dashboards using Analytics hub for customers. Review operational reports with customers, provide insights from the data, and recommend best practices to make improvements in KPIâ€™s for customers operation and optimize the operation. Contribute to the ongoing building and development of the Managed Services team by sharing knowledge, experience, and expertise with other team leaders. Identify technical and functional gaps of the team, and arrange training from appropriate subject matter experts from engineering or professional services to bridge the gap. Provide reports on the productivity of the team and perform scheduled team reviews. Education and Experience. Bachelorâ€™s degree in computer science or equivalent qualification in Information Technology, Business Studies, Computing or relevant subjects. years of experience in customer support/service, working on the web application support/service. Knowledge about technologies like Java/Analytics/HTML/JavaScript /SQL Server/ JSON / Python /Rest API. Able to work with and communicate effectively to all members of an organization and customers at all levels. Capable of managing own workload with minimal supervision and tight deadlines. Familiarity with technologies used in websites, contact centers, messaging, data analysis.

name: Data Analyst with Power BI
description: Job Description. We are considering the highest possible rate for consultants on CTC/99 with State of Michigan experience / Local consultants to Lansing MI/ Closer locations with all matching skills in the skillset. We deduct only $2.50/hour for any billable work as our margin from the client max rate. This will ensure maximum possible rate to the consultants. Hourly Rate: $77 W2; $88 CTC/1099. Job Description: The Programmer Analyst/ Data Analyst provides business analytics services such as business intelligence, customer research and analysis, dashboards, and scorecards creation. This role will be a specialized role focused on supporting the senior leadership with insights, management reports, and analysis for decision-making process in collaboration with Michigan Department of Transportation's (MDOT) Office of Enterprise Information Management (EIM) and Department of Technology, Management, and Budget (DTMB). The ideal candidate enjoys working with data, is familiar with Power BI, and would have the ability to review data sets, suggest appropriate visualizations for the data, know how to appropriately represent the context of the data, and have a keen sense of which visuals will benefit business in given circumstances. Responsibilities: Understands the decision-making process, workflows, business, and information needs of business areas and service manager/owners. Translates business needs into analytics/reporting requirements to support management decisions and workflows with required information. Collaborates and coordinates with business to understand their information needs and identifies ways to discover hidden patterns of data while visualizing and presenting information with the appropriate context in a user-friendly manner. Proactively mines data from multiple data sources to identify trends and patterns and generates insights for business units and senior leadership, including highly complex analytics with unstructured data such as pictures, videos, unformatted text, etc. Interacts with system owners and data architects to understand the context of the information and how information is stored, modeled, and tagged. Works with users, system owners, automation managers, information stewards, and data architects to enhance information visualization through development of dashboards, reporting, and user interfaces. Works closely with the Chief Information Steward, information stewards, architects, and business units for knowledge sharing, mentoring, and training. Acts as a go-to-person for end users to interpret and use information. Required Skills: Expert in data mining and unstructured information analysis (5 years). Ability to generate insights from information (5 years). Competent in information taxonomy creation, information visualization, information modeling techniques, and usability design, accurately applying visualization techniques to datasets, preferably using Power BI (5 years). Ability to perform functional requirements analysis and business domain analysis (5 years). Experienced with information/data analysis techniques (5 years). Experienced with consumer-level data for the purposes of analysis, reporting, and/or marketing (5 years). Ability to analyze, synthesize, and evaluate a variety of data for use in program development and analysis. (5 years). Ability to develop an understanding of the quality, design, and sharing requirements for critical information assets and entities (5 years). Knowledge of the principles and practices of research and analysis. (5 years). Some knowledge of the principles of administrative management, including budgeting techniques. (5 years). Familiar with data governance principles and IT project development methodologies, such as Agile. (5 years). Some knowledge of project management. (5 years). Ability to plan and organize tasks, execute project plans, and expedite work projects. Ability to work collaboratively and independently. (5 years). Ability to communicate effectively with people at all levels, from staff to the senior management, across the organization, both orally and in writing. Must possess good interpersonal and negotiation skills. (5 years). Ability to organize, evaluate, and present information effectively to varied audiences (5 years). More than five years of experience as a data analyst, business intelligence analyst, market research analyst, financial analyst, statistician, or equivalent roles (5 years). Experience with consumer-level data for the purposes of analysis, reporting, and/or marketing (5 years). Extensive experience with Structured Query Language (SQL); ability to write SQL against various data sources, structures, and repositories. (5 years). Experience with Power BI or similar reporting tool (5 years). Data Analyst with Power BI Data Mining, Power BI, SQL, Data Governance, Project Management. Higher Competitive Rates will be considered for consultants with advanced skill set. Corp to Corp Resumes are welcome. Consultants may need a criminal background check.

name: Senior Data Analyst
description: Job Description. Manifest Solutions is currently seeking a Senior Project Data Analyst for a hybrid position in New Albany, OH. Schedule isdays remote anddays onsite. Assure data accuracy, consistency and integrity within the primary Project Management computer systems. Provide data analytics expertise to assure execution of Quality Planning, Quality Assurance and Quality Control within Project Management. Responsible for working on data analysis projects that gather and integrate large volumes of data by performing analysis, interpreting results, and developing actionable insights and recommendations for use across Project Management. This includes data mining, data auditing, aggregation, validation, reconciliation, and visualization. Provide framework for enforcing data integrity rules during data entry. Provide regular, scheduled reports and ad-hoc and other information to project management team and leadership so that corrective measures can be put in place. Working with IT Support, provide framework for updating data for data correction activities. Monitor the progress and effectiveness of the project quality management system. Recommend and implement improvements when required. Identify quality improvement measures and work with management to implement. Work with project teams to put structure in place to monitor quality of process, documentation, scope adherence, etc., and to control influences that seek to change it. Perform project process and procedure alignment review as well as data analytics to ensure departmental compliance for audits. Monitor macro and micro performance metrics to measure process/productivity improvement effectiveness. Provide an objective view to ensure the metrics are driving correct behavior across the broader organization. Provide on-going continuous improvement support and training as required. Collaborate with schedule and cost groups within the QA/QC department to ensure that cost and schedule processes are aligned. Provide status reports to Project Support Manager. Facilitate the cultural desire within the organization to share and adopt best practices. Direct and guide the administration of the project management organizational standards and assist in the management of projects to those standards. Adhere to the guidance and standards put forth by the Project Management Governance Committee. Basic Qualifications: With a qualified Bachelor's degree, four (4) years' qualified experience required; With a qualified Associate's degree, six (6) years' qualified experience. Qualified degrees must be in a related field from an accredited university or college and could include Accounting, Business, Construction Management, Engineering, Technology, or Project Management. Minimum of four (4) years of experience with a demonstrated knowledge of analytics and statistical software such as SQL, R, Python, Excel, Hadoop, Tableau, SAS, SPSS and others to perform analysis and interpret data is attained. Clear understanding of typical Project Control methods and procedures consistent with Project Management Institute's Project Management Book of Knowledge (PMBOK) methodologies is preferred but not required. Effective and compelling communication, including the use of effective listening, with all stakeholders including team members, sponsors, management and senior management. Ability to apply strong analytical and complex problem solving and critical thinking skills. Provide training support as needed for Project Management as well as other departments impacted by departmental reporting, policies, and processes. Identify quality improvement measures and work with management to implement.

name: Data scientist
description: Job Description. Looking for a Data scientist who comes with below skills and experience. Skills and Responsibilities. Statistical analysis and Math skills. Machine learning. Data visualization and reporting. Exposure to multiple SQL and NOSQL databases. Experience in Predictive Analytics and Machine Learning solutions. Expertise in Statistical analysis and Math. Experience in working with messy, unstructured data, from sources such as smart devices, social media feeds, and emails that don't neatly fit into a database and deriving meaningful data from that. Strong experience with Machine Learning techniques. Good exposure to Data Visualization and Reporting, Data Mining, Cleaning and Munging. Strong experience in Data warehousing architecture with Snowflake, IBM DataStage etc. Should be able to design new databases to store data and maintain those databases to ensure that data remains secure and accessible. Should have good exposure to Big data processing and handled billions of data records. Should be able to review data requirements and develop plans and programs to manage these issues. Should be able to do data streaming. Evaluate software, hardware, and computer networks as they relate to the database to ensure reliability. Create new database applications as required. Exposure to AWS cloud is an added advantage.

name: Data Scientist
description: Job Description. Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Primarily responsible for the development of the Work Routing Engine project, performing data exploration, simulation, and modeling work. Collaborate with internal stakeholders and build production-grade models and machine learning algorithms on large-scale datasets. Apply machine learning to generate customer behavior segmentation, to enhance recommendation engines, and deliver personalized user experience on an eCommerce website and loyalty mobile app. Apply predictive modeling techniques and survival models to forecast various demands for operations and to deploy real-time learning algorithms to optimize the forecasts. Build data science solutions to fuel growth initiatives for Digital, Merchandising, Marketing, and Loyalty teams. Design experiments and deliver A/B Testing analysis to improve customer experience in physical stores and on digital platforms. Apply statistical analysis to detect anomalies in systems and outliers in operational metrics for operational excellence. Convey machine learning solutions with intuitive visualizations and effective communications. Some example data sets and needs youâ€™ll work on: Order data. Picking data, tilling time. Labor capacity and schedule data. Demand forecast. Store characteristics. Historical OTT by store. Macro factors (e.g., COVID lockd owns). Qualifications: Masters or Ph.D. degree in a quan itative discipline: Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Math, Statistics or related mathematically intensive fields such as Experimental Physics or Chemical Engineering. years of industry experience in applying data science and modeling methodologies: regression model, survival model, ensemble modeling, NLP, recommendation algorithm, clustering, deep learning algorithm, experimental design (Multivariate/A-B testing) and nonparametric Bayesian modeling etc. Experience with any of the following business analytics practices is preferred: Marketing-related analytics, including Customer Lifetime Value assessments. Customer Service analytics and advanced capabilities including NLP. Personalization and recommendations. years of experience and proficiency in SQL, Python, and/or Spark-ML. years of SQL development skills writing queries, transforming data, mining structured and unstructured data. years of hands-on experience in building data science solutions and production-ready systems on big data platforms such as Snowflake, Spark, Hadoop. Ability to write production-level code in Python. Experience with Snowflake, Azure Databricks is a strong plus.

name: Cloud Service engagement Manager
description: Job Description. This role is Cloud Services Engagement Manager. Global Cloud Services at HClient. Cloud First strategy. HClient have adopted a "Cloud Firstâ€ strategy in order to meet the growing market demand for speed to market, delivery flexibility and staying competitive in an increasingly challenging marketplace. The strategy is driven by a focus on business value, key focus areas being: Delivering improved capability â€“ HClient will be leveraging the Cloud Service Provider (CSP) technologies that HClient would not have been able to provide internally at an equivalent speed, cadence, cost or quality. Increasing delivery flexibility â€“ benefit from CSP elasticity and dynamic scaling of immediately available near infinite capacity, providing a cost effective edge in a rapidly changing and increasingly competitive market. Transforming our Cost Model â€“ adopt a flexible on demand consumption based model, leveraging lower available pricing for commodity services freeing up funding to focus on higher value propositions. Our Cloud First strategy has well established design principles, focussed on extracting the highest value from the cloud market with its associated resilience and security: Each major Cloud provider is playing a defined role within a multi-Cloud architecture. We are using geographical distribution for resilience and reduced latency, retaining control of the physical location of systems and data. Open standards and common technologies are prioritised to support contingency plans for key services. We are employing native Cloud services where appropriate to provide enhanced capabilities. We are protecting our data from attack and unauthorised access through market leading defence in depth, encryption and access management controls. An integrated Global Cloud organization. To support our 'Cloud First' strategy, we have established a "Global Cloud Servicesâ€ (GCS) organisation within Group IT. GCS is led by Ian Haynes. Our multi-cloud model. We are engaged with multiple global Cloud providers Google (Google Cloud Platform), Amazon (AWS) and Microsoft (Azure) to leverage their individual capabilities across geographic coverage and, to provide us with contingency options in the event of a failure of any one Cloud provider. These are transformational times at HClient as we build a market leading team in cloud adoption. Job Profile: The Cloud Services Engagement Manager job is accountable to country and Regional technology delivery teams for ensuring effective consumption of Cloud Services in the Americas. This role will carry out some or all of the following activities: Support the Cloud Services Regional Head in managing the Regional Cloud SteerCo, Cloud Working Group and Regulatory Engagement across the region. Manage the Cloud Services PMO for drive cloud adoption and business vaule realization in Region. Support meeting Regulatory requirements for Cloud Reporting and Quarterly Meetings. Management, maintain and develop an inprovment plan for the Regional Cloud Use Case Register for Direct Usage of Cloud and Software as a Service within Region. Partner with Third Party Risk Management to ensure compliance with local policies and practices for External Cloud Hosting. Be the local Cloud engagement point in region to provide seamless and easy access to GBGF's for Cloud Services and accounts, as well as to facilitate best option decisions. Represent Cloud Services in Regional and Country IT project meetings. Support Cloud Services Platform Leads to work with local Procurement, Rand C and Legal on regional contractual Cloud Service Provider matters. Partner with Cloud Control Office to manage Cloud Risk within region and properly report to CEMM and RMM's. Ensure that region specific Cloud requirements are raised to and delivered by the global team. Promote and provide regional view of key Cloud Services decisions and risks. Provide regular and meaningful MI on regional Cloud adoption, regulatory landscape, spend and consumption. Drive the Cloud vision and promote the use of technology trends within the region. Impact on the Business/Function. Support the Cloud community in the region to drive up engagement and execution of HClient cloud strategy. Partner with GBGF Regional CIO's and Heads to drive Cloud Adoption and maintain Cloud Service Pipeline. Monitor solutions, vendor SLA's, executive, manager and employee feedback to drive continuous improvement. Keep appraised of leading practices, evaluate future market trends and consider innovative solutions. Customers / Stakeholders. Enable / facilitate business dialogue to align regional objectives with global initiatives. Respond to all regional Regulatory Requests in a timely manner. Cost Optimize cloud usage / reduce cost of IT service provision in line with Group strategy / regional targets. Leadership and Teamwork. Work with cross-functional teams across a number of diverse environments. Operational Effectiveness and Control. Ensure critical deadlines are met for the service via accurate and excellent program management across multiple services co-ordinating upstream and downstream impacts. Knowledge and Experience. Experienced technology program and product manager with proven experience in delivering complex projects. Experience in Project Management Office preferred. Knowledge and experience in working with Public Cloud Services, Platforms and Technologies. Functional knowledge of large scale IT processes and strong experience with a complex matrix environment. Strong inter-personal and communication skills. Strong skilling in PowerPoint for executive presentations and Excel for data mining. Proven experience in delivering business transformation through technology solutions. Proven project management skills in global, cross business, complex initiatives. Demonstrable ability to work in a collegiate fashion across the matrix. Ability to demonstrate constructive pragmatism and delivery focus. Experience managing IT teams globally and across IT disciplines. IT service delivery and support.

name: Data Scientist / Database Architect
description: Job Description. Senior Database Architect / Data Scientist. Location: Alexandria, VA. Why CMCI? CMCI provides superior management consulting. and IT services. that empower enterprises to achieve their business goals in today's highly competitive market. Our goal is to seamlessly integrate into each customer's organization in order to fully understand their business and technology needs. This approach allows us to quickly deliver superior quality solutions. while achieving the highest level of customer satisfaction on time and within budget. By choosing CMCI, you are choosing a company that can deliver on business outcomes and mission needs in the most cost-effective manner and without sacrificing capability. As a part of CMCI's culture of loyalty and commitment to its employees, CMCI is committed to provide a tremendous career path by promoting employees to their highest potential. Job Description: Our client seeks capable, qualified, and versatile data scientists to help lead the development and delivery of high-quality predictive modelling solutions. Successful applicants will serve as recognized subject matter experts in the application of quantitative methods, machine learning algorithms, and predictive models to address complex national and homeland security challenges. They will help our team to leverage large structured and unstructured datasets to develop and operationalize models, tools, and applications that drive optimized decision making. Project tasks include data collection, mining, data and text analytics, clustering analysis, pattern recognition and extraction, automated classification and categorization, and entity resolution to implement and enhance automated risk assessment Responsibilities include: Lead and perform hands-on analysis and modeling involving the creation of intervention hypotheses and experiments, assessment of data needs and available sources, determination of optimal analytical approaches, performance of exploratory data analysis, and feature generation (e.g., identification, derivation,  aggregation). Demonstrate proficiency in extracting, cleaning, and transforming CBP transactional and mission data associated within an identified problem space to build predictive models as well as develop appropriate supporting documentation. Leverage expert knowledge of a variety of statistical and machine learning techniques and methods to define and develop programming algorithms; train, evaluate, and deploy predictive analytics models that directly inform mission decisions. Brief project management, technical design, and outcomes to both technical and non-technical audiences including senior government stakeholders throughout the model development/ project lifecycle through written as well as in-person reporting. Required Skills. Experience in developing machine learning models and applying advanced analytics solutions to solve complex business problems. Experience with programming languages including: R, Python, Scala, Java. Proficiency with SQL programming. Experience constructing and executing queries to extract data in support of EDA and model development. Proficiency with statistical software packages including SAS, SPSS Modeler, R, WEKA, or equivalent. Experience with pattern recognition and extraction, automated classification, and categorization. Experience with entity resolution (e.g., record linking, named entity  matching, deduplication/ disambiguation). Experience with unsupervised and supervised machine learning techniques and methods. Experience performing data mining, analysis, and training set construction. Masterâ€™s Degree in mathematics, statistics, computer science/engineering, or other related technical fields with equivalent practical experience. Desired Qualifications: Proficiency with Unsupervised Machine Learning methods including Cluster Analysis (e.g., K-means, K-nearest Neighbor, Hie rarchical, Deep Belief Networks, Principal Component Analysis), Segmentation, etc. Proficiency with Supervised Machine Learning methods including Decision Trees, Support Vector Machines, Logistic Regression, Random/Rotation Forests, Categorization/Classification, Neural Nets, Bayesian Networks, etc. Experience with visualization tools and techniques (e.g., Periscope, Business Objects, D3,  ggplot, Tableau, SAS Visual Analytics, PowerBI). Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, HIVE, HDFS, HBase, MapRe duce, Spark, Kafka, Sqoop). Experience working with large-scale (e.g., terabyte and petabyte) unstructu red and structured data sets and databases. Active Top Secret. Clearance Requirement: Selected applicants must be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) suitability. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

name: Systems Engineer Integration Manager
description: Job Description. Job ID:18599 Location: JBSA RANDOLPH , TX , US Date Posted:21-11-24 Category: Engineering and Sciences Subcategory: Systems Engineer Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Travel: Yes, % of the Time Minimum Clearance Required: None Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: Secret Potential for Remote Work: No Description. SAIC is looking for a Senior Systems Engineering Lead to join the Pilot Training Next (PTN) program in JBSA. PTN is a fast-paced development environment delivering virtual reality (VR)-based and adaptive training products to the US Air Force. Our engineers work hand-in-hand with our customer to deliver out-of-the-box training solutions, rapid prototypes and innovative user experiences that have an immediate impact on USAF pilot training. To learn more about PTN, visit https://www.af.mil/News/Article-Display/Article/1948666/pilot-tra ini ng-next-graduates-14-in-learning-experiments-second-iteration/ Our Senior Systems Engineering Lead will work alongside the existing Training Lead to design and implement the technical infrastructure for PTN's innovative training environment. The SE Lead will manage a multi-disciplinary team of up to software engineers, information technologists, and data scientists using an Agile methodology within the Atlassian suite (JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket). The SE Lead will advise team members on technical tasks and will interface directly with program management and the government customer to manage priorities and scope. Ultimately, the SE Lead will be responsible for the successful integration of multi-disciplinary activities into the USAF's learning environment. Given the potential breadth of work in the PTN program, SAIC is looking for a lead with strong Systems Engineering and systems integration skills along with significant experience in at least one of the following (and willingness to learn the others!): Database Design and Administration (mySQL, PostgreSQL). Data Science (data manipulation, analysis workflows and data visualizations). Distributed Simulation Interoperability (DIS/HLA). Web Applications Development (Angular JS, Spring). Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Algorithms and Applications. Responsibilities include: Design, document, implement, and manage technical infrastructure to support USAF training, to include System of Systems (SoS) architecture and design, system interfaces, system data flows, and system interoperability. Define technical requirements and tasks based on formal and informal customer interaction. Plan, manage, and close-out sprints for multiple functional teams working in parallel. Lead technical evaluation for subcontractor program reviews. Brief senior government leadership on current technical approaches and/or recommended courses of action. Qualifications. Required Experience/Skills/Education: Bachelors and fourteen (14) years or more experience; Masters and twelve (12) years or more experience; PhD or JD and nine (9) years or more experience. This position requires strong communication skills and experience working with geographically distributed teams. Management experience. Experience leading cross functional teams. Experience leading geographically dispersed teams. Complex systems integration. Enterprise Solutions Architect. Data Mining, Warehousing. Database Management Systems. Cloud Experience (Google, AWS, Microsoft). Agile Experience. Experience with Atlassian Suite. Software Development and Lifecycle. Clearance Requirement: Must be able to obtain/maintain a Secret Security Clearance. COVID Policy: Prospective and/or new employees are required to adhere with SAIC's vaccination policy. All SAIC employees must be fully vaccinated and they must submit proof of vaccination on their first day of employment. Prospective or new employees may seek an exemption to the vaccination requirement at Contact Us and must have an approved exemption prior to the start of their employment. Where work is performed strictly at a customer site, customer site vaccination requirements preempt SAIC's vaccination policy. SAICÂ® is a premier Fortune0Â® technology integrator driving our nation's technology transformation. Our robust portfolio of offerings across the defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets includes secure high-end solutions in engineering, digital, artificial intelligence, and mission solutions. Using our expertise and understanding of existing and emerging technologies, we integrate the best components from our own portfolio and our partner ecosystem to deliver innovative, effective, and efficient solutions that are critical to achieving our customers' missions. We are more than,500 strong; driven by mission, united by purpose, and inspired by opportunities. SAIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer, fostering a respectful work culture based on diversity, equity, and inclusion that values all contributors. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $7.1 billion. For more information, visit saic.com. My SAIC Benefits.

name: Consulting Engineer Systems Architect (RRP)

Programs typically support the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) tax processing pipeline and master file systems. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree. years of progressive IT experience. years of automated software testing experience. years of experience working with Greenplum Database Extensive experience working with Post greSQL4+, SQL, PL/pgSQL, and PgAdminExperience developing, training, and validating fraud detection models using Cross-Industry Standard Process for Data Mining (CRISP-DM) years of experience building solutions with FICO Blaze Advisor business rules management system Working knowledge of SAS Fraud Management suite years of experience building data analytics solutions with Pythonx Knowledge of data security best practices and informati on risk management practices. Proficiency with the  Rational suite of tools (Rational Quality Manager (RQM) and Rational Functional Tester (RFT)) Extensive experience with Extraction, Transformation, and Loading (ETL) workflows using various data transformation formats (JSON, XML, CSV, etc.). Ability to obtain and maintain a Moderate Risk Investigation, U.S. citizenship or a minimumyears of residency as a Lawful P rmanent Resident (LPR) in the U.S. required. Preferred Qualifications: Experience with IRS s R turn Review Program (RRP). Possession of a current IRS background investigation. years of experience building data analytics solutions with Pythonx. Experience developing data ingestion workflows with Spark Streaming, Kafka Streams, or Flink. years of experience using big data tools such as Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, and NiFi. years of experience developing data solutions with Python. Familiarity with data lineage and provenance, data governance, and master data management (MDM). Proficiency with Informatica PowerCenter and Data Validation Option (DVO) tool. Proficiency with SAP BusinessObjects Enterprise (BOE). Experience with IRS tax administration systems. We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. name: Big Data Architect
description: Job Description. Why Kyndryl. We design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. Our people are at the center, discovering, co-creating, and strengthening. We push ourselves and each other to seek better, to go further, and we carry this energy to our customers. In October20, IBM announced it's intention to separate the IT Infrastructure Services unit of its Global Technology Services division into a new, separate public company, creating two industry-leading companies IBM and Kyndryl. The spin-off is expected to be completed by the end of21. To find out more about Kyndryl, including information relating to privacy, please visit Kyndryl.com. Please be aware  Kyndryl will continue to use some IBM systems for a certain period after spin-off. This means when you sign up to either the IBM or Kyndryl candidate portal, you will have the benefit of being able to see and apply for IBM and Kyndryl jobs and to access information about IBM and Kyndryl jobs you have applied to, for a limited period from either candidate portal. If you have already signed up as a candidate on IBM's portal, please continue to use this account to access IBM and Kyndryl jobs. Your Role and Responsibilities. Kyndryl is looking for leaders who are passionate about helping some of the world's biggest companies to successfully achieve their Data Center Transformation. Do you have experience about the Overall Data Architecture and guiding principles, best practices, and patterns? Do you have strong Consulting experience within the different domains that make up Information Management? Can you break that knowledge down for our clients to show them their opportunities and solve their risks? Our Big Data Architects are leaders. They've gained years' experience in technology, years' experience and exposure to multiple industries and organizational functions with respect to their Data needs, challenges and solutions and are ready to make a meaningful impact on our clients. Sometimes that leadership manifests in such deep technical expertise that they can lead and perform hands-on technical development, deploy, and technical designs for projects to achieve client's Information Management needs and to help rescue clients from blocked or difficult projects. Translating client requirements, understanding client's circumstances, and executing project services to support the design and implementation of Information Management solutions, in order to deliver Dashboards, Analytics and data governance solutions. You will use assets and reference architectures, build proof-of concepts, build and execute implementation plans, testing plans and deployment plans to address client requirements and work with products or solutions based on partner hardware and/or partner software. Ideal Candidate Profile: Deliverable based driven. Client Facing Success Driven. Client Satisfaction Focused. Strong and Trusted relationships with clients. Business Growth Passion. Problem Solver and Creative Thinker. Desired Outcome Focused. Diligent and Engaging Communicator. Timely and Accurate information keeper. Works without supervision and strong collaboration. Performs and Balances tasks on multiple concurrent projects across multiple customers. Understands department/ functional mission and vision. Exposed to demands of travel and irregular work hours. Solution creation based on requirements. Team leader. Mentoring your peers. Responsibilities: Review, validate and assess client's requirements, and product's specifications/features. Create the required artifacts (design document, diagrams, ASD, HLD, LLD, etc.). Design Big Data Architecture Solution. Work closely with customer and internal teams to gather business and technical requirements. Accountable for successful delivery of highly complex, multi-disciplined consulting engagements that deliver lasting and measurable value to clients. Develop a point of view, capture, prioritize and analyze technical (functional and non-functional) requirements. Possess strong leadership skills and further the evolution of intellectual capital assets and developing architectural resources. Apply Architectural Methods and Techniques. Manage the technical architectural contract terms and conditions. Educate, mentor and coach teams in applying architectural techniques. Facilitate and capture lessons learned from projects to update methodologies and assets. Develop a point of view, capture, prioritize and analyze technical (functional and non-functional) requirements. Be a recognized as a technical though leader inside and outside of IBM. Support company initiatives for offerings, contracts, technologies, and go-to-market. Set priorities to build technical architectural and project assets/deliverables for repurposing. Successfully lead Customer's migration and transformation projects. Outcomes: Provided professional services (Design, Deployment, Troubleshooting, Assessment). Implementation of clients' technical strategy. Designed and implemented a compliant design and infrastructures solution meeting delivery criteria. Increasing the quality, quantity and frequency of client conversations and engagements for project and implementation services opportunities. Increase the awareness, applicability and value of consulting services with our clients, sales force and delivery organization. Achieve a "trusted advisor" persona as viewed by our clients, seller and delivery organization. Instill a sense of urgency and drive to close consulting practice deals. Maximize the project and architecture practice abilities and capabilities to increase project and solution success. If you are hired into a Colorado work location, the anticipated compensation range for the position $84,100 to $206,149 is based on a full-time schedule. Your ultimate compensation may vary depending on your job-related skills and experience. For part time roles, the compensation will be adjusted appropriately. #DiceKyndryl Required Technical and Professional Expertise. Project Experience: Leading teams towards an outcome and break down impediments. Applied Implementation "Hands on" using Methods and/or best practices to deliver Cloud, On-Premises or Hybrid Solution. Applied Mature Architecture design framework, principles and methodologies (high-level technical design, low-level technical design, and technical solution design integration). Applied Agile principles. Applied Project Management practices. Ability to Interpret requirements and create solutions. Ability to Facilitate workshops. Managing technical project workstreams to completion. Ability to articulate key technologies' impact on cost, capacity, transformation, risk, business enablement and transformation objectives. Applied Client Facing Ability to understand and provide guidance and recommendations on solutions to address clients' needs, challenges and transformations. Evaluate risk and merit to make recommendations on available and speculative information. Technology Experience: Prior experience of at least3 years as a Big Data Architect, and should have been involved in solutioning and implementing enterprise Big Data solutions. Very good knowledge on the entire commercial and opensource Big Data ecosystem. Deep experience with a variety of big data technologies (HDFS, Hive, Pig, Spark, SQLaaS, Parquet/Avro, Hadoop, etc.). Thought leader expertise within the areas of data analysis, data preparation, and data wrangling, with expert skills in Python and coding complex SQL queries. Experience with ETL, Persistence, Data Lakes, Data Warehousing, and Data Quality engineering. Some experience with Server Platforms (Windows, Linux, or UNIX). Some experience with commercial and opensource Data management ecosystem. Some experience with Third Party Cloud Infrastructures (Amazon AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, etc.). Some understanding of up-to-date Network architecture concepts and system integration principles including high-end routers / switches, Network and Security, Network Virtualization, Cloud Network Deployments, and other related infrastructure and system components. Some understanding of middleware, networking, application architecture, shared services and other components of n-tier applications. Preferred Technical and Professional Experience. Applied Azure and/or AWS data analytics engineering and designing skills. Being You @ Kyndryl. Kyndryl is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. Kyndryl is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status. Other things to know. Kyndryl offers a wide range of resources for eligible employees to thrive both inside and outside of work. In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to: â€¢12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. â€¢Well-being programs to support mental and physical health. â€¢Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money. â€¢Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

name: Sr Data Engineer Big Data Hadoop
description: Job Description. JOB DESCRIPTION. Cybersecurity is at the beating heart of our culture. Our diligence and expertise is what makes us the undisputed leader in electronic payments. Weâ€™ve made it our priority to create a top-tier Security Architecture team, poised to defend us against any potential cyber threats. CyberSecurity Architecture team is looking for a Data Engineer with Hadoop admin experience. Candidate will be a part of the Security Analytics Engineering team and involved with administering Hadoop-ecosystem and Data Engineering activities. The position will be based at headquarters in Foster City, California. The successful candidate will be working on cutting-edge technologies to perform statistical profiling, inference, classification, clustering and predictive analysis. As a key member of the Data Engineering team, you will be working on large datasets of Security Data and implement Data mining, Data parsing contributing to data availability building machine learning models to help derive new insights to defend against cyber-attacks. You will be working with world-class operation teams including Cyber Defense team and Data Science team to create awesome analytics for security and other business units. You'll need to have excellent communication and cross-group collaboration skills, be able to make forward progress despite ambiguous circumstances, be a self-starter, a quick learner of new technologies and have experience in Data engineering to maintain DataQuality and Integrity. Essential Functions: As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible to establish processes, automations, structures and big data systems based on business and technical requirements to channel multiple requirements, route appropriately and plan proper big data technology using combination of open source and vendor supported big data technologies, databases, and other applicable big data technologies as required. Interact and aid to provide data for other investigative teams within Visa on time sensitive, critical investigations. Work with cross functional teams to fully understand business requirements and desired business outcomes. Assist in scoping and designing analytic data assets, implementing modeled attributes and contributing to brainstorming sessions. Build and maintain a robust data engineering process to develop and implement self-serve data and tools for Visaâ€™s data scientists. Find opportunities to create, automate and scale repeatable analyses or build self-service tools for business users. Execute data engineering projects ranging from small to large either individually or as part of a project team. Experience on working with very large data sets and knowledge of building programs that leverage Massively Parallel Processing (MPP) Data warehouse platforms. The engineer will be working on Big Data technologies like Hadoop and tools and security related datasets doing Data parsing, Data mining activities and writing parsers. Responsible for loading data from several disparate datasets, documentation and debugging applications. QUALIFICATIONS. Basic Qualifications:years of work experience with a Bachelorâ€™s Degree or an Advanced Degree such as Computer Science. (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD , or PhD). years of software development experience (with a concentration in data centric initiatives), with demonstrated expertise in leveraging standard development best practice methodologies. Experience with Data Engineering with production pipelines, utilizing data engineering techniques that enable statistical modeling solutions to solve business problems. Experience with various Opensource Hadoop distribution systems and technology stack like Spark, oozie, airflow etc. Preferred Qualifications: Extensive experience with big data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Druid, etc.) tools for large scale data processing, data transformation and machine learning pipelines. Ability to create and manage big data pipeline using Syslog-ng, kafka, flume, Airflow etc. Hands-on expertise with Java or Python, Spark and any scripting languages. Go lang and Scala is a plus. Experience with highly distributed, scalable, concurrent and low latency systems working with one or more of the following database technologies: MySQL, Postgres SQL, NoSQL DB, Elastic Search. Experience with data visualization and business intelligence tools like Power BI, Tableau, Microstrategy, or other programs. Experience in developing Rest API. Experience with Continuous Integration and Automated Test tools such as Jenkins, Artifactory, Git, Ansible. Experience working in an Agile and Test-Driven Development environment. Demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor, strong attention to detail, team oriented, energetic, collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible style. Previous exposure to financial services, credit cards or Security analytics is a plus, but not required.

name: BIG DATA DEVELOPER
